description: Memorial Services

title: Doctor Says Humphrey Needs No Further Aid
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP)  Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's doctor reported today that he had found no need to prescribe further treatment of a potentially cancerous bladder condition.

title: INDIANA INDICATES GROWING G.O.P. RIFT
description: If voters in the Republican primary in Indiana are any indication, the ideological cleavage between the conservative and moderate wings of the Republican Party is widening.

description: TRENTON, May 5Springfield came to Trenton today; Springfield, Neb.; Springfield, Ill.; Springfield, Fla.; Springfield, Vt.; Springfield, Ohio; Springfield, Mass., and Springfied, N.J.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 5It is beginning to appear that Governor Byrne  whose choice of Jimmy Carter turned out to be a seat on a bandwagonis trying to take command of the state Democratic Party, a move being interpreted as a sign that he plans to seek reelection next year.

title: Advertising
description: There may be indications that the traditional media commission system of compensating advertising agencies is eroding, but the method is not without a host of supporters on the agency side.

title: Major League Leaden
description: Major League Leaden

title: Black Panthers Affected
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP)F.B.I. headquarters approved more than 2,300 actions in a campaign to disrupt and discredit American organizations ranging from the Black Panthers to Antioch College, according to the report released today on the bureau's Cointelpro program.

title: U.S.Soviet Arms Talks Start MonthLong Recess
description: GENEVA, May 5The United States and the Soviet Union today recessed until June 2 their current round of negotiations to expand their 1972 accord on limiting their strategic nuclear weapons.

title: 1,440 VOTERS POLLED IN INDIANA SURVEY
description: The New York Times and CBS News polled 1,440 Indiana voters Tuesday as they left the polling places. Of these, 634 were Republicans acrd 806 were Democrats.

title: SOVIET TRADE GAP WITH WEST CITED,
description: MOSCOW, May 5Heavy purchases of grain and machinery led the Soviet Union to run a $4.8 billion trade deficit with industrialized Western countries last year, according to preliminary Soviet trade figures released today.

title: Gov. Moore Cleared At Extortion Trial
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., May 5Gov. Arch A. Moore Jr. of West Virginia and his former top aide were acquitted by a Federal jury today of charges that they had conspired to extort $25,000 from a businessman who was seeking a state bank charter.

title: Rhodesian Chrome: A Dull Black Ore That Sets Sparks Flying in Congress
description: Last week, Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger announced during his swing through Africa that he would seek to end imports of Rhodesian chrome into the United States.

title: BRITAIN APPROVES TOUGH PAY POLICY
description: LONDON, May 5The British treasury and the country's trade union leadership, both openly anxious over the fall of the pound and Britain's continuing high inflation rate, agreed today to a tough new wagecontrol policy.

title: H. K. Porter Seeks Shares of Fansteel
description: The H. K. Porter Company announced yesterday that it was offering to purchase any and all of the 1,563,934 outstanding common shares of Fansteel of Chicago, a manufacturer at specialty metals, electrical contacts and carbide cutting tools, at $17 share. If all shares are tendered, Porter's expenditure would total about $26.6 million.

title: CIVIL SERVICE SHIFT OPPOSED BY BLACKS
description: WASHINGTON, May 5Civil rights advocates and black Congressmen are opposing proposed changes in the Civil Service Commission that they feel will seriously weaken job protection for members of minority groups in the Federal work force.

title: Day Care Cuts Protested
description: More than 1,000 workers, parents and children picketed the headquarters of the Emergency Financial Control Board at 270 Broadway yesterday to demand an end to the hatchet Job on the day care program. The demonstration against the closing of 28 centers plus further cuts in the day care program was called by Day Care Local 205 of District Council 1707, Community and Social Agency Employees.

title: News. Summary and Index
description: Egypt and the leadership of the Palestine Liberation Organization are reported to have reached a broad understanding for cooperation in Lebanon and elsewhere ending nine months of bitterly strained relations. The main purpose, according to sources close to Yasir Arafat, the P.L.O. leader, is to strengthen his hand against what they call a Syrian attempt to bring the Palestinian resistance movement in Lebanon under the control of Damascus. Informed. Arab officials said that Saudi Arabia, which has been mediating other Arab quarrels, helped smooth the EgyptianP.L.O. relationship. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Dubious Payments Made by Affiliates Of Phelps Dodge
description: The Phelps Dodge Corporation has recently learned of two payments, which appear questionable, made by its foreign manufacturing affiliates to local government officials abroad, George B. Munroe, chairman, told about 150 stockholders at yesterday's annual meeting.

title: KISSINGER'S VIEW ON SOMALIA ASKED
description: WASHINGTON, May 5Senator Dick Clark, chairman of the Senate African Affairs subcommittee, asked in a letter sent to Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger today why the State Department reportedly ignored a SaudiArabian proposal to diminish Soviet influence in Somalia. Mr. Kissinger is now in Africa, Senator Clark, who is an Iowa Democrat, called the allegation made by James E. Akins, the former American ambassador to Saudi Arabia, a serious matter.

title: Chess; Retain It or Exchange It? EndGame Decisions Count
description: Knowing which pieces to keep and which to eliminate by exchanges is a major part of endgame technique. Here are some standard examples: Where the pawns are fourtothree on one side of the hoard, rook endings, queen endings and bishop endings are generally draws. For the superior side to win, it should arrange to keep a knight, the piece that operates at maximum efficiency over limited terrain; with the same number of pawns, but where they are distributed far apart on both wings, the bishop is dynamite in creating a passed pawn and forcing it through to promotion.

title: Mikado by Carte Troupe Induces Modified Rapture
description: The D'Oyly Carte Opera Company, the London ensemble that keeps alive the performing traditions of the Gilbert and Sullivan operettas, returned here last night after an absence of seven seasons. It opened a threeweek engagement at the Uris Theater with The Mikado. To use NankiPoo's phrase in that work, it induced modified rapture.

title: Snnapd Cookies and Grapefruit Juice Are Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP) Thousands of cases of cookies, Graham crackers and grapefruit juice are being recalled nationwide because they are contaminated with rodent hairs and filth, the Food and Drug Administration said today.

description: Egypt and the leadership of the Palestine Liberation Organization are reported to have reached a broad understanding for cooperation in Lebanon and elsewhere ending nine months of bitterly strained relations. The main purpose, according to sources close to Yasir Arafat, the P.L.O. leader, is to strengthen his hand against what they call a Syrian attempt to bring the Palestinian resistance movement in Lebanon under the control of Damascus. title: I.T.T. PAYMENT DATA BORED TO PUBLIC
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (UPI) A Federal judge today granted the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation's request to protect from public disclosure documents pertaining to an alleged $3.8 million in payments to foreign government officials.

title: Bearne Expected to Head Party's State Delegation
description: Mayor Beame is likely to be chosen chairman of the New York delegation to the Democratic National Convention, politicians said yesterday.

title: 4 Workers Die in Fall
description: MONROE, Mich., May 5 (AP)  Four construction workers were killed today when a wire work cage in which they were being lifted to the top of a smokestack fell 300 feet to the metal floor. The authorities said the cage was being raised in side an S00foothigh smokestack at the Detroit Edison Company's Monroe Power Plant. The dead, whose identities were withheld pending notification of next of kin, were employees of William Farrel Inc., a mechanical construction concern in Toledo, Ohio.

title: A Little Happy FlagWaving on 7th Avenue
description: Perhaps it's the Bicentennial. Or maybe it's just the quality of the clothes. Whatever the reason, it's been a very long time since Seventh Avenue fashion openings had such a pervasive upbeat spirit.

title: Networks Weifihing 45Minute Newscasts for FallI
description: Despite vigorous opposition from numerous stations around the country to a proposal by ABC. News to expand its eveming newscast from the established halfhour format to minutes a night, there are indications all three networks will go forward with such a plan within the next year.

title: Playoff Results
description: Playoff Results

title: Brezhnev Sees Raul Castro
description: MOSCOW, May 5 (AP)Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, met today with Raid Castro, the second ranking official in the Cuban Communist Party, Tass reported.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Kaiser Industries Corporation, the top holding company of the Kaiser business empire, announced yesterday that its directors would reccommend a liquidation plan for major subsidiaries to shareholders under which the company would distribute to shareholders its shares in the 38 percentowned Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation, the 56 percentowned Kaiser Steel Corporation and 37 percentowned Kaiser Cement and Gypsum Corporation.

title: Yankees Trounce Angels
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 5A muchadvertised pitching duel between Catfish Hunter and Nolan Ryan, which brought out a crowd of 25.790, didn't go exactly according to expectations tonight as a sixrun eighth inning gave Hunter and the New York Yankees a 104 victory over the California Angels.

title: NEW YORK FACING HOSPITAL CLASHES
description: A union representing 40,000 employees and the operators of 52 nonprofit hospitals and nursing comes in the New York metropolitan area began negotiations for a new contract yesterday in a gloomy atmosphere.

title: Seton Hall Nine Vexing to Radmen
description: One St. John's baseball fan said recently that Tod Heimet, a lefthanded pitcher for Seton Hall, looks more like an accountant than a pitcher. But we can't get to him.

title: Personal Finance: Executor Standards

description: ALBANY. May 5Governor Carey has reached General agreement with the Legislature on a proposal to permit cities and school ??? to impose an optional state property tax to pay for employee pensions and other benefits, various officials said today.

title: CORRECTIONS

Mr. Eckhardt was not a candidate for delegate: his wife, Nadine, lost a delegate race.

title: Ford Withdrawal Urged
description: CONCORD, N. H., May 5 (UPI)Gov. Meldrim Thompson Jr. of New Hampshire called on all Republican governors today to urge President Ford to withdraw at once as a Presidential candidate in light of primary, victories by Ronald Reagan. The Governor, a longtime Reagan supporter, said that the Republican Party would commit national suicide with the FordKissinger team.

title: Italy Curbs Trade
description: Italy has imposed strong curbs on foreignexchange dealings, including stiff deposit requirements for all imports except grain, to aid the ailing lira. Page 55.

title: Critic's Notebook: Publisher as Gatsby
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., May 5 Maybe it's necessary for book publishers to leave town in order to contemplate themselves and their ways. New York is to publishing what water is to sticklebacks: the quotidian. And even the most intelligent and introspective stickleback would have a hard time, while under water, thinking about the aquadynamics of swimming or the concept of wetness. One publishes, one swims, one doesn't ask existential questions.

title: Dr. John J. McGuire, Head Of Jersey Medical Society
description: Dr. John J. McGuire, secred tary of the New Jersey State Board of Medical Examiners and president of the Medical Society of New. Jersey, died of a coronary attack Tuesday at his home in South Orange, He was 66 years old.

title: Soviet Is Critical of U.S. On 200Mile Fishing Zone
description: MOSCOW, May 5 (Reuters)The Soviet Union has told the United States that it disapproves of Washington's action in establishing a 200mile fishery zone, the Tess press agency reported today.

description: A new Chineselanguage radio station, Sinocast, will begin broadcasting here today from 9 A.M. to midnight.

description: MANHATTAN: All shoreline, park areas from Battery Park to the top of the island. The West Side Highway and Henry Hudson Parkway will almost certainly be closed to traffic and open to spectators, except for structurally unsound portions south of 72d Street. Greenwich Village piers are not recommended because of obstructed views caused by the presence of review vessels.

title: INVALIDVOTESMAR CAPITAL PRIMARY
description: WASHINGTON, May 5Voters in the predominantly black District of Columbia appeared today to have given Jimmy Carter a plurality of its 13 delegates to the Democratic National Convention, but the former Georgia Governor's primary victory may be more apparent than real.

title: Film: 'Baby Blue Marine' Is Apple Pie
description: "Baby Blue Marine," the first film to be directed by John Hancock since his moving and funny "Bang the Drum Slowly," has the tensile strength of a rubber hot dog.It's the tastelessly sentimental story of a nice young man named Marion (Jan-Michael Vincent), who, in 1943, has the humiliation of being washed out of a Marine Corps boot camp, for not measuring up, though he's as pretty as a picture of a Norman Rockwell World War II fighting man. Through a series of circumstances too silly to describe, he finds himself hitchhiking home to St. Louis wearing the uniform of a Marine Raider, whose battle ribbons dazzle the folks he meets along the way.Marion has particular success in a small California town that is so idyllically (and mysteriously) set that no matter where you look you see Mount Shasta in the distance. There he meets a family (Mom, Pop, the pretty daughter and her young brother who always has the sniffles) so apple-pie American that one longs for this to be a Hitchcock film, which might mean the family was really a bunch of Nazi spies. No such luck, however.Mr. Hancock and his screenwriter, Stanford Whitmore, apparently think they can evoke innocence by trafficking in idealizations that weren't convincing even 35 years ago. The film makes no comment on Norman Rockwell's Saturday Evening Post covers that are used behind the opening credits. Rather it adopts their style and then  unwittingly, I assume  he vacuity that lies behind the Rockwell gift for draftsmanship.Marion, of course, has doubts about the fraud he's pulling on these good honest folks, so would you be struck dumb if you were told that circumstances eventually turn him into an honest-to-gosh hero? Things go bad for him, but then they get better 'n' better.I can't believe that Mr. Hancock intended to make a movie quite as dopey as this one has turned out to be. Something vital seems to be missing.I also can't understand the PG rating. There is a tiny bit of barracks room language, but nothing you might not hear at a church social if Rover ate the turkey.

title: STOCK PRICES OFF; DOW SLIDES 7.24
description: Investor concern over the course of interest rates and the inflation rate weighed upon the stock market yesterday to drive prices steadily lower.

title: Rockefeller Holds U.S.Defense Lags; Attacks Congress
description: LOS ANGELES, May 5Vice President Rockefeller said today that the Soviet Union had surpassed the United States in some areas of military procurement, production and research, and he attributed this to Congress, which he said had consistently reduced Presidential requests for defense spending over the last decade.

title: CURB PLAN SETS OFF SOUTH AFRICA FIGHT
description: JOHANNESBURG, May 5 (Reuters)Liberal South Africans today began a vigorous attack on Government plans for a new state security law extending restrictions on personal and political liberties.

title: Youth Held in Slaying
description: NEWARK, May 5 (AP)An 18yearold youth has been charged with murder and illegal entry in connection with the slaying of a woman who was stabbed at least 11 times in her basement apartment in Orange, the police said. The youth, David Brian Clark, of Sea Bright, was ordered held without bail yesterday in connection with the murder of Doris Fisher, 32.

title: British Bankers, Upset by Scandal, Foresee Change
description: LONDON. May 5A man phoned C. Hoare & Company, a tiny Fleet Street hank renowned for its personal service, and asked how he might go about opening an account.

title: Firemen Mourn Comrade Who Died in 727 Crash
description: One morning last week Fireman Neville K. Martin stood smiling in the doorway of Engine and Ladder Company No. 17 in the South Bronx. He shook hands with his friends there and drove to Kennedy International Airport, where he boarded an American Airlines flight to the Virgin Islands.

title: A Cloud on U.S.Israeli Horizon!
description: JERUSALEM, May 5 Although the recent publicized arguments between the United States and Israel have concerned aid and arms supplies to Egypt, a more difficult, potentially explosive issue lies just beNews neath the surface. Analysis It is the question of negotiations with the Palestinians. Serious concern is being expressed here about the possibility of a confrontation with the United States over the issue after the November election.

description: A year ago, 11 of the 23 stores on 37th Avenue from 92d to 93d Street in the Jackson Heights section of Queens were vacant. Today all are in business, opening as early as 8 in the morning and sometimes still serving cuitomers at 11 at night.

description: WAGNER, S.D., May 5 (AP)Russell Means, leader of the American Indian Movement and another member were shot early today at a housing area on an Indian reservation near here. Attorney General William Janklowsaid.

title: Suns Win, 108101, To Square Series
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May (UPI)  Paul Westphal, a guard, made 14 of 19 shots and scored 31 points tonight to help the Phoenix Suns to a seriessquaring 105101 victory over the Golden State Warriors in their National Basketball Association Western Conference championship final.

description: Hayden B. Johnson, who retired recently as deputy director of planning and development for the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, died Tuesday evening at his home in Port Washington, L. I. He was 59 years old.

title: Dave Anderson
description: In the visiting team's clubhouse at Shea Stadium, the Cincinnati Reds were slipping off their diamond and ruby World Series rings as they changed into their redtrimmed gray uniforms. In his office, Sparky Anderson was listening to the question that follows him everywhere. Has winning the World Series changed his team? No, the manager replied. People keep asking me that and I wonder if they see things I don't see but I tell them, Don't you think maybe you're looking too hard? On this ballclub the main four guys are going to control the attitude of the ball players. The main four guys are Pete Rose, Johnny Bench. Joe Morgan and Tony Perez. They are my leaders, Sparky Anderson said. I depend on them. I listen to them. Some major league managers are dictators who don't listen. George (Sparky) Anderson is dictator, as a manager often must be, but he is also a dictator with a weakness for democracy.

title: Women Hoping to Sponsor Presidential Debates
description: The League of Women Voters announced yesterday that it hoped to sponsor a series of four debates between the two major candidates in the November Presidential election.

Those arrested were charged with selling drugs and barbiturates.

It is a place of Vanderbilts and Astors, of artists lofts and experimental theaters. unosts and phoenixes are the neighborhood's symbols.

Along the Lily Pool Promenade, booths offered plants of all kinds, from spathyphyllum to mammillaria, from bromeliads to gesneriads. Andyestomatoes and other vegetables. Proceeds from the sale, which continues today, aid the Garden's research projects.

title: Connecticut's Courts

The fundamental reform by the Connecticut Legislature achieves the aim of unification of all lower courts into one major trial court system. This can serve to raise the caliber of the bench, diminish piecemeal treatment of cases, and allow for greater judicial flexibility to speed up litigation.

description: The Lockheed Aircraft Cororation reported yesterday an 1.2 percent increase in firstuafter net earnings to $10.9 million or 92 cents a share, tom $9.8 million, or 86 cents t share, for the initial three montits last year. The company has been involved in payoff candals.

title: News Summary and Index
description: An intricate and comprehensive American approach to economic relations between rich and poor countries that put heavy stress on free enterprise and private initiative was outlined by Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger in an address yesterday to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development in Nairobi. The most dramatic proposal was for an International Research Bank, an institution that, Mr. Kissinger said, would promote rational, systematic and equitable development of resources in developing nations. [Page A1, Column 8.]

C.I.O. into some expression of sympathy for the Carter candidacy at the May 19 meeting of its executive council in Washington.
