title: SIMON SAYS CHILEANS WILL ADMIT U.N. UNIT
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 7 (AP)Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon said today that the Chilean military junta has relaxed its opposition to admitting a United Nations human rights mission.

title: Paper in Nashville Dismisses Writer Linked to the F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON, May 7  A newspaperwoman whose alleged special relationship with the Federal Bureau of Investigation was reported to Congress last week has been dismissed by her employer, The Nashville Tennessean.

title: INOUE AT AMEX TURNS TO SRO
description: An investigation of phantom option trades on the American Stock Exchange has apparently turned up the possibility that some specialists may also have been manipulating some of the stocks in which they make a market.

title: MINORITIES JOBS STIR BOSTON RIFT
description: BOSTON, May 7  Construction workers left their jobs and gathered at Boston's City Hall today to demand an end to a citysponsored minority hiring program which they contend is taking jobs away from union members.

title: Exxon and Texaco Join Gasoline Rise
description: The Exxon Corporation and Texaco, the nation's two largest oil companies, yesterday joined others in the industry in raising the wholesale price of gasoline. Both increased their prices for all grades of gasoline by I cent a gallon, effective yesterday. Owners of independent stations that buy gasoline from either company will have to decide whether to pass on the increased cost to their customers.

title: Triangles Beat Strings
description: PITTSBURGH, May 7 (UPI) Evonne Goolagong helped lead the Pittsburgh Triangles to a 3219 victory over the Los Angeles Strings in a World Team Tennis match tonight, but tendonitis in her left heel forced her to withdraw from a mixed doubles tournament this weekend. Miss Goolagong defeated Rosemary Casals, 6.2, in women's singles and teamed with Peggy Michel to heat Miss Casals and Dianne Fromholtz. 63.

title: Events Today
description: Events Today

title: Article 6  No Title
description: It was incorrectly stated in The Times yesterday that the Board of Education intended to give contracts to private agencies for school mentalhealth programs. The school board is opposed to the idea.

title: Southern Baptist Expansion Brings Increased Diversity
description: MOUNT TABOR, Ark., May 4Robert Melton believes in God. Not in some vague supernatural force approached with euphemism and uncertainty but in a personal being whom he addresses every day for support and guidance.

title: Sanitation Sabotage
description: The gingerly and ineffective manner with which City Hall continues to deal with sabotage by the sanitation workers only demonstrates once again how the citizens of New York have become the pawns of this union's limitless arrogance. The stinking mountains of uncollected garbage throughout the city are in virtually all cases well beyond the building employees picket lines, placed there by tenants of the struck apartment houses. Yet the general rule yesterday was that the sanitationmen refused to perform their jobs.

title: CHANGE IS URGED IN SCHOOL OUTLAY
description: A coalition of 16 civic organizations charged yesterday that the proposed city budget for the coming school year would reduce expenditures for classroom teaching while leaving the bureaucracy of the central Board of Education largely undisturbed.

title: Michigan Republican Leaders Worry About Crossover Votes Against Ford
description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich., Max 7  The heavyweights of Michigan Republicanism gather cd here last night for Bill's Beefsteak  a $130acouple event honoring Gov. William G. Milliken. But their minds were not on revelry.

title: Asian Fund Bill Gains
description: The Senate Thursday approved by a vote of 51 to 32 a $50 million authorization for the Asian Development Fund for fiscal 1977. The measure now goes to the House.

title: KERR SETS ACCORD FOR SUNNINGDALE
description: The KerrMcGee Corporation, an oil producing and marketing company in Oklahoma City, announced yesterday that an agreement had been reached to acquire 900,000 shares of the capital stock of Sunningdale Oils of Calgary, Alberta, at $17 a share. Immediately after closing the purchase, KerrMcGee will make a tender offer to Sunningdale's shareholders for the remaining 3.45 million shares at the $17 price. Total outlay for both the group's and public shareholders stock would amount to about $74 million.

title: Music: Bartok Quartets
description: The Guarneri String Quartet is certainly a wellestablished entity by now. But its concerts Thursday night and this coming Wednesday at the 92d Street Y mark its first New York cycle of the six string quartets of Bela Bartok.

title: Potato Contract Ends in a Furor
description: The May potato futures contract, which experienced some of the widest price swings in exchange history, expired yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange amid a noisy frenzy of lastminute transactions. The contract closed at 1:30 P.M. at 8.70 cents a pound, down from Thursday's 9.70.

title: Today's Entries at Belmont
description: Horses Iisted In order of post positions Letter desionales OTB listing

title: Protesters at Gouverneur Free 5 of 7 Hostages as a Gesture
description: Lower East Side residents occupying Gouverneur Hospital yesterday released, as a gesture of good faith, five of the seven persons they had taken hostageThursday, but the occupiers said they would remain until the city reversed its position to close most of the hospital's services.

title: Sally Little Gets2ShotEdge In Eager Bidfor FirstVictory
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C. May 7  There Was a time when Sally Little, a tall girl growing up in South Africa, had to sneak away from her friends to practice golf because they considered it an old man's sport and they ribbed me about it.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Next Tuesday is the date that new bicycle safety regulations of the Federal Consumer Product Safety Commission take effect.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money Mies for Friday

title: Extent of Kissinger Offer Surprises Parley Aides
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 7As delegates from the developing states were still analyzing the intricate proposals Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger made in his speech here yesterday, a general agreement seemed to be emerging that while he had not fully met their demands he had gone further than most had anticipated.

title: Arafat's Shift to Egypt
description: The immediate beneficiary of the newfound community of interests between Egypt and the Palestinian Liberation Organization is President Sadat. Ostracized as a pariah by the Arab world after agreeing to the second Sinai disengagement agreement with Israel last September, the Egyptian leader only now seems to be emerging from dangerous isolation. For that longawaited development, he has to thank the tumult that has been going on in Lebanon.

title: Editor Resigned State Post Two Days Before Dismissal
description: ALBANY, May 7Janine Selendy, the editor of the monthly newspaper published by the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation, said today that she had not been dismissed by the Governor's office but had resigned, effective July 1.

title: North Carolina Town Is Proud of Carter
description: SANFORD, N. C.Just after Jimmy Carter won the Democratic primary in Pennsylvania, Mayor Roy Stewart of Sanford was quick to say he was very pleased, but the victory was not so important to him that he did not talk first about the weather, the plight of the state's farmers, the 27 days without a drop of rain.

title: Jobless Rate Unchanged Despite Employment Rise
description: WASHINGTON, May 7Employment scored another strong gain in April, climbing to a new high, the Government said today, but the national unemployment rate remained unchanged at a recession level of 7.5 percent.

title: Books of The Times
description: Writing steadily for half a century and producing 40 books in a variety of genres, Paul Horgan has quietly built a solid reputation for literary excellence. His craftsmanship, never flamboyant, leans heavily on the carefully balanced sentence, the wellconstructed paragraph, the selfcontained chapter and the novel or history of substance. He resembles those gentlemanscholars of the late 19th and early 20th centuries who wrote for the pleasure and edification of their readers.

title: Maurice Feldman Dead at 66; Led PublicRelations Concern
description: Maurice Feldman, a publicrelations executive and economic consultant whose clients had ranged from major manufacturing concerns to governments and opera stars, died Thursday at his home, 945 Fifth Avenue, after a long illness. He was 66 years old.

title: Dodgers Outslug Phillies, 108
description: The last time the Los Angeles Dodgers lost a baseball game. Honest Pleasure was becoming the strong Kentucky Derby favorite, Gerald Ford was the strong Republican favorite and the Cincinnati Reds were the strong National League West favorite.

title: Spanish Cabinet Approves A TwoHouse Parliament
description: MADRID, May 7 The Spanish Government announced proposals tonight for setting up a twohouse parliament in which the entire lower house and most of the senate would be directly elected.

title: OFFER IS REJECTED IN BUILDING STRIKE
description: The landlords at struck apartment houses in New York City withdrew their iernards for reductions in contract bearfits yesterday and made their first money offer to union negotiators, but the union quickly rejected it.

title: Earth's Plates Converging in Quake Area
description: The earthquake in northeast Italy Thursday night occurred In a region where converging movements by vast plates of the earth's surface have caused devastating quakes ever since cities were first built there.

title: Erving's Operation Stuns the Nuggets
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., May 7The Denver Nuggets locker room at the Nassau Coliseum last night was a somber place. The New York Nets and Julius Erving had done it to them again.

title: People and Business
description: Dr. Robert Seamans, head of the Energy Research and Development Administration. said yesterday that a heroic effort would be needed to give the nation selfstifficiency in energy in 20 years.

title: Marks Set In Hammer, ShotPut
description: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y., May 7The heavies took over the spotlight as the twoday ninth Glenn Loucks Memorial schoolboy track and field games opened today at White Plains High School. Almost 2,000 athletes from 141 high schools are taking part in the meet.

title: Market Place
description: Many small investors who have tried to liquidate investments of $10,000 to $20,000 in taxexempt bonds have discovered that to do so they must accept a sacrifice price.

title: Ford Adds Campaign Aide
description: WASHINGTON. May 7 (UPI) James A. Baker 3d resigned today as Under Secretary of Commerce to take a key pat in President Ford's campaign organization. The White House issued only a brief announcement that Mr. Ford had accepted Mr. Baker's resignation. But a spokesman at the President Ford Committee headquarters said Mr. Baker would he working there under Rogers C, B. Morton. Mr. Ford's campaign chairman.

title: ANKER IS DEFIED ON EARLY CLOSING
description: Ignoring orders from School Chanceller Irving Anker, eight West Side schools kept pupils in class until 3 P.M. yesterday, setting the stage for a new move by Mr. Anker to bring them into compliance with the systemwide policy of reduced linstructional time.

description: MONTE CARLO. Monaco, May 7  The United States went into the lead in the second session of the world team championship final against Italy here tonight, overcoming the 18point lead with which the defending world champions began the day because of their scores in the qualifying matches between the teams.

description: PARIS, May 7 (Reuters)Foreign Minister Nguyen Thi Binh of South Vietnam said in an interview published here today that such foreign oil companies as the AngloDutch Shell Company and American Gulf Oil could resume work in Vietnam.

title: BID BY EMPIRE GAS REJECTED BY PARGAS
description: The Board of Directors of Pargas recommended yesterday that its stockholders reject a takeover bid by the Empire Gas Corporation. Both companies are distributors of liquefied Petroleum gas.

description: OMAHA, May 7  President Ford came to the city of his birth today to test a strategy meant to put new life into his faltering bid for the Republican Presidential nomination.

title: A Bill Spurring Jobs for All Is Endorsed
description: Mayor Beame, New York State officials, labor leaders and a leading economist yesterday emphatically endorsed proposed Federal legislation to require the Government to follow policies that would create jobs for all adults who want to work.

title: Four Die in Colorado Fire
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, May 7 (UPI)Three members of one family and a volunteer fireman who fell through a collapsing roof were killed today in an early morning apartment fire. The victims were identified as Francis Spoto, 29 years old; her daughter, Dawn Anne Marie Spoto, 5; Joseph Spoto, 65, and the fireman, Donald Wescott, 48.

title: Issues in Building Strike
description: Local 32B of the Service Employees Union, representing 20,000 superintendents, handymen, elevator operators, porters, mechanics and guards in 4,000 apartment buildings in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island. The Realty Advisory Board represents the building owners.

title: French Students Ousted
description: PARIS, May 7 (Reuters)The police removed 150 students occupying the arts school of the University of Nancy in eastern France today and detained 50 of them for questioning. The students, who began occupying the building yesterday evening, were protesting Government proposals to make university courses more joboriented.

title: SENATE UNIT BACKS MORE TAX ON RICK
description: WASHINGTON, May 7The Senate Finance Committee reached tentative agreement today on changes in the socalled minimum tax that would require somewhat more tax payments by highincome individuals who have been escaping all or most Federal income tax.

description: TRENTON, May 7About $40 million a year is spent on caring for the children of working mothers in New Jersey.

description: Dividends

title: The Heiress Is Closing
description: The Heiress, the Ruth and Augustus Goetz play based on Henry James's novel Washington Square, will end its Broadway run at the Broadhurst Theater tomorrow evening after 23 performances. Richard Kiley and Jane Alexander are starred in the play, presented by Steven Beckler and Thomas C. Smith in association with Ken Morse.

title: Note Sales Report Spurs Sharp Drop In Prices of Bonds
description: The Treasury Department announced yesterday that investors and securities firms bought $4.7 billion of the 10year notes that it sold earlier this week$1.2 billion more than it originally planned. The announcement pushed bond prices down sharply ending the biggest weekly selloff in the credit markets this year.

title: JUDGE WAS TOLD OF PHONE TAPPING
description: Testimony before a special corruption grand jury yesterday revealed for the first time that someone had tipped off Judge Anthony J. Mercorella of Civil Court that his telephone was being tapped by Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor.

title: Dow Is Up 6.69 as Trading Registers a Slight Pickup
description: The stock market, after tracing a seesaw pattern this week, wound up yesterday with steadily improving prices. The Dow Jones industrial average rose 6.69 points to 996.22 on a slight pickup, in trading volume.

title: 2d Hughes Will, Sent to Texas, Termed Fraudulent on Its Face
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 7A purported will of Howard R. Hughes, so fraudulent on its face that it was a courthouse joke, has been received in the mail in Houston.

title: Vote for Farmland
description: The Suffolk County Legislature is scheduled to vote next week on whether to make its first acquisition for farmland preservation. This pioneer program, long since approved by the Legislature in principle, designed to induce farm owners on the eastern end Long Island to withhold their lands from wouldbe developers by paying them for development rights.

title: Popular New XRay Unit Could Raise Cost of Care
description: Eagerness to acquire an Xray scanner that may revolutionize the diagnosis and treatment of many internal ills is causing growing concern that its main effect will be a further escalation of the already staggering cost of health care.

description: Arnold Schwarzenegger (yes, that's his real name), believed by many to have the world's most perfect male body, was pumping iron the other day at the MidCity Gym on West 49th Street.

description: Stephen Dudiak, who served as Passaic County Republican chairman from 1960 until 1968, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 68 years old and lived in Clifton, N.J.

description: WASHINGTON, May 7A new music learning system that enables a student to play his own instrument in a recorded concert has been invented by Peter C. Goldmark, president of GoldPatents mark Communiof the cations Corporation, Stamford, Week Conn. Patent 3,955,466 is to be issued next week to Dr. Goldmark, who has more than 160 others. It is assigned to the company.

title: Myths of Our Time
description: LA JOLLA, Calif.I am just as convinced as can be, states the geochemist Harrison Brown of the California Institute of Technology, that man has it within his power today to create a world in which people the world over can lead free and abundant and even creative lives.  I am convinced that we can create a world which will pale the Golden Age of Pericles into nothingness.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TONES A classical guitar program ranging from Bach to contemporary works will be played by Joseph Parisi tomorrow at 3 P.M. in the concert series at the Staten Island Museum, 75 Stuyvesant Place in St. George, opposite the ferry terminal. Admission is 0 and S2.

title: Corporate Profits Up 44% in Quarter
description: Fueled by consumer spending, corporate profits surged 44 percent in this year's first quarter from the recessiondepressed yearearlier period.

title: BROWN CANDIDACY SCORED BY CARTER
description: BALTIMORE, May 7Repeating the tactics he used in the Pennsylvania Democratic Presidential primary, Jimmy Carter asserted today that powerful political bosses and machine politicians in Marylandand perhaps in the city of Washington not far awaywere using the attractive young Governor of California, Edmund G. Brown Jr., to stop Mr. Carter and achieve a brokered. backroom nomination at Madison Square Garden in July.

title: French Climber Dies in Fall
description: PARIS, May 7 (AP)  One member of a French Himalaya expedition was killed and two others, including a 23yearold woman, were seriously injured in a fall after reaching the summit of the 22,400foot Guria Himal peak in Nepal, the French Foreign Ministry announced today. The three fell Wednesday while descending from the summit on the northwest ridge.

title: Mobile Home Makers Are Producing Family Circle AssemblyLine House
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., May 7  Union plumbers, electricians, and other construction tradesmen in this part of the country earn more than $100 a day, including fringe benefits. Factory workers employed at the Golden West Mobile Home plant in nearby Riverside earn about $50 a day. And they can turn out a 1,325 square foot home in about 250 manhours, substantially less than the higherpaid construction workers.

title: Governors of 13 States On a Visit to Ireland
description: DUBLIN, May 7 (UPI)American Governors on a Bicentennial goodwill visit to the Irish Republic met President Cearbhail O'Dalaigh today for an hourlong talk.

title: Stock Prices Climb On Amex and OTC; Trading Increases
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market advanced yesterday in heavier trading.

title: FORD URGED TO BID FOR JERSEY VOTES
description: TRENTON, May 7  New Jersey Republican leaders were reported today to be pressing President Ford to campaign in the state, contending that New Jersey represented a major opportunity for the President to counter Ronald Reigan's resurgent campaign for the Republican nomination.

title: Leadership in Lisbon
description: LISBON, May 7After 50 years of stern rightwing dictatorship and two years of romantic revolution, the Portuguese are again seeking firm leadershin. This country needs a navigator, someone to steady the ship and give it direction, a prominent Lisbon dentist said this week as the campaign intensified for the June 27 presidential election.

title: 80 Compete in 15 Congressional Districts,
description: Overshadowed in recent weeks by Presidential politics, Congressional nominations involving 80 candidates in 15 districts will also be decided in the state's primary on June 8.

description: LONG BEACH, Calif., May 7 (UPI)  Karen McCloskey led a nearsweep of heats by the Long Beach Rowing Association in the United States Olympic. 1.000meter women's single sculls trials at. Marine Stadium today. She rowed the course in 4 minutes 4.9 seconds, the fastest time of the dry.

title: Taming the Beasts
description: In retrospect, there is a striking similarity in the problems Senator Frank Church's Select Committee uncovered in its separate inquiries into domestic and foreign intelligence. Presidents of both parties succumbed to the temptation to use intelligence agencies, with their capacities to act in secrecy, as instruments to perform political magic for the Oval Office. In both the domestic and foreign intelligence agencies, Presidents found officials all too eager to engage in secret and lawless activities for, as one F.B.I. man put it the greater good of the citizenry.

title: The Merely Spectacular Doctor
description: He had stunned the Deliver Nuggets with 31 points, including 6 in the final 30 seconds that provided the New York Nets with a 117111 victory. He also had 10 rebounds, four assists, two steals and four blocked shots another merely spectacular game for Julius Erving, the merely spectacular Doctor J, the surgeon in sneakers. But the Nuggets appeared most stunned by the memory of two blocked shots in the closing minutes when the game was being decided. He got there quicker than I thought, Chuck Williams said. I didn't Sports even see him, Bobby Jones said. He came out of nowhere. That's not surprising. of Doctcr J performs in nowhere. He is the The Times best basketball player in captivity, perhaps in history. But the Nets are competing for the American Basketball Association championship and, sadly, that's nowhere. Only 12,243 customers attended Thursday night's game. When the fourofseven series resumes tonight at the Nassau Coliseum with the Nets leading, 21, a sellout might materialize, the way relatives gather at a death bed.

description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 7 (UPI)Forty percent of Chile's 10 million citizens are ill with the flu, the afternoon newspaper La Segunda reported today.

title: U.N. Talks Seeking a SeaLaw Accord Close With Differences Unresolved
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 7Eight weeks of negotiations for a treaty covering the uses of the oceans and mining of deep seabed minerals closed today with ample evidence that basic disputes remained unsettled.

title: Macmillan's TradeBooks Chief Quits
description: Regina Ryan, who has been editor in chief of trade books at the Macmillan Publishing Company for the last 13 months, resigned yesterday, citing irreconcilable philosophical differences with the management.

title: MEL TORME SINGING AT TOP OF HIS FORM
description: Mel Torme's singing tends to reflect the attitude he brings to his performances. When he allows his aw, gee, shucks friendliness to become overbearing, his singing is apt to be as superficial as his approach to his audience. But when he does not try to exploit his listeners credibility and concentrates his attentions and energies on the projection of his voice, there isn't a more skillful or polished singer in the DOD field.

title: Rhodesian Black Leader Now Takes Harder Line
description: BULAWAYO, Rhodesia, May 7Joshua Nkomo, the nationalist leader whose talks with Prime Minister Ian D. Smith collapsed six weeks ago, said today that he would not offer the same concessions if negotiations over majority rule were held now.

title: HUNDREDS KILLED, MANY ARE MISSING IN ITALIAN QUAKE
description: GEMONA, Italy, May 7The known death toll in the earthquake that struck northeastern Italy last night climbed today into the many hundreds, and authorities remained uncertain how many bodies were still buried in the ruins of foothill villages.

title: Issues in Ocean Parley
description: The fourth session of the Third Conference, on the Law of the Sea, which ended inconclusively yesterday, was the latest in a series of attempts by the United Nations to frame new rules for activities throughout the world's oceans and to spur international maritime cooperation that began almost three decades ago.

title: House Vote Halts Plans to Cut Back 13 Military Bases
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (AP) The House voted today to require the Pentagon to give Congress a oneyear notice on any plans to close or cut back military installations that employ at least 500 civilians.

title: K.C. Jones Discharged as Bullets Coach
description: K. C. Jones joined the growing list of unemployed National Basketball Association coaches yesterday.

title: U. S. Enclave Prizes Status Quo in Panama
description: PANAMA, May 7  The view in the tourist brochures is usually taken from some hieh hotel terrace. It shows the redtiled roofs of Spanish colonial style houses, tall condominiurns, the quaint shrimp boats in Panama Bay and, beyond, the freighters lining up to enter the canal for the eighthour journey that will take them from the Pacific to the Caribbean.

title: New British Study on Education Says Old Way Is Best Way
description: LONDON, May 7  The conflict between advocates of traditional and progressive education has flared anew here with the publication of a new study praising oldfashioned methods.

School District went into its second day today despite a court order against it and amid allegations of threats against teachers who cross the picket line. At a hearing in State Supreme Court in Mineola, L.I., yesterday on the showcause order and stay granted to the school district Thursday by Justice Bernard F. McCaffrey, it was alleged that there had been several acts of violence during the strike by members of the Farmingdale Federation of Teachers.

title: GEORGE A. HOUGH JR; PUBLISHER WAS 81
description: George A. Hough Jr., publisher of The Falmouth (Mass.) Enterprise, a semiweekly, died yesterday in Falmouth Hospital. He was 81 years old.

title: LEBANESE TO ELECT A PRESIDENT TODAY
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 7The leadership of Lebanon's Parliament, overruling leftist and Moslem objections, decided today to go ahead tomorrow with the election of a new president for this nation which has been torn by civil war for more than a year.

title: Earthauake in North Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 7 (UPI)An earthquake was reported today in the northern part of Chile, but the epicenter was in the sea, well off the coast, the Seismological Institue of the University of Chile reported. The institute said the quake struck at 2:29 P.M. with a scale of 2.29 on the international scale of 12.

title: Ford Asks Funds for Lake Placid
description: WASHINGTON, May 7President Ford, in the presence of seven Olympic Winter Games medalists, announced today he would ask Congress to appropriate S28 million for construction of facilities at Lake Placid, N.Y., for the 1980 Winter Olympics.

title: Bryant of 76ers Faces Drug Charge
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 7 (AP)Joe Bryant, a rookie forward for the Phildelphia 76ers of the National Basketball Association, was charged with possession of cocaine today following a highspeed chase that ended when his car struck three parked vehicles and rammed a wall.

title: Spanish Cabinet Approves A TwoHouse Parliament
description: MADRID, May 7  The Spanish Government announced proposals tonight for setting up a twohouse parliament in which the entire lower house and most of the senate would be directly elected.

description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 7The New Ycrk Yankees turned their runners loose in the Oakland Coliseum tonight, and with the aid of six errors by the A's some of them provoked by Yankee speed, opened a threegame visit with a 144 victory.

title: Sickle Cell Anemia Diagnosed in Fetus Still in the Womb
description: BOSTON, May 7 (AP)Sickle cell anemia, a painful blood ailment that affects mostly blacks, has been successfully diagnosed in fetuses still in the womb by research teams on the East and West Coasts.

title: Travelers Earnings Rise
description: The Travelers Corporation, the nation's second largest pubicly owned insurance enterprise, after the Aetna Life and Casualty Company, reported yesterday increases of 121 percent in operating earnings in the first quarter and a 249.1 percent rise in net income including realized capital gains.

title: Gloom of Dostoyevsky Novels Still Evoked by Old Leningrad
description: LENINGRAD  Improbably yet undeniably, they survive  the cobblestone lanes and canal footbridges, the shabby stucco facades and melancholy courtyards that gave the 19thcentury novels of Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoyevsky an overwhelming sense of place.

title: Borg and Vilas Gain W. C. T. Final
description: DALLAS. May 7Harold Solomon was busy telling everyone who would listen how much stronger Bjorn Borg was than him. Dick Stockton was busy telling everyone who would listen that Guillermo Vilas was such a bull.

title: Ohrenstein Bill on Prostitution Is Revised to Meet Objections
description: ALBANY, May 7Manfred Ohrenstein, the Senate minority leader, introduced a revised version of his antiloitering, antiprostitution legislation today with amendments designed to meet the objections of prosecutors, civil libertarians and some of his fellow Democrats in the Assembly.

title: AARON B. COHEN
description: Aaron B. Cohen, executive director of the Daughters of Jacob Geriatric Center, 1160 Teller Avenue, the Bronx, died yesterday in Albert Einstein College Hospital after a long illness. He was 60 years old and lived in White Plains.

title: Ballet: Falco Caravan
description: Louis Falco has come up with a riot of color, sound and energy in his Ellington ballet, Caravan, and at its premiere Thursday night at the City Center, the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater came up with a new company hit.

title: Music: Lively Pirates
description: The Pirates of Penzance, the second of the Gilbert and Sullivan operettas being given by the Oyly Carte Opera Company during its engagement at the Uris Theater, was presented on Thursday night. It found the players in a far more relaxed and lively mood than they had been in the opening Mikado.

title: Carter Backed by Auto Union Chief and Wins Praise of Henry Ford
description: DEARBORN, Mich., May 7Jimmy Carter won today the praise of two toplevel figures from opposite sides of the automobile industry.

title: Sports Today
description: Sports Car Club of America races, at Pocono International Raceway, Long Pond, Pa. Bosch VW Gold Cup 56mile race., 12:30 P.M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Administration's proposal of multimilliondollar plan to help poorer nations develop raw materials, announced on the eve of Secretary Kissinger's departure for Africa, needs to go further than money. Willard Wirtz's new book, The Boundless Resource, referring to human resources, gives us a clue.

title: Belmont Race Charts
description: Belmont Race Charts

title: Allied Chemical Indicted For Poison in James River
description: RICHMOND, Va., May 7A Federal grand jury indicted the Allied Chemical Corporation today on 1,094 criminal charges in the discharging of the ant poison Kepone into the James River. The discharges have forced a shutdown of a multimilliondollar fishing industry.

title: LOUIS ALEXANDER
description: ROCHESTER, May 7 (AP)Louis Alexander, a former coach and athletic director at the University of Rochester, died yesterday at Strong Memorial Hospital. He was 76 years old.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Ford Shifts Strategy
description: President Ford began testing a new political strategy after arriving in Omaha to campaign for next Tuesday's Nebraska primary. Page 10.

title: Black Political Moves
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C.  Still another political strategy meeting, held here last weekend, has failed again to answer for blacks the nagging question of their importance as a political force in this country.

title: Marjorie B. Davis. Educator And a Nurse, Is Dead at 75
description: Marjorie B. Davis, a retired sociology professor and a registered nurse, died Sunday in the Mercer Care Center in Trenton. She was 75 years old and lived at 135 MacDougal Street.

title: Suit Asks for Receiver for Smoke Rise
description: MORRISTOWN, May 7A former executive vice president of the two corporations that manage Smoke Rise, the exclusive residential community in Kinnelon, filed suit today to force the management companies into receivership.

title: ZAPATA DISCLOSES PAYMENTS ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, May 7The Zapata Corporation made questionable foreign facilitating payments totaling $152,690 during the last five years and plans to continue to make such payments, according to documents filed by the company with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The documents were made available today.

title: Chesimard Trial Delayed
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J. May 7 (UPI)Joanne Chesimard, a member of the socalled Black Liberation Army, will not be tried until September for the slaying of a state trooper three years ago because her lawyers need more time to organize her defense. Judge Theodore Appleby in Superior Court here granted a motion to delay the trialwhich had been scheduled to open on Mondayuntil an unspecified date in September.

title: Television
description: 5:30 (4)Agriculture, U.S.A.

title: Janus On the River Rhine
description: PARIS  Things are not going smoothly along the River Rhine, main axis of contemporary European politics West European, that is to say. On April 15, German Chancellor Helmut Schmidt made a passing reference to the rise of Communist influence in countries with longtime unchanged social structures, like Portugal, Italy and, he added, to a certain degree, France.

title: Allied Chemical Indicted For Poison in James River
description: RICHMOND, Va., May 7A Federal grand jury indicted the Allied Chemical Corporation today on 1,094 criminal charges in the discharging of the ant poison Kepone into the James River. The discharges have forced a shutdown of a multimilliondollar fishing industry.

title: Navy Appoints Hamilton Coach
description: ANNAPOLIS. Md., May 7 (UPI)Bob Hamilton was named today as the head basketball coach at the United States Naval Academy, replacing Dave Smalley, who resigned to devote full time to teaching.

title: No. Amer. Soccer League
description: Dallas at Vancouver. Seattle 1, San Diego O (overtime). Tampa Bay 1, Chicago O.

title: Interest Groups Active Before F.C.C. Decision
description: WASHINGTON, May 7The Federal Communications Commission adopted a rule sharply limiting the growth of cable television after the agency's members and officials had 350 private contacts with representatives of the various industries whose fortunes would be direedy affected, acording to an F.C.C. compilation.

title: Major League Box Scores and Standings
description: Saturday, May 8. 1976

title: 123 Women to Air Academy
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (Reuters)The Air Force said today that 123 women would enter the Air Force Academy in June as part of the first class to have women, It said 1,681 men would enter the academy in Colorado Springs.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: CORRECTIONS

title: Jascalevich Seeks Exhumation Rights In Curare Inquiry
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., May 7 (UPI)A Superior Court judge reserved decision today on a motion to allow Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich, suspected in the mysterious deaths of nine patients in 1966, to exhume the bodies for an independent medical study.

title: Boat Jumpers Mark 20 Years of Insultst
description: LODI, May 7The Boat Jumpers celebrated their 20th anniversary here tonight with a dinner that attracted a sellout crowd of 600.

title: Kingman Hits 2 Homers As lets Down Padres
description: Dave Kingman drew even with Mike Schmidt in home runs last night and took over the major league lead in runs batted in as he clouted two homers and drove in five runs as the Mets defeated the San Diego Padres, 62, at Shea Stadium.

title: Stage: 2 Perplexed Men
description: An immense, blubbery fat boy sits on a chair. He is so fat we can hardly see the chair. He looks like an inflated rubber toy, a Thanksgiving Day parade float, the figure on the marquee of the Fat Boy hero shops. He is a blimp, and is nicknamed Benno Blimpie. He never stops grinning, even as he jams Dotato chins into his mouth.

title: Visiting Democrats Given Plans On Convention, and Are Pleased
description: Democratic leaders from 41 states, the District of Columbia and the Virgin Islands received yesterday a thorough preview of arrangements for their national convention here in July and they pronounced themselves hiahlv pleased.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (UPI)The Justice Department today filed a proposed consent decree forbidding a former bank director from returning to his position so long as he also is a Prudential Insurance Company director.

title: HUNDREDS KILLED, MANY ARE MISSING IN ITALIAN QUAKE
description: GEMONA, Italy, May 7The known death toll in the earthquake that struck northeastern Italy last night climbed today into the many hundreds, and authorities remained uncertain how many bodies were still buried in the ruins of foothill villages. [In late evening, the national police said that 628 people had been killed, The Associated Press reported.]

title: Brooks Bros. Will End Custom Tailoring
description: Brooks Brothers, one of the nation's venerable bastions of sartorial conservatism, is phasing out all custom tailoring.

title: Says Millions of Consumers Face Serious Disruptions in Installment Buying
description: WASHINGTON, May 7The Federal Reserve has warned that extensions of credit to millions of consumers may be seriously disrupted if the Federal Trade Commission puts into effect next Friday a new holderinduecourse rule.

title: U. S. Said to Lag in Exploring Coast for Oil
description: HOUSTON, May 7Offshore oil development  a fledgling business only six years agohas burgeoned into one of the world's biggest industries, with oil companies spending an estimated $10 billion or more each year searching shallow seas for petroleum and natural gas.

title: CITY U. EVALUATES TUITION PROPOSAL
description: Students from families with annual incomes of $10,000 or above would have to pay at least $290 a year to attend City University, according to State Education Department data, if tuition were imposed at the same rate as at the State University.

title: Hartke Margin Increased In Indiana Senate Race
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 7United States Senator Vance Hartke appears to have won the Indiana Democratic senatorial nomination by a wider margin than earlier returns indicated.

title: Hayes Scrambles for 67133 Leads Nelson Golf by Two
description: DALLAS, May 7 (AP)Mark Hayes, who seems to have been among the leaders in every golf tournament for the last three months, scrambled through cold and wind to a fourunderpar 67 as he took a twoshot lead today in the second round of the $200,000 Byron Nelson golf classic.

title: ATOMIC PANEL BACKS PLANNED T.V.A. UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (UPI) Plans for a huge new Tennessee Valley Authority atomic power plant won approval today from the Nuclear Regulatory Commission's advisory committee on reactor safeHguards. The committee is an independent panel of scientists who review safety aspects of proposed nuclear plants and make recommendations to the N.R.C.

title: REDS OF EUROPE AGREE ON PARLEY
description: BONN, May 7After more than a year of arguments, East and West European Communist parties have agreed to meet in East Berlin after the Italian general elections next June, according to participants in a preliminary meeting that ended in the East German capital last night.

title: REDS OF EUROPE AGREE ON PARLEY
description: BONN, May 7After more than a year of arguments, East and West European Communist parties have agreed to meet in East Berlin after the Italian general elections next June, according to participants in a preliminary meeting that ended in the East German capital last night.

title: U.S. Agencies in Rift on Size of Soviet Arms Budget
description: A dispute between the Central Intelligence Agency and the Defense Intelligence Agency over estimates of the Soviet Union's military budget has been disclosed by Lieut. Gen. Daniel 0. Graham, former chief of the miliary intelligence service.

title: Ford Shifts Strategy
description: President Ford began testing a new political strategy after arriving in Omaha to campaign for next Tuesday's Nebraska primary. Page 10.

title: Ullrich, Greene, Nisselson And Cox in Golf Semifinals
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L.I., May 7Wind and water can play more tricks with a golf shot at the Seawane Club than a bad backswing. The fairways become small targets and the canals large landing areas when the wind swirls at 20 miles an hour as it did today.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: It was Incorrectly stated in The Times yesterday that the Board of Education intended to give contracts to private agencies for school mentalhealth programs. The school board is opposed to the idea.

title: U.S. Pilot in Czech Foray Cleared by Munich Court
description: MUNICH, West Germay, May 7 (Reuters)An American helicopter pilot who ferried 11 people from Czechoslovakia to West Germany was cleared here today of charges related to the incident.

title: Cars, Cars Everywhere And Not a Drop of Gas
description: LONG POND, Pa., May 7There were cars from England, cars from Germany; there were cars with Australian drivers and cars with Belgian drivers. There were blue cars and yellow cars and red cars.

title: Misuse of Power
description: Hard as it is to believe that a President of the United States would use his official power to hamstring a campaign rival, it is even harder to put any other interpretation on President Ford's failure to act immediately on the revised campaign finance bill. His press secretary has explained that Mr. Ford's decision on whether or not to sign the measure must wait for review by his counsel, the Office of Management and Budget and Republican Congressional leaders. That contention preposterous.

title: PRESIDENT VETOES AID BILL, CHARGING IT RESTRICTS HIM
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 President Ford vetoed the S4.4 billion foreignaid bill today, saying that unprecedented restrictions in the authorization measure would seriously inhibit my ability to implement a coherent and consistent foreign policy.

title: Warriors Beat Suns, Lead by 21
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., May 7 (AP)Rick Barry flipped a high pass to George Johnson who popped the ball in with 1 minute 20 seconds to go tonight as the Golden State Warriors posted a 9991 victory over the Phoenix Suns in the National Basketball Association Western Conference finals.

title: AssemblyLine Homes
description: The Golden West Mobile plant and the Vindale Corporation, in a project conceived and supervised by Family Circle magazine have developed a standardized, assemblyline produced home to ease the growing shortage of new, singlefamily homes. Page 33.

title: About New York
description: Leaving the annual dinner of the Bronx County Democratic organization at the Grand Ballroom of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel on Thursday night, an observer was cheered by the sight of a bouquet of attractive young women making for the adjoining Basildon Room.

title: Rogers Peet Plans To Close One Store 012 on 5th Avenue
description: The Rogers Peet clothing store at 600 Fifth Avenue will close next April, according to an announcement by its owners the Cluett. Peabody Corporation. The company cited mounting costs, including high rent, for the shutdown.

title: Critic's Notebook: Tale Of Caution for Architect
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 5 The theme of this year's American Institute of Architects convention is the architecture of information"an attempt to explore the idea of communication about a physical environment, about the importance that signs and symbols have in informing people's perceptions. Unfortunately, most of the architects who attended this year were preoccupied with something elsethe fact that for many of them. 1975 was a year of depression, and the outlook for economic improvement in 1976 is not much better.

title: Top Chairmen See Vigorous Recovery
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., May 7 (AP)The Business Council, an organization composed of chairmen of the boards of about 100 major companies, said today, that the economic recovery should be strong and now seemed to have the strength to last at least through next year.

title: Brooks Bros. Will End Custom Tailoring
description: Brooks Brothers, one of the nation's venerable bastions of sartorial conservatism, is phasing out all custom tailoring.

title: 14 Die in Mexican Crash
description: MEXICO CITY, May 7 (Reuters)Fourteen persons were killed and about 30 injured when a crowded suburban bus collided with a train here, Red Cross officials said today. All the casualties were passengers on the bus.

title: Dip in Con Edison Voltage Affects Many Businesses
description: Consolidated Edison voltage dipped momentarily across New York City and Westchester County yesterday afternoon, causing a flickering of lights and a flurry of electronic problems for Wall Street, the communications industry and many computerdependent businesses.

title: Emergency Help
description: The city has established an Emergency Operating Center at 60 Centre Street to provide assistance to tenants with problems stemming from the strike. The telephone number is 2679800.

title: Notes on People
description: There is a new big boss for Big Bird, the Cookie Monster, Oscar the Grouch and other Sesame Street residents. Paul B. Firstenberg, financial vice president of Princeton University for the last two years, is joining the Children's Television Workshop. He will take over daytoday operations in the newly created post of executive vice president. Joan Ganz Cooney, remaining as president, expects to concentrate more on creative development.

title: Prado's Goya Paintings, In Capital, Spectacular
description: One of the more spectacular events of the Bicentennial year is the arrival at the National Gallery of Art in Washington of eight paintings by Goya that normally hang in the Prado in Madrid. (They are in Washington through May 26. From June 6 through August 1 they can be seen at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.)

title: College and School Results
description: College and School Results

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Biship Paul Moore ("A Bishop's plea to New York Businessmen, April 25) is to be lauded for his forthright condemnation of the immorality of the corporations who leave New York in its hour of need. Your readers who fault the Bishop by pointing out that he blames the corporations for a situation not of their own making miss the point.

title: BillionDollar Stakes in Africa
description: WASHINGTON  The American presence in Africa has suddenly received new visibility with the symbolic tour of Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger through the continent, yet American economic relations with Africa remain deeply ambiguous.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: MAYBE it's not worth it to the National Geographic to send a camera crew out, as it does in pursuit of peculiar apods in the Mindanao Deep or anomalous shrubbery above the treeline on Mount Everest. But nature also works miracles in the suburbs about this time of year, when the weather is changing.

title: BEAME STEPS UP BUILDINGS TALKS
description: Mayor Beame yesterday asked the chairman of the State Mediation Board to schedule round  the  clock negotiations starting today in an effort to end the apartmenthouse strike in the next 24 to 48 hours.

title: Atoms Fast Goal Tops Cosmos in Overtime, 21
description: The Philadelphia Atoms scored twice within 58 seconds last night and defeated the Cosmos, 21, in a North American Soccer League game. Thesecond and deciding goal came after 33 seconds of overtime at Yankee Stadium before 14,287 fans.

title: Handicapped and Money
description: AFTER a long struggle, it appears that the only publicly supported school for the handicappedthe A. Harry Moore School in Jersey Citywill survive. The state has allotted it $614,000. This leaves in question the fate of the Pingry School of Hillside, which a state agency intended to buy for $6.5 million to replace the Moore school.

title: Sunday Observer
description: For many years Luke rode the range in a white hat. When he saw a man in a black hat, Luke chased him and shot him. Men in black hats were always trying to prevent the cattle from getting to Abilene or stealing the widow's ranch. Luke was fearless and kind. He never drank anything stronger than sarsaparilla and never tried to kiss the schoolmarm.

title: Phillies Snap Dodgers 12Game Streak
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 8 (UPI)Gene Garber, who relieved Jim Kaat in the sixth, blanked the Dodgers with onehit over four innings tonight, and Greg Luzinski belted a long rome run as the Philadelphia Phillies snapped a 12game Los Angeles winning streak with a 64 decision.

title: Flatlands Church Planning Fair to Help Famine Relief
description: The Flatlands Reformed Church will dedicate its Flatlands Community Fair next Saturday to the famine relief provided by the Church World Service for droughtstricken villagers in India.

title: Madeira Reacts Warily To Plan for Autonomy
description: FUNCHAL, MadeiraPortugal's new statute setting guidelines for regional autonomy to its restive Atlantic holdings, the Azores and Madeira, received a wary welcome here, but no cheers.

title: Yonkers Raceway Results
description: Yonkers Raceway Results

title: U.N. Chapel Weddings: Ecumenical Spirit
description: The bride was in white, a floor sweeping gown and doubletiered veil. On the arm of her father, she stepped down the chapel aisle past guestfilled pews draped with white bows toward the altar to join her bridegroom, who wore a pale blue brocade tuxedo. Before cleaving her there, her father lifted the veil and kissed her on both cheeks.

title: The World
description: The main issues in the Italian elections scheduled for June 20 and 21 will be not so much the faltering economy or controversial social questions such as divorce and abortion, but whether the best party to handle them is the Christian Democratic Party or the Communists.

title: WaterPipeline to Safety
description: HUGE cement cylinders that look like a giant, unthreaded necklace stretch in a jagged line from the Round Valley Reservoir in Hunterdon County to Whitehouse Station, 3.7 miles to the east. During the next 14 months, the cylinders, nine feet in diameter, will be joined and buried to a covering depth ranging from five to 15 feet to form a water pipeline with the capacity to pump 400 million gallons a day from the reservoir into the Raritan River or from the river to the reservoir.

title: 40,000 Believed Homeless After Italian Earthquake
description: UDINE, Italy, May 8Bulldozers and blasting teams from all over Italy were pushing their way through rockslides and demolished towns here in northeastern Italy today in an urgent effort to save any survivors still trapped in the debris of Thursday night's earthquake.

title: Just a Candidate in Office?
description: A new Gerald Ford, who is apparently going to be more Presidential, has appeared in the Nebraska primary, and tit's about time. The new strategy may not rescue Mr. Ford from Ronald Reagan, but maybe it will give the country something resembling a President, rather than a candidate in office who jumps when his opponent shouts.

title: Dr. Jane Kunstler Wed To Dr. George Drazek
description: Dr. Jana Kunstler and Dr. George Drazek, 1976 graduates of the Medical School of the State University at Buffalo, were married yesterday in Mamaroneck, N. Y., at the home of Lotte Kunstler, mother of the bride.

title: New Jazz From the Midwest Moves East
description: As more and more young jazz musicians from Chicago and St. Louis move eastward to New York and New England, their originality becomes more and more evident. Their improvisation ranges from solo saxophone recitals to littletried combinations of horns, rhythm instruments and electronics. They have rendered the clamorous playing characteristic of much of New York's jazz avantgarde all but obsolete with their more thoughtful approaches to improvisational structure and content. Their concerts at the La Mama Bilingual Workshop, the Tin Palace, Studio Rivbea and other downtown locations have enlivened the city's already busy new jazz subculture, and, more importantly, given local jazzmen something to think about. Where one often used to hear music which echoed the jazz revolution of the mid60's, one now hears genuinely contemporary innovation.

title: The Wind Will Not Subside
description: David and Nancy Milton are an American couple who transplanted themselves and three children to Peking in 1964. They tell us little or nothing about why, where they came from, what they knew about China, or how they were recruited to teach English to future Chinese bureaucrats. In this puzzling reticence they are almost Chinese but it's possible to infer that their motives were mainly political. Sharing a misapprehension that many Americans held at the time, they imagined that Peking was emerging as a new center and base for world revolution. In their case, appears, the misapprehension was also a hope. Peking for the Miltons seems to have been roughly what Petrograd had been long before for John Reed, the hometown of a thennew, nowfaded internationalism.

title: GARDENING
description: IT is difficult to imagine not having tomatoes as a staple in our diet. We use them most everyday in sauces, soups and ketchup, not to mention in salads and freshly sliced. Yet this same fruit was grown only as an ornamental in this country until about ]800, because it was thought to be poisonous. It was, in fact, not widely eaten until the early 1900's.

title: A New U.S. Plan For Poor Nations
description: Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger has completed his twoweek tour of Africa, leaving behind a set of political and economic pronouncements designedafter the shock Communist success and American failure in Angola  to promote anew Washington's influence on the continent and in the underdeveloped work generally.

title: National League
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES New York 7, San Diego 2. Pittsburgh 5, Atlanta 3. Cincinnati 14, Chicago 4. St. Louis 5, Houston 1 (n.). Phila. 6, Los Angeles 4 (n.). Montreal 7, San Francisco 5.

title: For Harlem, in 64 there was a dream. Not now.
description: In the late summer of 1964, I sat in a rear window seat of a Greyhound bus headed for Charlotte, N. C. I had just completed a summerschool program at Phillips Exeter Academy and I was excited about going home. At the time, however, I was preoccupied with a Time magazine article about the riots in east Harlem.

title: Adams of Suns Rookie of Year
description: The Phoenix Suns firstyear center, Alvan Adams was named yesterday as the National Basketball Association rookie of the year in a landslide vote for the 6foot9Inch Oklahoman.

title: Julie Shea, 17, Wins Central Park Run
description: Applause. Finish line. Cramps. Nearcollapse. Then smiles. Lot of smiles.

title: New Jersey/This Week
description: New Jersey/This Week

title: Egypt Seeks to Improve Bad Relations With Soviet
description: CAIRO, May 8Egypt appears to be intent on halting the deterioration of its relations with the Soviet Union, which reached a low point in March when Cairo abrogated its Treaty of Friendship and Cooperation with Moscow.

title: Bumper Crops Mean Lower Prices, and Farmers Blame Ford
description: As the Presidential primaries move through the western half of Middle America, the Republican candidates are contending with a particular kind of politics, that of rain and the Russians.

title: Garbage Peril Eased by Special Pickups
description: Cool weather along with an additional fleet of 20 sanitation trucks and a force of more than 40 health inspectors have lessened health dangers that might arise from the apartmenthouse strike, according to Health Commissioner Lowell E. Bellin.

title: William Swartzbaugh Weds F. May Parsons
description: F. May Parsons, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore Parsons of Billerica, Mass., and William Lamson Swartzbaugh, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Lamson Swatrzbaugh of Essex, Conn., were married yesterday at noon.

title: Isadora had a taste for Russian love
description: When Isadora Duncan returned to the United States in October 1922 after her triumphant appearances in Moscow, she brought back a boundless enthusiasm for the Soviet system and a Russian husband almost two decades her junior. Her return was widely covered in the press because she and Sergei Esenin, her new husband, were briefly detained by the immigration authorities at Ellis Island under suspicion of being Bolshevik agents. The Herald described Esenin as superblond, of a slim, athletic build, broadshouldered and slim waisted and the most cheerful Bolshevist that ever crossed the Atlantic. The New York World added that Esenin spoke French and was a boyish chap, who looks as though he might make an excellent halfback for any football team.

title: More Jobs Foreseen for Graduates of Kings Poin
description: KINGS POINT, L.I., May 1June graduates of the United States Merchant Marine Academy can expect to find more sailing jobs available after graduation than in recent years, members of the Academy's Congressional Board of Visitors have been told.

title: Ballet: Nureyev Compelling in Manon
description: The Royal Ballet, now drawing to the end of its season at the Metropolitan Opera House with only one more week to run, organizes itself on almost more operatic than balletic lines. Which is to say that the casting is as important as what is being cast, and the dancers are more important than what is being danced. It is a view of dance that has some validity, but less pertinence.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: How ironic that one should witness an epidemic through the eyes of the personally immune. Not that this isn't an enlightening vantage point, but it can be subtly and innocently misleading. Harold C. Schonberg's unusual ability ["The City's Beat Is Allegro Furioso, March 21] to assimilate all the sounds of the city is indeed remarkable, But I suspect he, like many another inveterate city dweller, has deceived himself into believing he has adapted to the daily cacophony, while in fact he is being subjected to continuous subliminal stress. Selfimposing a mental delusion is not so much an enviable solution as the only achievable one.

title: Major League Averages
description: Major League Averages

title: Franco's Legacy: Several Intractable Issues
description: MADRID  The Spanish Government is trying to perform a kind of political alchemy and, like most alchemists, is running into problems of both practicality and credibility. The attempts to transform a Fascistinspired system of authoritarianism that has lasted for 37 years into a democratic one is threatening the country's ability to survive.

title: NICOLAS CHATELAIN, LE FIGARO WRITER
description: PARIS, May 8, Nicolas Chatelain, a correspondent for the newspaper Le Figaro in Washington and Moscow, died yesterday in his apartment. He was 63 years old and lived with his son, Alexander.

title: Rising Cost of Plastic Money
description: It's the day before payday and you are offered an irresistible bargain. Since you don't have the cash, you dig out your bank credit card and snap up the item.

title: FLOOD THREATENS JAPANESE TUNNEL
description: TOKYO, May 8Deep under the Tsugaru Strait in northern Japan, construction workers toiled tonight to hold back surging water that threatens to ruin four years of work on what is to be the world's longest tunnel.

title: Writer, Threatened Over Link to F.B.I., Secludes Herself
description: NASHVILLE, May 8 (AP)The husband of a former copy editor and writer for The Nashville Tennessean said today that his wife left home yesterday with two of their three children after she received threatening telephone calls about her alleged relationship with the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

description: Nets Box Score

title: John D. Souther And Tom Pacheco At the Bottom Line
description: John David Souther and Tom Pacheco, two singing songwriters who performed at the Bottom Line Friday and yesterday, share a certain, tendency toward dourness. Mr. Pacheco, who is one of the new breed of country and western rebels, is dour in the manner of Johnny Cash, with a few Bob Dylan mannerisms thrown in.

title: A Box of Posies Will Brighten The Window
description: Like so many other things, window boxes have been adapted to modem living and may be found in many places. They are attached to window sills and porch railings or are built as part of a new home.

title: Anti  Apartheid Party Wins ByElection in South Africa
description: DURBAN, South Africa, Ma 6 (Reuters)South Africa's vigorously antiapartheid opposition Progressive Reform Party has won a byelection here, indicating that whites are splitting into two distinct campsthose for racial separation and those against.

title: Italy Likely to Maintain NATO Ties if Communists Join Government, Research Group Here Says
description: An analysis of recent events and emerging trends in world affairs, issued this weekend by Columbia University's Research Institute on International Change, concluded that Communist participation in an Italian coalition government after the June election would pose no immediate threat to private capital or to Italy's membership in NATO.

title: Empty Seats at Pocono 5000
description: LONG POND, Pa., May 8Dan Gurney stuck his fingers in his ears today and it wasn't because of the noise at Pocono International Raceway.

description: ()1976, by Trlangle Publications. (The Dally Racing Form)

title: SURPLUS PROPERTIES ARE GIVEN UP BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP)President Ford has announced the transfer of 19 parcels of surplus Federal property to state and local governments and Federal agencies under the Legacy of Parks program.

title: The Bowling Clinic
description: There are so many ways to describe the failure of one particular pin fall after what appears to be a perfect strike hit that it must be bowling's most intriguing issue.

title: How Ronald Reagan Would Run the Economy
description: WASHINGTONThere is a single theme that runs through nearly all of Ronald Reagan's speeches, position rapers and statements in interviews.

title: Smith's Foes: Young, Tough
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia As, the possibilities for a peaceful settlement in Rhodesia seem to diminish by the week, the focus of power in the black nationalist struggle is shifting from the politicians to the guerrilla army commanders. To the Western world, they are faceless men, largely unknown beyond the camps in Mozambique from which they launch sorties across the easilypenetrable 700mile Rhodesian border.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: It is still early to set out tomato, pepper, eggplant seedlings except in the most southerly sections where the weather is settled. Spray birch trees with Cygon or MetaSystoxR for control of birch leaf miner; repeat in lateMay and midJune. Mulch strawberry beds Set out gladiolus corms for cutting flowers. Continue fruit tree spraying with allpurpose formula.

title: Two Houses Run by Church Offer Runaways Haven in Fairfield
description: WESTPORT. Conn., May 8Runaway children number in the hundreds in Fairfield County every year, according to the police, and until a few years ago the area offered no haven for such youngsters.

description: MICAH was the mastermind behind our asking for the boys, Karina O'Malley said, alluding to her 10yearold son, in our family it helps to correct the imbalance.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: President Ford's decision to veto a bill providing funds to upgrade the quality of day care in America is not in the public interest. In this regard am in essential agreement with the editorial position taken by The Times. However, both President Ford's veto message and The Times editorial fail to speak to the most salient issue in this matter.

description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Amish People
description: The Amish are hard to get to know. They have been stared at ever since they got here from Germany two hundred years ago and the curiosity of rubberneckers doesn't interest them. Also, since as a matter of hard and fast principle they don't go to school for more than eight grades.

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: The white tile floor in our upstair bathroom has rust stains on it that we cannot seem to remove. Can you recommend a procedure that might work?Mrs. V. M., Bay Shore, N.Y.

title: TRIAL IN PAKISTAN IMPERS CRITICS
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, May 7In a closely guarded provincial courtroom near the Arabian Sea, Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto's Government is conducting a sedition trial that is expected to cripple its principal political opposition.

title: A Driver Charged in Greece In Crash Fatal to Politician
description: ATHENS, May 8 (Reuters)A 31yearold shopowner was charged today with the homicide by negligence in the death of the liberal politician Alexandros Panagoulis.

title: Cavaliers Still Working on Ways to Stop Celtics
description: Red Auerbach now sits in a loge in the Boston Garden. opposite the visitors bench and follows the game closely. A scowl still crosses his face when the Boston Celtics stand around when they should be running their famed break, Auerbach still mumbles under his breath when a player turns the ball over or fails to carry out a defensive assignment.

title: Postal Fees Force Maritime Day Posters Into Cheaper Berth
description: For the last 19 years early May has meant the appearance of a new Maritime Day poster in post offices all over the country and on the sides of mail trucks in major cities. This year it's going to be different. The Maritime Administration in Washington, which, with major steamship industry trade associations, sponsors the annual poster contest, open to high school students all over the nation, said last week it had to forgo the privilege of displaying this year's poster at post office facilities.

title: Nisselson Conquers Cox In Richardson Golf Final
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L.I., May 8Peter Nisselson, a 40yearold former Yale golf captain, holed out at the 16th and then the 18th hoies with two spectacular chip shots today to win the 29th annual William D. Richardson memorial tournament at the Seawane Club.

title: A Mild Touch of Gold Fever Along the Cool Streams of Vermont
description: I didn't strike it rich in Vermont, but not for lack of trying. I spent the better part of a day rummaging around barefoot, bent over until my back screamed, panning for gold in the cool, rushing streams of the Green Mountains. And when I finally decided to call it quits, I left refreshed and happy, if not laden with gold.

title: In Memorium
description: BURGER, The employees of Art Steel Co., Inc. are saddened to remember their Founder, Alexander Burger, flay 13, 1932: and their Secretary, Arthur Burger, Mar12. 1965.

title: The Age of Capital
description: Like the cuts of beef, the slices of written history have become so conventional that it is difficult to think of them as parts of a living animal. The American Civil War, which cost approximately 600,000 lives, is seldom placed on the same dish with the Chinese Taiping Rebellion (18501866), which may have cost 20 million lives. The nationalistic mid19th century has been particularly subject to meticulous carving by specialists on the German and Italian unifications, on the French Second Empire, on Victorian Britain and on the American Civil War. Professional historians have regarded efforts to box this portion of the world's experience in a single package much as French chefs would regard a Big Mac.

title: Many a Wonder Down Under
description: So tell me, dared the lady in Pittsburgh (where I was lecturing), why should I visit Australia?

title: He Neglected to Protect the Center
description: In the political handicappers early line, Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington, though hardly an oddson favorite, was almost a sure thing to make it through all the primaries and show up at the finish line, the July 12th Democratic convention in New York. He was a rock, colorless but stubborn and wellfinanced.

description: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS

description: BLOOMBERGDr. Henry H. Unveiling at 2 P.M. on May 16, at Beth Israel Cemetery, Woodbridge, N.J.

description: The Playoffs

title: The Republican Dilemma
description: WASHINGTON  The Republican Party is in trouble these days because it is playing its worst cards. Its strengths are that it has the Presidency, the economy is recovering and the nation is at peace for the first time in many years, but the G.O.P. seems determined to attack its own strengths.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Helen Maclnnes hit the jackpot with her very first novel, Above Suspicion, in 1941. She has written 15 books since then, and they have sold in the millions. There is something in the Maclnnes books that seems to satisfy every reader. Most of her books follow a formula. There is, always, espionage. There is the threat of the Communists (or, back when, Nazis or Fascists). There is often a romance. There is the bright amateur, thrust among the professionals, vet somehow managing to hold his own. There are interpolated homilies about the stupid, sleeping democracies and the hungry dangerous, freedomeating dictatorships.

title: ADELAIDE NEUWIRTH
description: Adelaide Neuwirth, a life master in contract bridge, died yesterday of a heart attack in the Monmouth Medical Center in Long Branch, N.J. She was 75 years old and lived at 11 Stuyvesant Place in Elberon, N.J.

title: Friendly Fire
description: Who served in the Vietnam War? Of the 234 drafteligible sons of members of Congress, only 26 went to Vietnam and only eight saw any combat. One of the eight was wounded; none was killed. Vice President Agnew's son served there but he came home O.K. Vice President Humphrey once called the Vietnam War our great adventure, but none of his draftage sons was in it. President Kennedy, who edged us into the war, had no draftable children. President Johnson, who heartily desired that America's soldiers bring home a coonskin for the wall, had no sons to give to his country's military service, nor did President Nixon, who once mused that the Vietnam War may have been our finest hour.

title: Portuguese Policei Battle 300 Refugees To End Occupation
description: OPORTO, Portugal, May 8 (AP)  Riot policemen used clubs, tear gas and warning shots early today against some 300 refugees from Portugual's former colonies in Africa who refused to end a fiveday occupation of the Government's Refugee Support Institute.

title: Remembering 64 Is No Elephant Joke
description: WASHINGTONRonald Reagan once was the leading apostle of an Eleventh CommandmentThou shalt not speak ill of a fellow Republican"and a poster on an office wall in President Ford's campaign headquarters facetiously proclaims a Twelfth: Thou shalt not hassle.

title: The Building of a Fence
description: Harry Landsfeld, zoning inspector in the town of Greenwich in Connecticut, frequently gets calls from homeowners who are about to install solid stockade fence around their property.

title: Mr. Science and Johnny Sell the SST
description: POPONENTS of the Concorde supersonic transport know that regardless of legislation or judicial decisions, people will not fly in an airplane they regard as an enemy. Accordingly, we may soon see the heghming of publicrelations campaign to persuade Long Islanders in th' plane's flight path and others concerned about its effects that carsplitting noise, chokinit air pollution and potentially cancercausing depletion of the ozone layer aren't as bad as they think. Following is a hypothetical TV spot designed with this end in mind:

title: LEBANESE ELECT A NEW PRESIDENT AMID SHELLFIRE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 8Elias Sarkis, a conservative banker and civil servant, was elected Lebanon's new President today in a dramatic session of Parliament, as mortar shells thudded into the street outside and automatic smallarms fire raked the approaches to the meeting place.

title: Restored Villages in Greece
description: The National Tourist Organization of Greece has begun work on a program to transform a number of villages into tourist complexes that will achieve two basic goals: (1) Offer visitors to the country a taste of typical smalltown life away from the larger towns and cities; (2) improve the economy in deserted areas, so that the people will return.

title: Briton Jailed on Charge Of Violating Race Act
description: BIRMINGHAM, England, May 8 (Reuters)A man who refused to take down a sign advertising his house for sale to English families only has been sent to prison for contempt of court.

title: Or Preserve By Drying For Wintertime
description: Because of their brilliant colors and varied forms annuals are most suitable to use as dried flowers. Some of them such as the strawflower and globe amaranth are known as everlastings for they are easily dried without the use of a desiccant.

title: When Movies Were a Laughing Matter
description: Have you been seeing more movies lately, but laughing less? It could be that today's harsh headlines have deadened your funnybone. But save your tears, for all is not lost. Laughter will reign again, starting Thursday night when the Museum of Modern Art presents Harold Lloyd's silent, hilarious For Heaven's Sake as the opening attraction of its Bicentennial Salute to American Film Comedy.

title: Recital: Judith Norell on Harpsichord
description: When Judith Norell was at her best during her harpsichord recital at Carnegie Hall on Friday night, she was good enough to rank with some of the finest of her colleagues in an increasingly competitive field.

title: Mr. Simon in Santiago
description: Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon, the first United States Cabinet member to visit Chile since the military takeover in 1973, said things that needed saying in Santiago and evidently made an impression on President Augusto Pinochet and his colleagues. In an obvious bid to dilute American criticism of its repressive practices, Chile's ruling junta had announced the release of 49 political prisoners even before Mr. Simon's arrival.

title: Record Influx
description: PARIS, May 8The French, who talk a lot about America, are going there this year in apparently record numbers for a personal look at what is widely perceived here as the land of pocket calculators, blue Jeans and, lately, someone called Jeemy, Car taire.
