title: 4Run 9th Sinks A's for No. 5
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 8The running Yankees, who are developing a finishing kick worthy of Marty Liguori, sprinted to another lateinning victory today as they, broke a tie with four runic in the ninth inning and defeated the Oakland A's, 84.

title: Ruling on Homosexuality Seems to Have Little Effect
description: The recent United States Supreme Court decision upholding a law that forbids homosexual acts committed in private by consenting adults so far appears to have had almost no impact on law enforcement.

title: Long Island, This Week
description: ART

title: LauraEileen Herrlin Engaged To Philip Needles Williams
description: LauraEileen O'Melia Herrin, a senior at Lafayette College, and Philip Needles Williams, who graduated summa cum laude last year from Lehigh. University, plan to be married in Garden City, L.I., on June 26. The ceremony will take place in the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation.

title: Crime and Parole
description: THE issue of crime touches everyone and is a favorite cause of politicians. In New Jersey, a fraud is being perpetrated on the people. Parole is being done away with, in all but name. Governor Byrne's budget proposes a 40 percent reduction in the field staff of the Bureau of Parole to accomplish a milliondollar saving in a budget of $2.8 billion. The practical effect of this cut will be to increase caseloads to such a degree that parolees will be seriously affected.

title: Nets Triumph and Lead, 31
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., May 8The New York Nets got a sparkling game from the usual sourceJulius Ervingand from two less usual sources at the Nassau Coliseum tonight, defeated the Denver Nuggets, 121112, and took a 31 lead in the American Basketball Association Championship playoff series.

title: Fashion: Paris report
description: Except for two smashing collections, both of which took strong ethnic turns, the Paris readytowear shows for next fall and winter were a bore.

title: Cooperating to Eat
description: IN the old, onestory building on Remsen Avenue in New Brunswick, the customers selecting fresh produce from huge bins on one day are likely to be working behind the counter or sweeping floors the next. Save Themselves, a food cooperative geared to lowincome groups, helping one another is the key.

title: Communism Italian style
description: ROME. The local Communist Party chief in the small northern Italian city was dressed in a bright tweed jacket A paisley scarf was tucked smartly into his shirt, and the English tobacco in his pipe was much more pleasant and expensive than mine. In his early 30's, he has been in the party for years, just like his father. But given the nature of the party today, he reported some generational problems.

title: News Summary and Index
description: While mortar shells exploded in the street and smallarms fire raked the approaches to the meeting place in Beirut, the Lebanese Parliament elected anew President yesterday. He is Elias Sarkis, a conservative banker and civil servant and, in conformance with Lebanese political tradition, a Christian. Sixtysix of the 98 members of Parliament voted for Mr. Sarkis and three cast blank votes. The 29 others, who favored Raymond Edde, the only rival candidate, boycotted the session in protest against what they said was open military and political interference in favor of Mr. Sarkis. The opposition's boycott made it questionable that the election of a new President would calm grievances and hasten the end of the civil war as was intended. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: I Hear America Swinging
description: Bill Bumpers's doctoral dissertation on divorce is rejected by the university's social sciences departinent, but then accepted by the English department as an antinovel. whose failure to make sense of the data through which it gropes is precisely its artistic raison d'etre. Armed with his degree, Bumpers sets up shop as a marital counselor in Middle City, Iowa, and quickly becomes involved with the Herkimer Heck Brown family. Heck's a farmer who's recently fallen in with a worldly and highliving Eastern crowd who hold that the Bible, is simply another book, to be read as literature, and who find amusement In everything on two levels (that's what camp is really all about). Heck has renamed the farm Pretty Pass and taken to wearing an e.e. cummings Tshirt over his tan corduroy trousers. He's also developed a block about farming. Shouldn't you be dusting the crops? his wife asks. Oh, the maid will dust them, the farmer said, and gave his new laugh. He won't even milk the cows, because he says he's avoiding the reeking herd, like Edna St. Vincent Millay tells us to.

title: Miss McGrath Is Wed To Thomas Robinson
description: Katherine McGrath and Thomas Robinson, 1974 graduates of Washington and Jefferson College, were married in West Simsbury, Conn., yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Joseph C. Gengras performed the ceremony in St. Catherine of Siena Roman Catholic Church.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Most people think of instant photography, or the concept of seeing finished prints within minutes after the film is exposed in the camera, as a comparatively modern innovation that first came along when Dr. Land invented the Polaroid camera. Yet the idea is in many ways as old as photography itself.

title: Lolich Gains 2d in 72 Victory
description: The New York Mets continued to deal the hot hand yesterday when they whipped the San Diego Padres, 72, before 41,990 customers at Shea Stadium for the 12th victory in their last 14 starts.

description: PITTSBURGH, May 8 (AP) Penn State's Mike Shine set two meet records in the hurdles and anchored a pair of relay teams today as he starred in the Pitt invitation track meet.

title: What Ails Portfolios? Too Much and Too Little
description: The main mistake that most investors make is oning too many securities. This declaration, coming as it does out of Wall Street, might sound like heresy. Rather, his specialty is reviewing customer portfolios for the world's largest brokerage house and his clinical perspective resembles that of a doctor studying a patient.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: 0 nce upon a time there was a form called musical comedy, but some sort of wicked witch came along and took the comedy out of it, leaving sobersided narratives and thoughtfully motivated tunesoften good tunesto do all of the evening's work. Now they're trying to take the music away, too, after which we can wear hairshirts and do penance for the sin of having, for so many carefree years, enjoyed ourselves.

description: TodayWindham County K.C. allbreed and obedience, Recrea, Lion Park. Junction Routes 6 and 14; Willimantic, Conn.; 1.608 dogs; 9 A.M.

title: Miss Guthrie Kept On Indy Sideline
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 8 (AP)Janet Guthrie, wearing a borrowed racing outfit, appeared at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway today, but was kept from driving because of a leaking oil line.

title: What's Doing in LONDON
description: SENSITIVITY  I've seen the past and it works, said one New York journalist about London. How kind, how very kind. Another gentleman from CBS called Britain a museum piece. We Londoners are very sensitive when American friends ask about the Crisis and the Decline. After all, we're busy helping America. We've sent over our plays, clothes, writers, broadcaststo spread joy in New York, as its schools and hospitals crumble. We want to send the supersonic Concorde to help you get away from it all. We've sent musicians, too. The British musician has a sense of stylemore flexible, more aware of subtleties that exists nowhere else. That comes with having an unbroken historyyou lose style as soon as you Lave a rtzmlution. Thus ehudi Menuhin. But does this cultural power blind the British to social divisions that could hamper their progress? That's a question this summer's visitors can rethemselves.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The genius of our Constitution is that it guaranteed rights to powerless individuals against the powerful collective called government so the people would control the governrnent, rather than the reverse.

title: Marjorie S. Mueller Is Wed in Fairfield
description: Lawrence McKitrick were marLawrence McKittrick were married yesterday afternoon in the Greenfield Hill Congregational Church in Fairfield, Conn., by the Rev. Stanley L. Houston.

title: West Virginia Rockefeller Running Hard
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., May 7Country roads, the rutted, muddy, twisting and sometimes impassable skein of hillside tracks that make large parts of backwoods West Virginia seem as remote as ShangriLa, are the top priority of this state's resident Rockefeller these days. More cosmic thoughts are not noticeably on his mind.

title: Madrid Releases 3 Leftist Leaders Arrested at Protest
description: MADRID, May 8 (Reuters)The Government of King Juan Carlos took another step toward liberalization today when it ordered the release of three members of the opposition held sinde April 3 after an antiGovernment demonstration.

title: The Nation
description: Unexpectedly, the Senate has failed to override President Ford's veto of et bill to provide $125 million for child day care centers to meet Federal safety and staffing standards. Because of the failure, many centers will have to cross unless the Department of Health, Education and Welfare declines to enforce the standards, or Congress quickly passes a new bill acceptable to Mr. Ford.

title: Endpaper
description: P.D.Q. Bach has been called history's most justifiably neglected composer and a fly in the oinunent of art, among other things; during the infrequent periods during which the smallest twig on the Bach family tree was sober enough to hold a pen, he produced a body of music that is held in the same esteem today as it was 200 years ago.

title: Football Is Rising In Japan
description: The San Diego Chargers and St. Louis Cardinals are negotiating to play a preseason exhibition game in Tokyo on August 15th, the first National Football League game outside the United States, and the promotera predict 60,000 Japanese would buy tickets and fill up the Korakuen Stadium.

title: Handyman's Guide to Power Sanders
description: Portaole electric sanders have probably done more to liberate the home craftsman and do  it  yourselfer from tedious hand labor than almost any other power tool. They permit the handyman or handywoman to effortlessly smooth and polish wood and plastic in a fraction of the time required for doing the same job by hand.

title: Prize Stories 1976
description: Much has been said about the shrinking market for the short story, and it is one of the topics touched on by Williams Abrahams in the introduction to this annual collection. But what of the shrinking reach of the stories for this shrinking market? Reading this group of what is presumably the best of the genre, it is clear that the writers stay very much within their strengths. Targets and victories

title: Concert
description: It would be difficult to overpraise Emanuel Ax for his masterly recital at the McMillin Theater on Thursday night. Successfully combating a noisy airconditioning system and a recalcitrant piano, Mr. Ax leaped from highlight to highlight in a program that included Beethoven's Eroica Variations, tne six Little Pieces or Schoenberg's Op.19, Ravel's Gaspard de la Nuit, a Chopin group and the New York premiere of Ned Rorem's Eight Etudes.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: WHOLESALE PRICES ROSE 0.8 PERCENT in April, the largest gain since October 1975. Farm products and processed foods rose 2.8 percent in the month  The Labor Department said unemployment last month was 7.5 percent of the work force, unchanged, from March  McGrawHill Publications estimated that business investment for new plants and equipment, in 1976 will total $123.7 billion, or 13 percent over the level of actual expenditures in 1975 American new car sales in the last 10 days of April rose 55 percent over the corresponding period of 1975.

title: Who Will Challenge Big 2 in Preakness?
description: Management hasn't put it in those words yet. But just about every other method of persuasion has been used in an effort to round up opponents for Bold Forbes and Honest Pleasure in the 101st Preakness.

title: Olympics Are On Time, But Won't Be Grandiose
description: MONTREAL  The Olympic Games are scheduled to begin here on July 17, less than 10 weeks from now. An inspection trip of the facilities last week left most of the visitors confident that the Games, beleagured by labor problems, would start on time.

title: Children Are Calling
description: Prospects of a happy summer for the poor children this city never looked so bleak as right now. The city's park and recreation funds and facilities have been cut to the bone, as have the Board of Education's summer programs. Neighborhood houses which depend on state and local funding are struggling along with fewer resources than at any time in recent memory.

title: Steel and Plexiglas al Fresco
description: Ros LY N MANY of the contemporary sculptures on view on the luscious grounds at the Nassau County Museum of Fine Arts do not at first blush appear to have much in common with nature.

title: The Music Festivals of Europe, 1976: Austria, Belgium, Britain
description: All over Europe each summer, in everincreasing numbers, music festivals blossom. A list of some seven dozen is presented in the accompanying chart giving dates, programs andwhere availableticket prices. The newest entry, the Castelfranco Festival 20 miles northwest of Venice, has a special American flavor, since the Clarion Music Society of New York played a major role in its creation. But in this Bicentennial year many of the festivals are making a westward bow. Works by George Gershwln, Aaron Copland, Charles Ives, Carlisle Floyd and Scott Joplin will be heard; three musicals, The Desert Song, Music Man and South Pacific, will be staged, and Lionel Hampton and Dizzy Gillespie will be leading jazz groups.

title: ART
description: THE eloquent exhibition of Oceanic art at the Squibb Gallery in the E. R. Squibb building brings into question the validity of the term primitive that is used to describe these art works.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: A common spring latch, left, can be easily jimmied with a piece of stiff plastic, above.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONMuch of the talk on Capitol Hill In the next few months is going to be about jobs, but the best guess is that no legislation will be forthcoming. Instead, the Democrats who control Congress will be laying the foundation for what is expected to be a major domestic issue in the November election campaign.

title: DR. WILLARD MACHLE
description: Dr. Willard Machle, an internist in New York and in Boca Raton, Fla., died April 30 in Coral Gables, Fla. He was 74 years old.

title: Sonkisser Captures Withers; 5 Spills Mar Belmont Card
description: Five spills during or after the running of four races yesterday overshadowed an impressive victory by Harold I. Snyder's Sonkisser in the 101st running of the Withers at Belmont Park.

title: A Flexible Spasm in Africa
description: PARIS In a 1968 analysis Henry Kissinger, then a Harvard professor with no government position, observed: One notices a tendency in American foreign policy to spasms of rigidity and spasms of tactical flexibility. This, it may be said, is not only still a tendency of United States diplomacy; it applies also to most democratic systems where parties and political moods shift, inevitably affecting all but the most fundamental aspects of policymaking.

title: Prices: A Global View
description: Price is hardly the only consideration in planning a trip abroad, but it is not to be denied. The chart below sets forth the cost of hotels, taxis, meals and alcoholic beverages in 50 major cities overseas. It is adapted from a table prepared by The Financial Times of London, based upon reports from its correspondents.

title: THE COUNTRY GIRL
description: While you're thanking God for personal blessings. you might thank Him too for our great country and our freedom as individuals and things like the privilege of being able to buy and enjoy good country recordings like Porter and Dolly'sCARL AND PEARL BUTLER, liner notes for the album Love and Music by Porter Wagoner and Dolly Parton.

title: S.R. Knapp Fiance Of Barbara E. Cory
description: Barbara Ellen Cory, a thirdyear student at Cornell Law School, and Spencer Richard Knapp, a law clerk to judge Albert Coffrin of the United States District Court in Burlington, Vt., plan to marry Aug. 21 in New Canaan, Conn.

title: ART VIEW
description: WASHINGTON The exact relation that obtains between art and the national ethos is, like most questions having to do with The relation of art to life, sometimes simple and straightforward and sometimes oblique and contradictory. No fixed approach to the question is ever likely to suffice for long. Both the relationship Itself and our perception of it change according to shifts In the political and the esthetic climatewhich is one reason why the history of art is in constant need of revision.

title: New & Novel
description: Bullet Bay, a lobstering port on the Maine coast, is so far from the madding crowd that its mail delivery system includes a sailboat. But isolation is no guarantee of innocence. Among its crusty natives and picture postcard ambience, there lurk a crooked politician, a pliant constable, a youth gang with a drug problem and a resident sex maniac. So, when a widower named Will McCarren tries to escape civilization by settling with his brood of five on an island two miles offshore, he finds that he has not left all of his troubles behind.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: The first thing you have to understand about Frederick Ashton's A Month in the Country is that it breaks all the rules. It is a ballet based oh a play. Not a good idea. Words have a special precision that the poetic subtlety of dance can match in its own way but not really equal in sheer terms of definition. There is no dance equivalent for a phrase such as, Would you like to put the cat out? And although unquestionably there are theatrical moments in dance that drama itself finds hard, perhaps even impossible, to equal, the intellectual bite of a play is irreplaceable in terms of choreography. The idea of making a ballet out of Turgenev's mid19thcentury play A Month in the Country sounded, at first hearing, less than attractive, and probably, less than practicable.

title: Metropolitan Fanciers Scurry to College Campuses
description: It's backtocollege week for metropolitan fanciers. Next Saturday, the Ladies Kennel Association is holding its 70th fixture on the Hofstra University campus in Hemptead and, on Sunday, the Long Island Kennel Club stages its 74th on the spacious grounds of New York Institute of Technology in Brookville.

title: GROUP CRITICIZES COURT NEWS AIM
description: Proposals to open Family Court proceedings here to expanded news coverage were denounced as racism yesterday in a statement by the Citizens Committee for Children of New York.

title: F.B.I. SOUGHT DOOM OF PANTHER PARTY
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Federal Bureau of Investigation carried out a secret, nationwide effort to destroy the Black Panthers, including attempts to stir bloody gang warfare between the Panthers and other groups and to create factional splits within the party, according to the staff report of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities.

title: Leftists Demand That Israel Oust 125 on West Bank
description: TEL AVIV, May 8Several thousand Israeli leftists demonstrated here tonight in demand for ejection of 125 Jewish nationalists from a military base on the West Bank, where they have been living since December, awaiting official permission to settle permanentiv.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NEWPORT, R.I. May 8 (UPI)France's Four Musketeers of Tennis, whose 1927 Davis Cup victory sparked dancing on the grass courts of Germantown Cricket Club, today became the first foreigners named to the International Tennis Hall of Fame.

title: Lawyer to Marry Sandra Henschel
description: Mr. and Mrs. George F. Henschel of Bedford Village, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Sandra Louise Henschel, to William Colm McKeveny, son of Mr. and Mrs. William G. McKeveny of Woodmere, L. I. A September wedding is planned.

title: U.S. BEATS ITALY FOR BRIDGE TITLE
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco. May 8The United States wont the world bridge team championship today, defeating the mat Italian Blue team by 34 international match points, 232 to 198. in a thrilling finish and breaking a 20year jinx. This is the 16th time since 1957 that the two countries have met at full strength in world championship matches, and the first time that the Americans have won.

title: Stories Without Words
description: THE World of Mime troupe arrived late at the Smith Haven Mall on Saturday afternoon, and as the young mimes entered the lounge there was an immediate upheaval of makeup cases and street clothes. An audience of about 25 young people, sprawled on comfortable old sofas, watched quietly as the four Farmingdale High School sophomores who make up the nucleus of the mime workshop stripped to black leotards and tights.

description: Deaths

title: Ann Marie Lazzari Becomes the Bride of Clay Allen Beccue
description: Ann Marie Lazzari, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John B. Lazzari Jr. of Crestwood. N.Y., and Clay Allen Beccueson of Mrs. Clay Beccue of Lockport, N.Y., and the late Mr. Beccue, were married yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Eugene O'Brien, president of Fordham Preparatory School, performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of the Annunciation in Crestwood.

title: Zoo Shutdown is Called Blessing for Animals
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 8 (AP)  The 35day strike shutdown at the San Francisco zoo was a blessing for the animals, because their junk food intake dropped to zero.

title: A Retreat Beside The Sea In Crete
description: On a grassy bank beside the swimming pool, under a clear night sky, the young Cretan performers moved swiftly through their traditional harvest dance, scythes swinging in rhythm with the drum. Beyond lay the dark Aegean Sea and a rim of blueblack mountains.

title: The Vital Grass
description: Now comes the great greening, the grass that grows almost everywhere except on the city's pavement. Grass, the vital green of this earth, even more widespread than the trees, and in some ways even more closely linked with the life of mankind.

title: Longer Vacations Are Planned
description: Fourteenyear old Saul Hansell of Detroit is finally getting his bar mitzvah trip to Israel and Europe this montha year late.

title: Nicholas Beale, Wine Expert, Marries Carmel Anne Philson
description: Carmel Anne Philson, daughter of Mary Ellen Mendes Philson of Pelham, N.Y., and Dr. Arthur DeLong Philson of New York and Point O'Woods, Fire Island, N.Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Nicholas Ridgely Beale. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Bouvier Beale of Glen Cove and Bridgehampton, L.I.

title: Ozzie, Harriet and Pro Basketball
description: What is the difference between an N.B.A. game and an Ozzie and Harrlet television show?

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: THE Long Island Congressional delegation is battling on various frontsin court, in Congress and on the runways of Dulles International Airportto stop the planned flights of the Concorde supersonic transports before they can get started. It'll all reach a climax in the next few weeks.

title: Strike by City Employees Is Ended in San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 8The 39day strike by 1,770 municipal craft workers here ended shortly before 2 A.M. today when the city's Board of Supervisors approved a backtowork agreement accepted earlier by leaders of the striking unions.

title: POLITICS
description: There is considerable risk in choosing political sides and State Senator James P. Dugan, the state Democratic chairman, gambled heavily when he initially calculated that former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia would not make it through the early Democratic Presidential primaries. Senator Dugan, along with many other New Jersey's top Democratic leaders. anticipated that the various Democratic contenders ineluding Mr. Carter, would kilt each other off, leaving Senator Hubert H, Humphrey of Minnesota in a strong position to take the nomination at the Democratic National Convention.

description: HOW many people can say they love their supermarket? Among the few who can are the 115 families who belong to the Twin Pines Coop in Port Washington.

title: Nebraska to Test Candidates With Midwestern Farm Vote
description: LINCOLN, Neb., May 8In Nebraska's primary election on Tuesday, the first in a Middle Western state that is almost solely agricultural, President Ford is facing another challenge by Ronald Reagan in a contest that has become dangerously close for Mr. Ford.

title: 2 Is a Crowd on a Mountain
description: ROCKAWAY TOWNSHIP From the top of Copperas Mountain, hawks glide into the thickly forested valley below and Phil Reynolds has a panoramic southeast view of rolling hills, reservoirs and brooks. When you're here, you can imagine being almost any place in the deep woods of North America. said Mr. Reynolds. It's still New Jersey, but it's a separate reality.

title: The Russians Are Gone
description: POINT PLEASANT THE Soviet fleet has finally caught its legal limit of the spring run and has headed back to Murmansk with 300,000 metric tons of frozen mackerel, herring and squid, leaving the 300 or so boats in New Jersey's commercial fishing fleet once again dominating the Atlantic from Sandy Hook to Cape May.

title: Despite Joint Effort in Lebanon, the Old Tension and Suspicion Remain
description: BEIRUT  The Lebanese civil war has given rise to both tension and cooperation between the United States and Syria. The two governments have at times been unavowed partners. At other times, they have been acting as enemies.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Theater

title: World Team Tennis
description: Golden Gate al San Diego.

title: Newark's New Bishops
description: POPE PAUL VI's appointment of three new auxiliary bishops for the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Newark set into place the final components of an administrative mosaic designed by Archbishop Peter L. Gerety, who has been the architect of change since he was named to head the nation's sixth largest archdiocese two years ago.

title: Social Announcements
description: Robyn, Howard and Marc joyfully welcome the birth of their sister, Dana Mara, May 1, 1976. Proud parents are Lynda (nee Slater) and Henry Arnbern. The delighted grandparents are Rose and Tom Slater and Ruth and Harold Arnberg.

title: Bergen's Ailing G.O.P.
description: THE Bergen County Republican organization used to be the RollsRoyce of New Jersey's political machines. Over the years, Bergen Republicans roiled up huge pluralities for Presidents and Senators unmatched by any other political organization in the state. But that was before a series of political calamities struck in the persons of Barry Goldwater, Charles W. Sandman Jr., Nelson G. Gross and Richard M. Nixon.

title: The Soccer Crazeand Controversy
description: MASSAPEQUA THE soccer ball, that recent European import, is quickly rolling across Long Island from Great Neck to the Hamptons, edging out other competitive youth sports along the way.

title: Israeli Elite at Campfire Fete
description: RANIAT GAN. Israel, May 8Virtually the entire Israeli establishment, from the Prime Minister down to retired Palmach commanders from the 1946 war of independence crowded into a scrubby garden behind an apartment house in this Tel Aviv suburb last night for the most genuinely Israeli social event of the year.

title: Follow Up on The News
description: Arthur Levitt, the New York State Comptroller, took a look early this year at what the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority was paying Robert Moses as a consultant and took exception.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: TodayTransAm and Formula 5000 races at Pocono Raceway. Long Pond, Pa. Practice at 10 A.M. First heat of 5000 at 12:30 P.M.; 98mile TransAm race, 2 P.M.; 98mile 5000 race; 3:15.

title: Thomas Adams Becomes Fiance Of Miss Harvey
description: Mr. and Mrs. Eldon Harvey Jr. of Stonington, Conn., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Adams Harvey, to Thomas Cole Adams, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Cress Adams Jr. of Arlington, Va.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: O n Saturday night in Fisher Hall the New York Philharmonic season will come to an end, with Pierre Boulez leading a performance of Gustav Mahler's Seventh Symphony. The following day in will come the wreckers. Thus ends one of the shorter eras in New York musical history. It was just 14 years ago that Philharmonic Hall was opened, the new home of the New York Philharmonic in the new Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts. It was a grand opening, even if the distinguished audience did have to pick its way through damp concrete. But the opening concert revealed what had been whispered around town: Philharmonic Hall was an unsuccessful acoustic installation.

title: Massey: Golfer, Skier
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., May 8There are professional women golfers who like to ski but don't dare to do much of it for fear of injury. Debbie Massey, on the other hand, enjoys the best of the two worldsshe is a pro at skiing and an amateur at golf.

title: Notes: A Summer Of Premieres For Menotti
description: Gian Carlo Menotti is in for a busy summer, by anybody's standards: from the middle of May to the middle of June he will be represented by no fewer than three premieres, followed in August by a fourth. On May 18 comes Landscapes and Remembrances, commissioned by the Bel Canto Chorus of Milwaukee. A cantata in nine parts for soloists, chorus and orchestra, it recalls memories and incidents of the composer's own life in America, I didn't want to do the usual patriotic kind of thing that's a bit of a bore, he says. The best way seemed to me to express what you feel about a country in personal terms. The piece begins with my arrival in New York and the last section is called The Sky of Departure'.

title: Heptagonal Track and Field Summaries
description: Heptagonal Track and Field Summaries

title: Public College Farms Out Students to Private Ones
description: QUINCY, Ill.  Residents of this quiet Mississippi River town have been given an unusual opportunity to get a private, college education at a lowcost, publicly supported tuition level.

title: Answers/Questions
description: OAK PROBLEM (April 18) A: C. P., Moorestown, N.J., noted that their eightyearold oak tree has developed white spots on its bark as if it had been speckled with white paint. He asked what caused it and what could be done about it. We consulted Dr. Philip Wargo, research pathologist with the U.S. Forest Service. He pointed out that anyone who seeks help on a disease or insect problem needs to supply more detail. The oak may have scale and the local office of Cooperative Extension may be aware of a particular infestation and should be consulted in this case. Ed.

title: Armenian Nuns Operate OpenClassroom School
description: RADNOR, Pa.  Thirteen years ago, the idea of a primary school that would preserve the Armenian language and alphabet, and the customs of that repeatedly displaced people, and which was religious in essence but progressive in its teaching methodology, existed only in the mind of Sister Jeannette Arousiae.

title: World News Briefs
description: MOSCOW, May 8 (AP)Leonid I. Brezhnev, chairman of the Communist Party, was promoted to the rank of marshal, and his hometown dedicated a bronze bust to him today in two new honors for the 69yearold Soviet leader.

title: TV Game Shows Are Hoodwinking Viewers Again
description: Early in November 1959, television viewers were jolted by the revelation that the highly popular quiz show TwentyOne was not on the level. The breathless pauses, the agonized stumWings, even the beads of perspiration on the brow of contestant Charles Van Doren and others were all exposed as part of a rehearsed act. Many viewersmyself includedreacted in much the same way as the disillusioned baseball fan who said during the 1919 Black Sox scandals: Say it isn't so, Charlie.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: communities are finding that the incidence of burglary and vandalism has inereasad of these breakins occur by jimmying an entrance door, one of the first steps the homeowner should take is to make certain all outside doors are equipped with good quality locks that are resistant to jimmying  this means a deadholt or dead latch that is locked by a separate key (on the outside) or knob on the inside).

title: Graduate Studies Planned By Fordham in Tarrytown
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y.Fordham University is moving to Westchester County, following a wellworn path that is likely to be traveled by other institutions seeking new enrollments.

title: Miss Manning Has Nuptials
description: In the First Presbyterian Church in New Canaan, Conn., yesterday afternoon, Brooke Manning, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Manning of New Canaan, was married to William Spencer Hinds, son of Mr. and Mrs. Spencer C. Hinds of Bloomfield Hills, Mich.

title: School Budgets: Opening Round
description: MINEOLA THE Island's taxpayers defeated more than a third of the schoolbudget proposals presented last week.

title: Chile was the Watergate of United States foreign policy
description: Chile is the Spain of the 1970'sa socialist dream transformed into a fascist nightmare, a complex civil war exacerbated by foreign intervention and moral commitments. Like the Spanish Civil War, the fall of Allende's Chile is increasingly the subject of books. intended to assign blame or justify political positions. These accounts, however, have a particular significance for Americans, given recent revelations of our special responsibility for the Chilean tragedy.

title: Nostalgia for Style Of Hollywood'40's
description: Sure he was impressed with Fred Astaire and Clark Gable. What American growing up in California in the 1940's wasn't? But Gustave Tassell once caught a glimpse of John Garfield in a doublebreasted navy blue coat and a gray homburg, and he kept an eye on Gary Cooper, too.

title: STAMPS
description: Benjamin Franklin was not only a man of many parts but of great reach, so great that in the decade before the American Revolution, he was serving the British Crown as a Postmaster General of the Colonies and also of Canada.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The city has been enjoined from enforcing its fire safety regulations under Local Law 5 until a trial is held on the issues.

title: Design
description: The mythology of revolution, with its familiar image of deprived humble folk rising to overthrow an effete ruling class wallowing in indecent luxury, has never been a very accurate or useful guide to the actualities of American life in the period of the War of Independence. That period was, in fact, our first age of elegancea restrained and sometimes homely elegance, perhaps, by the standards then prevailing in the kingdoms of Europe, but elegant all the same in its unashamed affection for finery in all the accouterments of public and private life.

title: Many on Medicaid Will Be Switched To a Private Plan
description: About 100,000 Medicaid eligibles will in a very short space of time be enrolled in the Health Insurance Plan of Greater New York, saving the city, state and Federal Governments a total of $20 million, a H.I.P. official said yesterday.

title: Confronting a Horror
description: TITT HE first year the TTT eighth graders at the nTr Hillel School here put TITT on a play about the Holocaust, there was some resistance from parents to making the extermination of Jews the subject of a theatrical production. Now in its fourth year the assistant principal says it has become a school tradition as a way of dramatizing history lessons.

title: Clearing the Air
description: IWISH to respond individually to the comments made by each of the administrators quoted in the article entitled, Where Smoking Is an Elective [April 4].

title: Henn in Streaker Powerboat Victor
description: MIAMI, May 8Preston Henn of Pompano Beach, Fla., chased Joel Halpern of Bronxvile, N.Y., over 164 miles of rough Atlantic Ocean today before overtaking him four miles from the finish and winning the Bacardi offshore powerboat race.

title: LABOR SEEKS TIES TO ECOLOGY BLOC
description: SLACK LAKE, Mich., May 6 Leading elements in organized, labor, the environmental movement and community action have charted courses of collaboration in politics and public affairs.

title: Irishtocrat Is Best at Springfield
description: WEST SPRINGFIELD, Mass., May 8A sporting dog, who has bounded to the fore this year, triumphed for the eighth time in an allbreed show today when he was named best in the field of 1,750 at the huge Better Living Center Building on the Eastern States Exposition Grounds.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on amendment to allow holders of permits for grazing on national range lands to pay 50 percent of the amount due the Federal Government in the form of rangeimprovement work, which passed, 41 to 39, May 3.

title: President Under Siege
description: The first axiom of contemporary Presidential politics is that victory goes to the candidate who seizes the middle ground. The second is that barring disastrous circumstances, such as an economic depression or an unpopular war, an incumbent President is mighty hard to beat.

title: Epilogue
description: Two American civilian technicians, kidnapped last year by Eritrean rebels in Ethiopia, have been released unharmed in Sudan. Steven Campbell and James Harrell were working at the United States naval communications facility in Asmara when they were abducted last July by members of an insurgent group known as the Popular Liberation Forces. V. H. BurwoodTaylor, the honorary British consul in Asmara, who was seized last October by the rebel group, was also released. All were reported in good condition.

title: DINING OUT
description: KURT WEILL wrote a sung about poor Jenny who couldn't make up her mind. He could have written it about Lenny's. For a number of years, Lenny's was a fairly ordinary steak house. Several months ago the owners hired a French chef of obvious talent. Lenny's hasn't really decided whether to be a French restaurant. Some of the lessappealing aspects of the steak house linger on to contradict the admirable creations of the chef.

title: Torment over the Viet nonorphans
description: It seemed simple at the time. As outlined by American A.I.D. officials, at a meeting in Washington on April 2, 1975, it seemed the only humanitarian thing to do. It would be Operation Babylift. Immigration authorities agreed. They would permit an estimated 2,000 Vietnamese orphans to enter the United States, and A.I.D. would allocate $2 million for their transportation. That same day in Vietnam, as the Saigon Government crumbled, the Vietnamese Minister of Social Services sent a letter to the Prime Minister, asking that a mass release be given for the orphans, many of whom had once been rescued from Vietnamese orphanages where they had been dying of malnutrition and had been living in cardboard boxes or chickenwire cages. In 24 hours, Operation Babylift was ready to roll.

title: Flowers to Grow and Cut for Summer
description: Annuals are unexcelled for cutting flowers to be used fresh indoors. The multitude of varieties, colors and forms are ideal not only for the experienced flower arranger but for those of us who prefer massed bouquets.

title: Nassau's Crazyquilt Government
description: NASSAU County is apparently incapable of prudent fiscal management as is reflected in the current $20 millionplus deficit.

title: Kelley Apologizes for F.B.I. Actions
description: FULTON, Mo., May 8 (UPI) Clarence M. Kelley, director of the F.B.I., apologized yesterday to the American public for abuses of the bureau's investigative powers in the twilight of J. Edgar Hoover's career.

description: Pro Transactions

title: Eyes Right
description: President Ford has now lost four straight primaries to Ronald Reagan, in Mr. Ford's own Middle West as well as in the South and Southwest, and both his and his party's embarrassment has been made explicit: He is a uniquely weak incumbent candidate, and so far the Republicans only other choice is a man who sounds like, and might run like, Barry Goldwater.

title: Amer. Soccer League
description: New York 2, Sall Lake City 1. Rhode Island 2, Cleveland 0.

title: 1912 Tapestries Depicting Life in New York Restored
description: RADNOR, Pa., May 6In the twostoryhigh allpurpose room of the Armenian Sisters Academy here children line up for their school buses, dance and put on plays and generally take for granted the richly woven, historical tapestries on the walls around them depicting events in early New York City.

title: S. W. Elliott Weds Joan Gwiazdowski
description: Joan Marie Gwiazdowski, a research assistant to the minority in the New Jersey State Assembly, and Stephen Wallace Elliott, research director for the majority leadership of the Assembly, were married yesterday afternoon in St. Paul's Roman Catholic Church in Princeton, N.J. The Rev. Eugene D. Errickson performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Bring Money, Yankee Fans
description: For those who might sometimes wonder what the difference is between Yankee fans and Met fans, one answer is that Yankee fans need to bring more money when they go to the ball park.

title: The Cloud Lifts, but the Shadow Stays
description: FOR Henry F. O'Brien, it now feels as if it all happened a hundred years ago. But there are momentstoo many of them, he sayswhen the memories return in a rush of pain. Those are the moments when the 42yearold Suffolk County District Attorney knows that the scars will never quite disappear.

title: No Longer Much Talk of a Place on the National Ticket
description: ALBANYJust as spring has brought longawaited relief from Albany's hard winter, these spring days should also be bringing relief, even honor, to Governor Carey after his hard winter of fiscal crisis.

title: Life After ClasA Mixed Bag
description: WHEN Woodrow Wilson was a Princeton student 100 years ago, he took time off from his studies to edit the campus newspaper and be a debater, too. So did A (Hai Stevenson in 1922, despite grades that one dean described as mediocre at best.

title: Card of Thanks
description: FRIEDLANDDavid B. The family of David B. Friedland acknowledges with grateful appreciation the kind expressions of sympathy by Members of the Council of the City of New York. City Officials, religious institutions, organizations and friends.

title: Racial Change: Two Queens Areas
description: Addisleigh Park, for three decades a synonym for black affluence and elegance, is struggling today to keep up its reputation.

title: Hayes Paces Golf by 3 Shots
description: DALLAS, May 8  Mark Hayes, benefitting from a wind that swept his challengers farther hack in the field, needed only a round of par 71 to expand his lead to three strokes today after 54 holes of the $200,000 Byron Nelson Golf Classic.

title: Bridal Planned By Miss Adams
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward Stratemeyer Adams of, RossIvn Farms, Pa., formerly of Califon. N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Kimberley Stratemeyer Adams, to Mark Raymond Depman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert J. Depman of Merchantville, N. J.

title: Mother's DayIt's Lilac Time
description: Mother's Day, says Jean Billton of Manhattan's MacDonald Forbes florist shop is the type of occasion where people suddenly think. Oh my God, it's Mother's Day and call us.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The Mets close their homestand at Shea Stadium today against the San Diego Padres at 2:05. On Tuesday the Detroit Tigers are in Yankee Stadium for the first of three 8 o'clock games. The Baltimore Orioles and Reggie Jackson will play a weekend series with the Yankees at 8 P.M. Friday and 2 P.M. Saturday and Sunday.

title: Margot Fonteyn: Autobiography
description: Though there are hints throughout this book of the unremitting hard work that circumscribes a ballerina's existence, the overwhelming impression left by Margot Fonteyn: Autobiography is of a life filled with glamour and adventure. Of the hard work involved in Fonteyn's calling there can scarcely be any doubt. Fonteyn made her first public stage appearance at the age of 4; at 14 she was a fullfledged member of Sadler's Wells Ballet (later called The Royal Ballet); by the time she was 19 she had danced all the great classical roles. Now on the eve of her 57th birthday, she has just finished an extensive tour of Britain and Europe with The New London Ballet and is, I believe, planning to dance again in New York this summer as guest star with the Australian Ballet in a new, eveninglength work based on The Merry Widow.

title: New & Novel
description: Bullet Bay, a lobstering port on the Maine coast, is so far from the madding crowd that its mail delivery system includes a sailboat. But isolation is no guarantee of innocence. Among its crusty natives and picture postcard ambience, there lurk a crooked politician, a pliant constable, a youth gang with a drug problem and a resident sex maniac. So, when a widower named Will McCarren tries to escape civilization by settling with his brood of five on an island two miles offshore, he finds that he has not left all of his troubles behind.

title: Miss McGrath Wed To Stephen Gacek
description: In the Roman Catholic Church of SS. Peter and Paul tm Waterbury, Conn., yesterday afternoon, Susan Lynn McGrath, daughter of Superior Court Judge James F. McGrath and Mrs. McGrath of Waterbury and Madison, Conn., became the bride of Stephen Francis Gacek, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Gacek of Lowell. Mass.

title: TV VIEW
description: Perhaps my own Celtic heritage, Irish variety, has more than a little something to do with my enthusiasm for Sunset Song, the sixpart dramatization set in a lonely and beautiful shire of Scotland that is currently being presented Sunday evenings on Channel 13 as part of public TV's Masterpiece Theater series. Having spent a year of my early childhood in a lonely and beautiful village in southwestern Ireland, I may be more susceptible than many to the shocks of recognition and perception scattered throughout this latest import from the British Broadcasting Corporation. Sucseeeding the successful Upstairs, Downstairs, Bill Craig's sensitive adaptation of Sunset Song continues with episode three this evening at 9.

title: History Means Little to Now Generation
description: In 1943 The New York Times tested 7,000 college freshmen on their knowledge of American history and found striking ignorance of even the most elementary aspects. Earlier this Bicentennial year, using an updated test and more sophisticated sampling methods, The Times repeated the project to find out whether the situation has changed. It has not.

title: It's Spring in Connecticut, and New Talent Blooms
description: One thing immediately apparent in Contemporary Reflections, the summer show at the Aldrich Museum of Contemporary Art in Ridgefield, Conn., is that there's a lot of very good painting and sculpture around by artists whose names you never heard of. The 70 selected by Carlus Dyer, the museum's director, have no dealers (or hadn't, until some were picked up as a result of inclusion in this, the fifth version of an annual event), which means little chance of exposure except for the one in a thousand that lands them in a show of this exceptional kind.

title: AILING U.N. AGENCY PULLS IN ITS BELT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 8The limousine purchased for use by the former administrator of the United Nations Developnsent Program has been sold for $5,600 and the chauffeur dismissed.

title: Brown Is Defeated By Syracuse Crew
description: LIVERPOOL, N. Y., May 8 (AP)  Syracuse beat Brown by 24 lengths in a varsity heavyweight crew race on Seneca River today.

title: New Chief Expected To Curb Corruption At Mexican Prison
description: MEXICO CITY, May 8The appointment of a respected penologist as head of Mexico City's largest penitentiary, known to its inmates as the Black Palace of Lecumberri, has raised hopes of reforms leading to reduction of the jail's chronic violence and corruption.

title: Soviet Experiment in Aluminum Fails
description: The Soviet Union, liberally endowed with the cheap power sources needed to produce aluminum but short of the traditional raw material for it, once had high hopes for using alternate minerals, available domestically, to build aluminum output.

title: Anne Marie Buhr Bride in Suburbs
description: Anne Marie Buhr, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carl Buhr of Greenwich, Conn. was marTied there yesterday afternoon to Charles DeLong Hoffmann, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Hoffmann of Mamaroneck. N. Y. The RevArnold C. Miller performed the ceremony in the Round Hill Community Church.

title: ALISON UTTLEY
description: LONDON, May 8 (Reuters)Alison Uttley, author of animal tales including the Little Grey Rabbit stories, died yesterday in High Wycombe, west of here. She was 91 years old.

title: Wood, Field & Stream: Ways Of Dealing With the Pickerel
description: WEST TISBURY, Mass. Fishing for pickerel when striped bass are along the beach may seem somewhat perverse, but every year or two my brother Dan and I hanker to try for the lean, toothy denizens of Watcha Pond.

title: Service Units Plead Their Special Cases For Federal Funds
description: Nearly 500 representatives of public and voluntary organizations jammed a hearing room yesterday to testify on priorities for the city's share of Federal funds for social service programs, but officials of the Human Resources Administration acknowledged that their pleas would have little bearing on actual programs.

title: Notes: But What If We Cancel?
description: In a letter to The New York Times recently, a New Yorker wrote: My wife and I have put a down payment on a cruise and must pay the balance about a month and a half before the cruise. In looking over the brochure, I noticed a paragraph on cancellations. If we cancel after we make our full payment of $1,100, the shipping company puts up our cabin for resale. If it is not sold to another party, they imply we will not get back one red cent. Is this a general practice in travelto keep the entire ticket cost?

title: ALBANY NOTEBOOK
description: GOVERNOR CAREY, who by now is used to the cries of outrage about rising welfare and Medicaid costs in the cities, got a heavy dose of the same sort of complaint last week from the Island.

title: Dr. Arthur Klatzkin Dies; Dental Surgeon, Musician
description: Dr. Arthur A. Klatzkin, a retired dental surgeon, died Wednesday of a stroke at Montellore Hospital, the Bronx. He was 83 years old.

title: The Mailbox: Did All Really Beat Young?
description: To the Sports Editor: One thing must be kept in mind when one judges a heavyweight championship fight. The only thing that matters is who does better in each round, not whether the champion is living up to his capabilities.

title: No Fear of Change
description: CHICAGO JOHN RAYMOND MCGANN did what almost followed some familial tendencies When he decided on the priesthood as his life work: His two sisters are nuns, his mother was a stanch supporter of Roman Catholic education and his father made sure everybody went to church on Sunday.

title: The Star Spangled Contract
description: Probably Mr. Garrison belongs on television. He is as big as Columbo and Kojak put together, and in appearance he out  Perry Masons Raymond Burr. Moreover, his years as the highly visible District Attorney of New Orleans equipped him not merely with a broad knowledge of criminal behavior but, more importantly, with the cynicism requisite to a major career in TV. As the D.A. in a D.A. series, it is hrm, Inn rnidel miss.

title: How Delaware Became No. 1
description: In 1890, James B. Dill, a young New York attorney, took the ferry across the Hudson River to persuade the Governor of New Jersey to transform the Garden State into a Mecca for Corporations.
