title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (Reuters) The United States and Brazil have reached an agreement on various trade issues, including a measure under which Brazil will adjust tax credits on soybean oil exports, according to communique issued here and in the Brazilian capital today. The adjustment in soybean oil production incentives will avert a planned antidumping action against Brazilian exports of the crop to the United States, Treasury Secretary William E. Simon said.

title: Bond Issues Stage Rebound in Prices
description: The credit markets, which declined so sharply last week and again on Monday, regained some of their lost strength yesterday. A large slate of new taxexempt bonds was offered to investors at the higher yields now available, and most of the bonds were purchased by investors. Corporate bond prices rose and a $50 million utility bond issue yielding more than 9 percent was snapped up in less than half an hour after it was offered.

title: MAYOR APPOINTS PANEL TO SETTLE BUILDING STRIKE
description: Mayor Beame appointed a threemember panel yesterday to make recommendations for settling the ninedayold strike of apartment house employees.

title: ENVOY OF BOLIVIA IS SLAIN IN PARIS
description: PARIS, May 11The Bolivian Ambassador. to France was shot and killed today in broad daylight underneath a subway bridge over the Seine, River. The assailant escaped.

title: CAREY CUTS BACK CUNNINGHAM ROLE
description: BUFFALO, May 11Governor Carey indicated today that he would soon name a person to supplant Patrick J. Cunningham, the embattled state Democratic chairman, in the coordination of the Democratic legislative election campaign and in the handling of party matters within the state.

title: Books of The Times
description: There were two points in C. D. B. Bryan's Friendly Firea powerful nonfiction account of the death of an American soldier in the Vietnam Warwhen I found myself close to tears of rage and frustration. The first came after Gene and Peg Mullen, two solid middleAmerican residents of Black Hawk County, Iowa, had learned in February 1970 of the noncombat death on an infantry mission of their oldest son, Michael. and were trying vainly to wrest from Washington a clear explanation of the circuitances surrounding Michael's death. So obstinate and callous did the Government seem (the only word of sympathy from the White House had been a note from a minor Presidential aide attached to Xerox copies of President Nixon's Vietnamization speeches), so determined to routinize and obscure Michael's sacrifice, that I found myself surprised that the Muliens had merely turned to peaceful warprotesting in order to invest their son's death with a measure of meaning. I half expected them to go underground and start bombing think tanks and military installations. And if they had done so, I suspect my sympathies, if not my principles, would have been with them.

title: When Singles Bars Pall: Some Alternatives
description: Singles bars? A wry grimace distorted the woman's face. I felt as if I were a piece of sirloin steak hanging in the butcher's window, she replied.

title: GREGORY M. SCHWAN
description: Gregory M. Schwan, an executive since 1966 of Allen Products Company Inc., manufacturer of pet foods, with national headquarters in Allentown. Pa., where he lived, died Monday in Sacred Heart Hospital Center in Allentown. He was 45 years old.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Tuesday.

title: Had Enough Instant Disaster Try ColdBrewed Iced Tea
description: Along with the premature blossoming of forsythia, magnolias and wisteria, our recent early preview of summer prompted the hasty arrival of another warmweather perennial, iced tea. Just let the mercury nit 80 two days in a row and a good percentage of Americans begin to quaff gallons of that muchfavored cold amber brew.

title: F.B.I.'s Deadly Games
description: It is axiomatic, but easily forgotten, that a suspension of the liberties of even the most reviled group in society will dilute the liberties of all since each discretionary suspension of rights leads more easily to the next one. This truth is brought to mind by the release of a study, by the staff of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, of the Federal Bureau of Investigation's counterintelligence programs against the Black Panther Party and other black nationalisthate groups.

title: As Birdbaths Go, It's a Bit Offbeat
description: There are quite a few things for the birds currently at the Greenwich House Pottery. Scattered amid the more general pots at the annual spring show and sale are such things as bird sculptures, pots with a bird motif and some bird feeders (at $12 and $15).

title: Court Upsets New York Policy To Combat BuildingTrade Bias
description: The New York State Court of Appeals ruled unanimously yesterday that New York City's regulations aimed at increasing the number of blacks, Puerto Ricans and members of other minority groups employed on construction in the city were invalid.

title: Court Upholds Powers
description: ALBANY, May 11 (AP)The State Court of Appeals today upheld a law giving the State Health Department broad powers to regulate the nursinghome industry, reversing a lower court's ruling that had threatened the department's efforts to police the industry.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Court Finds Social Security Bias Against Men Aged 64 and Older
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn has ruled that the retirement benefit provisions of the Social Security Act discriminate against men 64 years of age and older in favor of women and younger men.

title: F.D.A. Refuses to Lift 69 Cyclamate Ban Because of Unanswered Questions About Safety
description: WASHINGTON, May 11The Food and Drug Administration, announced today that it would not lift the sevenyearold ban, on the artificial sweetener cyclamate.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NEW WAVES The St. Bart Players are adding a touch of live island color to tonight's revival opening of South Pacific. There will be a luau starting at 6 o'clock, with music for dancing, refreshments and a Polynesian buffet on the front terrace of the annex showcase at St. Bartholomew's Church, Park Avenue at 50th Street.

title: Japan Sends an Envoy to U.S. To Clarify Lockheed Scandal
description: TOKYO, May 11The Government of Prime Minister Takeo Miki, feeling the continuing effects of the Lockheed Aircraft bribery scandal here, dispatched another special envoy to Washington tonight.

title: 20thCentury Group Plays 2 Premieres
description: A concert of music for two pianos and percussion would seem almost impossible to drum up. There is one masterpiece in the field, Bartk's Sonata, composed in 1937. But on Monday night, an organization called the Twentieth Century Ensemble came up with two companion pieces to go with the Bart6k to make an evening's program at Carnegie Recital Hall. The new worksthey had not been performed beforewere Robert Shechtman's The Chariots of Aminadab and Larry Lockwood's Quartet.

title: Surgeon Acquitted Of Dispensing Drugs Against Health Law
description: Dr. Daniel Manfredi, a Park Avenue surgeon whose patients include many prominent athletes, was acquitted late yesterday of prescribing sleeping pills and dispensing tranquilizers in violation of the New York State Health Code.

title: Udall Scores New Rules
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (UPI) Representative Morris K. Udall, Democrat of Arizona, floor manager of strip mining legislation in the House last year, called the new rules woefully inadequate.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 11Fred Burke, the state's Commissioner of Education, told a State Senate committee today that he was opposed to a bill that would establish performance standards for pupils. Having said that, he then confused some members of the committee by saying he intended to establish something he called reference points.

title: Tudor City Volunteers Serve in Strike
description: Edna Osborne jabbed a forefinger at a bag of chocolate cookies as she sat yesterday behind a cluttered desk placed temporarily in a Tudor City lobby.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASKETBALL

title: In Japan, a Big Push Is On: Let Them Eat More Rice
description: TOKYO, May 11Japanese schools can now serve rice at lunch regularl for the first time in 30 years.

title: Senate Unit Approves Safety Aide Nominee
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (AP)The Senate Commerce Committee, despite previous opposition, voted today 11 to 7 to recommend S. John Byington for a 2.year term as chairman of the Consumer Product Safety Commission.

title: Coop City Strike Chief Sees Agreement
description: The leader of the Coop City rent strike said yesterday that tenant negotiators and the state had reached an agreement in principle before a court ruling on Monday that upheld the right of state housing officials to foreclose the project's $436 million mortgage.

title: Carter Is the Victor In Connecticut Vote; Udall Close Second
description: HARTFORD, May 11Jimmy Carter, the former Governor of Georgia, won a narrow victory today over Representative Morris K. Udall of Arizona in townbytown voting in Connecticut for Democratic Presidential candidates.

title: Grants to Japanese Judges By Asia Foundation Assailed
description: TOKYO, May 11 (Reuters)More than 50 Japanese judges and prosecutors received cash assistance for foreign travel from an American foundation that has received funds from the Central Intelligence Agency, Justice Minister Osamu Inaba said today.

title: OTB Shops Won't List Preakness
description: New York City's Offtrack Betting Corporation said yesterday it would not handle wagers on Saturday's Preakness at Pimlico in Baltimore. We've been advised by Pimlico's management that the Maryland Racing Commission has refused to approve our contract. said Paul R. Screvane, OTB's chairman.

title: Another Will Filed
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 11Another purported will of Howard R. Hughes was filed with the Clark County clerk here today on the instruction of District Judge Keith Hayes, who has Hughes probate matters before him.

title: COAL LAND SOLD FOR $20 MILLION
description: Nuclear Resources, a subsidiary of the Commonwealth Edison Company in Chicago, purchased rights yesterday to more than 8,000 acres of coalladen land in Wyoming from the C. F. & I. Steel Corporation, a subsidiary of the Crane Company, for $20 million in cash, Nuclear Resources received 640 acres of land, plus certain underground minueral interests in approximately 7.563 additional acres. The utility, which has been buying its coal, plans to mine the low sulphur steam coal for its Illinois generators.

title: The Dodge Site
description: Even with construction at a virtual standstill, it was inevitable that the site of the Dodge mansion at Fifth Avenue and 61st Street would find a buyer and developer; its location on Central Park adjacent to Grand Army Plaza makes it one of the most expensive, elegant and pivotal building blocks in New York.

title: TV: Scenery as Star
description: The difficulty in using the ferocious beauty of the Irish seacoast as a dramatic setting is that the rugged terrain and tumultuous waters tend to reduce everything else to insignificance. It happens with people, which is one of the points of Sea Marks, a play by Gardner McKay being shown on public television's Theater in America tonight at 9.

title: Red Sox Suffer 10th Loss in Row As Jenkins Bows to Indians, 43
description: Who has the worst record In baseball? Surprisingly, the Boston Red Sox, defending American League champions. And their slump continued last night as the Cleveland Indians sent them to their 10th successive defeat, 43, at Municipal Stadium in Cleveland.

title: FORD SIGNS BILL ON SCIENCE AID
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (AP)President Ford signed today bill that reestablishes the White House Office of Science and Technology and gives scientists their first direct access to the Oval Office since President Nixon eased them out three years ago.

title: Poking in Consignment Shops: The Shabby Is Often Just Right
description: COS COB, Conn.The other day a woman walked into the Commission Mart, glanced around and said, I'm looking for something shabby to go with my shabby furniture.

title: THE COMMODORE CLOSING TUESDAY
description: The Commodore Hotel will close next Tuesday because of rising operating losses, the trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company announced yesterday.

title: Kissinger Offering Economic Mediation
description: Through Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger's proposal for an international resources bank, his plans to stabilize certain commodity prices, and other overtures to the poor nations of the third world, the United States Government is enunciating a new foreign policy that is a blend of economics and politics. As one highly placed official has said, Economics is when I've got it, and politics is when you want it.

title: Blacks Gain Posts in South But Lag Proportionately
description: ATLANTA, May 11 (AP)Blacks gained 356 elected offlees in the South last year but still hold only 2.5 percent of the positions in a region where they make up 20.4 percent of the population, according to a study released yesterday.

title: New Blood Pumps for Humans Are Used to Try to Save Hearts
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (UPI) Surgeons in Houston and Boston have implanted fistsize mechanical blood pumps in humans in attempts to give failed hearts time to recover after surgery, it was reported today.

title: Woman Fights a Law
description: A woman who scored 99.999 percent on a Civil Service test but lost her job to a lowerscoring male veteran who got preference under New Jersey law charged in a Superior Court suit that the law discriminated against her and against women in general. Page 45.

title: S.E.C.BRIBERY SUIT NAMES EMERSONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 11The Securities and Exchange Commission filed today the first domestic bribery suit arising from its increasingly broad two :. year investigation of questionable corporate payments.

title: Cadet Who Said Almost All Cheated Faces Expulsion From West Point
Government Moves to Block Private Delivery of the Mail
description: WASHINGTON, May 11Lawyers for the Government moved today to block the operation of a private mail delivery system in Pittsburg, Kan., by bringing criminal charges against the company's owner.

title: ROCKEFELLER 4TH IN STRONG SHOWING
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., May 11President Ford defeated former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California tonight in West Virginia's Presidential preference primary.

title: Scientist Fights Gypsy Moth With Birds, Beasts and Bugs
description: MOHONK LAKE, N.Y.For Dan Smiley, the gypsy moth isn't a pest, even though it has defoliated millions of acres of trees in this country since it was introduced 107 years ago.

title: In Memoriam
description: VANDROFF  Joseph, beloved and devoted husband and tether. Forever In our hearts and thoughts. Daddy dear, we love and miss you always.

description: LAST NIGHT'S MATCHES

description: WASHINGTON, May 11President Ford reluctantly approved today legislation reviving the major powers of the Federal Election Commission and freeing the agency to authorize the payment of a $2 million backlog of subsidies to candidates in the Presidential primaries.

description: To the Editor:

title: TEACHERS HARDEN L. I. STRIKE STAND
description: FARMINGDALE, L.I., May 11 The strike by teachers of the Farmingdale School District appeared to grow in intensity today after the school board rejected a recommendation for resolution by the Superintendent of Schools.

title: U.S. Reiterates Opposition To New Israeli Settlements
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (Reuters)The United States expressed hope today that Israel was not planning to establish new settlements in occupied Arab territory.

title: One Connecticat Town Bypasses the Election
description: FRANKLIN, Conn., May 11 In the voting in Connecticut today for Democratic Presidential candidates, one rural town in the eastern part of the state dropped out.

title: TWO KEY PANELS IN CONGRESS BACK REVISED AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 11Key Senate and House committees moved quickly today to approve a new 27month, $9.3 billion foreign aid bill that dropped some of the policy restrictions that prompted President Ford to veto a similar bill last Friday.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Mountain Fuel Supply Company easily subdued an attempt by dissident shareholders to unseat its management at the annual meeting in Salt Lake City yesterday.

title: Reuss Assails Burns On Money Supply Aim
description: WASHINGTON May 11 (UPI)The House Banking Committee chairman, Henry Reuss, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today that a growth in the money supply of 1 to 2 percent, as suggested by the Federal Reserve chairman, Arthur F. Burns. would he a guarantee of economic stagnation and maybe depression.

title: BOSTON TO FOLLOW ORDER ON SCHOOLS
description: BOSTON, May 11 (AP) Mayor Kevin H. White agreed today to find money to keep Boston schools open but said the Federal judge who ordered the action, was guilty of fiscal ignorance.

title: Cavs Victors, 83 to 78; Trail, 21, in Semifinal
ZIONISM IN MEDIA DECRIED BY AGNEW
Protesters Halt Work On 63d Street Subway
description: Yvonne Bailey, the wife of a dealer in oriental rugs, led about three dozen determined residents of East 63d Street into 6footsquare holes in the ground yesterday to stop the digging of test pits for a subway station.

title: Burmah May Act on Stock
description: LONDON. May 12 (Reuters) Alstair Down, chairman of the Burman Oil Company. said today he might contemplate seeking an injunction restraining the Bank of England from selling the 77.8 million shares of common stock of the British [Petroleum Company acquired from Burmah last year. Mr. Down told a news conference here he could give no details of the course of action recommended by the company's legal advisers in relation to the British Petroleum stock, but said !moves were under way.

title: M. SHERIDAN COGAN
description: M. Sheridan Cogav,, a dance teacher, died Sunday at her home at 311 East 50th Street. She was 44 years old.

title: Japan Battling Slump With Public Works
description: TOKYO, May 11Ju Kanbara does not know it, but he has become an important part of the Government's economic recovery efforts.

title: Lebanese Moslems Offer A Deal to New President
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 11Lebanon's leftistMoslem alliance, which was one of the parties to the yearlong civil war, tonight offered to cooperate with Presidentelect Elias Sarkis on the conditions that he keep Syria out of Lebanon's internal affairs and protect the presence here of the Palestinian guerrilla movement.

title: Radio
description: 57:30 A.M., WNYCFM: Masterwork Hour. The Hussite Overture, Dvorak; Violin Concerto, No. 1, Bruch; Symphony No. 5, Tchaikovsky.

title: COURT STEP ASKED ON HIRING QUOTAS
description: TRENTON, May 11 (UPI)New Jersey's Division of Civil Rights has asked the State Supreme Court to approve quota systems for police and fire departments as a way to achieve racial balance.

title: Botanists Find Unreality In Plant Protection Laws
description: Most local, state and Federal laws designed to protect and preserve endangered species of plants in the United States are unrealistic and unenforceable. an international symposium of botanists was told here yesterday.

title: Political Instincts Spur Savings Bank Bill
description: ALBANY, May 11New York State's saving banks are finally on their way to getting the checkingaccount business they so urgently sought, and which their competitors in the commercial banks so strenuously opposed. But late last night, when the Assembly finally passed a bill that seems assured of Senate passage, it seemed as if the legislators own political instincts rather than the banks lobbying had the most effect on their action. The bill's course through the Legislature illustrates the kind of overlapping and intricate pressures that often accompany controversial legislation.

title: BEANIE PRESENTS PROPOSALS TO END BUILDINGS STRIKE
description: Mayor Beame early this morning presented a list of recommendations for settling the 10dayold. apartmenthouse strikc at a meeting with both sides at City Hall.

title: Suffolk Legislature Kills Plan To Preserve East End Farms
description: HAUPPAUGE, LI., May 11The Suffolk Legislature this evening killed a resolution that would have enabled the county to buy development rights to thousands of acres of farmlands, which are rapidly disappearing from Long Island's bucolic East End.

title: U.S. ISSUES RULES FOR COAL MINING
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (AP) Interior Secretary Thomas S. Kleppe announced new regulations today to protect the environment and restore the land during future coal mining on Federal land.

title: About Real Estate
description: More retail stores are coming downtown.

title: Loews Quarter Profit Off by 5.9% as Its Operating Earnings Rise
I.R.S. Balksat Divulging Political Files
description: WASHINGTON, May 11Donald C. Alexander, the Commissioner of Internal Revenue, said today that he did not think it either necessary or desirable for the Internal Revenue, Service to inform some 11,000 individuals and organizational that they had been improperly singled out for special attention by Lax examiners because of their ideologies.

title: Cunningham Comments
description: WASHINGTON, May 11Mr. Cunningham said he was obviously involved in national matters in his visit here.

title: Consultant Has Franchise Theory
description: Robert M. Prentice, formerly of Lever Brothers, is consultant who doesn't waste his time. He thinks a lot. And because he thinks a lot he's come up with a marketing theory and he is sure he can back it with proof. It has to do with what he calls Consumer Franchise Building.

title: Senate Chiefs Back Unit to Watch C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 Senate leaders reached a compromise agreement today on plan to create a permanent new committee with exclusive authority to monitor the Central Intelligence Agency and authorize funds for the agency's operations.

title: Single World Circuit Shapes Up in Tennis
description: Last week in Dallas the two superpowers of men's tournament tennis  the World Championship Tennis circuit and the International Lawn Tennis Federation Grand Prix circuit signed a peace pact. In effect it paved the way for a single, unified world circuit that could be marketed in much the same way as the golf tour: One bigtime tournament per week with irlIst, if not all, the top players competing. Lawn Tennis Federation Grand Prix circuit signed a peace pact. In effect it paved the way for a single, unified world circuit that could be marketed in much the same way as the golf tour: One bigtime tournament per week with irlIst, if not all, the top players competing.

title: Lindenwold Fares to Rise
description: CAMDEN, N. J., May 11 (AP) Fares on the Lindenwold HighSpeed Line would jump 20.2 percent under a plan approved by a committee of the Delaware River Port Authority. The rate increase, approved, yesterday by the authority's finance committee and expected to receive final authorization from the authority cornmissioners May 19, would raise fares 5 to 15 cents. The 75cent ride from Philadelphia to Lindenwold would rise to 90 cents junder the new schedule and the 35cent trip from Philadelphia to Camden would cost 40 cents,

title: TALKS CONTINUING ON TRANSIT PACT
description: The Transit Authority and the Transport Workers Union met yesterday for an hour and a half but failed to reach agreement on a renegotiated contract to submit to the Emergency Financial Control Board on Friday.

title: JAY ROCKEFELLER IS AN EASY VICTOR
description: CHARLESTON,. W. Va., May 11 President Forddefeated former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California tonight in West Virginia's Presidential preference primary.

title: SOVIET AND CHINA CLASH IN NAIROBI
Red Skelton's ExWife Dead
description: ANCHO MIRAGE, Calif., May 11 (AP)The 54yearold former wife of Red Skelton, the comedian, has been found dead; from an apparentely selfinflicted gunshot wound, sheriff's; deputies say. The sheriff's office in Riverside County said that Georgia Skelton apparently shoL herself in the head yesterday with a 39caliber revolver.

title: Defiance and Despair at Coop City.
description: Residents of Coop City in the Bronx were in a defiant mood yesterday although some were in despair over the news that state housing officials had won a court fight to foreclose the mortgage of the 15,000family cooperative.

title: Policies and Politicians
description: PARISNo one yet knows whether the new look of U.S. African policy is founded on the old adage, If you can't lick em, join em, or if Henry Kissinger has decided to follow Talleyrand's advice: The art of statesmanship is to foresee the inevitable and to expedite its occurrence. Probably his tactic combines the two theories.

title: Rabe Is Compelled to Keep Trying
description: This was supposed to be the season that David Rabe did not have a play in New York. Instead, yesterday, his newest work, Streamers (selling out at the Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater in Lincoln Center) was named best American play of the year by the New York Drama Critics. From Mr. Rabe's point of view, his return to the theaterafter a brief absence is fortuitous, an accident, another sign of the randomness of life, which is one of the 36yearold playwright's major concerns.

title: DRAMIN D. JONES
description: Dramin D. Jones, a retired United Nations electronics engineering designer, died Sunday at Brookhaven (L. I.) Memorial Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived in Shirley, L. I.

title: SouthernThrift Unit Halts Withdrawals For 30Day Period
description: JACKSON, Miss., May 11 (UPI)The Bankers Trust Company, a large Mississippi savings and loan holding company, announced today a 30day moratorium on all withdrawals.

title: Honor at West Point
description: Capt. Arthur Lincoln is clearly guilty of two violations of West Point's code of the gentlemanly coverup.

title: Hispanic Leader And a Policeman Arrested Upstate
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., May 11A field representative for the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico and a former city policeman of Puerto Rican descent were arrested today and charged with attempted coercion.

title: Coast Poll Shows Ford Losing Ground to Reagan
description: SAN FRANCSCO, May 11A poll released today shows President Ford losing ground to former Gov. Ronald Reagan in then approaching battle for, California's 167 Republican convention delegates.

title: Aerosol Can Controversy: Effects Are Filtering Down to the Beauty Salon
description: Lourdes Riera paused during a recent shopping trip to a Coral, ,Gables, Fla., supermarket to discuss a product that has aroused concern across the country: the aerosol can.

title: Selectperson Is Rejected
description: AMHERST, Mass May 11 (AP)Town meeting members here voted, 140 to 70, last night against changing the job title of selectman to selectperson. Among the defenders of the established designation were Nancy Eddy and Diana Romer, the two women members of Amherst's fivemember Board of Selectmen.

title: Aiding Diabetics
description: The philosopher who complained that progress consists mainly of substituting new problems for old ones might well have been thinking of diabetes and its victims. A halfcentury ago a serious case of diabetes was equivalent to a death sentence. Then came the discovery and use of insulin, an advance that has added many years to the life expectancy of diabetes victims. One result is that the number of diabetics in this countrynow about 10 millionis increasing rapidly. By 1990 this number is expected to have doubled.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The New Jersey State Supreme Court has ruled that the Montclair local of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association should have gone to the State Public Employment Relations Commission when a dispute arose over the town's refusal to negotiate with the local. The court also said that the commission could apply in its action a law passed after the dispute arose that gave the commission power to decide charges of unfair labor practice.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: At a recent hearing held by Senator Charles Percy, Republican of Illinois, a witness told about a man from Minnesota who had paid nearly $4,000 for 11 hearing aids over a period of years. The witness, Dr. Darrell E. Rose, director of audiology at the Mayo Clinic in Minnesota, explained that the man's effort to find an aid to improve his hearing had been futile from the outset; the condition that caused his hearing loss could not helped by amplification.

title: A.M.A.ScoresUnneededSurgeryReport
description: CHICAGO, May 11  The American Medical Association called today for new Congressional hearings on unnecesry surgery. contending that a a Congressional subcommittee's report on the controversial subject had been biased and inaccurate.

title: Senate Chiefs Back Unit to Watch C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 Senate leaders reached a compromise agreement today on a plan to create a permanent new committee with exclusive authority to monitor the Central Intelligence Agency and authorize funds for the agency's operations.

title: Reagan Declines to Call Himself Winner Over Ford in Nebraska
description: BOISE, Idaho, May 11Ronald Reagan cautiously declined to claim victory tonight in his close Republican primary race with President Ford in Nebraska.

title: New Quake Jolts Italy, Causing More Injuries
description: UDINE, Italy, May 11 (AP) A strong temblor shook the devastated areas of northeastern Italy late tonight, causing more destruction and injury the nolice reported

title: Ethiopia Said to Prepare Attack on Eritrean Rebels
description: WASHINGTON, May 11The Ethiopian military Government is preparing to open a major offensive against Eritrean rebels in the next few days, using half the army and tens of thousands of armed peasant volunteers, Administration officials said today.

title: TWO KEY PANELS IN CONGRESS BACK REVISED AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 11Key Senate and House committees moved quickly today to approve a new 27month, $9.3 billion foreign aid bill that dropped some of the policy restrictions that prompted President Ford to veto a similar bill last Friday.

title: DEAL D. HEYWOOD
description: Deal Dunham Heywood of Kintnersville, Pa., former secretary and business manager of the Little Red School House, at 196 Bleecker Street, died of cancer yesterday in Easton Hospital. She was 71 years old.

description: N.B.A. Playoffs

title: L.I. Farm Plan Dead
description: The Suffolk County Legislature killed a resolution that would have enabled the county to buy development rights to thousands of acres of disappearing farmland on Long Island's East End. The controversial measure had been designed to stem the tide of suburbanization. Page 45.

title: ELECTION AGENCY REVIVED BY FORD
description: WASHINGTON, May 11President Ford reluctantly approved today legislation reviving the major powers of the Federal Election Commission and freeing the agency to authorize the payment of a $2 million backlog of subsidies to candidates in the Presidential primaries.

title: IRAN BARTER PLAN RAISES QUESTIONS
description: The General Dynamics Corporation, the Boeing Company and the Northrop Corporation confirmed yesterday that they have been negotiating with the Iranian Government on a multibilliondollar barter deal of oil for airplanes.

title: Freehold Committee Asks Utilities Authority Inquiry
description: FREEHOLD TOWNSHIP, N.J., May 11 (AP)  The Freehold Township Committee Wants county, state and Federal authorities to investigate the dealings of the Western Monmouth Utilities Authority.

title: DAVID I. HITCHCOCK
description: David Ingersoll Hitchcock, associate professor emeritus of physiology at Yale University, died Saturday in a convalescent home in Wallingford, Conn. His age was 82.

title: Ballet: Two for Spring
description: On paper at least, the Royal Ballet double bill of Sir Frederick Ashton's The Dream and Kenneth MacMillan's Song of the Earth, which the company introduced into ites final week's repertory at the Metropolitan Opera House on Monday night, sounds most attractive. Something light and Shakespearean and something heavy and Mahlerianjust right for a spring evening. But the spring never quite sprung.

title: Trinity Crew in Henley
description: HARTFORD, May 11 (AP) Trinity College accepted an invitation today to compete with more than 100 other college level crew teams in the 137th Henley Royal Regatta in England July 1 through 4. Two lightweight eights and a varsity pair without coxswain will accompany the heavyweight crew to the regatta.

title: Carter Is the Victor In Connecticut Vote; Udall Close Second
description: HARTFORD, May 11Jimmy Carter, the former Governor of Georgia, won a narrow victory today over Representative Morris K. Udall of Arizona in townbytown voting in Connecticut for Democratic Presidential candidates.

title: Dowell, the Dancer, Now Feels Like Actor
description: When Anthony Dowell makes his entrance in Sir Frederick Ashton's ballet A Month in the Country, the lights dim, the characters onstage freeze, the applause rolls in and some hearts, in the audience at least, skip a beat.

title: Rookie Fractures Neck in Indy Crash
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 11 (AP)Eddie Miller of Lakewood. Colo., suffered a broken neck today during practice for the Indianapolis 500 when his car spun into a drainage ditch and vaulted through the air almost into a spectator stand.

title: About Education
description: Ivy League colleges that went coeducational under the assumption that the proportion of women could be kept relatively low are finding that their premise was unworkable.

title: Ethiopia Said to Prepare Attack on Eritrean Rebels
description: WASHINGTON, May 11The Ethiopian military Government is preparing to open a major offensive against Eritrean rebels in the next few days, using half the army and tens of thousands of armed peasant volunteers, Adiministration officials said today.

title: Where to Send Money For Victims of Quake
description: Among the organizations that are accepting donations to aid victims of the earthquake in Italy are the followine:

title: Navy Urges Action On Litton's Claims
description: WASHINGTON, May 11Defense officials have informed Congressional staff members that Litton Industries faces serious financial difficulties unless there is prompt and equitable settlement of the company's financial claims against the Navy on shipbuilding contracts.

title: $100,000 Bail Set in Slaying
description: CAMDEN, N. J., May 11 (UPI) Bail of $100,000 has been set for a Levittown, Pa., man, charged in connection with the April 24 fatal shooting of his wife in a store in nearby Berlin last month. Heinz Swiferth, 48 years old, was held in Camden County jail in lieu of bond today after being returned here from Maryland. He facos a preliminary hearing for May 18.

title: Times Square Murder Suspects Seized
description: Police Officers Vincent Brusco and Frank Daugherty, on burglary patrol, were scanning the horizon with binoculars from a Bronx rooftop yesterday when they saw two men on another roof who they thought fitted the description of two sought for holding up a milkman earlier.

title: Mc Feeley Cites Internal Unrest, Quits Abruptly as P.B.A. Head
description: Ken McFeeley, the president of the policeman's union for New York City, explained yesterday that with internal opposition making it impossible to lead the group, he had abruptly resigned Monday evening, but he added that he intended to campaign for reelection next year.

title: REAGAN WINS IN NEBRASKA, CHURCH IS LEADING CARTER; FORD WEST VIRGINIAVICTOR
description: OMAHA, Wednesday, May 12  Ronald Reagan, running steadily ahead of President Ford in the conservative small cities and towns of western Nebraska, won early today this state's Republican Presidential preference primary by a slender margin.

title: NEW YORK BUDGET FEARED OFF MARK
description: The chief state monitor of New York City's austerity plan cautioned yesterday that the city would probably have to make deeper budget cuts and increased projections for welfare and other expenses if it was to meet the mandate of ending its deficit by mid1978.

title: Suffolk Farmland
description: In an act of extreme shortsightedness, the Suffolk County Legislature yesterday turned down a chance to preserve the remarkable appearance of the eastern end of, Long Island as it has existed in parts almost since colonial times. A pioneering concept to preserve much of its existing farmland by safeguarding future development rights through a bond issue was tabled in the Legislature.

title: AMY LYON SCHAEFFER
description: Amy Lyon Schaeffer, who wrote foou news tor The New York Times in the 1930s, died last Wednesday of a heart attack in her home in Falls Village, Conn. Her age was 59.

title: Appeals Court Reinstates Hughes Case Indictments
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 11A oncedismissed indictment that accuses Howard R. Hughes and three of his associates of illegal manipulation of a publicly traded stock has been reinstated by the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.

title: Memorial Services
description: COGLEYJohn. A memorial service will hn held Friday. May 14, 6:30 P.M., at St. Joseoh's Church, 6th Ave. and 4th St.

title: Temple Still Rises But Gaudi Pupils Won't See Finish
description: BARCELONA, Spain, May 8A half century after its creator's death, one of the renowned masterworks of 20thcentury most devoted is still. abuilding, and its most devoted sponsors have no hope of seeing it completed in their lifetime.

title: Giscard, in Talks With African Leaders; Presses Plan to Win Bonds With West
description: PARIS. May 11President Valery Giscard d'Estaing told leaders of 19 African and Indian Ocean countries who ended a twoday session with France today that they should consider defense of liberty. sovereignty and economic and social development as part of the same struggle.

title: Some Democrats Push Rodino As VicePresidential Candidate
description: WASHINGTON. May 11Representative Peter W. Rodino Jr., the Newark Democrat who is chairman of the House judiciary Committee, is being promoted by some of his Congressional colleagues as a Democratic candidate for Vice President.

title: U.S. RAISING AIMS IN NURSING HOMES
description: ALBANY, May 11The State Health Commissioner moved today to rescind an earlier decision to reduce minimum standards in nursing homes to those required by the Federal Government.

title: GEOLOGIST FAVORS ATOM WASTE BURIAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (AP) The Government should heed a recommendation made by scientists nearly two decades ago that nuclear wastes be buried in deep salt and rock formations. a leading geologist said today.

title: Let Us All Remember the Black Sox
description: As the crowds drawn by oldtimers games have often demonstrated, baseball fans love to revisit the past, and yesterday's heroes seem to have a charm that warms even those cockles whose owners are so young they never saw Sandy Koufax throw a ball or Mickey Mantle hit one. this BicentenTridi Year, when half the nation is busy looking backward, Bowie Kuhn is seizing the opportunity conduct 5,000 of baseball's most intimate friends on guided tour down memory lane. The 5.000 have been invited to cast ballots selectingthe most memorable this and least forgettable that in the game's history. Commenting in this space yesterday on this organized plunge into bathos, Dave Anderson observed that some of the nominees for beatification as baseball's most memorable personality are not in the Hall Fame. Somebody's got to be wrong. Voters have been fingering immortals for enshrinement in Cooperstown for years now, and even if we allow for occasional lapses on their part, a man whom they have forgotten for four decades hardly fits the description, one most memorable.

title: Man Held in Car Death
description: WOODBRIDGE. N. J., May 11 (AP)A Kearny man has been arrested and charged in the death of a man who was hit by a car while inspecting his own vehicle on the shoulder of the New Jersey Turnpike here. The defendant, Robert J. Smillie. 22 years old, left the scene of the accident yesterday, drove short distance away and fled on foot, an eyewitness told the police. Mr. Smillie was apprehended by a policeman a short time later after hitchhiking ride with a passing motorist on nearby Route, 9.

title: U.S. Sues to Force a Poll By Board on School Bias
description: The Federal Government filed, suit yesterday to require the New York City Board of Education to distribute questionnaires seeking to determine] whether there had been discrimination in the operation of a $300millionayear Federal aid program.

title: Exxon Subsidiary Cuts Price for Heavy Fuel Oil
description: Exxon USA, a subsidiary of the Exxon Corporation, the nation's largest oil company, announced yesterday adjustments in the prices of its East Coast heavy fuel oil that have the overall effect of cutting prices to customers by 63 to 83 cents a barrel. The company said that the price reduction would result from an entitlement allowance for heavy fuel oil retroactive to May 1, together with adjustments to the prices of certain grades of fuel oil made effective yesterday. Entitlements are a Federal Government program, which attempts to even out the cost of crude oil to all United States refiners.

title: Further Ways to Prepare Artichokes: From Bottoms to Sauce and Stuffings
description: (Fonds d'artichauts aux huitres)

title: Agnew, on Zionists, His Novel...
description: Spiro T. Agnew, in his first network television appearance since resigning as Vice President on Oct. 10, 1973, was interviewed yesterday by Barbara Walters and Jim Hartz on NBC's Today show. Now in international trade, Mr. Agnew was on the program to promote his book, The Canfield Decision, a novel about political intrigue and romance. Following are excerpts front the network's transcript of the interview.

title: ENVOY OF BOLIVIA IS SLAIN IN PARIS
description: PARIS, May 11The Bolivian Ambassador to France was shot and killed today in broad daylight underneath a subway bridge over the Seine River. The assailant escaped.

title: Israeli Settlements a Policy Clue
description: JERUSALEM. May 11Anyone curious about how Israel's leaders envision the country's future and final borders need lonly look at a map of the 68 Israeli settlements established in occupied Arab territory sine e. 1967. Connect the dots marking the settlements  just as in the children's gameand the new frontiers emerge.

title: Cruel Joke
description: It is difficult to believe that officials of a city that is as financially strapped as New York would turn their, backs on more than $100 million in Federal aid. That is what could happen if the Board of Estimate continues to reject Beame administration proposals for spending $102 million in Community Development funds for which application must be made to Washington by June 1.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The first mate of a schooner that sank off Brigantine, NJ., in January 1974 testified at the captain's manslaughter trial in Camden yesterday that the schooner's tiny lifeboat might have capsized if Capt. Cyril E. LaBrecque had tried to throw his pet Labrador retriever overboard to make room for two crewmen who died of exposure while clinging to the side of the bobbing craft.

title: Mate of Sunken Schooner Testifies for the Captain
description: CAMDEN, May 11The first mate on a schooner that sank in a storm off Brigantine testified at the captain's manslaughter trial today that a lifeboat might have capsized had the captain tried to throw his dog out to make room for crewmen clinging to the side.

title: Ban Lifted on NL Industries Plant Shut for Polluting
description: PEDRICKTOWN, May 11The state's Deparment of Environmental Protection has agreed to permit an NL Industries plant here to resume operations under certain conditions after shutting it down last Friday, a department official said today.

title: $1.3 Million Award In Venereal Disease Called Landmark
description: CASPER, Wyo., May 11 (AP) The lawyer for a woman who was awarded $1.3 million in damages because she contracted gonorrhea from the 38yearold son of former Ambassador Angier Biddle Duke says the case may turn out to be a landmark in America's judicial history.

title: The Religious Issue
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 The religious issue in the Presidential campaign is relevant and even important up to a point, but it's in danger of getting out of hand, and could, we're not careful, divide the country on theological rather than political grounds.

title: Quake Leaves the Treasures of Venice Unscathed
description: VENICE, May 11The artistic and architectural treasux es of Venice escaped Virtually unscathed from the devastation of last Thursday's earthquake and the tremors since, experts here said today.

title: China's Education Minister Is Reported to Lose Post
description: SHANGHAI, May 11 (Reuters) A senior official at Futan University in Shanghai said today that China's Education Minister, Chou Junghsin had been removed from office but could not confirm reports that he was dead.

title: People in Sports
description: I'm no prophet, but the only prediction I'll make about the flight is that I'll be the winner, said Richard Dunn, the 31yearold European heavyweight champion from Britain. Dunn arrived in Munich yesterday to begin training for his May 25 worldtitle bout with Muhammad Ali. I don't know how I'll win. said Dunn. I don't know when I'll win either, but it doesn't matter if it's the first round or the 15th. I don't fight with my mouth I'll leave that to Ali. fight with fists.

title: Rail Safety Funds Backed
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (AP) The House Commerce Committee approved today a bill providing $35 million in each of the fiscal years 1977 and 1978 for railroad safety.

title: 4 Die as Ammonia Truck Explodes in Texas Crash
description: HOUSTON, May 11 (AP)A tank truck loaded with pressurized ammonia plowed through an overpass guard rail at the state's busiest freeway interchange today, plunged 20 feet into the noontime traffic and exploded, Scattering cars and clouds of toxic fumes over the area.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: Lawyer Swears He Delivered Arol Gifts to Bronx Courthouse
description: A lawyer for the Arol Devellopment Corporation said in an affidavit made public yesterday that he had delivered gift cartons of cosmetics to several officials at the Bronx Courthouse two of them to the chambers of a judge who months earlier had ruled in favor of the company.

title: Tuna Fishermen Barred From Killing Porpoises
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (AP) Environmentalists won a major fight today as a Federal district judge banned commercial fishermen from killing porpoises while netting tuna, practice that killed more than 100,000 porpoises last year.

title: Namesake of Schooner Slaves Took Over Joining Operation Sail
description: Amid the mighty, tall ships coming here July 4 for Operation Sail 1976 will be a smaller vessel bearing a large tradition.

title: Council Won't Approve City U. Budget Until Cuts Are Specified
description: The City Council's Finance Committee warned the Board of Higher Education yesterday that it would refuse to vote on the board's budget until $150 million in mandated cuts was spelled out precisely.

title: Amex. in Discussing Study, Denies S.E.C. Is Displeased
description: Commenting on a report that the Securities and Exchange Commission had had opened its own investigation of options trading irregularities on the American Stock Exchange because of apparent dissatisfaction with the Amex inquiry, Paul Kolton, chairman of the Amex, denied yesterday that the S.E.C. was dissatisfied.

title: Aeros Triumph, 43
description: HARTFORD, May 11 (UPI) The Popiel brothers, Pouf and Jan, scored three goals in the opening period tonight to give the Houston Aeros a 43 victory over the New England Whalers and even their fourofseven World Hockey Association playoff series at 11.

title: CAREY CUTS BACK CUNNINGHAM ROLE
description: BUFFALO, May 11Governor Carey indicated today that he would soon name a person to supplant Patrick J. Cunningham, the embattled state Democratic chairman, in the coordination of the Democratic legislative election campaign and in the handling of party matters within the state.

title: 2d Study in Week Scores Law Agency
description: An independent study, group recommended yesterday that the Federal Law Enforcement Assistance Administration be reorganized into an agency that conducts research and experimentation and that Federal aid for criminal justice be distributed directly to state and local governments instead of through the agency.

title: About New York
description: A humble, sixstory Yorkville apartment building is the only unionized building on the Upper East Side at which members of Local 328 have remained at work.

title: REAGAN AHEAD IN NEBRASKA AND CHURCH LEADS CARTER; FORD WEST VIRGINIA VICTOR
description: OMAHA, May 11  Ronald Reagan took a slender lead over President Ford in early returns from the Nebraska Republican Presidential primary tonight while Senator Frank Church of Idaho was building up a somewhat larger margin over Jimmy Carter, the former Georgia Governor, in the Democratic race.

title: Brown Quits Colonels to Pilot Hawks
description: Hubie Brown, schooled in defense and intolerant of failure, accepted the task yesterday of rebuilding the young but stumbling Atlanta Hawks.

title: Legislators Lulus Are Ruled Illegal
description: ALBANY, May 11The extra allowances that legislators voted for themselves last year were held unconstitutional today by the Appellate Division of New York State Supreme Court, but the court ruled that the lawmakers would not have to return the money.

title: Plan to Raze Stevens Academy Stirs Mixed Feelings in Hoboken
description: The demolition of Hoboken's 116yearold Stevens Academy is scheduled to begin Friday to make way for the 33d branch office of the Garden State National Bank.

title: Church Says Miracle He Needs May Be in the Making
description: OMAHA, May 11Senator Frank Church, who had said that it would take a political miracle for him to win the Nebraska Presidential primary, told reporters tonight that the miracle we needed may be in the makina.

title: Advertising
description: About 30 days after Delano W. Ladd decided to get into the agency business by buying a controlling interest in Edwin Bird Wilson Inc., the agency lost its biggest account. How's that for getting off on the right foot?

title: West Berlin Police Disperse Protesters After Jail Death
description: WEST BERLIN, May 11 (Reuters)  Police men used clubs to disperse demonstrators here tonight and a bomb exploded at a United States forces radio station in Munich as protests continued following the death in prison of the anarchist leader Ulrike Meinhoe.

title: Optometry Measure Lagging in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 11The Sen?? wealth Committee has recommended further study of a bill that would allow optometrists to use some drugs in diagnosing eye disordersa Move that is likely to stall the littleknown but controversial measure in the New York State Legislature for the second year in a row.

title: PROTESTERS OUSTED IN COLUMBIA SITIN
description: Ten demonstrators briefly occupied an executive office at Columbia University, yesterday, the day before commencement exercises, to protest the university's recent cancellation of a communityeducation prograin it had run for about 1,000 neighborhood residents at a cost of $350,000 a year.

title: WINE TALK
description: There are hundreds of different wines produced in Italy, but only a handful of them are known in the United States. Two of them; soave and verdicchio, have served as introductions to wine drinking for many Americans because, first of all, they are white and we seem to prefer white wines, and secondly, because they are plentiful, not too expensive and relatively easy to remember.

title: Temple Still Rises But Gaudi Pupils Won't See Finish
description: BARCELONA, Spain, May 8A half century after its creator's death, one of the renowned masterworks of 20thcentury architecture is still abuilding, and its most devoted sponsors have no hope of seeing it completed in their lifetime.

title: Northrop Shareholders Focus On Rising Profit, Not on Bribes
description: HAWTHORNE, Calif., May 11Rising profitsnot admissions of illegal campaign contributions and overseas bribesreceived the attention of shareholders of the Northrop Corporation today at the company's first annual meeting in three years.

title: Bomb Hurts 3 in Jerusalem
description: TEL AVIV, May 11 (Reuters) Three people were slightly injured tonight when a small bomb went off in a crowded movie theater in the center of the city, the police reported.

title: New AntiZionist Move Blocked in U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 11Countries of black Africa succeeded today in stopping an Algerianled initiative to link Zionism with racism in two resolutions in the United Nations Economic and Social Council.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Pan Am Creates New Unit
description: Pan American World Airways has created a new division of public communications to combine the departments of Federal affairs, public affairs, and public relations. Stanley Gewirtz, previously vice presidentpublic affairs, has been placed in charge of the new division and been given the title vice president  public communications.

title: Critics Select Travesties As Best Play of 197576
description: The New York Drama Critics Circle yesterday voted Travesties, the Royal Shakespeare production, the best play of the 197576 season. Streamers was named the best American play and Pacific Overtures the best musical.

title: When Circus Bears Take to the Stage
description: I am glad that actors aren't polar bears. There's enough injustice in the world as it is. Not that I have even had a particular thing about polar bears; I've always been able to take a polar bear or leave it without inquiring into its working conditions or the rewards it is apt to get for its prodigious labors. (Obviously I am speaking of working polar bears, not those still lazing about on cakes of ice somewhere.) They've seemed nice enough creatures, if a trifle large. But never my problem.

title: Analysts in Regulatory Fight
description: The New York Society of Security Analysts is best known for its daily luncheon meetings with executives of corporations, large and small, and its annual election of officers has been a humdrum affair for almost as long as anyone can remember.

title: Bridge:
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, May 11The United States teams, winners of the world team title in the Bermuda Bowl contest here last week, climbed above average for the first time this afternoon in the world team Olympiad.

title: OPEC OFFERS AID TO FOOD PROGRAM
description: PARIS, May 11The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries decided today to commit $400 million to an international fund to finance projects for increasing food production in developing countries, OPEC sources said.

title: Market Place
description: While the stocks of many major companies have shared in the 1976 bull market. those of hundreds of smaller companies have not.

title: U.N. DROPS SESSION ON ANGOLA'S ENTRY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 11The Security Council today canceled a scheduled meeting on Angola's application for membership in the United Nations because the United States delegation lacked instructions from Washington.

title: Woman Who Scored 99.9 And Lost Job Sues State
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., May 11  Ruth Ballou was provisionally appointed as coordinator of Federal and local programs in the State Division of Consumer Affairs in 1971, and two years later, when her position came under the State Civil Service, she took the examination pre. scribed for it and scored 99.999

title: England 40 Victor In British Soccer
description: LONDON, May 11 (UPI) England defeated Northern Ireland, 40, in the British soccer championship today to set the scene for a title game against Scotland in Glasgow Saturday.

title: PRESIDENT BACKED BY G.O.P.LEADERS
description: WASHINGTON, May 11A dozen Republiean Congressional leaders, seeking to counter Ronald Reagan's recent gains in the Republican Presidential primaries, offered today a resolution pledging support to President Ford for the party's nomination.

title: LISBON CHIEF HINTS BID FOR PRESIDENCY
description: LISBON, May 11 (Reuters)Prime Minister Jose Pinheiro de Azevedo indicated today, that he would run as a candidate, in the June 27 presidential election.

title: A Mystery in Iran: Who Killed the Mullah?
description: ISFAHAN, Iran, May 6Who abducted the revered Iranian religious leader Abolhassan Shamsabadi from near his home here last month?

title: Canadiens Down Flyers, 2 to 1, And Take 20 Lead in Cup Final
description: MONTREAL, May 11 Enlivened by Jacques Lemaire's shorthanded breakaway goal late in the second period, the Montreal Canadiens once again called upon their quickness and beat the Philadelphia Flyers tonight, 21, in the second game of the Stanley Cup championship series.

title: Suit Accuses McGrawHill Of Sex Bias
description: A woman went to court yesterday to press her long fight against a company rule that she said resulted in her losing an editorial job at McGrawHill five years ago because she married another employe of the company.

title: Carter's Reaction
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 Jimmy Carter, awaiting the resuits Of a close race in the Nebraska Presidential primary election, said tonight that even a loss in one or two states in the next few weeks would not stop his drive for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Newsday Exploring Move From Plant in Garden City
description: GARDEN CITY, May 11 (UPI)A spokesman for Newsday said today that the newspaper was exploring the possibility of moving its plant from Garden City.

title: Spy Inquiries, Begun Amid Public Outrage, End in Indifference
2 Youths, 17, Sentenced To 4 Weekends in Jail
description: Two Brooklyn youths who had pleaded guilty in connection with the knifepoint mugging of a third youth in front of Grand Central Terminal were sentenced yesterday to the unusual term of four weekends in jail and two years of public service.

title: TWO ROCK GROUPS AT BOTTOM LINE
description: The double bill of Dr, Feelgood and the Ramones at the Bottom Line Monday and last night promised to be something of an event of this season's rock season, but it didn't quite live up to expectations.

title: Of Ritual Heroes And Old Clothes
description: A labor union gallery is a rather unlikely place to find an exhibition of something that is a first cousin to hooked rugs. But that's the show currently on view Gallery 1199 in the Martin Luther King Jr. Labor Center.

title: Yields Up as Fed Cuts Funds Rate
description: This month's pronounced trend toward higher interest rates, interrupted briefly Tuesday, resumed yesterday. The key Federal funds raterose as high as 5 percent, causing the Federal Reserve to pump some temporary reserves into the money market to brine the rate back down. Some new Federal agency bonds were given the highest yields since December, and an issue of mediumgrade corporate bonds was priced to yield 10 percent, a rate that proved not high enough to cause quick sale of the securities to investors.

title: Controlling U.S. Arms Sales
description: President Ford's .veto of the International Security Assistance and Arms Export Control Act of 1976 blocks the Most comprehensive and farreaching reform of the policymaking process for United States arms sales ever undertaken. Though not without flaws, this legislation represented a historic initiative by Congress to increase its oversight with respect to the rapidly growing armssales program.

title: Voting Effects
description: Following are the final tally in Tuesday's Democratic Presidential voting in Connecticut and the latest delegatevote totals, including the Connecticut results, the primaries in Nebraska and West Virginia and Republican caucuses and conventions in Louisiana, Missouri and Guam:

title: Senate Unit Approves Tax Cut For 250,000 in Top 1% Bracket
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Senate Finance Committee approved today a change in the tax laws that would reduce the taxes of some 250,000 persons. all of whom have incomes that place them in the top 1 percent of taxpayers.

title: Speedy Canadiens Expecting Rougher Going in Spectrum
description: Larry Robinson gave his words the weight of an Oriental truism. You can't check someone, said the Montreal defenseman, who isn't there.

title: Hoboken Will Pay Tribute To a 5Wheel Locomotive
description: Just 150 years ago today, strange  looking, five  wheel openplatform contraption with an upright steam boiler chugges around a small loop of track on an estate in Hoboken, N.J.

title: Soccer Is in Jersey's Future
description: NEWARK, May 12 (AP)Officials of the Hackensack Meadowlands sports complex said today they expected a major league soccer team, Pro tennis tournaments, rodeos and concerts to complement the football Giants and hose racing that will begin there this fall.

title: Nureyev in Dream Lead
description: The Dream is Sir Frederick Ashton's very English ballet inspired by A Midsummer Night's Dream, and Rudolf Nureyev, a Russianborn dancer, captured its Shakespearean quality superbly in his local debut as Oberon on Tuesday night at the Metropolitan Opera.

title: Aides Say Carter Is Courted by Russians
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 Jimmy Carter's aides and advisers say that Soviet Embassy officials have made numerous contacts with them, expressing interest in the Presidential race and implying that they could possibly pursue policies that might influence the outcome.

title: Food Prices: Up or Down?
description: It was only a few days ago that the Labor Department issued ominous news for consumers: The wholesale price index for April, the department announced, had risen eighttenths of one percent, largely under the inflationary pressure of a remarkable 4.2 percent jump in farm prices. Since retail prices tend to follow wholesale prices with a lag of a few weeks, one did not have to be an economics Ph.D. to understand the effect on prices soon to be encountered at the supermarket.

title: British Announce Schedule Of Concorde Flights to U.S.
description: LONDON, May 12 (AP)British Airways said today that it would run Concorde supersonic passenger flights between London and Washington twice a week,, instead of the planned onceaweek flights, beginning May 24.

title: Nets Set To Clinch At Home
description: DENVER, May 12Julius Erving was going to the airport for the New York Nets return trip to Long Island this morning when the driver a Denver fantried a little psychology on him.

title: For Laver, W.T.T. Represents Another Stage of His Career
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., May 12 The announcement that Rod Laver had agreed to jump out of the tournament frying pan and into the Friars of World Team Tennis was greeted with sufficient eye blinking by the tennis community. They blinked once at the reported figures of his contract with San Diego$500,000 for three years. They blinked again at the commitment of this man this living legend of tournament tennisto legitimize this socalled mockery of the game, with its oneset format, its colorcoded court and its theatrical pretensions.

title: Tenants, Citing Strike, Act to Withhold Part of Rent
description: Tenants in a luxury apartment building on Riverside Drive sought court permission yesterday to withhold part of their rent to be used to correct hazardous and dangerous conditions brought on by the 10dayold strike of building service employees.

title: Gerald Ford's America
description: GRAND FORKS, N. D.Mr. Ford's troubles in the primaries stem in part from particular issues such as defense and farm policy. But underneath, one senses a deeper reason for his failure. He has disappointed hopes that Americansstill put in the Presidencyhopes for reassurance about the system and themselves.

title: DowntoEarth American Classics Get Star Billing
description: Seventh Avenue met Broadway again this week and again the encounter was successful. This time 800 people saw Calvin Klein's fall fashions introduced at the Circle in the Square Theater, and Mr. Klein proved that 125 styles could be paraded in 35 minutes in such a way that everybody could see what was going on.

title: ISLAMIC NATIONS OPEN CONFERENCE
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 12 (Reuters) Foreign ministers and other representatives of 42 Islamic countries began three days of closed talks here today, with Palestine and Cyprus expected to dominate discussion of economic and political problems in the Middle East, Asia and Africa.

title: New Yorker Hotel Is Sold to Church Of the Rev. Moon
description: The Unification Church, which is headed by the Rev. Sun Myung Moon, announce last night that it had bought the 2,000room New Yorker Hotel.

title: BUILDING OWNERS BAR PANEL'S PLAN TO SETTLE STRIKE
description: The Realty Advisory Board, which represents apartmenthouse landlords, yesterday rejected the recommendations of a special panel for settling the 10dayold walkout of building service employees.

title: BANK IN NEW JERSEY FILES TANKER SUIT
description: Charging that a Greek tanker company was in default on a $100 million loan in which it had a small participation, the American National Bank and Trust Company of New Jersey has filed suit against the EuropeanAmerican Banking Corporation to recover $1.45 million, papers filed in Manhattan Federal Court disclosed yesterday.

title: Business Briefs
description: Dollar Gains in Most Markets Abroad

title: INDIA AND PAKISTANI RENEW DISCUSSIONS
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, May 12 (Rewers)India and Pakistan, reopened talks today after a I2month break and reaffirmed their commitment to normalize relations.

title: The Long March: G.O.P.
description: Candidates in both parties are discovering that there is no smooth road to a Presidential nomination this year.

title: Bribery Panel Approach Questioned and Backed
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Administration's task force on corporate bribery, which has no fulltime staff of its own and no money appropriated for it, has met twice in its sixweek existence.

title: LATIN PRESIDENTS DENY CUBA THREAT
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, May 12 The presidents of Colombia and Venezuela feel that Cuba's military intervention in Angola was deplorable, but this has not altered their policy of seeking a normalization of Latin American relations with Havana.

title: Carey Proposes Wagner Do Key Cunningham Jobs
description: Governor Carey proposed yesterday that former Mayor Robert F. Wagner take over many of the duties of Patrick J. Cunningham, the Democratic state chairman, in what was interpreted by some political leaders as a signal to Mr. Cunningham to quit his post.

title: NEBRASKA VICTORY BY CHURCH BUOYS STOPCARTER BLOC
description: OMAHA, May 12Senator Frank Church of Idaho, with his upset victory over Jimmy Carter in yesterday's Nebraska primary, gave fresh hope to Democrats who still seek to stop the former Georgia Governor's Presidential drive.

title: WORK ON SUBWAY HALTED BY COURT
description: A Federal judge yesterday ordered work temporarily halted on the 63d Street subway station following charges by local residents that the Transit Authority had escalated its plans for the station without ever informing them.

title: U.S. LINKS CUBA MOVE TO ANGOLA U.N. ENTRY
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The State Department said today that it was essential for Cuban troops to be withdrawn from Angola before Angola can be considered for membership in the United Nations.

title: CAREY BID TO AID H.F.A. IS SET BACK
description: ALBANY. May 12Governor Carey's drive to enlist Federal help in the rescue of the Housing Finance Agency ran into complications today when Republicans here objected to the Governor's handling of the Coop City strike in the Bronx over increases in monthly maintenance charges.

description: With the reverence of Conservationists displaying a whooping crane, the Offtrack Betting Corporation devoted a news conference yesterday to a horseplayer who had won $128,844 on a $3 bet.

description: WASHINGTON, May 12A. compromise natural  gas bill, that would maintain Federal regulation over wellhead prices, but permit substantial price increases for new gas was introduced in the Senate today by a coalition of Democrats and Republicans.

title: Soviet Georgian Artist Finds Conformity Pays

title: Panel Proposes Guidelines In Commodity Option Deals
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP)  Trading in commodity options should be limited to domestic exchanges regulated by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, an advisory committee said today. It said options trading should only be on United States exchanges or offexchange systems that meet criteria providing the same safeguards for customers now provided for exchange trading of futures contracts.

title: SOVIET'S U.N. CHARGE REBUFFED BY ISRAEL
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 12Israel today rejected Soviet charges that it was responsible for terrorist attacks or threats against the Soviet Mission to the United Nations or that it was guilty of racial genocide in the occupied West Bank of the Jordan.

title: Rose Given Select Prize
description: Pete Rose, the Cinainnati Reds third baseman, known as Mr. Hustle for his fierce competitiveness on the baseball field, was named yesterday as the sixth recipient of the Roberto Clemente Award, given annually to the player who best exemplifies the game of baseball on and off the field.

title: ROTHKO DAUGHTER FILES FRAUD SUIT
description: Kate Rothko Prizel, daughter of Mark Rothko, the Abstract Expressionist painter, filed a Federal law suit yesterday seeking more than $6 million in damages against a law firm and an art appraiser for her father's estate.

title: SPANISH RIGHTISTS ASSAIL CHANGES
description: MADRID. May 12 (UPI) Spanish conservatives have launched an attack against the changes planned by the Government and have told King Juan Carlos I to stay out of politics.

title: Captain Says He Feared Lifeboat Would Capsize
description: CAMDEN, May 12The captain of a schooner that sank off Brigantine with the subsequent death of two young crewmen testified today that if he had thrown his 80pound Labrador retriever out of an 11foot lifeboat, the boat would have capsized.

title: Sun Myung Moon Sect Buys New Yorker Hotel
description: The Unification Church, which is headed by the Rev. Sun Myung Moon, announced last night that it had bought the 2,000room New Yorker Hotel.

title: Heroin Ring Leader Sentenced To 20 Years and $20,000 Fine
description: Franois Rossi, the head of the socalled South American Triangle, a major drug operation that was said to have smuggled more than $1.5 billion worth of heroin into this country between 1965 and 1973. was sentenced yesterday to 20 years in jail and a $20,000 fine.

title: Coop City Money Compromise Pressd
description: A compromise proposal was being worked out yesterday to prevent foreclosure of the $436 million mortgage of Coop City, but a split developed within the Carey administration over whether to go along with it.

Rohatyn, chairman of the Municipal Assistance Corporation, said yesterday that he was attempting to devise a way to use the proceeds from the forthcoming MiniM.A.C. bonds to provide some security for numerous anxious retirees and widows whose past city investments have been frozen by the fiscal crisis.

description: Dr. Walter Cane, who retired last July as a physician specializing in gastroenterology, died yesterday in Nassau County Hospital, Mineola, L. I., where he had been a member of the staff. He was 80 years old and lived in Hempsead, L. I.

title: Anticrime Agency Is Voted $5.4 Billion by Senate Unit

description: Randy Jones, the 26yearold lefthander of the San Diego Padres, became the major leagues first sixgame winner last night when he shut out the Philadelphia Phillies, 40, in Veterans Stadium.

title: I.T.T. ELABORATES ON FUNDS IN CHILE
description: PHOENIX, May 12  The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation disclosed today that it might have sent $350,000 to Chile in 1970 for political purposes.

title: Robber Is Stabbed By a Store Owner With Gun to Head
description: With a holdup man's cocked pistol pressed against his temple, a Washington Heights delicatessen owner grabbed a butcher knife and plunged it into the robber's stomach last night, according to the police. The mortally wounded man's gun went off just as the proprietor jerked his head out of the line of fire.

description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP) Representative Torbert H. Macdonald, who had been expected to die after lifesupport equipment was turned off at his own request, has improved instead and is out of immediate danger, his eldest son said today.

description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP) President Ford signed today a bill increasing the power of the Consumer Product Safety Commission but excluding pesticides, tobacco and firearms, from its jurisdiction to eliminate overlapping with other Government agencies.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Federal marshals have seized several million tablets of two new stimulant drugsimipramine and hydrogenated ergot alkyloidsthat they said fere being manufactured and distributed widely here without approval of the Food and Drug Administration. The seizure was made at the plant of the Bolar Pharmaceutical Company at 130 Lincoln Street, Copiague, L.I. An assistant United States attorney, Cyril Hyman, said the Government moved to impound the drugs, worth about $50,000, because the manufacturer had never offered proof they could be absorbed in the blood. Without proof that the drugs were effective, Mr. Hyman said, taking them for specified ailments could be like drinking water. The company is expected to contest the seizure.

title: Comstar Blastoff to Increase Communications Competition
description: Stiff competition in the American domestic communications satellite business, accompanied by risks of nearterm overcapacity, is expected to intensify after today's planned launching of a Comstar satellite. It is built to handle as many as 14,000 telephone conversations at one time.

title: Books of The Times
description: David Lloyd George's life encompassed an incredible span of British and world history. In American terms, he was born in the first Presidency of Abraham Lincoln and he died in the final days of the Presidency of Franklin D. Roosevelt. In his 82 years he had climbed from North Wales poverty and obscurity to become Britain's Prime Minister in the darkest days of World War I, world statesman at Versailles, then elder statesman in the long and sometimes cantankerous twilight of his career. Along the way he laid the foundations of the British welfare state and negotiated the settlement under which what is now the Irish Republic was established.

title: William Girdler's Not-Quite-So-Toothsome 'Grizzly'
description: Jean-Luc Godard proposed some years ago that the only adequate way to review one film is to make another in response. A director named William Girdler apparently agrees. He's on his way to the creation of an entire oeuvre of such movies. "Abby," made in 1974, was the repository of the Girdler meditations upon "The Exorcist."His latest, "Grizzly," is the story of a man-eating grizzly bear that terrorizes the campers in a national park. It is Mr. Girdler's answer to "Jaws" and if I had the facilities, I'd review "Grizzly" by making a movie about a teensy-weensy insect walking amok. It would be called "Flea.""Grizzly," which opened yesterday at the Rivoli and other theaters, is such a blatant imitation of "Jaws" that one has to admire the depth of the flattery it represents, though not the lack of talent involved. In addition to Mr. Girdler, he people behind the film include Edward L. Montoro, the executive producer, and Harvey Flaxman and David Sheldon, who wrote the screenplay and then produced it. Lights like theirs don't fit under bushels.The national park that is the location of "Grizzly" is never identified, though one would suppose it had to be somewhere in the American Northwest, where one might conceivably find a grizzly bear, and not Georgia, where the movie was actually made. It doesn't help the film that the Georgia forests, while pretty, look somewhat less menacing than Central Park and that the grizzly who plays the lead, though large and probably dangerous, can't quite shake his Winnie-the-Pooh image.It's one of the curious properties of second-rate fakery that the blood and gore that "Grizzly" deals in are just that much more offensive than they might be in a better-made film, such as "Jaws." "Grizzly" is not only clumsily plotted, photographed and edited, it is also downright rude when it insists on showing us the bear lopping off an arm or decapitating a horse.Because it's not good enough to earn the right to scare us, I would hope intelligent adults would avoid it and that parents would give it a personal X. Officially it's been rated PG.

Present statutory rape law says a person over 16 cannot have relations with a person under 16.
