As Mr. Novak correctly perceived, it's a variation of a set of questions millions of guilty Americans ask themselves every day, as they turn to the sports section in the morning before troubling to check if the globe is still spinning on its axis, as they fall asleep at night wondering what football players the New York Giants signed from the Memphis Southmen. So. Mr. Novak is perfectly right to attempt some serious answers to his questions, to give his head reasons for what his heart already knows.

title: Budget Panel's Chairman
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Half a dozen years before such actions became acceptable and even popular in the House of Representatives, Brook Adams tried unsuccessfully to oust the chairman of a House committee whom he regarded as dictatorial. The effort marked him, in the eye of some, as a radical.

title: CARTER PROPOSES A NUCLEAR LIMIT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 13Jimmy Carter called today for a voluntary moratorium by all nations on the purchase or sale of nuclear fuel enrichment and reprocessing plants as a means of curbing the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: From Malthus...
description: Almost two centuries ago, the Rev. Thomas R. Malthus won immortality by publishing his dire judgment on mankind's future. In his view, the great obstacle in the way to any extraordinary improvement in society is of a nature that we can never hope to overcome. The perpetual tendency in the race of man to Increase beyond the means of subsistence is one of the general laws... which we can have no reason to expect will change.

title: Bicentennial Fete at Synagogue
description: PATERSON, May 13Congregation B'nai Jeshurun, the state's oldest Reform synagogue founded in 1847, will began a celebration today of the Bicentennial and the American Jewish heritage in its Nathan Barnert Memorial Temple at Wall and 13th Avenues.

title: Hiyoshi's 63 Ties Mark
description: TAKASAKA, Japan, May 13 (AP)Sadao Hiyoshi, a Japanese pro, tied the Takasaka course record today with a nineunderpar 63 to take the firstround lead by three strokes in the $100,000 Fuji Sankei golf classic. Mya Aye, a Burmese pro, was second with 66, followed by Akira Yabe of Japan with a 67.

title: Change Is the Royal Ballet Way
description: In its last week at the Metropolitan Opera House, the Royal Ballet is coming up with debuts and new changes of cast. On Wednesday night, Rudolf Nureyev made a first, rollicking, appearance of the season in Sir Frederick Ashton's La Fille Mal Gardee. At the matinee, Laura Connor and David Ashmole made their local debuts in the leading roles in the same ballet.

title: BUILDING PACTS REPORTED BY UNION
description: The union representing striking paartment house employees said yesterday that it had begun to sign separate agreements wit hindividual landlords and cooperatives that incorpoated settlement terms recommended by Mayor Beame's special panel.

title: House Unit Acts on Baseball
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Congressional pressure to bring major league baseball back to Washington intensified today as the House Rules Committee unanimously approved creation of a special House committee to recommend possible legislation affecting professional sportsmainly baseball.

title: SCHOOLS IN JERSEY FACE JULY CLOSING
description: TRENTON, May 13The New Jersey Supreme Court ordered today that the state's 2,500 public schools be closed on July 1 unless the Legislature comes up with a constitutional method of financing them.

title: Reserve Report
description: In Billions

title: Guidelines Listed by I.R.S. On Questioning Companies
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) The Internal Revenue Service said today that not all corporate officials would be subject to questioning in the agency's attempt to ferret out illegal payments by business.

title: Finnish Coalition Cabinet Quits as Communists Balk
description: HELSINKI, Finland, May 13 (UPI)The fiveparty Fin nish coalition, the only Government in Western Europe to include Communists, collapsed today over a Communist refusal to agree to a sales tax increase.

title: Today's Entries at Belmont
description: Horses listed in order of post Positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: DIFALCO, SAYPOL ACCUSED OF PLOT TO TRADE FAVORS
description: Manhattan Surrogate S. Samuel DiFalco and Justice Irving H. Saypol of the State Supreme Court were charged yesterday with illegally steering $20,000 in commissions to Justice Saypol's son, an appraiser and auctioneer, in exchange for the justice's appointment of lawyers to lucrative court assignments.

title: Some Believe Fed Is Tightening Policy
description: The nation's money supply rose by $800 million last week, despite continuing predictions from moneymarket analysts that an end to the rapid growth of recent months was imminent.

title: Mohamed Shoaib, 70, Dies; ExPakistan Finance Chief
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (Reuters)Mohamed Shctaib, former Pakistani Finance Minister and vice president of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank), died at his home near here today. He was 70 years old.

title: And Now for the Second Question
description: BALTIMORE, May 13Two questions absorb America's horseplayers every yearwho is going to win the Kentucky Derby? Will something win the Triple Crown? The first is answered on the first Saturday in May, usually but not always. In 1968 Dancer's Image reached the wire first at Churchill Downs but flunked his postrace urinalysis and a couple of years passed before Forward Pass won that Derby in court. If the answer to the second question is no or maybe it is provided by the Preakness Stakes, which comes off for the 101st time on Saturday. That is, if Bold Forbes can score at Pimlico as he did in Kentucky, he will still be eligible to complete the triple in the Belmont Stakes three weeks hence. If he can't, then the roster of Triple Crown winners will stand at nine for at least another year.

title: Nature on the Piano
description: The logic of constructing a Bicentennial program out of three works by American women plus a smattering of Beethoven, Rachmaninoff and Gershwin may not be unassailable, but it hardly matters when the major Bicentennial offering proves as worthwhile as Miriam Gideon's Of Shadows Numberless.

title: AIM IS MIXED, COUNTER LOWER
description: The American Stock Exchange finished mixed yesterday while prices in the overthecounter market ended lower.

title: Market Place
description: The shares of the Bergen Brunswig Corporation which soared as a result of favorable publicity in connection with a healthcare program the company regards as a sideline, have plunged since the company announced that the program appeared to be in trouble.

title: KISSINGER VOWS EFFORT 10 CHANGE RULE IN RHODESIA
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger sought to assure the Senate Foreign Relations Committee today that the Ford Administration would act energetically to carry out its new policy of seeking an end to white minority rule in Rhodesia.

title: Assembly's Abortion Bill Advances, Then Falters
description: ALBANY, May 13  The Assembly Health Committee today approved a bill to require parental consent for abortions performed on minors.

title: Aft: Chase, Porter and History
description: BETWEEN the careers of William Merritt Chase (18491916) and Fairfield Porter (190775), there stretches a wide gulf of history and experience, yet there are also some remarkable similarities. For anyone interested in the qualities and continuities of American painting, both the large Chase retrospective at M. Knoedler & Company, 21 East 70th Street (through June 5) and the exhibition of Porter's last paintings at the Nirschi & Adler Galleries, 21 East 67th Street (through May 28) are events of special interest.

title: A U.N. Slip by Scranton Makes Carter a Winner
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 13William W. Scranton, the chief United States delegate, reached today for an if but came up with a when and so for a moment conceded the Presidential election to Jimmy Carter.

title: Shopper's Guide to the Avenue
description: RESTAURANTS

title: Bridge
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, May 13The United States Seam, recovering well after a poor start, had its best day yet in the world team Olympiad here.

title: CARTER PROPOSES A NUCLEAR LIMIT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 13Jimmy Carter called today for a voluntary moratorium by all nations on the purchase or sale of nuclear fuel enrichment and reprocessing plants as a means of curbing the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: Late Task for Governor
description: DIX, Neb., May 15 (AP)Is it too late to order some hamburgers? a woman called to ask a small cafe in this western Nebraska town. Good, she said when told it was not late. I'd like six. I'll have the Governor, of Nebraska pick them up. And, indeed, a short time ater the cafe waitress reported that Gov. J. Exon came in personally and picked up the takeout order for a late night hamburger snack Monday.

title: Order by Supreme Court
description: TRENTON, May 13Following is the order of the New Jersey Supreme Court today directing that no tax money be spent on public education after July 1:

title: RADIO
description: 67:30 A.M., WNYCFM: Masterwork Hour. The Voyevode, Tchaikovsky; Piano Concerto. No. 3, Bartoic; Symphony No. 14, Shostakovich.

title: How to Get There
description: By car, it is a clear run of 125 miles from the Cross Bronx Expressway to New London on Interstate 95. The trip takes about three hours, the speed limit is 55 m.p.h. and the state troopers are strict and numerous.

title: FORD PLAN GIVES 4 YEARS TO REFORM REGULATORY UNITS
description: WASHINGTON, May 13President Ford asked Congress today to adopt a mandatory fouryear timetable for approving or rejecting the most extensive reform of the Government's regulatory programs and agencies ever attempted.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Justice Department has promised to suspend until June 2 the interviewing by F.B.I. agents of defense witnesses in the Government's antitrust action against the International Business Machines Corporation. The interviewing will resume then, the department stipulated yesterday in Federal Court for the Southern District of New York, if Judge David N. Edelstein has not yet ruled against it. The judge has said he will decide by June 2, if possible, about the legality of such interviewing by the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Charles R. Sellers Dies; BankingLaw Suecialist
description: Charles R. Sellers, who retired in 1974 as a senior partner of the law firm of White & Case, died yesterday in Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived in Georgetown, Conn., and at 200 East 66th Street in New York City.

title: Mao, 82, Is Reported Limiting Time Spent With Foreign Aides
description: PEKING, May 13An obviously frail Mao Tsetung has drastically reduced the amcunt of time he spends talking with foreign leaders visiting Peking. Meetings with visiting leaders in the last few weeks have established a pattern lasting only a fraction of the time for similar meetings as recently as three months ago.

title: St. John's Is Victor In Met. Golf
description: MUTIONTOWN, L. I., May 13The Woodcrest Club's beautiful 15 year  old golf course is too tight for the complete freedom of a big swinger who can't control tee shots well. Young college golfers, who tend to hit their tee shots far but in all directions, found trouble in many places today during the Metropolitan Golf Association's 27th annual intercollegiate tournament.

title: Art People
description: A PUSHY piece of velvetcovered plumbing by Barbara Zucker drops from the ceiling to catch you at navel level. Some terra cotta stringbeans by Diane Kaiser lie neatly heaped on the floor. Hairy black stalagmites by Les Bohnenkamp clump together in a corner. And in another corner stands a huge pair of hooks, by Jeffrey Lew, made of CorTen steel with endpapers marbleized by rust.

title: Major League Leaders
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE BATTING.

title: Yonkers Entries
description: Horses listed in order of past positions Letter designates OTB listing FIRST$7,000, pace, Class C3. mile.

title: U.S. Judge Stays Law Ending Relief For Some Under 21
description: A Federal Judge has temporarily barred New York State front enforcing a law that would have ended homerelief benefits today for 11,000 recipjent under the age of 21.

title: NEW YORK GIVEN RENT ASSURANCES
description: WASHINGTON, May 13A high Treasury Department official told the New York City Congressional delegation today that the Ford. Administration would not insist that the city abolish rent control as a condition for future Federal loans.

title: Pubic Workers Worried About Support
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 13Leaders of many municipal unions around the country are worried that public employees are losing public support and bargaining powers only recently secured, as voters seek an end to rising local taxes and city officials attempt to balance budgets while revenues are decreasing.

title: Critic's Choice: Warm Wagnerian
description: Norman Bailey is fast emerging as the leading Wagner baritone of his generation. This weekend, he can be seen and heard here both live and cannedtonight he sings the title role in the Chicago Symphony's muchawaited, concert performance of Der Fliegende Hollander at Carnegie Hall, and tonight at 10 and tomorrow afternoon at 2 there is a telecast of the BBCTV Englishlanguage production of the same opera, on Channel 13.

title: Political Bickering Mars U.N. Trade Talks in Kenya
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 13 (AP)  Political bickering among China, the Soviet Union and some thirdworld nations pushed economic issues into the background today at the fourth United Nations Conference on Trade and Development.

title: Hughes's Stewards Move to Prevent Breakup of Estate
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 13The almost daily appearance of another purported will of Howard R. Hughes has obscured the tact that the executives of the Summa Corporation and some of Mr. Hughes's relatives have begun to seek a way to avoid the forced breakup of his empire to pay inheritance taxes.

title: Security Bank Jury Acquits All but One
description: The nowdefunct Security National Bank and three of its former top officers were cleared yesterday of charges that they had illegally diverted $200,000 of the bank's funds for political contributions.

title: Feldman Will Meet With S.E.C. Officials On Reports His Concern Paid Kickbacks
description: NEWARK. May 13Senator Matthew Feldman, Democrat of Teaneck and president of the State Senate, said today that he would meet with the Securities and Exchange Commission in Washington tomorrow to discuss allegations that a liquor distribution company that he OWLS had made unlawful kickback payments to Emersons Ltd., the steak house chain.

title: Comstar Launched; 3d Satellite Setup For Domestic Calls
description: CAPE CANAVERAL Fla., May 13 (UPI)A Comstar communications satellite was launched today to give the nation a third domestic communications satellite system and provide a new pathway for calls to Hawaii and PuertoRico.

title: Mr. Reagan's Veto
description: Ronald Reagan has won more than a few Republican Presidential primaries. It increasingly begins to look as though he has won something approaching veto power over the Ford Administration's foreign policy. Mr. Ford's demoralization in the face of recent reverses in the primaries has apparently led to a decision that nothing must be done in the area of foreign policy that might give Mr. Reagan any ammunition with which to attack the President from the right.

title: On Hustings With an Enigmatic Brown
description: It was the end of a grueling day in the fall of 1974, a day of frustrations and delayed schedules. At 2 A.M. Edmund G. Brown Jr., then a California gubernatorial candidate, was visibly irritated.

title: 2 Held on Drug Charges
description: CRANFORD, N.J., May 13 (AP)Two men were arrested yesterday and charged with the possession of cocaine, which the police said had a street value of up to $30,000. The men, Michael Martin and Michel J. Mershon, both 23 and of Cranford, were arrested at 1:30 A.M. on the Garden State Parkway here.

title: Eagleton Endorses Carter
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., May 13 (Reuters)Senator Thomas F. Eagleton and 33 other Democratic leaders in the state today endorsed former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia for the party's Presidential nomination. Missouri's Senior Senator, Stuart Symington, did not sign the statement.

title: YUGOSLAVS DELAY U.S. ARMS BUYING
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 American and Yugoslav officials disclosed today that Yugoslav purchases of advanced American weapons had been indefinitely postponed because the pending sale received undesirable publicity in the United States.

title: Deaths
description: BARDITCHGoldie. The HewlettEast Rockaway Jewish Centre records with sorrow the passim of the mother of Its esteemed member, Helen Austin and extends its heanielt sympathy to the bereaved family.

title: Notes on People
description: Mayor Beame and Public Events Commissioner Angier Biddle Duke may now address each otherand be addressed as  Commander. Both received that Danish rank Wednesday in the Order of the Dannebrog, named for the Danish flag. ConsulGeneral Erik. KrogMeyer presented the decorations at Gracie Mansion in an advanced celebration of Queen Margrethe's coming visit here and in rec ognition of Mr. Duke's 196869 service as Ambassador to Denmark. Decorated a: Knights of the Dannebrog were Walter Terry, the dam critic, for his longtime coverage of Danish ballet; John Heistein, a Norwegian who is president for North America of Scandinavian Airlines, and Jens Rommerdahl, a Danish. American since 1945, who is director of the new passenger terminal on the West Side piers.

title: SPANIARDS COMBAT HUGE OIL LEAKAGE
description: LA CORUNA, Spain, May 13 (Reuters)Ships and helicopters today sprayed oildispersing detergent on the blackened sea round this north Spanish port to try to stem a flood of oil from a wrecked tanker.

title: Bill to Compel Bids, On Lottery Printing Advances in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 13The Senate today passed a bill to require competitive bidding on all printing contracts granted by the New York State Lottery Division with a preference for instate companies.

title: Cut in Arms Bill in House Is the Smallest in Decade
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The House Defense Appropriations Subcommittee today made the smallest cut in a military budget in a decade, reducing the Ford Administration's request for $106.7 billion in military appropriations by only $800 million.

title: School Custodians Under Investigation
description: Investigators for the New York City Board of Education. are looking into allegations of fraud as well as nepotism involving school custodians, including one who employs both his wife and a son for a total family income of more than $70.000 a year.

title: Brown Only National Candidate To Run Without Spending Curb
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California occupies a unique position among the Democrats campaigning nationally for their party's Presidential nomination: He is the only one campaigning without spending limits.

title: Court Upholds Carey Refusal To Detail Personnel Cutbacks
description: ALBANY, May 13  Governor Carey's defiance of the Legislature's orders to make specific spending and personnel cuts was upheld as constitutional in State Supreme Court here today.

title: Green and Stockton Tie for Lead at 67
description: FORT WORTH, May 13 (AP)Hubert Green, the season's leading moneywinner on the pro golf tour, attacked the small, damp greens for a threeunderpar 67 today to share the firstround lead with Dave Stockton in the $200,000 Colonial National invitation tournament.

title: Death Linked to Silicone
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 13 (AP) The Atlantic County Medical Examiner has ruled that a 24yearold gogo dancer died last October from silicone injections in a breast, The examiner's Dr. Milton Ackerman, said yesterday that the dancer, Denise Care, a Mays Landing mother of two who also worked as a model, died three days after receiving the injections from a New York City physician, whom he refused to identify, Dr. Ackerman said the woman died rom massive hemorrhaging caused by the silicone.

title: PEABODY SOUGHT BY AUSTRALIANS
description: Several Australian companies are members of business groups seeking to buy the Peabody Coal Company. By order of the Federal Trade Commission, the Kennecott Copper Company must divest itself of Peabody. Broken Hill Proprietary of Melbourne, an oil and coal producer, said yesterday that it was a member of a group headed by the Newmount Mining Corporation, which had put in a bid for Peabody, the largest coalmining company in the United States. Peabody was purchased by Kennecott in 1968 for more than $500 million.

title: Costs of Power
description: New York's Public Service Commission is embarking on a vitally important inquiry into the relative cost of nuclear and coal processes in the generation of electricity.

title: Cuba to Train Journalists
description: HAVANA, May 13 (Reuters)Cuba intends to set up a Latin American Center for Journalism Studies to counteract United States influence on schools of journalism in the region, the secretary general of Cuba's journalists' union has announced.

title: People and Business
description: In the first contested election slate of the New York Society of Security Analysts in 33 years, Dave H. Williams, 43yearold executive vice president of Mitchell Hutchins Inc., a research oriented brokerage firm, won an upset victory yesterday as president of the 5,000member society.

title: BOOTH NEWSPAPERS AMENABLE TO OFFER
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., May 13 (AP)Booth Newspapers officials say they want to keep the business independent and investorowned. But stockholders also were told today the directors might recommend selling or merging the company if someone makes an offer that cannot be refused.

title: Bouchard Goal Beats Flyers By 3 to 2
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 13A long shot by Pierre Bouchard that went through Rick Chartraw's legs and past the Philadelphia goalie gave the Montreal Canadiens a hardfought, 32 victory over the Flyers tonight in their final playoff series for the Stanley Cup.

title: Rep. Macdonald Is Stable
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) Representative Torbert H. Macdonald was reported in serious but stable condition today after ordering physicians at Bethesda Naval Medical Center to remove all lifesustaining devices. The 58yearold Massachusetts Democrat sank into comalike condition last Sunday because of internal bleeding. His illness has not been disclosed.

title: Bold Forbes Gets Post 4 At Pimlico
description: BALTIMORE, May 13Pace makes the race, and that's what they were talking about at Pimlico today as entries were drawn for Saturday's 101st Preakness.

title: Bonnie Franklin Debut
description: Bonnie Franklin, the sparkling redhead who made an impact on Broadway singing the title song in Applause, is making her nightclub debut at the. Grand Finale, 210 West 70th Street, with a performance that is even more impressive than her oneshot razzledazzle in the Lauren Bacall musical.

title: DungeonLike SubbasementYields Dusty Municipal Past
description: A vast collection of New York City documents dating back to 1810 and perhaps into the 18th century, will be salvaged from a subbasement in the Municipal Building in a classification operation that may take 10 years.

title: At the Movies
description: FRANCIS FORD COPPOLA and a cast and crew of 1,000that's the number of breakfasts, anywayhave built a town in the Philippine jungle and now are destroying it. They are making a film on the Vietnam war. It will be called Apocalypse Now.

title: U.S. WEIGHS MOVE AGAINST A SAUDI IN ARMS PAYOFFS
description: WASHINGTON, May 13A Federal grand jury here is looking into the alleged failure of Adnan M. Khashoggi, a central figure in the arms payoff scandals, to comply with a subpoena issued by the Securities and Exchange Commission, according to a lawyer for the Saudi Arabian businessman.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Dangerous Impasse
description: Mayor Beanie has reacted with understandable surprise and dismay to the Realty Advisory Board's rejection of the terms recommended by his mediation panel in efforts to end the strike of the building employees union. In appealing to the landlords to reconsider their turndown, Mr. Beanie is supported by the flat statement issued by Vincent D. McDonnell, the chairman of the State Mediation Board, who has been trying to settle the dispute throughout the negotiations and also served on the Mayor's panel: There is nothing more to negotiate.

title: People in Sports
description: Rod Gilbert, the Ranger; leading scorer last season, was given the Bill Masterton Trophy in Philadelphia yesterday. He beat Gerry Hart of the Islanders. 28 to 22, for the award voted annually by the Professional Hockey Writers Association to the player who best exemplifies the qualities of perseverance, sportsmanship and dedication to hockey. The award t; named for the former Minnesota North Star, who diet in 1968 after hitting his head on the ice.

title: French Warship in Maine For a Bicentennial Visit
description: PORTLAND, Me., May 14 (AP)A spanking new French warship began a fourday Bicentennial visit here today, commemorating delivery of documents that sealed the Revolutionary War alliance between France and the United States.

title: BUILDINGS STRIKERS MARSHAL BACKING
description: Leaders of the striking building service employees were marshaling support yesterday from labor groups in a drive to sign agreements with landlords and cooperatives on an individual basis.

title: WAGNER STRESSES LEADERSHIP ROLE
description: Breaking his silence on his new role in the state Democratic Party, former Mayor Robert F. Wagner made it clear yesterday that he would be an active party leader and not merely a figurehead or messenger for Governor Carey.

title: GOLD NAMED HEAD OF TALENT AGENCY
description: Sheldon Gold, dismissed last week as president of Hurok Concerts, has been appointed president of ICM Artists Itd., a newly formed classical music and dance subsidiary of Marvin Josephson Associates, a talent agency that handles clients primarily in the entertainment and literary fields.

title: U.S. SCANS DEAK TIE TO SMUGGLED MONEY
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 14 (UPI)  A currencysmuggling operation involving the internationally prestigious Deak & Company moneyexchange concern is being investigated by the Government, a Federal court action has disclosed.

title: Music: Solti Leads a Fine Hollander
description: Sir Georg Solti and the Chicago Symphony Orchestra maintained tradition by presenting an opera in concert form last night in Carnegie Hall. Ever since Sir Georg came to New York with Das Rheingold, he has been careful to devote one of his annual appearances here to an opera, generally a German one.

title: QUAKE FORECAST BRINGS NO PANIC
description: LOS ANGELES, May 14 (AP) The feared consequences of earthquake predictionfalling land values and public panichave not materialized despite a recent quake forecast for Los Angeles, a University of Colorado sociologist says.

title: Pest Curb Patented
description: A new way to control a sugar beet pest that has cost American farmers $20 million a year has been patented. Page 36.

title: Checking on Savings
description: After years of academic arguments, false starts and jousting among some of Albany's most active lobbyists, the New York Legislature finally appears ready to grant the state's savings banks the longsought facility to offer free checking and overdraft services to their depositors.

title: Farmingdale Teachers' Strike Continues as Negotiations Fail
description: FARMINGDALE, L. L, May 14An anticipated agreement on a new contract between striking teachers and the Farmingdale School Board collapsed last night during a negotiating session and the union said today it would continue the strike until a contract was obtained.

title: A Top Paris Banker Is Slain by Gunman; Crime Held Political
description: PARIS, May 14Jacques Chaine, president of the Credit Lyonnais, France's second largest bank, was shot to death today and his wife wounded by an assailant, identified by the police as an anarchist from southern France, who then killed himself.

title: Basement Blasts Damage Housing for the Elderly
description: BROCKTON, Mass., May 14 (UPI)A series of explosions in a 13,000volt electrical panel in the basement of a 10story apartment building for the elderly injured three persons today and forced evacuation of 300 residents. One of the iniured was hurt seriously.

title: PAKISIAN, INDIA AGREE TO RENEW DIP0MATIC TIES
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, May 14India and Pakistan, moving to ease years of bitter hostility, agreed today to the resumption of diplomatic relations within a short period of time.

title: CANNES FILM FETE ON DESPITE STRIKE
description: CANNES, France, May 14 (AP)  The 29th annual Cannes Film Festival got under way today despite a strike in some of the city's biggest hotels, which forced hundreds of visitors to carry their own bags and make their own beds.

title: Bridge:
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, May 14In an actionpacked day at the World Team Olympiad today, Britain increased its lead, the United States effort to move into contention lost momentum, and the Italian defending champions suffered an unusual penalty.

title: Soviet Defends Cuban Actions In Angola and Criticizes U.S.
description: MOSCOW, May 14  The Communist party newspaper Pravda issued a tough defense today of Cuba's Angola involve Iment and accused the United States of damaging dtente by its hostile campaign of threats against the Castro regime.

title: Imported Workers on Virgin Islands Pose Immigration Problems
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V. I., May 2Alien workers from offisland, who were invited here to the American paradise in the boom years of the fastdeveloping tourist industry, now find themselves caught by the economic downturn in a web of conflicting interests that make up America's most complex immigration problem.

title: Accuser in Thorpe Case Drops a Defamation Suit
description: LONDON, May 14 (Reuters) A former model who says he once had a sexual relationship with the former Liberal Party leader, Jeremy Thorpe, said today he was withdrawing a defamation suit against Mr. Thorpe.

title: Trevino's 64132 Leads By a Stroke
description: FORT WORTH, May 14 (AP)Lee Trevino, playing with his wellknown flair and flamboyance, birdied six of his last seven holes, set a course record on the back and surged into the secondround lead today in the $200,000 Colonial National invitation golf tournament with a 64.

title: BUILDING STRIKERS MARSHAL BACKING
description: Leaders of the striking building service employees were marshaling support yesterday from labor groups in a drive to sign agreements with landlords and cooperatives on an individual basis.

title: Noel Quits Party Post in Dispute Over His Remarks About Blacks
description: PROVIDENCE. R.I. May 14 (UPI)Gov. Philip W. Noel of Rhode Island announced today that he would step down as chairman of the Democratic National Platform Committee because of controversy generated by his recently publicized remarks that cast aspersions on black parents.

title: PACT IS ANNOUNCED IN PARCEL WALKOUT
description: CHICAGO, May 14 (UPI)A tentative agreement was reached today between the United Parcel Service and negotiators for 14,000 teamsters who have been on strike in 13 midwestern states since May 1. Federal mediators said.

title: Notes on People
description: The West Berlin suburb of Zchlendorf throbbed with Give My Regards to Broadway, played by a United States Army band, as Vice President Rockefeller and his wife, Happy, arrived at American headquarters there yesterday. There was a sort of Fourth of July flavor to the welcome from school children and about 1,000 American military personnel and dependents

title: Block Associations, Praised by Beame, Hold First Festival
description: Lunchhour strollers lined up for blood  pressure tests, watched auxiliary police operate an emergency van and received advice on the kinds of plants that can withstand the rigors of New York streets at the city's first Block Association Festival near City Hall yesterday.

title: JOHN CALLAHAN OF S.E.C. DIES AT 81
description: John T. Callahan, who retired as assistant general counsel of the Securities and Exchange Commission in 1968. died yesterday in a convalescent home in North Andover, Mass. He was 81 years old and lived at 38 Royal Crest Drive, North Andover.

title: A Top Paris Banker Is Slain by Gunman; Crime Held Political
description: PARIS, May 14Jacques Chaine, president of the Crdit Lyonnais, France's second largest bank, was shot to death today and his wife wounded by an assailant, identified by the police as an anarchist from southern France, who then killed himself.

title: Lottery Is Enjoined
description: A special drawing in the New York State Lottery scheduled for Tuesday, to make up for drawings not held last October after the lottery was suspended, was barred yesterday by an order in State Supreme Court in Manhattan. Page 29.

title: POWER INDUSTRY WOOING VOTERS
description: Thousands of dollars have been pooled by some of the nation's major electric companies, power equipmnt manufacturers and investment houses to fight a controversial California referendum proposal. If approved by voters June 8, Proposal 15 could seriously impede the use of nuclear power for the production of electricity.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Wednesday.

title: Compensation Is Won By Volunteer Fireman
description: ALBANY, May 14(UPI)A New Jersey volunteer fireman who yearned to join New York City's firefighters and was injured while fighting fires as a volunteer in New York City should be compensated by the city, the New York State Court of Appeals ruled today.

title: Prices of Soybean Futures Rise on European Demand
description: Good demand for soybean meal from the European Economic Community nations and Eastern Europe spurred higher prices yesterday for both the meal and soybeans.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article on the Maryland primary election that appeared in The New York Times yesterday, the results of a poll by The Baltimore Sun were incorrectly reported. Jimmy Carter was first with 28 percent of those polled; Gov. Edmund G. Brown jr. was second with 27 percent.

title: About New York
description: I sat down next to a man on the Fifth Avenue bus the other day who was poring over one of those transit system maps, reports Caroline K. Simon, former Secretary of State of New York and a former Court of Claims judge who is now in private practice.

title: Arkansan Debates Chase Manhattan
description: HELENA, Ark., May 14  The $40 billion Chase Manhattan Bank sent a planeload of experts here today to debate the question of a capital shortage with the secretarytreasurer of a corporation that employs three people.

title: Japan Says Russian Spied on U.S. Fleet;
description: TOKYO, May 14In a local police announcement with diplomatic implications, law enforcement authorities here announced today the arrest of Aleksandr Machekhin, a Soviet press agency representative, on charges of attempting to buy United States military secrets, including code books for the Seventh Fleet.

title: New York Kingrnaking
description: It is not quite a worthless crown that is being passed on from Patrick J. Cunningham to Robert F. Wagner, but it is certainly a tarnished one. By giving the former Mayor of New York City most of the visible powersincluding greater proximity to the Albany throne roomheld by the Democratic Party state chairman from the Bronx, Governor Carey has made the best of a complex situation that stretches from the Nadjari investigation to the July convention in Madison Square Garden.

title: Storms Imperil Refugees of Earthquakes in Italy
description: UDINE, Italy, May 14 (UPI)Rainstorms, snow flurries and rock slides today turned the tent cities that shelter 100,000 earthquake refugees into quagmires. The army stood by to relocate the refugees in railroad boxcars.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, MAY 15, 1976

title: Dow Off by 8.50 to 992.60; Trading Continues to Lag
description: Prices retreated on a broad front in the stock market yesterday. Trading remained light as participants appeared hesitant over the nagging questions that have arisen about interest rates.

title: Reagan, in Detroit, Asserts U.S. Curbs Auto Industry
description: DETROIT, May 14  Ronald Reagan, campaigning for the first time in President Ford's home state, lashed out today at the restraints that he said Washington, from. Capitol Hill to the White House, had placed on the automobile industry.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: Beame Will Share Role at Convention With Miss Krupsak
description: Mayor Beame and Lieut. Gov. Mary Anne Krupsak were elected cochairmen of the state's delegation to the Democratic National Convention yesterday after a flurry of opposition to Mr. Beame because of his reported decision to back Jimmy Carter for the Presidential nomination.

title: A Plea to Senator Mansfield
description: PARISOne of the many grim mysteries hidden by revolutionary Cambodia's selfimposed isolation is that concerning the fate of Prince Norodom Sihanouk, who served as nominal chief of state both during and after the civil war won by Communist Khmer Rouge forces last spring.

title: Many Are Willing to Pay For Improved Food Labels
description: About half the women who participated in a Gallup poll on nutrition conducted last month said they were sufficiently interested in expanding nutritional labeling on food to pay more for it.

title: 93 FreeAgent Kickers Dream of Glory As Jets Open Hempstead Tryout Camp
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., May 14 There were names like Botticelli and Shanghai, from schools like Diablo Valley, and they wore old college shirts and, for a few hours today, they made believe they were major league football players.

title: JOAN MURRAY CITED IN ASSAULT CHARGES
description: Joan Murray, a former WCBSTV reporter, was charged yesterday with hiring two men to beat up a former business as sociate whom she allegedly blamed for the failure of their advertising agency.

title: Beame Vetoes Avenue of Puerto Rico
description: Mayor Beame yesterday vetoed a bill to change the name of part of Graham Avenue in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn to the Avenue of Puerto Rico. The section is a major shopping center in a predominantly Hispanic neighborhood.

title: ATOM UNIT STAFF REJECTS WARNING
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (UPI) The staff of the Nuch ar Regulatory Commission today rejected warnings from an adviser who says that no new nuclear plants should be licensed until a fullscale test of cooling systems in reactors has been conducted.

title: O'JAYS PERFORM WITH DISTINCTION
description: The O'Jays, who are performing this weekend at the Westchester Premier Theater, are the aristocracy of rhythmandblues vocal groups. Their singing is strong and distinctive, and Kenny Gamble and Leon Huff, the phenomenally successful songwriters and record producers, lavish their best songs and most careful studio craftsmanship on them.

title: Miss Neppel Sets 3Mile Run Mark
description: MANHATTAN, Kan., May 14 (AP)Peg Neppel of Iowa State set a world record in the threemile run today at the Association of Intercollegiate Athletics for Women national track and field championships.

title: New Way Is Devised To Curb Sugar Pest
description: WASHINGTON, May 14A means of controlling a destructive worm that costs United States sugar beet farmers an estimated $20 million a year has been devised at the University of Idaho. Under Patent 3,946,485, granted this week to James D. Willett and L. Michael Cheek, natural, nonpolluting agents are to be used against the pest, which is known as the sugar beet cyst nematode. The new compounds offer alternatives to expensive control methods now employed, such as crop rotation or soil fumigation with toxic chemicals.

title: Brown Gains in Suburb of Baltimore, But Most Support Seems Tentative
description: PARKVILLE, Md., May 12 Kathryn Sturm has seen a good deal more of Jimmy Carter on television than she has of his rival in next week's primary here, Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. California. She assumes the commentators are right when they say the Georgian is likely to win the Democratic nomination and she fears that a Brown victory here might encourage Senator Hubert H. Humphrey to run again.

title: Red Sox Run String To 3 on 21 Victory
description: During Boston's recent 10game losing streak, Jim Willoughby, a pitcher, commented, I think we all want to do the best we can. We can't think back to the losses except to think about the things we did or didn't do. But this club is a winner, we all know it is a winner.

title: Suns Win; Series Tied, 33
description: PHOENIX, May 14 (AP)Alvan Adams took a pass under the basket and scored with 12 seconds left to give the Phoenix Suns a 105104 victory over the Golden State Warriors and tie their National Basketball Association Western Conference playoffs series at three games each tonight.

title: Preakness Seen as Match Race: Bold Forbes vs. Honest Pleasure
description: BALTIMORE, May 14Who's going to win the Preakness? a nonracing fan was asked today in a hotel lobby here.

title: Intelligence Compromise
description: Though compromise is often assailed by political ideologues, it is the oil of the governmental process. This week four SenatorsMansfield of Montana, Byrd of West Virginia, Ribicoff of Connecticut and Cannon of Nevada combined to work out a promising compromise which revived the proposal for a Senate intelligence committee that had been left toothless and mangled by the Rules Committee.

title: Chemical Concern and City Deny Kepone Contamination
description: RICHMOND, May 14 (UPI)The Allied Chemical Corporation and the city of Hopewell, Va., pleaded not guilty today to Federal criminal charges that they were responsible for contaminating the James River with Kepone, a pesticide ingredient.

title: Deaths
description: ALIMENALillian R. (Allen), beloved wife of Leonard N., loving sister of Minna Davis, Stella Pepperman and Moe Cohen. Funeral services Monday, May 17, 10 A.M., at the Park West Chapel, 115 W. 79th St., New York City.

title: Spain Ousts RightWing Carlist Accused by Left of Role in Clash
description: MADRID, May 14 (Reuters)The Spanish Government has expelled Prince Sixto de BorbonParma after clashes between frightwing and leftwing Carlists that caused two deaths last (Sunday, an Interior Ministry spokesman said today.

title: Citizens Committee for WNYC Opposes a Takeover by WNET
description: The Citizens Committee for WNYC, a new organization whose principals include former city officials, has expressed opposition to a proposal by public television station WNET/13 to take over the three broadcast properties owned by the cityWNYCTV, WNYCAM and WNYCFM. The group said that the plan would constitute a giveaway of public assets without appreciably relieving the city of financial burden.

title: Eased Election Rules Voted in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 14A bill that would greatly ease the eligibility requirements for voting in state primaries received final legislative passage in the Assembly today and was sent to the Governor for his signature.

title: Blanche Leonard to Sing; Stern, Menuhin Also Due
description: Blanche Leonard will sing at Carnegie Hall next Tuesday evening.

title: Getty Gasoline Up 1c
description: The Getty Oil Company's eastern operations announced yesterday a price increase of one cent a gallon on all grades of gasoline, effective today.

title: RICH'S INFORMS U.S. OF POLITICAL FUND
description: ATLANTA, May 14 (UPI)An officer of Rich's Inc. said today that it had notified Federal authorities of a secret political fund that gave state and Federal candidates more than $40,000 over 12 years.

title: 300 Central Park West Normal Again
description: After 11 days on strike, Pa?? Kerrigan was back on the avenue hailing cabs and helping tenants with their packages. The redlettered sign behind him in the entrance of 300 Central Park West was not picket sign but read: This building has signed with Local 32B, Service Employes International Union.

title: Sheriff of Suffolk Banned From Office Over Fund Raising
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I., May 14A State Supreme Court judge gave a conditional discharge today to Sheriff Philip F. Corso of Suffolk County, who was convicted of the misdemeanor charges involving the illegal sale of tickets to a Republican fundraising dinner. But the judge ordered that Mr. Corso could not hold public office for one year.

title: Detroit Mayor Telling Blacks Carter Will End Neglect
description: DETROIT, May 14The black Baptist ministers, perhaps 100 of them, were still working on the fried chicken and ham, the sweet potatoes and snap beans, the mustard greens and corn, when Coleman A. Young, Detroit's black Mayor, stood up to speak and threw his high, hard one on behalf of Jimmy Carter.

title: BLUE NIGHT' SHOW TO REMAIN ON CABLE
description: Manhattan Cable Television indicated yesterday that Blue Night at the Movies, a commercial program shown on cable, would not be barred as obscene.

title: Ukrainian Fair Enlivens East 7th St.
description: Luba Bardygyla, who is 10 years old, had polished her red leather boots for the occasion. Her embroidered blouse, and her redgreenblueyellowandpink flowered skirt was freshly pressed and starched, like the embroldered blouses and the purple, orange, turquoise, scarlet and magenta flowered skirts of the other girls from St. George's Catholic Parochial School.

title: Beame's 7% Solution
description: The pay package recommended by Mayor Beame in his unsuccessful effort to effect a quick end of the apartmenthouse strike has given New York's Civil Service unions a new bargaining weapon to use in their campaign to break out of the noincrease pattern the Beame admin istration hopes to make stick in municipal contract talks this year.

title: Astronauts Sought For Space Shuttle; Women Eligible
description: PARIS, May 14 (AP)The United States will recruit 30 more astronauts possibly including women, for a United StatesEuropean space shuttle project involving 200 flights starting in 1980, American officials said today.

title: Arkansas Power Deal
description: The Arkansas Power and Light Company, a unit of Middle South Utilities Inc., completed yesterday financing arrangements for an earlier announced plan to sell and lease back 44 pieces of companyowned real estate for $22.7 million in a transaction to be concluded July 1.

title: Implications of the Supreme Court Decision on Sodomy
description: Two hidden implications in the recent United States Supreme Court decision upholding the constitutionality of a Virginia law against sodomy have largely been neglected by the press. the first is that technically far more heterosexual women and men are affected by the ruling than lesbians or homosexual men.

title: Levi Weighs Asking High Court To Upset Boston Busing Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Attorney General Edward H. Levi is seriously considering filing a friendofthecourt brief with the Supreme Court within the next few days siding with opponents of Boston's courtordered school desegregation plan, and asking the Court to reconsider its landmark 1971 decision giving Federal courts broad power to order busing to desegregate schools, sources close to the matter said tonight.

title: Levi Weighs Asking High Court To Upset Boston Busing Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Attorney General Edward H. Levi is seriously considering filing a friendofthecourt brief with the Supreme Court within the next few days siding with opponents of Boston's courtordered school desegregation plan, and asking the Court to reconsider, its landmark 1971 decision giving Federal courts broad power to order busing to desegregate schools, sources close to the matter said tonight.

title: Lottery Is Enjoined
description: A special drawing in the New York State Lottery scheduled for Tuesday, to make up for drawings not held last October after the lottery was suspended, was barred yesterday by an order in State Supreme Court in Manhattan. Page 29.

title: Radio
description: 6.9 A.M., WQXR: Breakfast Symphony. Symphony, Zelenka Cello Concerto in B flat, Boccherini; Overture to The Happy Slaves, Arriaga; Concertino for Clarinet and Orchestra. Weber Symphony No. 5, Mendelssohn Fugal Overture, Hoist; ScherzoValse from Suite Pastorale, Chabrier Excerpt from Concertino for Marimba and Orchestra, Creston; Hary Janos Suite. Kodaly.

title: BATH IRON WORKS IS SEEKING RELIEF
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Bath Iron Works Corporation of Maine has asked the Defense Department that it be granted the same contractual relief being offered three other shipbuilders on their contracts with the Navy.

title: Udall Denies Deal
description: HASTINGS, Mich., May 14Representative Morris K. Udall angrily denied today any implication that he and Senator Frank Church have made a deal about the Nebraska and Michigan primaries. Mr. Udall who held a brief news conference to issue his denial attributed the charge of a deal to his opponent here, Mr. Carter. Mr. Carter, on his arrival yesterday at Flint, Mich., .made a statement implying that Mr' Church and Mr. Udall had in some way agreed not to cross each other's paths and draw votes away from each other, in the two states. Mr. Udall was not in the Nebraska primary, which was won by Mr. Church, and Mr. Church is not in this state's contest, to be held Tuesday

title: Arkansan Debates Chase Manhattan
description: HELENA, Ark., May 14  The $40 billion Chase Manhattan Bank sent a planeload of experts here today to debate the question of a capital shortage with the secretarytreasurer of a corporation that employs three people.

title: Settlement Marks 90th Anniversary
description: New York's University Settlement has reached the age of 90, still doing what it has done all alonghelping bewildered, impoverished immigrants find their way to the American dream.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The city's Health and Hospitals Corporation announced that it had won $3,358,000 in grants from the Federal Government to provide healthbuilding food supplements to women and children with serious nutritional deficiencies. Three of the hospitals, in Manhattan, and the amounts they will receive are Gouverneur, $932,000; Bellevue, $326,000, and Harlem, $200,000. The two others are Kings County, Brooklyn, and the Queens Hospital Center in Jamaica, each of which will receive $450,000. The program is open to pregnant women, mothers who are nursing babies, and newborn infants and children under 5.

title: WOMEN CHARGE BIAS IN BUILDING TRADES
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) Women construction workers filed a suit today against the Secretary of Labor, contending that he had perpetuated sex discrimination in the construction trades.

title: House Panel to Study F.B.I.'s Link to ExReporter
description: WASHINGTON, May 14An alleged special relationship between the Federal Bureau of Investigation and a former Nashville newspaperwoman over the last decade will be examined in a public hearing next Thursday by a House subcommittee, according to its chairman, Representative John D. Dingell.

title: CanadiensVerging on New Dynasty?
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 14When the Montreal Canadiens last played in the National Hockey League's championship finals, Scotty Bowman promised his players that if they won, the baby his wife was expecting would be named after Lord Stanley's Cup.

title: Adam Smith in Tbilisi
description: In this bicentennial year of The Wealth of Nations, revolutionaries throughout the world look for inspiration not to Adam Smith but to Karl Marx or Leon Trotsky or Mao Tsetung. The ideas of Adam Smith are generally considered outmoded, and anything but revolutionary.

title: Nets Attribute A.B.A. Victory To Loughery's Yellow Press
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., May 14 The victorious bedlam that started last night in the dressing room of the New York Nets and continued into the early morning made it seem that a long time had passed in the American Basketball Association season since Coach Kevin Loughery devised the pressing defense he calls Yellow.

title: Corporate Profile
description: The three O'Neil brothers Thomas F., Michael G. and Johnlike to say they run the General. Tire and Rubber Company as a troika, with no particular dedication to such conventional trappings of the executive suite as organization tables, flow charts and management concepts.

title: Schooner's Captain Freed In Death of 2 Off Lifeboat
description: CAMDEN N.J., May 14The captain of a shipwrecked schooner whose dog remained in a lifeboat while two crewmen clung to the boat in the icy Atlantic till they died of exposure was found not guilty today of manslaughter or endangering human lives.

title: Mets Are Defeated by Reds, 51
description: CINCINNATI, May 14The fourgame series that started tonight between the New York Mets and the Cincinnati Reds had been billed as the arms vs. the bats. But it only took 1 hour 58 minutes to prove that the glove was even more important.

title: Poll Pats Carter Ahead Of Either Republican
description: WASHINGTON, May 14, ReutersJimmy Carter, the leading Democratic Presidential candidate, commands a large lead over both Republican candidates, President Ford and Ronald Reagan, among registered voters interviewed in a national poll by the Washington Post.

title: Dividends
description: STOCK

title: Trade Fair Reflecting Chinese Difficulties
description: CANTON, China, May 7An American businessman looking over a contract he had just signed at the Canton Trade Fair for 1,000 dozen Chinese socks, noticed a small point he had earlier missedall the socks were to be one size.

title: The Cordero Horse and the Bookmakers

Nevertheless, there is a school of thought that holds this music to be worth preserving precisely because of its limited appeal, and there always seem to be a few excellent performers willing to work tirelessly to bring it before a small but dedicated public.

title: MOBIL IN ACCORD TO ACQUIRE IRVINE
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation said it had reached a tentative agreement with most of the shareholders of the Irvine Company for acquisition of they land development corporation. for stock valued at around $200 million. Mobil has been negotiating for several months with Irvine, whose properties include the 80,000acre Irvine Ranch in Orange County, Calif. A Mobil spokesman said that many more steps, must be taken before the merger could be consummated. Before the James Irvine Foundation, which owns 54.5 percent of the stock of the Irvine Company, can take any of the necessary steps, California courts must vacate or modify an injunction that currently prohibits the foundation from making any agreements with regard to the disposal of its shares in the Irvine Company.

title: GUILD AT THE POST THREATENS STRIKE

The guild, which represents news, business and clerical employees, has been working at The Post without a contract since March 31. 1975.

description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) Mr. Carter paid a courtesy call today on George Meany, president of the A.F.L.C.I.O., and said he believed labor would support his Presidential campaign if he wins the Democratic nomination.

description: BALTIMORE, May 14Dearly Precious, last season's champion 2yearold filly, found a 10pound weight concession about an ounce too much today in the 52d running of the $58,300 BlackEyed Susan Stakes at Pimlico.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PLAY BALL Now is the time for a baseball operaone such as William Schuman's oneact, threescene work, The Mighty Casey, based on the poem Casey at the Bat. With a libretto by Jeremy Gury, the Schuman opera was first performed in 1953 in Hartford and later as a television special, to critical acclaim.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (Reuters)The Senate Finance Committee voted today to end taxation of foreigners who invest in American banks or corporate bonds but to keep the tax on foreigners who buy American company stocks. The tax relief was put into an overall measure that would change a number of tax laws. The relief is supported strongly by the Treasury.

title: Schooner's Captain Freed In Death of 2 Off Lifeboat
description: CAMDEN, N.J., May 14The captain of a shipwrecked schooner whose dog remained in a lifeboat while two crewmen clung to the boat in the icy Atlantic till they died of exposure was found not guilty today of manslaughter or endangering human lives.

title: Islamic Parley Postponed
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 14 (Reuters)  A final session of the 42member Islamic Foreign Ministers Conference was postponed today with delegates split on issues about Eritrea and the French territory of Affars and Issas, officials said. The conference was to end today but may now be extended until tomorrow, sources said.

title: April Output Up Strongly; Continued Recovery Seen
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Industrial production rose strongly in April and the production indexes for both February and March were revised upward, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Armco Steel Corporation yesterday filed suit in a Federal court in Catlettsburg, Ky., against the Allied Chemical Corporation for $217 million for breach of contract.

title: STUART F. SMITH
description: Stuart F. Smith of Naples, Fla., who retired in 1961 as senior vice president and a director of the Connecticut General Life Insurance Company in Hartford, died yesterday in Naples. His age was 77.

title: Brown Asserts He Will Go Anywhere Needed in Drive
description: BALTIMORE, May 14Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California, pressing his campaign here against Jimmy Carter for the Maryland Democratic primary next Tuesday, said today that he would go to any state required to seek his party's Presidential nomination.

title: Marching or Whirling, De la Renta's Fall Styles Blend Drama and Beauty
description: Oscar de la Renta brought the twoweek merger of fashion and theater to a happy conclusion with a whirling, vibrant presentation of his fall collection at the Circle in the Square theater.

title: IMPACT OF STRIKE BEGINS TO WIDEN
description: The economic effects of the apartment  house  employees' strike are reaching out to include many more people besides landlords, strikers and tenants.

title: PAKISTAN, INDIA AGREE TO RENEW DIPLOMATIC TIES
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistani May 14India and Pakistan, moving to ease years of bitter hostility, agreed today to the resumption of diplomatic relations within a short period of time.

title: Film: 'Echoes' Wavers:Jodie Foster Is Superb as a Dying Child
description: "Echoes of a Summer," about the slow dying of a child, wavers infuriatingly between stoic beauty and sheer foolishness, between wisdom and sententiousness, between wit and archness.Its virtues, left too long on some vine of creative indecision or second-guessing, have gone badly soft in spots. It could have been a triumph. As it is, endurance, patience and a selective deafness will be needed for the rough parts; the good parts are good enough to make up for the trouble.The chief good thing is Jodie Foster, who played the barely adolescent hooker of "Taxi Driver." That was a stylish part; gritty, shocking and a natural for an acting tour de force."Echoes," made two years earlier, when Miss Foster was still a child, offers no such ease. She must sustain the movie's major role. Her composure, her toughness, her bleak eye that dissolves into a rare but total glee, carry her over bad and embarrassing lines and turn the good ones into arrows.She plays Deirdre, whose incurable heart disease has split her parents into opposite and conflicting strategies toward death.Her mother is consumed by the need to overcome the impossible. She has taken Deirdre to specialist after specialist, in Europe and America, to try to find a cure. ("European doctors look away from you the same as American doctors," Deirdre observes.)When the movie begins it is her father's turn. A writer, he is convinced that the important thing is to make Deirdre's last year as perfect as possible. No more dragging from city to city; instead he has moved his wife and child to a riverside retreat in Nova Scotia.He treats Deirdre as his "princess," talks to her in a mixture of child and adult whimsy, makes up stories and fantasies, refuses to talk to her about death. She must end with dignity and grace, he tells his wife. No one dies gracefully, she says."Dying is a coming down from the hills," he says cloudily. "Stop that," his wife says, agonized. "How?" he asks. Neither he in his futile whimsy nor she in her futile practicality can accept Deirdre's death.Deirdre can. She discusses her symptoms pitilessly with a brilliant and rough-mannered doctorone of the picture's best scenesand asks him to soften things a bit for her parents. She indulges her father and plays all his games until pain and weariness exhaust her.Her only real confidant is a plump, melancholy neighbor boy who is half her size. He lies down beside her on the beach when she asks him toshe wants to feel a man beside heralthough he cautions her that he is too young for sex. The scene could be mawkish and coy; it is funny and horribly touching.If Jodie Foster is the film's main strength  Lois Nettleton as the mother and Brad Savage as the boy are almost as goodits main weakness is Richard Harris.He is disastrous as the father. He is nothing but the whimsical, sentimental figure he is playing for Deirdre's benefit. And he imparts to the film most of its unbearable softness."Echoes," which opened at the Columbia Two Theater, is rated PG. The caution is presumably for some of Deirdre's comments about sex.

title: Gottfried Upsets Ashe in Quarterfinal
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 14 (UPI)Gusty winds seemed to confuse Arthur Ashe, and the secondseeded player was knocked out of the Las Vegas Tennis Classic today by Brian Gottfried. Ken Rosewall ousted Adriano Pannatta of Italy in another quarterfinal match.

title: Fires of Independence Smolder in Soviet Georgia
description: TBILISI, U.S.S.R.Brooding eyes, dark with smoldering anger, look out from behind the raised glass of white wine. To the United States of America, the toast begins, the final bulwark of democracy and freedom. Let the American people not forget the Georgian peo ple, who seek their own democracy and freedom.

title: REFORM RABBI OUT OF POST IN ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, May 14Reform Jews in Israel recently registered a breakthrough in their long struggle for a place in the country's religious establishment but it was shortlived.

description: TRENTON, May 14If the Assembly  passed state income tax is defeated in the State Senate on Wednesday as is widely predictedlegislative leaders have no backup plan to raise money for the public schools.

title: Callaway Says He Tried to Get A Quick Decision on Ski Resort
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) Howard H. Callaway said today that he only tried to get the Forest Service to speed up a decision on his Colorado ski resort, but the chairman of a Senate subcommittee investigating the case said that Mr. Callaway, President Ford's former campaign manager and Secretary of the Army, had clearly used his political influence.

title: WAGNER STRESSES LEADERSHIP ROLE
description: Breaking his silence on his new role in the state Democratic Party, former Mayor Robert F. Wagner made it clear yesterday that he would be an active party leader and not merely a figurehead or messenger for Governor Carey.

description: JERSEY CITY, May 14 (UPI) The police and Federal Bureau of Investigation agents searched today for two gunmen who wore black Ku Klux Klan style hoods during the holdup of a bank here and escaped with an undetermined amount of cash. The police said a teller at the Greenville branch of the Commercial Trust Company of New Jersey was slightly injured in the holdup yesterday after the two fired a shotgun blast inside the bank.

title: IRANIAN OIL DEAL IS HELD UNLIKELY
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Government energy officials said today that a swap of Iranian crude oil for American war planes probably would not be in the interests of the United State. They also said it was unlikely that such a deal would come about.

title: Bomb Damages Coast Bank
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 14 (Reuters)  A powerful bomb exploded in the Bayview Federal Savings Corporation branch at Larkspur 10 miles north of there early today and minutes later a male telephone caller cold the police it had been placed by the New World Liberation Front, an underground group. The bomb caused, extensive damage to the bank and six adjacent buildings.

title: Detroit Stock Exchange Will Close on June 30
description: DETROIT, May 14 (AP)After 69 years of operation, the Detroit Stock Exchange will close June 30 because of lack of interest and decline in trading volume, exchange officials said today.

description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 14The leaders of the Palestine Liberation Organization publicly appeared today to Syria for the first time to end its military intervention in Lebanon and to stop using Palestine Liberation Army units for its own political purposes.

title: Big Board Reports Rise In April Margin Accounts
description: Stock margin accounts in April rose to $6.7 million from $6.4 million in March and $4.4 million in April 1975, the New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday. It was the eighth consecutive increase and partly attributable to a gain of 15,000 in the number of margin accounts.

title: FORD SEEKS VOTES IN BORDER STATES
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 14President Ford stumped intensively across Tennessee and Kentucky today, but his most pressing and worrisome concern was next Tuesday's primary election in his home state, Michigan.

title: Jersey Milk Prices Stable
description: TRENTON, May 14 (AP)The minimum retail price of milk in New Jersey will remain the same next month, according to the State Division of Dairy Industry. Woodson W. Moffet Jr., the division director, said yesterday that farmers' costs were stable this month and did not need bolstering through the imposition of higher prices for June. Current minimum retail prices in the state are 39 cents for a quart of milk. 73 cents for a halfgallon and $1.40 for a gallon.

title: Books of The Times
description: In the future, it can be said that Dame Margot Fonteyn wrote the way she danced. Her autobiography has the same attention to form, interlaced with emotion, as her most memorable performances.

description: WASHINGTON, May 14Army intelligence officers stationed in West Berlin have opened firstclass mail between there end the United States and may be continuing to do so, according to two affidavits recently filed in civil court cases by Army Secretary Martin R. Hoffmann.

description: The Bell System plans today to put into commercial service between Chicago and Madison, Wis., the first leg of a nationwide signaling system designed to shorten the time it takes to, place long distance calls and to, economize on circuits for carryinc the conversations.

description: LA CORUNA. Spain, May 14 (AP)Officials said today that they had stopped the leakage from a wrecked Spanish tanker, but thousands of tons of crude oil continued to wash onto tourist beaches, blackening at least 60 miles of the northwest Spanish coastline.

description: Lunchhour strollers lined up for blood  pressure tests, watched auxiliary police operate an emergency van and received advice on the kinds of plants that can withstand the rigors of New York streets at the city's first Block Association Festival near City Hall yesterday.

description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 19The military callup of white reservists is placing a strain on Rhodesian businesses, especially small companies. In some cases they have seen half their work force march off to patrol the country's borders.

description: Yoshimasa Wada, a Japaneseborn artist turned composer, gave a program of his music called Small Night Music in Fog at the Kitchen Thursday night and last night.

However, the company has been dancing excitingly, and it was a particular pleasure to see Natalia Makarova perform with the company for the first time in New York.

title: Inflation in Israel at 36%
description: TEL AVIV, May 14 (AP)Inflation in Israel is running at 36 percent so far this year, the state radio reported today. The rise in the cost of living followed an accumulated inflation rate of 117 per cent over the last two years, according to figures from the Government's Statistics Bureau.

title: SUSPECT GIVES UP IN DOCTOR'S DEATH
description: A 22yearold unemployed man surrendered to the police in Brooklyn yesterday and was charged with the fatal stabbing ??f a 49yearold family physican during a robbery in Lincoln Terrace Park in Crown Heights two weeks aim.

title: Senator Says Agencies Lied to Warren Panel
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP)  The Central Intelligence Agency and Federal Bureau of Investigation lied to the Warren Commission about the assassination of President Kennedy, a member of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence said today. The Senator also suggested that we pursue some hot leads to answer for certain who killed Mr. Kennedy.

title: Rail Freight Up by 6.5%
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 15.6 billion tonmiles, 6.5 percent above a year ago. Carloadings in trie same period totaled 477,378 cars, up 4.8 percent. The American Trucking Associations reported intercity truck tonnage was 18.9 percent above last year.

description: The Secretary of Transportation, William T. Coleman Jr., said yesterday, White America owes a debt of gratitude to black America for making the Constitution work.

title: Opera: Cinderella Spoof
description: James Billings, a leading bass at the New York City Opera, writes opera librettos on the side. One of them, Meanwhile, Back at Cinderella's, with a score by Dennis Arlan, was given its premiere by the New York Lyric Opera on Thursday night at the Universalist Center for the Arts. A oneact comic piece, it was preceded by Gian Carlo Menotti's terse melodrama The Medium.

title: 8 ON FACULTY SUE CITY U. OVER PAY
description: A group of faculty mmoes at City University filed a suit yesterday against the faculty union and the university to block ratification of a contract that they contend robs them of two weeks' pay by deferring Payment for two years.

title: Working With Nature, For Easier Landscaping
description: NEW LONDON, Conn.A tight mat of leaves called bearberry hugged the woody hillside and not far from it were two other mats of green leaves over the ground. Sally Taylor explained to her small attentive audience that one of them was mountain cranberry and the largeleaved one was cowberry. Both of them belonged to the same genus as blueberries and cranberries.

title: Special New York Lottery Barred by Court Injunction
description: A New York State judge yesterday barred a special drawing of the problemplagued state lottery scheduled for Tuesday to make up for drawings not made after the lottery was suspended last October.

title: Where Are the Jobs?
description: Although the economy is making a reasonably vigorous recovery, unemployment continues to be a severe problem. More people were at work in March than ever but the unemployment rate stagnated at 7.5 percent because more people are entering the work force. The true percentage may be even higher. Depending upon what measurement is used, one can say that the number of persons seeking work is at least seven million and may be more than nine million.

title: A Passage to U.S. For Writer of India
description: After nearly 25 years of writing fiction in India, Ruth Prawer Jhabvala poured coffee in her new homea 14thfloor apartment on the East Side of Manhattanand reflected:

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on the Maryland primary election that appeared in The Times yesterday, the results of a poll by The Baltimore Sun were incorrectly reported. Jimmy Carter was first with 28 percent of those polled; Edmund G. Brown Jr. was second with 27 percent.

title: 2 Crews Gain Final
description: ORINDA, Calif., May 14 (UPI)  Washington and California advanced today into the varsity eight Final of the Western Intercollegiate rowing championships with heat victories at San Pablo dam reservoir. The Huskies, who shaded California in a dual race last month, won their heat from Oregon State, while the Golden Bears beat U.C.L.A. in the second 2,000meter heat.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A distant cousin has successfully contested the will of a Wenonah man who wanted most of his $500,000 estate to go toward the upkeep of family graves. Nollin B. Cox, who died March 10, 1975, had directed in his will that all but $7,900 of his estate go to the mowing, grading and proper care of the monuments and lots of two family cemetery plots in Bridgeton.

description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) A new contract has been worked out between AnheuserBusch breweries and striking members of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, subject to a vote of the union membership and working out a hacktowork agreement, a Federal mediator said today.

title: Consumer Notes:
description: Bergen County's first reregional health and senior citizen center, financed under the 1974 Federal Community Development Act, opened yesterday in East Rutherford.

title: Four Crushed on Train
description: LOS ANGELES, May 14 (Reuters)Four Mexicans, believed to be illegal immigrants trying to reach Los Angeles, were crushed to death on a freight train a few miles short of their destination early today when a load of heavy steel piping in which they were hiding tumbled down on them.

title: U.S. SETS UP PLAN ON ASHIPMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The United States is preparing proposals of new international facilities to curb the spread of nuclear weapons technology, a highranking Administration official said today.

title: Senate Bill Would Cut Tax For Home Loan Nominee
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 14 (AP)President Ford's nomine to become the nation's top savings and loan regulator, 3. Ralph Stone, would avoid at least $1 million in Federal income taxes under a bill pending in the Senate, the Sacramento Bee said today.

title: Sheriff of Suffolk Banned From Office Over Fund Raising
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I., May 14A State Supreme Court judge gave a conditional discharge today to Sheriff Philip F. Corse of Suffolk County, who was convicted of the misdemeanor charges involving the illegal sale of tickets to a Republican fundraising dinner. But the judge ordered that Mr. Corso could not hold public office for one year.
