title: Recital: Claremont Trio
description: Artists International has done a fine service to the music community this season by seeking out seven deserving young performers or groups and presenting them in Carnegie Recital Hall debuts. Concluding the series Saturday night was the Claremont Trio, named we may presume, for the avenue of the players' alma mater, the Manhattan School of Music.

title: ANSWERS ELUSIVE AT ATOMIC PARLEY
description: RENSSELAERVILLE, N.Y., May 16Atomic scientists and United Nations diplomats turned up some unexpected political and ethical considerations at a weekend meeting here on nuclear issues.

title: Hospitals Corporation Held Losing Millions
description: New York City's Health and Hospitals Corporation loses about $200 million a year in emergency and outpatient care to people who do not pay, according to a corporation spokesman and an audit by Arthur Levitt the State Comptroller.

title: Illinois Towns Are Center of Feud Over Which Side of River Should Get New Airport for St. Louis Area
description: WATERLOO, Ill., May 12It seems extraordinary in this time of environmental protest over urban growth that Americans could be battling one another to get a project that will produce high levels of noise, traffic and air pollution.

title: Roosevelt Island Tramway Ready for Maiden Voyage
description: The Roosevelt Island tramway will carry its first paying passengers tomorrow, and they will make the crossing to the new community in the East River in just threeandahalf minutes. It took the tramway itself an awful lot longer to make its first trip.

title: PALMIERI GARNERS LATIN MUSIC PRIZES
description: Eddie Palmieri was the top winner for the second year in a row at the second annual Latin N. Y. Music Awards ceremony last night. The awards, chosen by readers of Latin N.Y. magazine from a list selected by a nominating committee, are the principal form of noncommercial recognition for Latin musicians in this country. They were presented at the Beacon Theater.

title: The New Sunshine Law Reported to Be Working
description: A number of state officials and public interest groups believe that the threeandahalfmonthold Open Public Meeting Act, or Sunshine Law, is working.

title: Music: A Trim Pinafore
description: It's a regrettably short docking for H.M.S. Pinafore the third and last of the Gilbert and Sullivan operas being presented on the D'Oyly Carte's American tour; she opened yesterday afternoon at the Uris Theater and will sail out again after the Wednesday performance.

title: INQUIRY PRESSED IN STABBING DEATH
description: Detectives continued their investigation yesterday into the murder of Beverly Manoff, the wife of a prominent Springfield, N.J., lawyer, who was stabbed and bludgeoned to death in her home Friday morning.

title: BREWSTER CAUTIONS ON INTRUSION EVIL
description: NEW HAVEN, May 16 (AP)  Consumer activism and demands for the accountability of private business are preferable to government regulation or intrusion, Yale University's president, Kingman Brewster Jr., said today.

title: Yanks Bow to Orioles, 70
description: Ken Holtzman and the Baltimore Orioles confirmed a role reversal yesterday at Yankee Stadium: Suddenly they're a hot team in the American League East, and the Yankees are a cool team.

title: WEICKER DESCRIBES A G.O.P. PREAKNESS
description: Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., Republican of Connecticut, said today that if Ronald Reagan defeated President Ford in the Michigan primary, the Republican party would have a political Preakness on its hands in which both candidates burned themselves out before the race's finish.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Seeking to speed enactment of Governor Carey's courtreform plan, the state Bar Association is asking the Legislature for quick first passage of the constitutional measure, which must be approved by two successive Legislatures and a public referendum before it can be put into effect. In letters to be delivered to each legislator in Albany, the lawyers group said that a speedy first passage would allow full and careful consideration by the new Legislature to be elected this fall. The plan, cosponsored by the Governor and dhief Judge Charles D. Breitel, seeks a nonpartisan merit selection of judges, centralized court administration, streamlined judicial discipline and a simplified court structure.

title: Beame Is Expected to Testify With 100 Against State Formula on School Aid
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 16Mayor Beame and other top New York City officials are expected to be among the 100 witnesses who will testify, starting this week, in a suit that challenges the constitutionality of the state's financing of education.

title: Examining New York's Crisis

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 16  The key to passage of a state income tax may be in a bill up for a vote in the Senate Education Committee tomorrow.

title: Issue and Debate
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Five years ago, President Nixon coined the term Health Maintenance Organization to describe prepaid health groups those organized medical services that allow a family to pay one set fee for almost all its medical care.

title: Will Rogers Fund Plans to Continue Cardiac Research
description: VALHALLA, N.Y., May 15The pulmonary and cardiac disease research that was carried on for almost 40 years at the Will Rogers Memorial Hospital in Saranac Lake, N.Y., is to continue at a new wing of the Westchester County Medical Center complex on the Grasslands camous.

title: Mets Top Reds, 75, Lose, 81
description: CINCINNATI, May 16 The New York Mets beat the Cincinnati Reds. 75, in the first game of their doubleheader at Riverfront Stadium today hut lost to the Reds B squad, 81, in the second contest.

title: Reading Ford's Mind
description: Could these be my own Final Days? Gee, the ups and downs in this business. Six months I ago was a bum, a klutz, didn't stand a chance against Reagan; three months ago, was riding high, had the nomination in the bag and the election looked like a breeze. Now here I am getting my bones rattled on a whistlestop train tour of Michigan, which could be the end of the line.

title: It's All Greek as Marchers Mark Independence
description: What's so special about Greeks? a barbarian stranger asked Mark Kianedes, who was standing yesterday afternoon in full traditional dressexcept for his saddle shoesreviewing the Greek Independence Day Parade.

title: First FourYear Class Graduates at Purchase
description: PURCHASE, N.Y., May 16 Members of the first fouryear class at the State University of New York at Purchase, who have demonstrated the spirit of early pioneers, gathered for commencement exercises at noon yesterday under a huge green tent.

title: Doctor Weds Lisa Sokoloff
description: Lisa Beth Sokoloff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jesse B. Sokoloff of Hewlett Neck, L. I.. and Dr. Mark L. Steinberg, son of Dr. and Mrs. Abraam Steinberg of Pittsburgh were married yesterday afternoon.

title: Beyond the Accusations
description: Regardless of the outcome of the charges brought against Justice Irving H. Saypol of the State Supreme Court and Manhattan Surrogate S. Samuel DiFalco, both jurists have properly followed tradition and asked to be relieved of any new cases. The seriousness of the accusations would suggest that they step down from the bench entirely at this time. Continuity of faith in the judicial system is far more important than the inconvenience caused by assigning new judges to their pending cases.

title: Quake in Washington State
description: SEATTLE, May 16 (AP)A moderate earthquake, registering 5.4 on the Richter scale, rattled parts of northwest Washington and adjacent areas of British Columbia early this morning. it caused minor damage but no injuries, the authorities said. Dr. William Milne, of the Dominion Astro Physician Observatory near Victoria, said the quake's epicenter was northeast of Pender Island, a retirementresort community in the Strait of Georgia, south orVancouver.

title: Legislators Trying to Salvage Expense Allowances
description: ALBANY, May 15With just a little bit of selfpity legislative leaders here are examining a range of strategies to try to salvage their vital expense allowances, popularly known as Lulus, which were declared unconstitutional in court again this week.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, MAY 17, 1976

title: Miss Howard First in Gym Trials
description: LOS ANGELES, May 16 (AP)Kathy Howard of Oklahoma City took first place last night in the United States Olympic women's gymnastics trials. She will lead a sixwoman team to Montreal.

title: Proud Delta Victor in Belmont Fog
description: Sunday thoroughbred racing made its 1976 debut on a damp note at Belmont Park yesterday but it was on a lucrative one for Marion duPont Scott. Her Proud Delta carried the stable's blue, rose and silver colors to victory in the $56,530 Shuvee Handicap:

title: 3 Minor Firebombs Set Off in 2 Boroughs
description: Minor firebomb explosions for which militant groups claimed responsibility took place yesterday in Queens and Manhattan.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: 8th Title to Bacallao In Squash Tennis
description: Pedro Bacallao of the Princeton Club captured the National Squash Tennis Association championship for the eighth straight year yesterday at the Yale Club. He defeated Bill Rubin of the host club, 156, 1115, 156, 1816. in the final.

title: Box Scores
description: ESchmidt, D. Cash. DPRhilacielphla 2, .Houston I. LOBPhIladtlohla PS; Houston .5. 3BG.Maddox, L.Robeils?? HRL.Roberts (3). SCarlton 2. 5FTolan, Johnstone.

title: Cincinnati Editor Named
description: CINCINNATI, May 16 (UPI)James E. Schottelkotte, sports editor of The Cincinnati Enquirer, has been named managing editor of the paper, William J. Keating, president and editor, announced yesterday.

title: Carter's Record as Georgia Governor: Activism and Controversial Programs
description: ATLANTA, May 12Up in Maryland this last week, Jimmy Carter suggested that those who are curious about the kind of President he might be should look at the sort of Governor I was.

title: Latin Chief of Staff Held in Plot to Sell 10,000 Machine Guns to Underworld
description: The chief of staff of El Salvador's armed forces has been arrested and charged in Federal District Court in Manhattan with taking part with six other men in a plot to sell 10,000 submachine guns to people he thought were underworld figures in the United States.

title: PBS GROUP BUYS FILM BY BERGMAN
description: Scenes From a Marriage, the original sixpart series directed by Ingmar Bergman for Swedish television in 1973, which later was edited into a movie, has been purchased by WNET/13 and 77 other United States public television stations for a showing next season.

title: 14 REPORTED SLAIN IN TEHERAN CLASH
description: TEHERAN, Iran. May 16 Iranian security forces kiiied at least 11 alleged terrorists here today after three Iranian security officials were assassinated in the capital early this morning, highly placed sources close to the Teheran police reported.

title: The Retreat of the Liberal Sages
description: Last fall, with several members of the Yale Class of 1965, I returned to the chill of New Haven to mark, perfunctorily, the tenth year of our graduation. We had come of age during the civil rights movement of the mid1960's, but before the days of rage and drugs. We had been nurtured, politically, in the bosom of Democratic liberalism, and we took the rhetoric of our liberal mentors seriously.

title: SENATORS BID U.S. WEIGH END OF AID TO NEW YORK CITY
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Senate Banking Committee unanimously urged the Federal Government today to seriously consider ending its $2.3 billion in annual, seasonal loans if New York City failed to maintain its threeyear wage freeze.

title: Troubles forged Sox Go On
description: Although they ended a recent 10game losing streak with four consecutive victories, the Boston Red Sox are still in trouble in the defense of their American League Eastern Division title.

title: Ford Ends 3Day Appeal For Support in Michigan
description: SAGINAW, Mich., May 16Reiterating his contention that he should be elected to a full) term in office because he deserves It, President Ford, ended today hi spersonal campaigning for support in Tuesday's Michigan primary.

title: Julie Nixon Scores Portrait of Mother In The Final Days
description: Julie Nixon Eisenhower has taken strong exception to the portrayal of her mother, Pat Nixon, in the book The Final days as a withdrawn and selfcentered woman and a secret drinker. She said that this was one distortion in particular she could not live with.

title: Pact Reached in Bus Strike
description: ATLANTA, May 16 (UPI)Representatives of the Amalgamated Transit Union and Continental Trailways reached a tentative agreement yesterday in a contract dispute that led to a 16day strike by 1,000 bus drivers and terminal workers in nine states. Union members were to vote on the pact tomorrow.

title: Even a Prince Fails To Stop Bumblebee
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 16 Ever since Cleopatra sailed her barge down the Nile, yachting has attracted royalty. Today Prince Henrik of Denmark served on the crew aboard Jesse Philips's Charisma in the StamfordDenmark Friendship Race on blustery Lone Island Sound.

title: Ammonia Gas Routs 3,000
description: GLEN ELLYN, Ill., May 16 (UPI)Some 3,000 to 4,000 residents in a squaremile area of the western Chicago suburb of Glen Ellyn were evacuated from their homes early today because of leaking ammonia gas from a derailed Chicago and Northwestern freight train. A spokeswoman for Central Dupage Hospital In Windfield said six persons were treated for ammonia gas inhalation.

title: Threatened Strike Delayed By Union at General Tire
description: AKRON, Ohio, May 16 (AP) The United Rubber Workers postponed today a threatened strike against the General Tire and Rubber Company and said that the 2,700 General Tire workers would continue on the job while negotiators tried to reach a new contract.

title: RIGHTS BLOC MAPS APPEAL ON BUSING
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Civil rights organizations, reacting to disclosures this weekend that the Justice Department is prepared to ask the Supreme Court to reconsider busing decisions, will meet tomorrow to discuss ways to block the request.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, MAY 17, 1976

title: Club of Paris Expands Role in Helping Debtor Nations
description: PARIS, May 16The clubhouse is the French Finance Ministry. The members are middlebracket civil servants from some countries that cannot pay their bills and other countries to whom the bills are owed. The club's purpose is to stretch out debt for countries on the verge of bankruptcy.

title: BREWSTER CAUTIONS ON INTRUSION EVIL
description: NEW HAVEN, May 16 (AP)  Consumer activism and demands for the accountability of private business are preferable to government regulation or intrusion, Yale University's president, Kingman Brewster Jr., said today.

title: Radio
description: 9:0610 A.M., WQXR: Piano Personalities. Garrick Ohlsson, Pascal Roge, and Denise Roge. Liebstraume, Numbers 1.3, Liszt; Mother Goose Suite, Ravel.

title: Suzanne Ducharme, Student, Is Married
description: Suzanne Ducharme and Gerald Schwartz, both of Manhattan, were married yesterday afternoon at the Church, Center for the United Nations. The Rev. Joseph O'Rourke, a Roman Catholic priest, and Cantor Al Sturmer officiated.

title: Simon Says Ford Is to Get New Tax Plan This Year
description: CANCUN, Mexico, May 16 (AP)Treasury Secretary William E. Simon said today that he planned to give President Ford proposals for a new Federal income tax structure before the end of the year.

title: Connors Trounces Rosewall
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 16 (AP)Jimmy Connors, continuing his domination of 41yearold Ken Rosewall, defeated the Australian in the final of the $150,000 Alan King tennis tournament today 61, 63.

title: While Other Candidates Scramble, Reagan Still Campaigns at His Own Pace
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 16In these days of frenetic Presidential primary campaigning, Ronald Reagan usually appears to be marching to a different drummer.

title: Beirut Suffers Heavy Toll In New Surge of Violence
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Monday, May 17  The Lebanese capital and its suburbs went through one of the most violent days of the 13month civil war yesterday.

title: ...and an Eclipse?
description: Threats of a gubernatorial veto have cast a shadow over hopes in Albany for a new sunshine law which would require government meetings, at all levels, to be open to the public unless the unit that is meeting votes to conduct an executive session for limited, specified purposes.

title: Disaster Day in Middlesex
description: SOUTH AMBOY, May 16It was all simulated, but it might have happened, especially in yesterday's fog and rain.

title: Andrew Bronfman Weds Jane Kaften
description: Jane Lee Kaften, daughter of Mrs. Nelson Broms of Stamford, Conn., and Douglas Kaften of New York, was married yesterday morning to Andrew Bronfman of North Bergen, N.J. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Samuel M. Silver in Temple Sinai in Stamford.

title: In Thumb of Michigan, Fervor for the Primary Is Not Red Hot
description: UBLY, Mich., May 15The Michigan Presidential primaryindeed, the whole world of politicsseems very far away here in the thumb section of President Ford's home state.

title: Metcalf to Head Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI)The Senate Government Ciperations Subcommittee on Reports, Accounting and Manx0020;dgement is examining the spending of Government adcommitees. The subcommitee's chairman, Senator Lee Metcalf, Democratof Montana, said, Although many advisory Committee members donate their services, advisory committees issued 1,070 exports to gederal agencies and officers last year' at a total Federal cost of $51.8 million.

title: Roosevelt Island Tramway Ready for Maiden Voyage
description: The Roosevelt Island tramway will carry its first paying passengers tomorrow, and they will make the crossing to the new community in the East River in just threeandahalf minutes. It took the tramway itself an awful lot longer to make its first trip.

title: Children And Politics
description: MINNEAPOLISNestled against a wall of St. Mary's Basilica, a hulking old church near downtown Minneapolis, is a small playground. Terr children, 2 to 6 years old, use the swings and slide and run over to talk with their teacher, Michael Young. They are in a daycare center: Child Garden Montessori.

title: Relief Craft Crashes in Italy
description: TRASAGHIS, Italy, May 16 (AP)A Canadian helicopter involved in relief operations in northeast Italy crashed today near this earthquakestricken village. One crewman was killed and another injured.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Music

title: Latin Chief of Staff Held in Plotto Sell 10,000 Machine Guns to Underworld
description: The chief of staff of El Salvador's armed forces inks been arrested and charged in Federal District Court in Manhattan with taking part with six other men in a plot to sell 10,000 submachine guns to people he thought were underworld figures in the United States.

title: Julie Nixon Scores Portrait of Mother In The Final Days
description: Julie Nixon Eisenhower has taken strong exception to the portrayal of her mother, Pat Nixon, in tile hook The Final Days as a withdrawn and selfcentered woman and a secret drinker. She said that this was one distortion in particular she could not live with.

title: North Korea, Citing Health. Replaces Defense Minister
description: PEKING, May 16 (Agence FrancePresse)  The North Korean Defense Minister, Choe Hyon, has been relieved of his job for health reasons, Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency, reported today from Pyongyang, the North Korean capital.

title: Methodists in Britain Urge Strict Rules on Exorcising
description: LONDON, May 16 (Reuters) Stringent guidelines for ministers exorcizing evil spirits are recommended in a Methodist church study published here.

title: BERME IS DEFIED ON SEXFILM HOUSE
description: The New York City Buildings Department, disregarding instructions from the Mayor's office, has issued a permit allowing the owners of Broadway's de Mille Theater to convert it into three small theaters that, according to city officials, will show pornographic films.

title: Ballet: 2 Royal Debuts
description: Just before closing its season at the Metropolitan Opera House on Saturday night, the Royal Ballet presented two eagerly awaited local debuts in the afternoon Lesley Collier and Wayne Eagling in the leading roles of Swan Lake.

title: World Trade Talks: HaveNots Demand a Fair Share
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 12 In terms of identifying the problems of an unbalanced world economy, the delegates to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development meeting here have achieved something close to unanimity. It is the search for solutions that has them at loggerheads.

title: Nastase Victor Over Borg
description: REAUHOUKONA, Hawaii, May 16 (AP)Ilie Nastase of Rumania defeated Bjorn Borg of Sweden today and gained a berth in next weekend's finals of the World Championship Tennis Challenge Cup.

title: Canadiens Defeat Flyers, 53, Sweep Series for Stanley Cup
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 16Hoisting hockey's glistening prize, the Stanley Cup, on their shoulders, the Montreal Canadiens returned the National Hockey League championship north of the border tonight.

title: Rivkind Is Tennis Victor
description: BARDONIA, N.Y., May 16Dan Rivkind of New York defeated Paul Lynner of Carle Place, L.I., 76, 63, today in the final of the 45yearold division of the New York State indoor senior claycourt tennis championships. Gordon Reynolds of New York upset Steve Oglivy of Westport. Conn., 63, 75, in the 55yearold division

title: ETHIOPIA OFFERS AMITY TO REBELS
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, May 16The Ethiopian Government tonight made major conciliation offers to Eritrean rebels in an effort to head off a clash.

title: JEROME BOUCHER, 55; HARRIS UPHAM AIDE
description: Jerome H. P. Boucher, executive vice president of the investment firm of Smith Barney, Harris Upham & Company, died Saturday at Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston of complications following a heart attack. He was 55 years old and lived at 200 East 62d Street and Darien, Conn.

title: About New York
description: A man walked slowly north on Seventh Avenue between 40th and 41st Streets. He shuffled, really, scarcely lifting his feet. He kept his eyes focused downward through the subway gratings in the sidewalk. Now and again he stopped. He bent down and shaded his eyes, trying to decide whether the flash of silver he had seen in the debris 10 feet below was a coin.

title: Floor Brokers Cut Rates by 18 to 25%
description: A leading stockbroker, caught up in a rate war in which his biggest institutional customers have exacted commission reductions of 50 percent and more, gleefully remarked the other day, Now it's our turn to get some rate cuts.

title: Lauda Posts 4th Grand Prix Triumph
description: ZOLDER, Belgium, May 16 (UPI)Niki Lauda of Austria, still racing with painful ribs after a tractor accident at his home last month, led from start to finish today in a Ferrari and won the Grand Prix of Belgium.

title: Livingston Merchant, 72, A Top Diplomat, Is Dead
description: Livingston T. Merchant, former Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs, twice Ambassador to Canada and a key aide to President Eisenhower during the Geneva summit meeting in 1955, died Saturday at his home in Washington after having suffered a heart attack. He was 72 years old.

title: Rockefeller Speech Raises Questions
description: BONN, May 16American, diplomats expressed surprise, today at an apparently strong political tone in a sharp at tack on the Soviet Union by Vice President Rockefeller in Frankfurt yesterday.

title: Golf Victory To Trevino
description: FORT WORTH, May 16 (AP)Lee Trevino, shaken and unsteady and with his game on the verge of collapse, parlayed a lucky break into a birdie that turned back Mike Morley and enabled him to win the Colonial national invitation golf tournament today. It was the first victory of his pro career in Texas.

title: Kennedy's Vietnam Plan
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (Reuters)  Senator Edward M. Kennedy today urged President Ford to name a special envoy to seek to normalize relations with Vietnam and repair United States ties with Laos. He made the recommendation in releasing a staff report of the Senate Subcommittee on Refugees dealing with the problem of postwar rehabilitation in Indochina and resettlement of Indochinese refugees in the United States.

title: Work of Four Choreographers To Ellington Music at the Ailey
description: One supposes that Alvin Ailey has been working himself up to a Duke Ellington festival all of his life, and it is now officially announced for later in the year. Unofficially, during the current season of the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater, the company has been presenting allEllington programs such as the one given Saturday afternoon.

title: Toros Win; New Cosmos Star to Play
description: The Miami Toros scored their first North American Soccer League victory in seven games, while the Tampa Bay Rowdies failed to gain ground on the Cosmos by losing at Toronto yesterday.

title: World Team Tennis
description: LAST NIGHT'S MATCHES

title: A Light Touch for Funds Made by Judson Church
description: Judson Memorial Church was built in 1892 and now is falling apart.

title: About New work
description: A man walked slowly north on Seventh Avenue between 40th and 41st Streets. He shuffled, really, scarcely lifting his feet. He kept his eyes focused downward through the subway gratings in the sidewalk. Now and again he stopped. He bent down and shaded his eyes, trying to decide whether the flash of silver he had seen in the debris 10 feet below was a coin.

title: KISSINGER WANTS TO GIVE UP OFFICE EVEN IF FORD WINS
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, who for eight years has been the main architect of American foreign policy, said in an interview released today that even if President Ford won the November election, he would prefer to leave office.

title: Yorkie Again Judged Best In Dog Show
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., May 16 A Yorkshire terrier, his silken tresses flowing to the wet turf, moved sturdily through the rain today to catch the eye of a bestinshow judge for the second day in a row. He was Ch. Mayfair Loup de Mer, owned by Ann Seranne and Barbara Wolferman of Newton, N.J., and the occasion was the 74th show of the Long Island Kennel Club on the spacious grounds of the New York Institute of Technology.

title: Canadiens Win Cup
description: The Montreal Canadiens won the Stanley Cup in hockey by beating the Philadelphia Flyers, 53, for a fourgame sweep. In the National Basketball Association playoffs, the Phoenix Suns gained the final round by defeating the Golden State Warriors in the seventh game, 9486. Page 35.

title: Mondale Says Panel Seeks F.B.I. Assassination File
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities has asked the Justice Department to turn over a previously undisclosed assassination file of the Federal Bureau of InvestigaLion, according to Senator Walter F. Mondale, Democrat of Minnesota.

title: IRITARY FLOUTED CIVILIAN'S RIGHTS; SENATE UNIT SAYS;
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Military intelligence agents have violated the rights of United States citizens in the agents' investigations of domestic political and protest groups, and in the process have threatened to violate the traditional and legal restraints which govern the use of military forces in the civilian community, the staff of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities has concluded.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your April 27 editorial Needless Flood Victims shows proper concern for the victims of flood but apparently misconceives the current national policy upon which the National Flood Insurance Program (N.F.I.P.) is based.

title: Today's Entries at Belmont
description: Horses listed in order or post position, Letter designates OTB listing

title: Carter's Record as Georgia Governor: Activism and Controversial Programs
description: ATLANTA, May 12Up in Maryland this last week, Jimmy Carter suggested that those who are curious about the kind of President he might be should look at the sort of Governor I was.

title: RHODESIA ATTACKS KISSINGER'S STAND
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) Prime Minister Ian Smith of Rhodesia accused Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger today of uninformed meddling in the affairs of Rhodesia.

title: Personal Finance
description: Stockholders are the owners of corporations and, as such, receive a wealth of information about these companies. They get annual and interim reports, attend annual shareowner meetings, can secure copies of statements filed with the Government and frequently receive research and background reports from brokerage firms.

title: Simplified Art Deco
description: It remains to be seen whether the current revival of Art Deco furniture styles is just a temporary touch of nostagia, or a salute to the permanent validity of those styles.

title: James Coggeshall Jr., 79, Dies; ExHead of First Boston Corp.
description: James Coggeshall Jr., president of the First Boston Corporation from 1947 until his retirement in 1962, died Saturday at his home in Barnstable, Mass. He was 79 years old.

title: 3 Minor Firebombs Set Off in 2 Boroughs
description: Minor firebomb explosions for which militant groups claimed responsibility took place yesterday in Queens and Manhattan.

title: Sadat Weighs Appeal
description: CARIO, May 16 (UPI)President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and his top advisers today discussed an appeal for international action concerning Israel's treatment of Arabs in occupied territories, the Middle East News Agency said.

title: Mr. Grimond's Task
description: It is an unusual politician who has enough perspective on himself to decline the almost unanimous demand by his party that he resume its leadership. But when the call from Britain's hardpressed Liberals came to him last week, Jo Grimond accepted only on a caretaker basisto enable the country's third party to recover from the abrupt departure of Jeremy Thorpe.

title: OWENS URGES CUTS IN DAY CARE RENTS
description: Unless New York City takes immediate steps to reduce the rents it pays real estate developers for day care centers, 20 percent of the day care budget will be going for rent, a State Senator charged yesterday in a report prepared by his staff and a private study group.

title: United MU MeMiltiOnet Teachers demonstrating in front of the State House in Trenton yesterday in support of the passage of a state income tax to fund education
description: TRENTON, May 17State Senate leaders were holding firm today to their plans to put the incometax bill up for a vote Wednesday despite their inability to count on 21 affirmative votes, the minimum needed for passage.

title: A Nemo to Tese Healms
description: DOUGLASTON, N. Y.  As I was about to make out checks for Federal, state and city income taxes, I read a Dear Friend letter from Senator Jesse Helms asking me to join him in a new effort to halt the steady rise of taxes, and saying, What I've done is help organize the National Conservative Political Action Committee.

title: JOHN R. CAULEY
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., May 171 (AP)John R. Cauley, retired chief of The Kansas City Star's Washington bureau, died today at a Kansas City hospital. He was 68 years old.

title: REVERSAL BLOCKS 3 SEXFILM HOUSES
description: The New York City Buildings Department has revoked a permit to convert the de Mille Theater in midtown to three smaller theaters following charges by a mayoral aide that the new theaters would show pornographic films.

title: Sharon Steel Board Approves an Offer For Foremost Stock
description: The Sharon Steel Corporation, a unit of the NVF Company, announced yesterday approval by its directors of a $216 million bid to extend its interest in foremostMcKesson Inc., to 77.9 percent.

title: ATOM PLANT CURBS DEBATED ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, May 17California, already headed for a popular vote on limiting atomic power development, is also considering conventional legislation with the same objective.

title: SAMUEL LOVEMAN,89, A POET, BOOK DEALER
description: Samuel Loveman, a retired book dealer and poet who was a youthfu protg of the writer Ambrose Bierce and a lifelong friend of the poet Hart Crane, died Friday in the Jewish Home, and Hospital for the Aged. He was 89 years old.

title: Judgment for Dolphins
description: Federal Judge Charles R. Richey has sternly ordered the tuna fishing industry to obey a law passed by Congress in 1972 and ignored by both the fishermen and, even more outrageously, by the Department of Commerce ever since. The industry, through its spokesmen, is raising cries of injured innocence, as though the pros and cons of its position had not been weighed for months at thetime the legislation was being argued. It has already persuaded Representative Robert L. Leggett, Democrat of California, who chairs the Merchant Marine and Fisheries subcommittee that has jurisdiction, to introduce emergency legislation to relieve the industry by changing the law.

title: ...or for Politics?
description: There is no good reason to press ahead with a big new naval shipbuilding program before completion of the basic study under way in the National Security Council to determine the role, size and composition of American naval forces through the end of the century. The Soviet shipbuilding program appears to have stabilized and is focusing on modernization instead of increased numbers. An effort to curb the SovietAmerican naval arms race, rather than to step it up again, is what is needed.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (UPI)The Justice Department today urged the Securities and Exchange Commission to call a public hearing to evaluate effects on competition and other issues before approving registration of the new National Securities Clearing Corporation. The corporation would consolidate present functions of the New York and American Stock Exchange clearing corporations and the National Clearing Corporation,

title: Yanks Banter on a Rainy Day
description: CLEVELAND, May 17Elston Howard stared morosely out at the rain steadily falling outside the Yankees hotel.

title: Apartment House Walkout in 3d Week With Owners and Workers Still Apart
description: A meeting between negotiators for the Realty Advisory Board and striking apartment house employees in New York City failed yesterday to break the deadlock as the walkout continued for the 15th day.

title: Flindt's Ballet: Puffed Sleeves to Nudity
description: The Royal Danish Ballet, one of the few firstrate companies In the world, opens tonight at the Metropolitan Opera House. This will be its first visit here since 1965 and the first since Flemming Flindt, still one of its principal dancers, became the company's artistic director 10 years ago at the age of 30.

title: Bangladesh Protest March On Ganges Diversion Ends
description: CALCUTTA, India, May 17 (AP)  A Bangladesh march protesting Indian diversion of water from the Ganges River ended today at a border town with no disturbances, the Bangladesh radio reported.

title: Aerial Tram Ride to Roosevelt Island Is Opened With a Splashon O'Dwyer
description: Aerial tramway service connecting Manhattan with the city's newest urban community on Roosevelt Island was formally inaugurated yesterday with champagne and public expressions of hope for the city's future.

title: Salvador Disavows Accused Gun Plotter
description: The chief of staff of El Salvador's armed forces was left to defend himself in Federal Court in Manhattan yesterday against United States charges of taking part in a plot to sell 10,000 submachine guns to ostensible underworld buyers.

title: Carey Submits CriminalJustice Bills to Legislature
description: ALBANY, May 17Governor Carey submitted a package of criminaljustice bills today, including measures similar to ones he vetoed last year that would have eased some of the state's mandatory drug penalties and restricted plea bargain ing for those charged with certain violent crimes.

title: NEW TRANSIT PACT HELD NEAR, TYING RAISE TO SAVINGS
description: Participants in the negotiations for a revised transit contract said yesterday they were close to an agreement that would tie costofliving increases to productivity savings and limit the size of the transit workers raises in any year.

title: Companies Aid Ford
description: WASHINGTON May 17The political committees set up by corporations to channel campaign contributions to favored candidates have invested more than four times as much money in President Ford as they have in his Republican challenger, Ronald Reagan, in 1976.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: Sex Theater Blocked

title: Leontyne Price Proves She Is Still in Fine Voice
description: Leorrtyne Price is one of Americas national monu ments. Her admirers apparently no more want her to change than they would want to see the Grand Canyon filled in and paved over. So there was general and vociferous rejoicing on Sunday night at Carnegie Hall when the soprano, in splendid form, gave a recital that reminded any who may have forgotten that hers is one of the premiere voices of our period.

title: The New York Times/Frank C. Dougherty Men playing checkers at BelmontRunyon Park, which also has playing fields and basketball courts for the use of Newark residents.
description: NEWARK, May 17  A oneacre scrap of land left over from an abandoned highway project was dedicated today in the predominantly black South Ward as the city's first new urban park under a $6.7 million Open Space program.

title: The Henry James Gang
description: Mary Sillman

title: Messersmith Stops Astros, 32, For First Victory With Braves
description: John Alexgnaer Messersmith, the miliondollar former tree agent, better known as Andy, finally got his act together for the Braves in Houston last night the 30yearold righthander tossed a sek enhitter at the Houston Astros in the first game of a twilightnight doubleheader and picked a 32 victory, his first as a Brave, after four straight losses.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Up at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Yields rose on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: 8 Unions Plan to Respect Any Guild Action at Post
description: Officers of eight newspaper unions met with leaders of the Newspaper Guild yesterday and promised to respect picket lines Zitsthe guild if it carried through its threat to strike The New York Post at 5 P.M Thursdav

title: House Votes to Establish Panel on Helsinki Accords
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP) The House voted final Congressional approval today to a bill setting up a commission tot monitor and report back on Soviet compliance with humanitarian provisions of the Helsinki accords signed last summer.

title: Iran, Announcing Arrests of 4, Says Mullah Was Slain in a Religious Dispute
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 17The four murderers of a revered Islamic leader have been arrested, the Iranian Government has asserted, saying they had been mainly motivated by theological dispute.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme  Court in Brooklyn has upheld a court ruling in Mineola, L.I., that Kiwanis International is a private club and thus can bar membership by women. The policy had been challenged by the Kiwanis Club of Great Neck and by several women who have been allowed to become members of the service organization there. The Appellate Division ruled that as a private organization Kiwanis International was not subject to the 14th and Fifth Amendments. Justice J. Irwin Shapiro dissented.

title: Prince Alexis A. Droutzkoy Of White Russians Is Dead
description: Prince Alexis A. Droutzkoy, a member of the White Russiar, colony in New York, died Saturday in Doctors Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 1020 Fifth Avenue.

title: Concert: Lynn Harrell
description: Lynn Harrell, who served as the Cleveland Orchestra's principal cellist under George Szell while still a teenager. abandoned orchestra work years ago to seek fame and fortune as a soloist in the last couple of seasons, it has become obvious that fame, at least, has come his Nagy. Mr. Harrell, last year's winner of the Avery Fisher Award as an outstanding young artist, played the central part in the season's final concert by the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center Sunday as one of his

title: Tenants Start Fund for Building Strikers
description: Tenants at 60 West 57th Street have collected about $1,000 to give to the workers who are striking their building.

title: Giving Peace a Chance
description: The agreement of India and Pakistan to resume, diplomatic ties and reopen air and rail links marks an encouraging leap along the laborious stepbystep path to peace set forth by their two leaders at Simla four years ago, when the then President (now Prime Minister) Zulfikar All Bhutto of Pakistan observed:

title: Hunter Irked by Steinbrenner's Criticism
description: Catfish Hunter. who becomes visibly upset about as often as baseball players get $3.5 million contracts, is steaming at George Steinbrenner 3d.

title: Open Interest
description: Monday, May 17, 1976

title: Briton Says North Sea Oil Is Below Original Goals
description: North Sea oil production is surpassing forecasts made a year ago but is still nowhere near so substantial as expected originally by this time, Lord Balogh, deputy chairman of the British National Oil Corporation, said in a recent interview in New York.

title: CAREY PRESS AIDE LEAVING THE JOE
description: ALBANY, May 17Governor Carey's press secretary, Robert W. Laird, is leaving the job he has held since the beginning of the Carey administration to become a deputy commissioner in the State Commerce Department, the. Governor's office announced today.

title: Payments Cited by Seibert
description: The J.C. Penney Company, one of the nation's largest retailers, had a sharp recovery in the first quarter, with net income of $29.9 million in the 13 weeks ended May I against $5.1 million in the same 1975 period, Donald V. Seibert, chairman and chief executive officer, said yesterday at the annual meeting. The quarter's net was equal to 47 cents a share, up from 9 cents a share.

title: Cays
description: Once upon a time there was a joke about a basketball team and its coach. The team was an expansion one that won only 15 games during the 197071 season and Its coach would rather tell jokes than talk about his team. Once when the team came close to winning a game, he quipped, close only counts in horseshoes, hand grenades and at the driveinmovies.

title: Dance Group's Benefit Is in Roseland Tonight
description: Alvin Ailey and Walter Terry will be hosts at 9:30 o'clock tonight at Roseland, where leading dancers from Broadway, ballet and modern dance, will teach ballroom dance at a special benefit for the Association of American Dance Companies.

title: WELFARE REFORM RULED ARBITRARY
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (UPI) A Federal judge has ruled that the Government's threeyear effort to reduce weltare errors is arbitrary. capricious [and] an abuse of discretion. and must he halted, it was learned today.

title: People and Business
description: James A. Baker Ed, former Under Secretary of Commerce, asserted yesterday that investment tax incentives are essential if American industry is to be capable of meeting strong competition for world markets.

title: The Government as Bully Is New Issue in Britain
description: LONDON, May 16Harold E. McCafferty received two gentlemanly tax inspectors a few weeks ago at his Black Cap Pub, a sprawling establishment in northwest London known for transvestite floor shows. Their visit, to check the pub's books, is a normal enough occurrence for many British businessmen. But what followed 15 minutes later was not so normal.

title: ExJohnson Aide Gets Probation on Theft Charge
description: SAN ANGELO, Tex., May 17 (AP)Jake Jacobsen, a onetime aide to President Johnson, pleaded no contest today to a theft charge involving an $825,000 loan and was immediately given seven years probation.

title: Jersey School Shock
description: The stage has been set for an extraordinary confrontatation between the New Jersey Supreme Court and that state's Legislature, with potentially farreaching consequences for public school pupils and their teachers. The court has ordered that no tax money be spent on New Jersey public education after July 1 except for such limited purposes as the maintenance of school property. In effect the court has ordered suspension of public education unless the Legislature provides for a system of financing the schools in compliance with the education clause of the constitution.

title: Unhappy Flyers Laud Team That Took Title From Them
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 17As champions for the preceding two seasons the Philadelphia Flyers had not been wellliked outside of their own rink. Because the team was based in the United States, some people in the National Hockey League had considered the Flyers inappropriate custodians of the Stanley Cup, the symbol of supremacy in Canada's national sport.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: CLEVELAND. May 17Ofof tne White Motor Corporation told shareholders today that the company intended to he suit against White Consolidated Industries Inc. because of White Consolidated's termination of a merger agreement earher this month.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, MAY 18, 1976

title: Advertising
description: Fiat, Carl Ally Inc., Anil Gargano and David Altschiller roared together to glory last night at the third annual One Show, the city's most prestigious advertising competition. It was at the Americana Hotel.

title: Latin and Catapults Hailed
description: INDIANAPOLISIt was a day illdesigned to lure Julius Caesar from, his battle tent. But it did not daunt the band of slightly soggy latterday centurions manning a motley array of homemade catapults in a vacant Indiana lot.

title: More Money Is Sought for Aged Poor
description: A plea for new state legislation to enable 400,000 aged, blind and disabled poor in the state to receive a 6.4 percent costofliving increase July under the Supplemental Security Income program was made public yesterday by the Community Council of Greater New York.

title: Memorial Seruires
description: LOSCHTilly. A memorial service for Tilly Losch, who died Christmas Eve., 1975, will he held In the Lady Chapel of Sr Patrick's Cathedral at 4:30 P.M, Tuesday, .a May 18.

title: The proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: May 18, 1976 ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Rafael Fruhbeck Leads Montreal Symphony Debut
description: Rafael Frilhbeck de Burgos, the Spaniard who took charge of the Montreal Symphony last fall, brought the orchestra to Carneige Hall last night for its first New York appearance.

title: Books of The Times
description: I think that here lies the sense of literary creation: to portray ordinary objects as they will be reflectedin the kindly mirrors of future times to find in the objects around us the fragrant tenderness that only posterity will discern and appreciate in the far off times when every trifle of our plain everyday life will become exquisite and festive in its own right. . . . This is Vladimir Nabokov, writing in 1925. when he was more in love with life and literature than with himself: At 26, he was possessed by the magical properties of the .world around him.

title: COMMODORE HELPS SWITCH DELEGATES
description: The 500 delegates and their families from five states who drewthe Commodore Hotel for their stay during the Democratic National Convention at Madison Square Garden will be accommodated in four other hotels, Deputy Mayor Stanley M. Friedman said yesterday.

title: Aide Denies Report That Reagan Paid No 70 Income Tax
description: LOS ANGELES, May 17 (AP) A spokesman for Ronald Reagan denied today a report indicating that the former California Governor paid no Federal income tax in 1970. But he declined to say how much Mr. Reagan did pay.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on Jimmy Carter's tenure as Governor of Georgia that appeared yesterday in The Times, the name of the Speaker of the Georgia House of Representatives was given incorrectly. He is Tom Murphy.

title: Madrid Forbids a Rally Called By Rightists to Honor Franco
description: MADRID, May 17The Government dealt a sharp blow today to the political forces to its right by refusing them permission to hold a major rally in downtown Madrid next Thursday.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: EHRIACIIMAN GUILT UPHELD ON APPEAL IN EOM CASE
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The United States Court of Appeals unanimously affirmed today the conviction of John D. Ehrlichman, once President Nixon's chief domestic affairs adviser, for his role in the 1971 breakin of the office of D. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist by the White House plumbers.

title: Latin and Catapults Hailed
description: INDIANAPOLISIt was a day illdesigned to lure Julius Caesar from his battle tent. But it did not daunt the band of slightly soggy latterday centurions manning a motley array of homemade catapults in a vacant Indiana lot.

title: MARYLAND VOTING IN PRIMARY TODAY
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 17They all gathered this morning at the Hilton Hotel in Baltimore, the wheelhorses of the Democratic machine, to get their marching orders from Gov. Marvin Mandel for tomorrow's Maryland Presidential primary.

title: PRODUCTIONOF STEEL HITS PEAK FOR YEAR
description: For the first time this year the domestic steel industry was able to put to use over 90 percent its available production capability.

title: Arnold Palmer Starts World Flight for Speed Mark
description: DENVER, May 17 (AP)Arnold Palmer, the golfer, and three companions set out in a business jet today to try for a roundtheworld speed record.

title: Television
description: Valerie Masterson plays YumYum in the D'Oyly Carte Opera Company's The Mikado, Ch. 13 at 9 P.M.

title: ERNEST G. PAINE
description: Ernest G. Paine, a former ship news reporter, died Saturday at the City Hospital Center in Elmhurst, Queens. He was 63 years old and lived at 41.42 Elbertson Stret in Elmhurst.

title: City Upheld by Court On Limousine Control
description: Overruling a decision by the State Supreme Court in Queens. th Appellate Division has held that limousines operating in New York City are subject to the regulations or the Taxi and Limousine Commission just as taxicabs are.

title: The Banana Caper (R)
description: If Dustin Hoffman and Robert Redford are looking for another script based on the real thing, how's this? Opening credits show ten thousand submachine guns, ready for action. Cut to Pepper Tree Restaurant in Mount Kisco where underworld buyers hu??e with colonel from Central American republic.

title: REPORT ON ISRAEL REJECTED BY W.H.O.
description: GENEVA, May 17The anmual assembly of the World Health Organization refused today to consider an expert committee's report tat health services in Israelioccupied Arab territories had undergone slow but steady Improvement since 1967

title: SCHULBERG LEAVING ASTODAYPRODUCER
description: Stuart Schulberg, who has been producer of NBC's Today show since 1968, has received a new assignment as an executive producer of NBC news documentaries, and will be succeeded on the twohour morning program within two weeks by Paul Friedman. Mr. Friedman is currently a producer of the NBC Nightly News and had previously been executive producer of WNBCTV's twohour early evening newscast. Newscenter 4.

title: LIBYA SEEKS ROLE IN LEBANON CRISIS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 17Libya, a supporter of the most extreme elements within the Palestinian camp, today openly entered the Lebanese scene in an attempt to mediate between Syria and the various leaders of the Palestine Liberation OrI ganization.

title: Boston Mayor Asks Special Busing Tax
description: BOSTON, May 17Mayor White Kevin H. asked today for a special, onetime property tax to raise $27.5 million to cover the cost of courtordered busing for school desegregation.

title: Janet Guthrie Passes 500 Rookie Test
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 17 (AP)Janet Guthrie raced through the final phase of her rookie test in today's rainshortened practice session for the Indianapolis 500, and she was cleared to make a historic qualification attempt for the 33car field.

title: F.T .C., Citing Rise In Smoking, to Look Into Cigarette Ads
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (UPI)  Reporting that Americana smoked a record 601 billion re 603 billion cigaretttes last year, the Federal Trade Commission announced today an investigation to determine whether the tobacco industry was encouraging smoking with unfair advertising:

title: Corporate Angels Also Lose Their Shirts
description: What does a corporation say when it has lost about a million dollars on a musical that lasted less than a week on Broadway?

title: CORONARY STUDY BACKS HOME CARE
description: Home care is a proper form of treatment for many patients with heart attacks, according to an extensive analysis of a British experiment conducted over a fouryear period in four cities.

title: Montreal Acclaims Cup Team
description: MONTREAL, May 17 (AP) Chants of Go Habs, go! and We're No. 1 rocked downtown sections of Montreal today as thousands of fans turned out during the lunch hour to pay tribute to the Canadiens. the champions of the National Hockey League:

title: PRICES ARE UP 16% IN SOYBEAN MEAL
description: Export demand for soybean meal, especially from Eastern Europe, continued to be a strong influence behind higher prices for the meal on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: Earth Sciences in Accord
description: Earth Sciences Inc. has signed an agreement for the development of its Idaho phospate property with Western CoOperative Fertilizers Ltd. of Calgary, Canada.

title: UtilityReform Bills Gain in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 17The Assembly's Democratic majority today pushed through an electionyear package of bills aimed at reforming the state's utility system and strengthening the reelection campaigns by some of its Democratic freshmen members.

title: Bridge:
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, May 17While Britain, Italy and Sweden took turns in the lead, the United States made a modest improvement in its position at the world team Olympiad here today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, MAY 18, 1976

title: Communist Guerrillas Kill 15 in a Raid in Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 17 (Reuters)About 100 Communist guerrillas raided a training camp for defense volunteers in southern Thailand yesterday, killing 15 people and burning their bodies before pulling back into the jungle with more than 100 captured weapons.

title: Notes on People
description: The Defense Intelligence Agency, the target of much recent Congressional inquiry, got news of a new director yesterday with the appointment of Lieut. Gen. Samuel V. Wilson, a former deputy director of the Central Intelligence Agency. If confirmed, he will succeed Lieut. Gen. Daniel 0. Graham, who resigned last fall when James R. Schlesinger was replaced as Secretary of Defense.

title: Lunch Is Served
description: Soup's on. And there are sandwiches and cocktails, too, for the new lunch service started yesterday on a trial basis by the Metropolitan Tranportation Authority on the 12:05 P.M. train out of Grand Central for New Haven.

title: Cooper Leaving Post As Envoy in East Berlin
description: SOMERSET, Ky., May 17 (AP)John Sherman Cooper said in an interview with a radio station here today that he is resigning as Ambassador to East Germany. Mr. Cooper, who will be 75 years old in August, said he had told President Ford he would resign because he felt it was time for a younger man to take the post.

title: New Move on Rhodesia Is Urged by South Africa
description: CAPE TOWN. May 17South Africa's Foreign Minister appealed today for a fresh diplomatic initiative by nonCommunist nations to avert the blood bath in Rhodesia that he predicted would result if the initiative remained with the insurgents.

title: Mrs. Abzug Attacks Buckley in Entering Race for Senator
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug declared her candidacy for United Skates Senator yesterday, dismissing the man p who holds the job now as Lore; Bucldey.

title: Dow Off by 4.96 to 987.64 For 5th Decline in a Row
description: Takeover bids put some spark yesterday into a stock market that, for the most part, continued to drop because of Wall Street's concern over rising interest rates.

title: Sweptwind, with James Martin up, winning the first race at Belmont Park yesterday
description: All four New Yorkbased 3yearolds who had tried and lost in last Saturday's Preakness at Pimlico were back in their Belmont Park barns yesterday rest

title: JAMES KENNEY, 86, OF FRIARS IS DEAD
description: James E. Kenney, oldest living New York City member of the Friars Club, the fraternal and charitable showbusiness organization, died Friday in the City Hospital Center, at Elmhurst. Queens. His aee was 86.

title: 3 Accused of Using Secret Airco Data
description: Two stockbrokers and a printing company employee were charged yesterday with illegally using secret information about a tender offer by Airco Inc. for stock in the Unitek Corporation.

title: In Memoriam
description: JAVITSBenjamin A. Whose strength, energy and love live on to comfort and inspire undiminished by the third passing year. Whose, vision of bettering our world through decent and courageous living, the Manifesto of Fredom and Ownerism became evermore; Prophetic and hopefully real for Lily, Jack. Joan and Eric, Jocelyn, Jonathan, Eric Jr.:. Andrea, Eloise, Phoebe and Merrily.

title: 3 Injured in Turnpike Crash
description: KEARNY, May 17 (AP)A truck driver was critically burned and two persons were injured today when a gasoline tanker collided with a car during the evening rush hour between Exit 15W and 18W of the New Jersey Turnpike. The truck driver was identified as Gerald Taylor, 32 years old, of Marlboro, and the auto driver as Clarence R. Vander Horn, 39, of Paterson. Two passengers in the car were injured slightly.

title: Democrats Put Moynihan on Platform SubcoMmittee
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Despite protests from some liberals and blacks, Daniel P. Moynihan was elected today to the drafting subcommittee of the Democratic Platform Committee.

title: Giscard Arrives for Talks With Ford
description: WASHINGTON, May 17President Valdry Giscard d'Estaing of France flew here today in the world's newest, fastest lairliner to celebrate America's loldest alliance.

title: F.E.A. Seeks Relief For Small Refiners
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The Federal Energy Administration wants to modify the special relief for certain small refiners that Congress wrote into the 1975 Energy Policy and Conservation Act. It also wants to extend the modified relief to all small refiners.

title: 2 More Die in Ulster Strife
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 17 (AP)  Gunmen shot down a young man in a Londonderry bus tonight and a man died in a hospital of gunshot wounds, raising the death toll from three days of violence'. to 15.

title: Jessie Stanton, 89, Expert On Nursery Schools, Dies
description: Jessie Stanton, a nationally known authority on nursery education, died Sunday at her home at 200 East 66th Street. She was 89 years old.

title: Steinbrenner Sent Gift by Perenchio
description: Still crabby about the Yankees grass, Jerry Perenchio, although spurned in his effort to stage a big fight at Yankee Stadium, nevertheless invited yesterday the Yankees principal owner to the bout at the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale. LI.

title: Arab Games to Be Avoided By U.S. Chess Federation
description: WINDSOR LOCKS, Conn., May 17 (AP)  The United States Chess Federation has decided not to participate in an Arabsponsored Against Israel Chess Olympic.

title: NATAN BRAND SHOWS IMPETUOUS PIANISM
description: Judging from his recital at Alice Tully Hall Sunday night, the Jerusalem  born Natan Brand is a singularly impetuous pianist. His brain seemed teeming with sudden ideas about tempo, pedaling and dynamics. His gestures were florid and unpredictable. Even his bows were impetuousnot once did he face the audience standing still.

title: Knowing the Rules Can Help in Golf
description: Dr. Richard S. Silver is a Park Avenue dentist and an expert on the rules of golf in the United States. He almost makes it painless when he explains what a golfer may

title: Demand Strong, Wood Reports
description: CHICAGO, May 17The net income of, Sears, Roebuck and Company's for the first quarter which ended April 30, was 56 percent higher$85.06 million, or 54 cents a sharecoinpared with a restated $54.35 million, or 34 cents, in the 1975 period.

title: Inquiry on Panama Urged
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP) Representative Philip Crane. Republican of Illinois. announced today that he would file a resolution of inquiry seeking information on the number of Cuban or other foreign troops or advisers in Panama.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Just when you thought nothing more could be done to the Tshirt (they've been studded with rhinestones, edged with delicate lace, appliqued, logoed, painted and emblazoned with everything from political statements to advertisers slogans) along comes a new wrinkle for the garment that has come a long way since its days as the lowly undershirt.

title: Despite Protests, Judge Allows Work on 63d St. Subway Station
description: Federal Judge Marvin E. Frankel ruled yesterday that the arguments of East Side community leaders were insufficient to delay further the construction of a subway station at 63d Street. Work on the station had been delayed for almost a month by the objections of local block associations, which have charged that the Metropolitan Transportation Authority had escalated its plans for the project without informing! them

title: Udall Is Hoping to Turn This Thing Around Today in Michigan
description: DETROIT, May 17  It was two years ago today, by his own reckoning, that Representative Morris K. Udall's quest for the Democratic Presidential nomination began, and he marked the anniversary with a 20hour day of campaigning to keep his candidacy alive beyond tomorrow's Michigan primary.

title: Farmingdale Teachers Approve a Pact With Pay Increases, and Return to Work,
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., May 17Teachers in the Farmingdale School District voted unanimously today to accept a twoyear contract and end their strike, which started May 6.

title: Drills, Ills, Wills Urged As PayLater Matters
description: TRENTON, May 17 (UPI)A trip to the dentist, a hospital stay or a visit with lawyer would be payable by a credit card under a bill passed today in the New Jersey Senate.

title: ]Pound Rallies After Drop Below $1 80 for First Time
description: LONDON, May 17The British pound fell to less than $1.80 today for the first time before staging a slight recovery on the strength of modest purchases of sterling by the Bank of England.

title: Helping New York
description: During the day, infants, toddlers and young children play happily in the sand pit and in the dirt under the trees with their pails and shovels in Abingdon Square Park in Greenwich Village. But at night, dogs are taken into the playground to relieve themselves where the childdren have played during the day.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: Suslov Represents Soviet At East German Congress
description: EAST BERLIN, May 17 (Reuters)East German leaders today welcomed Mikhail A. Suslov, a member of the ruling Politburo, as the chief foreign delegate to their ninth party congress, which begins tomorrow.

title: Yale Awards 2,876 Degrees, a Record
description: NEW HAVEN, May 17Yale University awarded a record 2,876 graduate and undergraduate degrees this morning at commencement exercises that marked a thaw in the often icy town  gown relationship here.

title: The Dance: Stravinsky
description: The nervous, edgy quality of Stravinsky's Symphony in Three Movements found its visual expression in George Balanchines ballet of the same name. Its appearance at the State Theater on Sunday evening was tinged with the manic excitement that only the swift and highly charged New York City Ballet can impart to it.

title: INTEREST RATES CONTINUE CLIMB
description: Shortterm interest rates continued to climb yesterday even though the Federal Reserve moved twice in a way that appeared aimed at slowing the rise. The Federal funds rate the rate of interest at  which one bank charges an other bank for a loanrose as high as 5 percent, and Treasury bill rates climbed sharply. Threemonth bills were sold at an average rate of 5.25 percent, their highest since March 1, and sixmonth bills were auctioned at 5.73 percent, their highest since Dec. 15.

title: Aerial Tram Ride to Roosevelt Island Is Opened With a Splashon O'Dwyer
description: Aerial tramway service connecting Manhattan with the city's newest urban community on Roosevelt Island was formally inaugurated yesterday with champagne and public expressions of hope for the city's future.

title: The Making of an Issue
description: The Democratic majority in the House has proposed a fiveyear economic plan that if incorporated in the 1976 platform would draw clearly the major issueperhaps the only real issuebetween the two parties. That issue is whether the nation's highest economic priority should be full employment or a low rate of inflation.

title: College in Iowa Flourishes on Meditation
description: FAIRFIELD, Iowa  One day last year, someone here at Maharishi International University found a $5 bill and posted it on a bulletin board with a note about where it had been found. It remained posted for several days and everyone presumes that whoever removed the money was the rightful owner.

title: NEW TRANSIT PACT HELD NEAR, TYING RAISE TO SAVINGS
description: Participants in the negotiations for a revised transit contract said yesterday they were close to an agreement that would tie costofliving increases to productivity savings and limit the size of the transit workers raises in any year.

title: Who Killed Free Tuition?
description: Free tuition at the City University was sentenced to death many months ago in the political back rooms. Formal execution has merely been waiting for somebody with the courage to sign the death warrant in public. Governor Carey now appears ready to take the fatal step.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Dr. Kenneth C. Francis, Taught Orthopedic Surgery at N.Y.U.
description: Dr. Kenneth C. Franc:, a clinical professor of orthopedic surgery at New York University Medical Center and a leader in the study of cancer of the bones, died yesterday in ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center after having suffered what apparently was a stroke Sunday afternoon at his home. 336 Engle Street, Tenafly, N.J. I He was 53 years old.

title: Wilkins to See Levi
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Roy Wilkins, executive director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, will meet here tomorrow morning with Attorney General Levi to state the opposition of civil rights groups to a reported proposal that the Government intervene on the side of busing opponents in Boston:

title: Con Ed Views Energy Costs as No. 1 Worry
description: Management of the Consolidated Edison Company of New York, no longer confronted by a maze of financial problems and stockholder antagonism, told shareholders at their annual meeting today at the Felt Forum of Madison Square Garden that the most difficult problem confronting the company now was providing energy at prices it customers could accept as reasonable.

title: Billions for Defense ...
description: Angola, Russia's continuing military buildup, the Ronald Reagan campaign and doubts about dtente all have contributed to the unwillingness of Congress this year to make significant cuts in the Administration's military budget, which now appears likely to exceed $114 billion. But the desire to impress the Soviet Union and Mr. Reagan's supporters cannot justify the virtual abandonment by the nation's legislators of their responsibility to review the country's defense posture.

title: Cheating Scandal's Wide Impact Makes Many Changes in Life at West Point
description: WEST POINT, N. Y. May 17 The lounge in Grant Hall carries pleasant memories for generations of West Point graduates as the site of longawaited visits with family members and girlfriends.

title: MEXICO TIRE PAYERS DENY ACT WAS BRIBE
description: MEXICO CITY, May 17 (AP) Mexican tire company exec ntives say they paid the former manager of the Mexican Chamber of Rubber Industries for his part in obtaining Government approval of price increases for Mexican tares, the Attorney Generai's office said today.

title: Mrs. King Is Back on Cup Team
description: Billie Jean King, Chris Evert and Rosemary Casals were named yesterday to the Federation Cup team by the United States Tennis Assoeintlfri.

title: ISRAELI SOLDIERS KILL ARAB YOUTH
description: KALANDIA, IsraeliOccupied West Bank, May 17An 18yearold Arab student was shot and killed by Israeli soldiers fleeing an angry mob today as riots continued on the West Bank of the Jordan River for the third day.

title: Plaza Buys Murals By Everett Shinn From Old Owners
description: Three murals on the walls of the Oak Bar at the Plaza Hotel by the American painter Everett Shinn have been purchased by the current owners of the Plaza, Western International Hotels, it was announced yesterday. Western Internetional bought the hotel itself from the Sonesta Corporation last year for $25 million. The murals were not part of the sale.

title: Theater: Last Chord Early Gordone Work Has Bolts of Talent
description: Charles Gordone's No Place to Be Somebody, which won the Pulitzer Prize in 1970, was a blistering and sardonic drama about the denizens of a New York bar. Since then little has been heard from this versatile writeractordirector.

title: Trade in Commodities Stays at Record Pace
description: The recordbreaking pace in the trading of commodity futures continued through April, according to the latest report issued by the Futures Industry Association.

title: Cosmos Crush Aztecs; Pele and Chinaglia Star
description: Giorgio Chinaglia, Pele and the rest of the Cosmos displayed some brilliant soccer at Yankee Stadium last night defeating the Los Angeles Aztecs, 60, before 24,292 fans.

title: Cable TV Company Planning To Serve 150,000 More Homes
description: HASBROUCK HEIGHTS, May 17Plans to expand cable television to more than 150,000 homes in Bergen,.Passaic, Essex and Morris Counties were announced here today.

title: DATA STIR DOUBTS ON GULF OIL FUND
description: PITTSBURGH, May 17Documents introduced the United States District Court here tend to cast doubts on assertions by some Gulf Oil Corporation directors that they were kept in the dark about the extensive scope of the company's political slush fund.

title: The New York Times/Nelson Bryant Commercial shad fisherman towing a skiff along Delaware River in Lambertville, N.J.
description: LANIBERTVILLE, N.J. Lunging upstream on a heavily worn footpath along the east bank of the Delaware River, several commercial shad fisherman towed a netladen skiff behind them.

title: School Bands Searching for the Right Notes (Money)
description: The Lakewood (Calif.) High School Band during practice outside school recently. The band marched jointly with the Lakewood, N.J., school band

title: Desert Region in Soviet Central Asia Struck by Quake Stronger Than Italy's,
description: MOSCOW, May 17 (AP)  A severe earthquake struck a deseft area of Soviet Central Asia today and caused serious damfage in a number of places, Soviet officials reported.

description: Two Primaries Today

title: LIBYA SEEKS ROLE IN LEBANON CRISIS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 17Libya, a supporter of the most extreme elements within the Palestinian camp, today openly entered the Lebanese scene in an attempt to mediate between Syria and the various leaders of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: INTELLIGENCE PLAN ADVANCES IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP) Senate leaders reached an agreement today to end a lowkey filibuster against a proposal to create a new intelligence oversight committee.

title: Karsh, Ottawa, 1962 Carrol M. Shanks
description: Carrol M. Shanks, lawyer and insurance executive, died yesterday at his home. He was 77 years old and lived at 575 Park Avenue.

title: 2 Britons Atop Everest
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, May 17 (AP)Two British soldiers reached the 29,028foothigh summit of Mount Everest yesterday, the Nepalese Foreign Ministry announced today. Sgt. J. H. Stokes and Sgt. M. P. Lane, both 30 years old, are members of a joint BritishNepalese army expedition. They suffered frostbite and are being escorted down, according to a message from the expedition leader, Lieut. Col. Tony Streather.

title: A Michigan Primary Jumper
description: DETROIT. May 13For the first time in his short, undramatic but absorbing life, Dewey Burton is crossing the ilne.

title: Harlem Glee Club: A Broad Goal
description: To Dwayne Grayman, the 19yearold first tenor with the Martin Luther King Jr. Male Glee Club in Harlem, the four years spent with the group has meant a professional grounding for a singing career.

title: Amex and Counter Register Declines; Houston Oil Up 4
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market finished lower yesterday in slower trading.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Sex Theater Blocked

title: Trade Bloc Official to Run on Italy's Communist Slate
description: BRUSSELS. May 17  An Italiart member of the policymaking Commission of Western Europe's Common Market has decided to run for a seat in Italy's Parliament next month as an independent on the Communist ticket.

title: Control Board Businessmen Press For a Strong Policy on Wage Freeze
description: The three businessexecutive members of the state's Emergency Financial Control Board reacted to Federal criticism of the city's austerity plan yesterday by pressing for a general policy on labor contracts.

title: Wood Pulp Rise Foreseen

It estimated that by 1980, total world production capacity of papergrade wood plup would be approximately 165 million tons, compared to about 140 million tons in 1975a growth rate of 3.4 percent a year.

title: FANSTETS BOARD BACKS SIEGLER BID
description: Directors of Fansteel Inc., which is seeking to ward off a takeover bid by the H. K. Porter Company, have unanimously voted to recommend acceptance of a higher offer made yesterday by Lear Siegler Inc. The Lear Siegler bid of $22 a share in cash for Fansteel's 54 million shares outstanding, or a total of $33.9 million, tops H. K. Porter's $17ashare offer made May 5. Goldman, Sachs & Company, a New York underwriting firm, will be dealermanager for the Lear Siegler offer, which will allow withdrawal of tendered shares during the first seven days after they are tendered. The offer expires June 1.

title: Law and Order, Stanley Cup Style
description: All around him, his players were guzzling champagne or chugalugging beer or singing or laughing or quietly enjoying the moment of having won the Stanley Cup, but Scotty Bowman, the coach of the Montreal Canadiens, wasn't even smiling. We've still got to look at our game, Scotty Bowman said.. I hope this series doesn't change the thinking. For two years, the Philadelphia Flyers had held the Stanley Cup, held it between clenched fists. But now the Montreal Canadiens had dethroned them. The only thing the Canadiens clenched were their teeth. Traditionally, the Canadians are of a hockey team of skill and speed. Style really. They appear to be skating in Pierre Cardin velvet blazers. Not that there aren't some muscles under the velvet. And a few elbows. But basically, the Canadiens play hockey the way it's supposed to be played. By sweeping the Flyers in four games, they recorded a triumph for law and order, a philosophy that the National Hockey League has occasionally winked at. But realists, such as Scotty Bowman, hope that the Canadiens victory won't erase the embarrassment that the Flyers had created with their brawling intimidation until Roy McMurtry, the Ontario Attorney General, intimidated them by arresting four players on assault charges. That's really law and order. Suddenly the Flyers coach, Fred Sherd, told his players, No mole cheap penalties, let's play hockey. And the Flyers played hockey very well, but the Canadiens it better.

title: South Africa Rescinds Ban On TV Film on Nazi Camps

title: 3 Girls Killed in Fire
description: FRUITLAND, Wash., May 18 (UPI)A small wooden house exploded in flames last night, killing three girls, 4 to 7 years old, who were trapped while their mother watched helplessly from outside. The victims were Theresa Sue Scherpf, 7, and her sisters, Spring Lasandra, 5, and Rikki Lynn, 4. Their mother, Susan Smith, 25, was treated for shock at a hospital. Sheriff's officers said the wood stove used to heat the home apparently touched off fumes from gasoline, kerosine and oil stored there.

title: Futures Prices Fall For Soybean Meal, Ending Long Surge

title: and Lebanon
description: If Israeli authority is under pressure on the West Bank, the leading forces of the Arab world are facing their own challenge in Lebanon, where the combat far graver, bloodier and virtually out of control. On days when single isolated deaths bring grief in Jerusalem, hundreds of casualties are reported routinely from Beirutincluding last weekend the chance killing of Edouard Saab of Le Monde, one of the most respected correspondents in the Middle , East, and the hair'sbreadth escape with but minor injuries of Times correspondent Henry Tanner.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON. May 18 (AP)The Senate Commerce committee approved today, as expected, a compromise bill for partial deregulation of natural gas prices, a move that would raise prices for the fuel to consumers. By a 16toI vote, the committee sent to the floor a measure designed to break the monthslong legislative impasse over natural gas deregulation.

title: Caging the Elephant
description: In trying to approach the reform of the regulatory agencies, Congress in the past has been rather like the group of blind men in the fable, each of whom gave a different description of the elephant. There are Many different committees and subcommittees, each of them concerned about a particular regulatory agency and a particular set of problems. Reform in general means something different to each of them, while reform particular sets alarm bells ringing and awakens a covey of lobbyists.

title: Music: ViolinPiano Duo
