title: Angola's Premier Is Off to Soviet to Improve Ties
description: LUANDA, Angola. May 23The Angolan Prime Minister flew to Moscow today to express his Government's thanks independence support in its struggle for independence and for power and to consolidate already close relations between the two countries.

title: Books of The Times
description: To describe Herbert G. Gutman, professor of history at City College and the Graduate CenterCity University of New York, as a labor historian is too neat classification, for he is also familiar with cultural and social history. He has adeptly combined these disciplines to become one of the country's ranking experts on the development of the work force from preindustrial times to today. Quite apart from scholarship, his reputation rests on his challenges to accepted wisdom about American labor and his findings that one must now view that wisdom with considerable skepticism, if not outright disbelief.

title: INQUIRY BY RDA. INTO ITS INTEGRITY CALLED DEFICIENT
description: WASHINGTON. May 23In a report made public today, panel of distinguished lawyers and scientists sharply criticized the Commissioner of Food and Drugs for serious deficiencies in a report that he made after investigating charges of mismanagement within the drug agency.

title: Big Civilian Toll in Eritrea Is Feared in Ethiopian Peasant Force's Drive Against Rebels
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, May 23  Abraham, a 24yearold teacher, sat in the living room of a friend's home, sipping a can of beer. His brother is fight ing with the Eritrean rebels in the north. His friends are in jail.

title: Amy Alcott Is Victor With Birdie at Final Hole
description: JAMESBURG, N.J., May 23  Amy Alcott sank a fivefoot curling speed putt fox a birdie 3 on the final hole today to win the Ladies Professional Golf Association 76 Classic by a stroke over Jane Blalock.

title: MEDICARE CLIENTS HELD OVERPAYING
description: WASHINGTON, May 23A General Accounting Office report has found that clerical mistakes and the generally poor management of the Medicare program is forcing tens of thousands of elderly New Yorkersand probably millions across the countryto pay more for their health care than they should.

title: South Africans Hoping for an Understanding With U.S,
description: CAPE TOWN, May 23The big story in the newspapers here last week was the bizarre affair in London involving a South African diplomat and an alleged attempt to procure a film of a British politician's sexual activities. However, even the news vendors found space on heir billboard for reports that President Ford had spoken of the possibility of meeting with South Africa's Prime Minister, John Vorster.

title: Vitas Ousts Amava
description: ROME, May 23 (AP)Topseeded Guillermo Vilas of Argentina survived a strong challenge by Victor Amaya of Holland, Mich., today and moved into the second round of the Italian open tennis championships. The scores were 63, 16, 61.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
GISCARD ASSERTS HE'LL STAY IN POST
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (Reuters)  President Valdry Giscard d'Estaing has pledged to remain in office in France until his term expires in 1981 even if the SocialistCommunist opposition alliance wins the parliamentary election two years from now.

title: Guards Bitter After Prison Riot
description: COMSTOCK, N. Y., May 21Correction officers at Great Meadow Correctional Institution, the huge maximum security prison here where some 150 inmates rioted last Monday, charged yesterday that the administration knew the disturbance was coming but refused to add guards because of possible overtime expense.

title: Reagan, Now Trailing Ford, Renews FirstBallot Hopes in Tour of Oregon
description: CORVALLIS, Ore., May 23Ronald Reagan barnstormed across Oregon today on his final campaign swing before Tuesday's Republican Presidential primary elections here and in five other states.

Reiterain; 3, Mr. and Mrs. Richard Oster's Laborador Retriever, Ch. Ajoco's Canon Yankee; 4, J. 1, and Celei. Gavin's and Ted Eldredge's Irish Setter, Ch Tirvelda Hunter's Moon.

title: Egyptians Again Accuse Syria; Arab Aides Mediate in Feud,
description: CAIRO. May 23The Foreign Ministers of Saudi Arabia and Kuwait arrived in Cairo today to mediate in the feud between Egypt and Syria and Cairo's newspapers published charges of a Syrirn plot to nartition lebanon between Moslems and Christians.

title: CHINA HESITATING ON FOREIGN TRADE
description: HONG KONG, May 23A recent slowdown in China's imports and exports is causing growing concern among some businessmen that China's current antirightist political campaign may be adversely affecting its foreign trade following several years of rapid expansion.

title: 2 Undercover Agents Involved Cunningham
description: One June evening in 1974, two secret police agents began negotiations to buy a Bronx discotheque, which they planned to use as a base for spying on the Mafia. But, instead of being solely an undercover mission against organized crime, that investigation put lawenforcement officials on the trail of possible major corruption scandals in the courts and at the State Liauor Authority. The agents, a city detective and an exconvict who became

title: CARTER SETBACKS IN PRIMARIES HURT DELEGATE REST
description: Jimmy Carter's poor showings in the Michigan and Maryland primaries last week cost him support over the weekend as delegates to the Democratic (National Convention were selected in four states.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Sacco's Brother, 92, Dies
description: MILAN, Italy, May 23 (UPI) Sabino Sacco, whose younger brother, Nicola, was executed 49 years ago in the Sacco and Vanzetti murder case, has died at the age of 92. The newly formed International Committee for the Rehabilitation of Sacco and Vanzetti said the elder Sacco died May 12 in San Severn, a southern Italian town where he lived with his children, Dante and Libera.

title: 3d World Improving Trade Position
description: The overseas deficit of the nonoilproducing developing countries will be less than was expected earlier this year and substantially less than last year's record shortfall, according to economists at the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company.

title: Martha Gorowitz Wed to R. Scot Perlin
description: Martha L. Gorowitz, a cashcompensation officer in the human resources department of the Chase Manhattan Bank N.A., was married at noon yesterday to R. Scot Perlin. He is with the Australia/New Zealand/South Pacific desk in the Asia division of the Bankers Trust Company.

title: The Most Helpful and Ignored Award
description: By this time you'll have endured the Oscars, secretly applauded the Tonys tor having presented us with people who seemed living and breathing, human beings, and made note of the prizes bestowed by the Pulitzer people and the New York Critics Circle. Awardgiving time for the season is very nearly over, and you may well be heartily sick of the whole presumably benevolent business. After all most of the choices made are the obvious choices and when they're not so obviousperhaps even shockers they're apt to leave you churlish. So wash your hands of the newsprint that tells you who won, turn your television set to commercials that aren't sandwiched between laurel leaves, and breathe a sigh of relief that it's got to be another year before it all starts up again.

title: Russians Step Up Oil Exports to West
description: The Soviet Union taking advantage of high world prices for petroleum, shipped a record volume of crude oil to the West last year while holding town the growth of both domestic consumption and exports to its East European allies.

title: Hudson Bridge Construction to Start in June, a Year Behind Plan
description: ALBANY, May 22  Construction of a new bridge across the Hudson River alongside the present NewburghBeacon Bridge will start next month, a year behind schedule. Since test borings began four years ago, the estimated cost of the new bridge has almost doubled, from $55 million to $107 million, with the possibility that the final cost will be even higher, according to the stlite Department of Transportation.

title: Dins Defeats Orantes
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, May 23 (UPT)Eddie Dins of Miami Beach outlasted favored Manuel Orantes of Spain today and captured the singles title in the 70th German tennis championships, 6.4, 46, 61, 26, 61.

title: Nastase Defeats Ashe in 5
description: KEAUHOUKONA, Hawaii, May 23Arthur Ashe who never loses his composure during a match, might have lost it today had he heard Ilie Nastase utter a racial epithet during the second set of their winner  take  all $100,000, final of the Worlds Championship Tennis Avis Challenge Cup.

title: San Quentin Trial: Inmates vs. Guards
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., May 23 One of the defendants in the San Quentin Six murder trial wept on the wtiness stand in Marin County Superior Court here last week as he described the events of Aug. 21, 1971.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: We have noted many times over the years that thoughts about food go in cycles. To cite a recent indication are two letters from readers asking for information about what is known as mother of vinegar.

title: NO INCREASE FOUND IN 1974 CRIME RATE
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) A Federal poll suggests that violent crime has not increased as much as many Americans may have feared.

title: Tempest Captures Edlu Trophy Sail
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., May 23The largest boat in the fleet was also the swiftest in Larchmont Yacht Club's 21st annual distance race on Long Island Sound as Eric Ridder's SOfoot Tempest claimed all three major trophies awarded today.

title: Protecting Privacy
description: The House Judiciary Committee will begin consideration tomorrow of a measure called Bill of Rights Procedures Act, which is designed to limit and regulate governmental and commercial intrusions into the commonplace transactions of modern American life. aims at protecting privacy with respect to hank, telephone and credit records, mail covers, telephone service monitoring and nonverbal communications.

title: Municipal Hospitals Plan Strike Talks With Union Today
description: The threat of a strike at the 18 municipal hospitals was temporarily eased as a meeting was set up for today involving the Health and Hospitals Corporation, a hospital union and New York City officials to discuss a possible compromise in the planned layoffs of 3,200 workers.

title: VALDHEIM TRAVELS TO SYRIA TOMORROW
description: UNITED NATIONS N.Y. May 23 (AP)United Nations sources said today that Secretary General Kurt Waldheim would fly to Damascus on Tuesday to persuade Syria to renew the mandate of the United Nations buffer force on the Golan Heights.

title: New Navy Ship Criticized As a Big Floating Lemon
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) A landing helicopter assault ship that the Navy plans to commission next weekend is the biggest floating lemon that the Navy has accepted in a very long time, Representative Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today.

title: ALBERT R. GOMMI
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 23Albert R. Gomm, president of Gommi Associates Inc. of New York, commercial photographers, died yesterday while offing at the Burning Tree Golf Club in Greenwich. He was 57 years old and lived at 33 Nindmill Road.

title: Liberal Group Still for Udall
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (UPI) Americans for Democratic Action today unanimously reaffirmed its March 20 endorsement of Representative Morris K. Udall of Arizona for the Democratic Presidential nomination. Meeting in convention, the liberal group, which heard a banquet speech from Mr. Udall last night, adopted a new resolution praising Mr. Udall's legislative record and his continuing dedication to the principles of democracy and social Justice upon which this organization was established.

title: College Rowing
description: AT SYRACUSE

title: JESSE S. WEST
description: Jesse Stevenson West, a publichealth nurse who wrote the textbook Aftercare of Poliomyelitis, died Friday of cancer at the Valley Verde Convalescent Home in Santa Barbara. Calif. She was 84 years old and lived in Santa Barbara.

title: Strong Quake Is Reported In Southern Pacific Area
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (Reuters)  A strong quake shook an area of the Southern Pacific Ocean today, the United States Geological Survey reported here. Estimates puta on or near the island of New Britain, a spokesman said.

title: Label It Made in New York State
description: The State Department of Commerce is initiating Made in New York State labeling campaign in hope increasing sales of such goods within the state.

title: Celtics Beat Suns In Series Opener
description: BOSTON, May 23Maybe the National Basketball Association season is too long. Maybe the Phoenix Suns, a wildcard team that finished 17 games out of first place during the regular season, don't belong in the championship series. Maybe the Boston Celics miss a healthy John Havlicek. Although he played 41 minutes today with his ailing left foot.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, said private industry did not have the capital to finance the construction of the proposed floating nuclear plant off Little Egg Harbor Township. He also said that he believed Federal subsidies would not be authorized. Mr. Nader was interviewed in Lakewood, where he gave the commencement address to graduating students of Georgian Court College. In the address, he suggested solar power as an alternative to nuclear energy and called it the great and future source of energy in the world.

title: Patricia A. Mendell Bride of R. C. Singer
description: Patricia Anne Mendell, a pediatric social worker at St. Vincent's Medical Center of Richmond on Staten Island, was married yesterday afternoon to Richard Clark Singer, a New York lawyer. Municipal Court Judge George M. Dominguez of Butler, N.J., performed the ceremony at the Rockaway River Country Club in Denville. N.J.

title: Miss Quinlan Taken Off Respirator Temporarily
description: Karen Anne Quinlan, who has been in a coma for 13 months, has been breathing without the aid of a mechanical respirator for more than four days at St. Clare's Hospital in Denville, N.J., and has been moved from the intensivecare unit to a private room, according to persons close to the case.

title: JOSEPH P. DUNN, 64, JERSEY BANK HEAD
description: Joseph P. Dunn, president and chairman of the Security National Bank of New Jersey since 1966. died Saturday at St. Michael's Hospital in Newark. He was 64 years old and lived at 90 Oldchester Road, Essex Fells, N. J.

title: Rep. Hays Defers Trip, Denies Aide's Accusation
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Representative Wayne L. Hays. Democrat of Ohio, has deferred his trip to London where he was to join a Congressional delegalion receiving a copy of Magna Carta, to discuss with his lawyers here tomorrow a published report charging that a woman on his committee is paid $14, 000 in public money to be his mistress.

title: European Socialists and Latins Hold a Solidarity Conference
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, May 23Western Europe's Social Democrats, led by Willy Brandt of West Germany and Mario Soares of Portugal, met here today in a solidarity conference with the beleagured, and in some cases exiled, leaders of Latin America's democratic parties.

title: Baeza Is Reported Ill at Home
description: Two questions of importance were answered yesterday at Belmont Park: Mr. Harold P. Whitmore's Sir Lister was the best in the $57,700 Peter Pan and Braulio Baeza, mysteriously absent from Saturday's program, was safe at his Garden City, L. I., home.

title: Accounts
description: Gillette Safety Razor and Toiletry Divisions to Uni World Group Inc. for minority advertising campaigns.

title: Amin to Talk With Sadat
description: CAIRO, May 23 (UPI)President Idi Amin of Uganda will pay a threeday visit to Egypt starting Thursday, the Middle East News Agency said today. It said Mr. Amin would hold talks with President Anwar eSadat In Alexandria to discuss international problems in general and African problems in particular.

title: News Summary and Index
description: After they exploded grenades on the plane setting it afire, three of the six hijackers who seized the Philippines Air Lines jet Friday were killed yesterday with 10 of their 86 hostages when a gun battle broke out between the hijackers and troops in Zamboanga. 530 miles south of Manila, where the plane's captors had forced it to land. Twentytwo other passengers were wounded, and 54 escaped through emergency exits. Seventeen other hostages had previously been released by the hijackers. The three remaining hijackers were captured, but were seriously wounded. They had identified themselves as members of a Moslem separatist movement. [Page 1, Columns 141

title: TREATMENT LAGS FOR HYPERTENSION
description: The first report on more than one million persons examined for high blood pressure in a nationwide program indicates that, while there has been considerable improvement in the detection and treatment of this potentially fatal disorder, it is still an undetected or uncontrolled disease in more than half of those who have it.

title: Police Kill 6 in Thai Raid
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 23 (AP)  Thai security forces killed six persons they identified as Communist rebels and arrested eight others in two southern provinces, the police said today. A large amount of medical supplies and ammunition were found yesterday in the raids in Nakorn Srithammarat province, 365 miles south of Bangkok, according to police.

title: Duran Retains Title
description: Roberto Duran of Panama retained the World Boxing Association lightweight title yesterday by knocking out Lou Bizzarro in the 14th round at Erie, Pa. Page 41.

title: Tenafly Plan to Buy Tract From Centex Hits a Snag
description: TENAFLY, May 23  Th Plans of this borough to acquire a 274acre tract from a Texas developer have run into a new snag, Mayor John G. Manos learned today.

title: Music: Carmina Sung
description: Carl Orff's Carmina Burana has become something of an annual rite of spring with many choral groups. This 40yearold scenic cantata, based on lusty medieval poems celebrating love and the rebirth of nature, seems especially appropriate for this time of year, and so it was not surprising that the Collegiate Chorale chose the work as its major offering Saturday night in Carnegie Hall.

title: Unbowed Class of 26 Revisits Vassar
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., May 23Three young girls in faded jeans sitting on the dormitory steps might only vaguely know who Rudy Vallee was, but Frances Pruyn remembers. He serenaded her, from the grass below Room 812, in the North Tower of Vassar, In the spring of 1924.

title: In Marathon Trials
description: All three qualify for the Olympic team.

title: FISCAL SQUEEZE IN DANCE FEARED
description: The Association of American Dance Companies, a national organization founded with Federal aid to serve the needs of the country's dance companies, closed its 10th annual conference yesterday amid warnings that the past decade of expansion in the dance field would be followed by a financial squeeze.

title: Synagogue Group Marks Birthday and Bicentennial
description: NEWPORT, R.I., May 23With gratitude, fanfare and a tinge of sadness, the Synagogue Council of America, the coordinating organization of the three branches of Judaism, celebrated yesterday the American Bicentennial and its own 50th anniversary.

title: Israelis Deride Proposal
description: TEL AVIV, May 23Israelis today derided France's offer to send soldiers to Lebanon to separate the combatants in the civil war.

title: Issue and Debate
description: When Muhammad Ali was declared the winner in his wight with Jimmy Young recently, two of the oldest controversies in sports were re vived what's the right way to determine the winner of a fight, and why shouldn't everyoody know who's ahead while the fight is still on?

title: Personal Finance
description: I'm 53 years old with a 4 percent G.I. mortgage on my home about to be paid off in another year. Should or shouldn't I take out a new mortgage when the old one expires?

title: Ali Unhurt as Stage Collapses; Weighs 220 for Tonight's Bout
description: MUNICH, West Germany, May 23  Muhammad Ali weighed in today at the lightest since regaining the world heavyweight championship, stepped off the scales, and moments later the stage collapsed at the Circus KroneBau, tumbling the champion and about 25 other persons through a hole in the wooden floor.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Udall, Taking a Calculated Risk, Is Stumping for Votes in Carter Country
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 23For the last three days, Representative Morris K. Udall has been neglecting such delegaterich states as Ohio and New Jersey to campaign here and in two other Southern states he knows he cannot do well in, making a skimpy, ad ho??? effort in pursuit of what even he calls calculated risk!

title: Playboy Bunnies Missing At Brown's FundRaiser
description: LOS ANGELES, May 23Flamingos and peacocks and other elegant birds strutted about the grounds of Hugh Hefner's 85 million California estate, but there wasn't a Bunny in sight.

title: LeFlore Extends Batting Streak to 25 Games
description: Ron LeFiore of the Detroit Tigers was not content simply to extend his hitting streak to 25 games yesterday. The fleet outfielder, who was discovered by the Tigers while he was serving a third term in prison in 1973, banged out four hits and led the Tigers to a 106 victory over the Orioles at Baltimore.

title: CARTER SETBACKS IN PRIMARIES HURT DELEGATE GUEST
description: Jimmy Carter's poor showings in the Michigan and Maryland primaries last week cost I him support over the weekend as delegates to the Democratic National Convention were selected in four states.

title: West Point Acknowledges Cheating Is Widespread
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., May 23 The Superintendent of the United States Military Academy, Lieut. Gen. Sidney Berry acknowledged today that cheating at West Point was more widespread than previously indicated.

title: INQUIRY BY F.D.A. INTO ITS INTEGRITY CUED DEFICIENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 23In a report made public today, a panel of distinguished lawyers and scientists sharply criticized the Commissioner of Food and Drugs for serious deficiencies in a report that he made after investigating charges of mismanagement within the drug agency.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The bankruptcy option which you denounce in a recent editorial is not a myth created by glib politicians but a new, legitimate and sound alternative made possible by a law signed by President Ford on April 8. This means that we now have a choice of optionsand these options determine who gets what first.

title: Dr. Bernard A. Goodman Dies; I Board Chairman of ExLax Inc,
description: Dr. Bernard A. Goodman, a former New York City surgeon and chairman of the board of ExLax Inc., and the father of State Senator Roy M. Goodman, RepublicanLiberal of Manhattan, died yesterday at Doctors Hospital after a long illness. He was 77 years old and lived at 955 Fifth Avenue.

title: Poor Nations Advised Their Gains Must Have Others Backing
description: CAMBRIDGE. Mass., May 23'You can't always get what you want, the theme of a Rolling Stones hit song a few years ago, or an academic version of it, is the hardhearted message that some of the world's most distinguished international economists seem to he sending rho lessdeveloped countries.

title: A Marxist Guyana Bucks Trend in South America
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana. May 19  Prime Minister Forbes Burnham, the man the Central Intelligence Agency helped put in power 12 years ago to avert a Communist takeover, has established the only Marxist government in South America.

title: Shorter Is Winner
description: EUGENE, Ore., May 23 (AP)  Frank Shorter, who won the marathon at Munich four years ago, will return to the Olympic Games this year.

title: Tully Staff Takes to Stage for Display Of Musicianship for Admiring Colleagues
description: Anybody expecting a bumbling sort of home entertainment hour at the Mostly Ushers concert at Alice Tully Hall must have been happily surprised by the mostly expert performances Saturday afternoon.

title: Solomon's Mine Believed Found
description: King Solomon's legendary lost gold mine, the biblical Ophir that yielded much of the fabulous wealth of the Kingdom of Israel nearly 3,000 years ago, may have been found in Saudi Arabia.

description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., May 23Three young girls in faded jeans sitting on the dormitory steps might only vaguely know who Rudy Vallee was, but Frances Pruyn remembers. He serenaded her, from the grass below Room 312, in the North Tower of Vassar, in the spring of 1924.

title: Gains Make Brown 3rd Choice Of Democrats in Gallup Survey
description: Recent gains by Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California have made him the third choice among Democratic voters for the Presidential nomination, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: Realty Loans Sink Small Coast Bank
description: WASHINGTON. May 23The Federal Deposit Insurance Cor poration announced yesterday the failure of the $63 million First State Bank of Northern California, San Leandro, and its asstunpi ion by Lloyds Bank California.

title: NICOLAI GEDDA SINGS WITH CHORAL GROUP
description: Nicolal Gedda Joined the Russian Choral Society for an afternoon of mostly Russian music yesterday at Carnegie Hall. Mr. Gedda, of course, is Swedish, not Russian, but his linguistic talents are such that he long ego established himself as a superior exponent of the Italian, French and Russian vocal literature.

title: Art Posters Drawing In Profits
description: Art postersonce viewed as decorations for college dorms or Park Avenue nurseries  have come of age commercially. Now they dramatize the walls of corporate headquarters, banks, hospitals and Federal agencies. That evolution during the art boom of the 1960's was brought about in part by Poster Originals Ltd., which first conceived of art posters as one big business package. Poster Originals not only pioneered by publishing posters designed by young American artists but also framed and sold them at a profit.

title: Long Day's Journey to Defeat
description: While fly rods were being rigged and waders pulled on, two Canada geese on a pool nearby gabbled discordantly. At the river, John I. Day of the Thoroughbred Racing Association walked downstream; Phil Dunn, assistant general manager of the sports complex rising on the Hackensack wastelands, went up, and their companion took the beat in between, starting at a footbridge. Crossing the bridge he saw the dark shape of a trout fleeing upstream. A large man with whiskers and a wide brimmed hat was drifting a wet fly downstream. There are monsters in here, he said. I'd be afraid to fall in the water. The words were music a to a newcomer, but minutes later the stranger snatched a fiveinch brook trout clear up onto the bridge without benefit of landing net. This was how he defended himself against monsters?

title: Solomon's Mine Believed Found
description: King Solomon's legendary lost gold mine, the biblical Ophir that yielded much of the fabulous wealth of the Kingdom of Israel nearly 3,000 years ago, may have been found in Saudi Arabia.

title: Rockefeller's Acclaim at Republican Dinner in Queens Shows He Is Still the Life of the Party in New York
description: Vice President Rockefeller spent less than an hour at the recent Queens Republican dinner, but he managed to disrupt it completely.

title: EXGOV. BROWNING OF TENNESSEE, 86
description: HUNTINGDON, Tenn., Alayi 23 (UPI)Former Gov. Gordon Browning died today at Carroll County General Hospital. He was 86 years old.

title: Miss Quinlan Taken Off Respirator Temporarily
description: Karen Anne Quinlan, who hat been in a coma for 13 months. has been breathing without the aid of a mechanical respirator for more than four days at St Clare's Hospital in Denville, N.J., and has been moved from the intensivecare unit to a private room, according to persons close to the case.

title: Ford's Primary Losses Divide White House Staff as Factions Trade Charges of Laxity
description: WASHINGTON. May 22Under the pressures of President Ford's up and down and up political fortunes, cracks of dissension have appeared among the White House staff.

title: Soviet MilitaryParty Balance Appears Unchanged
description: MOSCOW, May 23  The complex relationship between the Communist Party and the Sweet armed forceshistorically one of party control, but also of heavy military considerations in the making of party policyappears to have remained essentially unchanged by the recent naming of a civilian as Minister of Defense and the elevation of the Communist Party chief Leonid I Brezhnev to the rank of marshal.

title: Soviet Hits Spanish Pact
description: MOSCOW, May 23 (UPI)The Soviet Union today attacked a new American pact that allows the United States to retain key military bases in Spain. The bases, said an article in Pravda, the Communist Party newspaper, are regarded as a link between NATO and Spain. Madrid is seeking membership in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, which it was denied under Franco.

title: DE SAPIO TO FACE CHARGES TODAY
description: Carmine G. De Sapio, once the most powerful political party leader in New York, now elderly, ill and the latest big name to become the target of charges; in Maurice H. Nadjari's waning weeks as special prosecutor,1 will surrender at the Nadjari office at 10 A.M. today.

title: ManyNamed Lamp Is Casting Its Spell On Many Designers
description: It's called the tent. Or the triangle. Sometimes it's the V, sometimes the wide V. Whatever it's called, it's a sturdy but delicate looking floor lamp that is especially good for reading.

title: In Memoriam
description: HOLLANDERPaul. Remembortme your birthday with love and treasured memories.

title: Medicare Drops Madison Ave. Hospital
description: Madison Avenue Hospital, a 117bed profitmaking facility, has been informed that because of lifethreatening fire and health violations, it is no longer eligible to receive Medicare funds. The cutoff of funds, effective June 8, is expected to result in the closing of the hospital, which has been targeted for closure by city and state officials for years.

title: FRENCH IN DISPUTE ON LEBANON ROLE
description: PARIS, May 23President Valery Giscard d'Estaing's tentative proposal to send French troops to Lebanon began to assume the proportions of national political dispute today, as prominent officials of the leftist opposition assailed the President's initiative.

title: Canada Introducing Arts Fete in Kingston
description: KINGSTON, Ontario  This historic lakeside city, once Canada's capital, will become a showcase for Canadian talent in a full range of the arts this summer.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Jewish Theological Seminary of Americathe major educational Institution of Conservative Judaismyesterday dedicated its first residence hall for nonrabbinical students, a fivestory building at 415 West 120th Street. The building is tangible evidence of the 90yearold institution's decision to remain on Morningside Heights, its home for the last 75 years, said Dr. Gerson D. Cohen, the seminary's chancellor.

title: Spical to The New York Times
description: ENGLEWOOD, May 22On the night of March 17, a car carrying five teenagers from this Bergen County town ran off the road and crashed into a tree. Two of the youths were killed and two others seriously injured.

title: Spiro Agnew and the Jews
description: WASHINGTON  The antiIsrael lobby has a new champion my old friend and former colleague, novelist Spiro T. Agnew. Up to now, the antiIsrael lobby was made up of these dissimilar elements:

title: T.A. Accuses the City on Bus Franchises
description: The Transit Authority charged yesterday that the city's Bureau of Franchises repeatedly awarded the best bus routes to private bus companies, and it called on Mayor Beame to investigate.
