description: Members of the Brooklyn Congressional delegation made a new appeal to the Navy yesterday to reconsider its planned move of 724 civilian jobs and a $12 million annual payroll out of New York City to the Chicago area.

title: Miss Kahn Lifts 'Won Ton Ton'
description: "Won Ton Ton, the Dog That Saved Hollywood" is the name of the movie that opened yesterday at the Sutton Theater. What saves the movie, a jumble of good jokes and bad, sloppiness, chaos and apparently any old thing that came to hand, is Madeline Kahn.Madeline Kahn has eyes like sad soup, a jaw that is both long and vulnerable, and hair like unexplored jungle. Her voice is high and tinny, as though a midget were making a speech inside a beer can.All these things are part of her comic equipment, but they aren't what make her a genuine comedian. What she hasas W. C. Fields and Buster Keaton and Charlie Chaplin hadis a kind of unwavering purpose at right angles to reality, a concentration that she bears, Magoolike, through all kinds of unreasonable events. What is funny is not so much her visible actions as her visible mind.The movie itself is an untidy, sometimes pleasant mess, a string of sight and situation gags strung along a minimal plot about filmmaking in Hollywood of the 1920's. The colors and dcor look like "Day of the Locust," the jokes about moviemaking on a shoestring look like "Hearts of the West."The gimmick is a trained German shepherd named Won Ton Ton (Rin Tin Tin, believe it or not, is the reference) who makes a fortune and then fades from sight. He is first seen letting himself out of the dog pound, after locking the keepers in his own cage. He meets Estie DelRuth (Madeline Kahn), an aspiring starlet, when both are hiding behind some garbage cans. (Never mind the details: It is simply part of a masterly bad day that she begins by walking out of her apartment dragging a whole tablecloth behind her, and continues by causing a monumental chain-collision when she tries to thumb a ride.)Potchuk, an equally aspiring director who has impractical ideas of making films about a giant shark, a girl possessed by devils and a city destroyed by an earthquake joins up. A teetery and lecherous film-studio chief (Art Carney), who sits at his desk in boxer shorts in order to speed up his interviews with young starlets, spots the dog.Won Ton Ton's success is phenomenal; he makes both Estie and her director rich. After a while the bubble bursts, the trio is fired, and Won Ton Ton is given away to a traveling dog show. Finally Estie, whose attempts to be an actress are nothing but a comic failure, is spotted as a comedian and makes a second fortune.There are a number of cheerful things along the way. A torrid romance between Eskimos is being filmedthe director screams at the protagonists to stop sweating.Bruce Dern is adequate as the young director, but his effectiveness depends on his lines and for long stretches he doesn't get much to contribute. Art Carney's horrendous studio president is funny for a while, but eventually becomes nothing but roaring.Then there is Miss Kahn. She has some funny things to do and say, but it is in her small moments of comic embroidery that her real talent shows. Some gawky, mindless calisthentics while Mr. Dern, fired, is trying to figure out where they'll go next. A lovely bit where she slumps and rocks in front of a distorting mirror, turning alternately square and oblong.The dog is all right. But Miss Kahn upstages him. It is because of her that "Won Ton Ton" is something more than a dog.The movie is rated PG. It is quite harmless. Possibly the rating is based on frequent references to sex as the way to get ahead in Hollywood.

title: It's a Long Day's Work To Accuse 3 Defendants
description: It was all neat and orderly and by prearrangement, until the three accused men reached the First Precinct station on Ericsson Place just before noon yesterday.

title: 2 on School Board Who Voted To Ban Books Win in Levittown
description: Voters in the Island Trees school district in Levittown, L.I., reelected yesterday by narrow margins two school board members who had voted to remove 11 books from the junior and senior high school libraries because they were deemed objectionable. Their opponents objected to the removal of the books.

title: Turkey Expanding Moslem Ties
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 16 While the foreign ministers of 42 Islamic countries were, meeting here in early May and hailing Moslem solidarity, a Turkish journalist looked up from her notes and snapped, It is the American Congress that has brought us to this point. The meeting symbolized an important, change in Turkish foreign policy. After many years of unswerving identification with the West, Ankara is actively seeking broader ties with its Moslem neighbors to the south and east.

title: Convention Phones Installed Amid Elephants and Hay
description: Shortly before the 1:30 performance of the circus in Madison Square Square Garden yesterday afternoon, elephants were munching peanuts, horses were stomping their hoofs in hay and, nearby, a New York Telephone Company crew was installing a telephone system (large enough to serve the entire town of Southampton, LI.

J., May 26Jimmy Carter's selfassurance is expressed in softer tones these days, but it is still there: It I am elected Presidentand I think there's a good likelihood that will come to pass. Or sometimes: If I am elected Presidentand I Intend to be.  Audiences do not miss the determination in the quiet voice.

From the start, it's good to realize you are going to lose tar News more than you win. So have a of good time at the Dogs shows. Mix with other exhibitors. The Minneapolis fancier can speak with authority. Breeder or owner of 76 champions, she has been active in the sport for nearly three decades, first with Doberman pinschers, then with poodles.

description: Somehow it seemed quite appropriate: C. Z. Guest, long one of the monarchs of New York society, sitting on a peacock throne (even though it was only made of bamboo), surrounded by flowers and plants and occasionally signing her name in large, regal strokes.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Defense Department officials in Washington disclosed that Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld was interceded on behalf of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation in an attempt to overcome Japanese reluctance to purchase $250 million worth of patrol aircraft directly from the company. The sale has been jeopardized by disclosure of the company's payment of bribes and commissions in Japan. Mr. Rumsfeld has proposed an arrangement under which his department would become the contracting agent. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Mother, Jugs, Speed, a Comedy About Ambulances
People and Business
description: Elliot L. Richardson, Secretary of Commerce, was reported yesterday to have warned Japanese officials that President Ford would carry through his plans for imposing import quotas on specialty steel products.

title: New Questions in Quinlan Case
description: Karen Anne Quinlan's ability to survive without the aid of a mechanical respirator has raised in a dramatic way a set of ethical problems that touch on the care of many other patients. The problems in Miss Quinlan's case apparently were unforeseen by the New Jersey Supreme Court almost two months ago. In what has been called a landmark case, the court drew on the right to privacy to define new guidelines to govern the patientdoctor relationship in cases where the patient's recovery is regarded as hopeless.

title: Dorothy Schiff Tells of Relationship With Roosevelt
description: Dorothy Schiff, editor in chief and publisher of The New York Post, says in a new biography that she had a personal relationship with President Franklin Delano Roosevelt that lasted from 1936 to 1943.

title: Inmate Tells State Inquiry That Guards Sold Drugs and Liquor to the Prisoners
description: TRENTON, May 26A former inmate at Trenton State Prison told members of the State Commission of Investigation today that guards at the prison often brought in drugs, liquor and other contraband, which they sold to inmates.

title: Waldheim Sees Assad in Syria On Issue of Golan Peace Force

description: NEWARK, May 26 (UP1)An unemployed Brooklyn junk dealer was in custody today, after he allegedly tried to sell a stolen painting valued at $125,000 to an art dealer who turned out to he an undercover detective. Be was charged with Possession of stolen property.

Moments later, Sandra Jordan stepped to the far end of the bar beside Marty Berns's piano, and sang Feelings, with some applause from diners and sippers at the bar and cocktail tables. The hostess will be singing Tuesday through Saturday, othcr duties permitting.

description: ALBANY, May 26New York State has one of the worst records in the nation for neglecting the overassessment and underassessment of commercial and residential property, a special task force reported to Governor Carey today.

title: Hays Asserts Woman Got $1,000 Through Threats
description: WASHINGTON. May 26Representative Wayne L. Hays. who acknowledged yesterday having had a sexual relationship with one of his Capitol Hill employees, asserted today that the woman, Elizabeth Ray, extorted more than $l.000 from him over the last five weeks with threats to make the details of their relationship public.

description: The inconclusive results in six Southern and Western primaries stalled but did not reverse former Gov. Jimmy Carter's steady drive toward the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Typhoon Death Toll Nears 100 in Northern Philippines
description: MANILA. May 26 (Reuters)The death toll from a typhoon that struck here approached 100 today and many people were reported missing as floors ranaged parts of the northern; Philippines.

title: GASOLINE PRICES BEGINNING TO RISE
description: As Memorial Day approaenes, heralding the beginning of the peak summer driving period, gasoline prices have begun to increase while some supply dislocations and spot shortages of motor fuel appear to be a possibility.

title: Notes on People
description: David Eisenhower will start his legal career with the 79yearold Wall Street law firm of Curtis, Mallet  Prevost, Colt & Mosle, which has a general practice but specializes in international and corporate law. A partner in the firm is Peter E. Fleming Jr., former assistant United States Attorney here who successfully defended John N. Mitchell, the former Attorney General, in his 1974 conspiracy trial with Maurice H. Stans, former Secretary of Commerce in the Nixon Administration. Mr. Eisenhower, a 1976 graduate of George Washington University's law school, and his wife, Julie Nixon Eisenhower, have moved here from Washington.

title: GALLUP SAYS G.O.P. HAS 22% OF VOTERS
description: A national study by the Gallup Poll shows twice as many adults classifying themselves Democrats than as Republicans.

title: 50 Warships of 26 Nations To Sail Into Harbor July 3
description: Two centuries ago, New York Harbor, the busiest in the New World, was closed, dominated by a British fleet. In the early morning of next Juiy 3. more than 50 ships from 26 foreign navies, three of the ships British, will pass under the VerrazanoNarrows Bridge to start the international naval review honoring the Bicentennial.

title: Reagan Asserts Law Aids The Criminal Defendant
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 26In his sharpest comments of the campaign on the lawandorder issue, Ronald Reagan said today that he would support legislation that would change laws, precedents, procedures and rules of prosecution that are stacked on behalf of the criminal defendant.

title: Experimental Lakes Yield. Nutrients and Pure Water
description: EAST LANSING, Mich.Scientists here have found a way to take partly treated sewage before it can pollute natu, ral waterways and, through biological processes alone, turn it into a manmade lake jumping with bass and clean enough for boating and swimming.

title: A $15 Billion Plan For Housing Voted By Representatives
description: WASHINGTON. May 26 (UPI) The House passed today a bill to provide about $15 billion over the next four years in housing assistance for the poor and the elderly.

title: Study of Stanley Home Finds Payments by Foreign Units
description: Stanley Home Products has announced that a special corporate  designated committee has completed an investigation and found that improper and questionable payments had been made by its foreign subsidiaries in two countries.

title: Screen: Busy 'Drive-In':Odd Melange Watches Epic Disaster Movie
description: "Drive-In," which opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters, is two movies for the price of one. And while one is better than the other, both are conceived in mordancy and sent forth with gleeful wickedness at the sort of multidramas made popular by novelists like Arthur Hailey and the disaster movies made profitable by Hollywood.Like "Hotel" or "Airport," this movie brings together one night in a Texas Panhandle drive-in a pair of bumbling stickup men, two rival youth gangs, a teenage couple perhaps headed for an unfortunate marriage, a pretty girl who has just broken up with one of the gang leaders, the decent but sexually unprecocious boy she is now interested in, his voyeuristic brother, a frightened black doctor and a host of subsidiary characters.Before the movie on the drive-in screen ends, much will be decided. And what a film it is. Its title is "Disaster '76."From the occasional glimpses offered, it begins with a dynamite explosion aboard a jetliner, which proceeds to crash into a skyscraper, touching off a major fire. Sometime thereafter, a dam breaks, an ocean liner sinks and a shark menaces both a swimming woman and the ship's captain, who took over the controls of the jetliner after the dynamite went off."Disaster '76" is short, sweet and frequently funny. 'Drive-In" posseses the virtue of fresh faces, the drawback of uneven acting, the irritation of occasional overwriting and the limited appeal of what is basically a juvenile story. It may not be "The Last Picture Show," but it may be the last word in the miniaturization of a genre.The PG rating is presumably attributable to a couple of words, a bit of violence and an atmosphere of adolescent prurience.

title: Zoning Shift Passed for Queens Complex
description: The construction of a controversial, $150 million complex of apartments, stores and parking facilities in Rego Park, Queens, was virtually assured yesterday when the City Planning Commission approved, by a single vote, zoning changes sought by the developer.

title: Suzanne Farrell Gives Air of Lightness to Chloe
description: Watching Suzanne Farrell at the State Theater on Tuesday evening in John Taras's lightweight Daphnis and Chloe, one was poignantly reminded of another Taras ballet and another Miss Farrell in the spring of 1963. She was barely 18 years old, inexperienced, ambitious and frighteningly talented, and was dancing the first major role created for her, in his Arcade. She needed its skilled structure then, but now the maturity of the intervening years enables her to make something even of the current uninteresting Chloe.

title: Candidates Shift Focus to California and Ohio
description: pects seemed bleak only two weeks ago after a aeries of losses to the former California Governor, won on Tuesday In Oregon, where he had been expected to, and in Kentucky and Tennessee, where he had not. Although he lost in Arkansas, Nevada and Idaho, he was delighted to win half the races) rather than losing five out of six, as some of his aides had predicted he would.

title: France Modifies Giscard Remark On Lebanon Offer
description: PARIS, May 26  Foreign Minister Jean Sauvagnargues, asserting that an offer of French peacekeeping troops for Lebanon had been misinterpreted, stressed today that the French Government had no intention of intervening militarily in the Lebanese civil war.

title: Dance: Fascinating Work by Glass and deGroat
description: La musique obsessionelle was the way a visiting French artistic figure recently characterized the music of avantgarde composers such as Philip Glass. The work of choreographers such as Andy deGroat, who collaborate with Mr. Glass, might be described similarly, except that the human element in the dancing always softens the relentless repetition that crops up in the works of both artists.

title: Senate Actions in Albany Criticized by Democrats
description: ALBANY, May 26The Republicancontrolled Senate today passed two measuresones that would limit Mayor Beame's authority to cut fire protection services in New York City and a $300 million tax relief proposal. Neither is given much chance of passing in the Democraticcontrolled Assembly.

title: U.S. REPORTS A RISE IN SOVIET EXIT VISAS
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (AP) While formally easing its emigration rules somewhat, the Soviet Union issued about 5,000 exit visas for Israel in the first four months of the year, State Department figures showed today.

title: Pound at New Low, Then Rallies a Bit
description: LONDON, May 26 (UPI)The pound hit a new low against the dollar during trading today, but recovered somewhat to close still considerably below the previous day. The dollar rose against all European currencies except the Swiss franc.

title: SMALLER PARTIES IN ITALY TROUBLED
description: SALERNO, Italy, May 24The heavy rain obscured the view of the bay, political posters started peeling from the walls of the narrow streets, but 3,000 of the faithful in the Social Democratic Party still managed find their way to the downtown movie theater.

title: Rangers Acquire Hodge Of Bruins for Middleton
description: The Rangers got the brawny wing they need to feed passes to Phil Esposito when they landed the funloving Ken Hodge from the Boston Bruins yesterday in a straight exchange for Rick Middleton.

title: TOP BRITISH AIDE CRITICIZES SOVIET
description: LONDON, May 26Foreign Secretary Anthony Crosland attacked the Soviet Union today for holding a narrow and limited view of detente, one that he said the Russians, had confined to furthering their own goals in EastWest ideological struggles.

title: LAND SITE URGED FOR ORE DISPOSAL
description: MINNEAPOLIS, May 26A Minnesota hearing examiner recommended today an onland disposal site for the thousands of tons of industrial waste that the Reserve Mining Company dumps daily into Lake Superior.

title: Bridge :
description: It is not unlikely that the prestigious Reisinger knockout team championship, being played this week at the New York Hilton Hotel, will be won for the first time in its 36year history by a team that was eliminated in an early round.

title: Bruins Teacher Beaten, 63, 75
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., May 26 (UPI)Topseeded Peter Fleming of the University of California, Los Angeles, advanced at the start of the National Collegiate tennis championships today, but the Bruin's hopes for defending their team title were damaged by the defeat of secondseeded Brian Teacher.

title: RUMSFELD TRYING TO HELP LOCKED SAVE JAPAN SALE
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld has interceded on behalf of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation in an attempt to salvage the troubled company's $250 million sale of patrol aircraft to Japan, Pentagon officials disclosed today.

description: MOUNT HOLLY, N. J., May 26 (UP1)More than 100 lawenforcement officials staged raid.; in nine Burlington County communities today, arresting alleged drug dealers. The county's Narcotics Strike Force obtained warrants for 37 suspects in Willingboro, Moorestown, Lumberton, Mount Laurel itnd Medford and the towships of Burlington, Southampton, Feinberton and Tabernacle.

description: FALLSBURG, N.Y., May 26Walter S. Wurzburger was inIstalled tonight as president of the Rabbinical Council of America, which represents 1.5 million Orthodox Jews.

description: ALBANY, May 26An aide to Governor Carey estimated today that New York City would have to contribute about $50 million more to the City University in the 1977%78 school year, than Mayor Beame has said it would, even if tuition were imposed on all of the system's undergraduates oy then.

title: Directors of GEICO Back $75 Million In Capital Financing
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Directors of the financially troubled Government Employees Insurance Company today approved a capital financing program that includes plan to issue 7.5 million shares of convertible preferred stock that would raise $75 million for the company.

description: A. Richard Perry, vice president of finance for the Flinkote Company, died Saturday, apoarently of a heart attack, at his home in Chappaqua, N.Y. He was 54 years old.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 26  Security Council members today deplored the establishment of Israeli settleMen's in occupied Arab tertitortes. The criticism was in statement presented as the majority view at the end of threeweek Middle East debate.

description: The American Basketball Association championship trophy, stolen earlier this month in Denver, was returned undamaged to the league offices yesterday. The trophy, worth about $900, was delivered to the A.B.A.'s headquarters at 1700 Broadway. The parcel carried a return address of C.J. Flynn, 2619 Lark. Denver. But league officials, checking with Denver authorities, could find no such person or address.

title: 1976 Forecast Is Raised On Shipments of Steel
description: The pick up in steel demand is so strong that industry shipments this year may go above 100 million tons, Frederick G. Jaicks, chairman of the Ameri can Iron and Steel Institute, bold a news conference in the Waldorf Astoria Hotel.

title: Tottenville Wins Title
description: Tottenville High School of Staten Island, coached by Leo Katz, won the Public Schools Athletic League tennis championship yesterday by beating South Shore of Brooklyn, 32, in the final at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills.

title: Senate Panel Votes to Curb Access to Income Tax Data
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (AP) The Senate Finance Committee voted today to restrict White House and Congressional access to income tax returns.

description: WASHINGTON, May 26Roderick M. Hills, chairman of the Securities and Exchangei Commission, announced today a sweeping reexamination of the laws and regulations governing mutual funds that could lead to substantially more freedom in their operations.

description: The rise in food prices has depressed consumer confidence, the Conference Board said yesterday. Page 52.

description: KINGS POINT, L.I., May 26 Tufts University overtook Webb Institute in the last two races today and won the 15race North American dinghy championship series at the United States Merchant Marine Academy.

title: Chess :
description: In almost all variations of the Sicilian Defense, White obtains a spatial advantage by virtue of maintaining a center pawn at K4 against Black's pawn at Q3, and yet it is invariably difficult to put down and keep down the second player's counter attacking possibilities.

title: Personal Finance
description: Depending on what happens in the Congress in the next five weeks or so, depositors in many of the nation's federally insured mutually owned savings and loan associations may be faced with a novel investment decision.

title: State Department to Protest
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The State Department said today that it would protest to Soviet authorities against the article in Literaturnaya Gazeta suggesting that three American correspondents were closely alwith the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Transit Authority said yesterday that it would hire 208 more laidoff firemen as bus drivers. The move would not only put laidoff city employees back to work but would also reduce the Transit Authority's overtime costs.

title: Martin Heidegger, a Philosopher Who Affected Many Fields, Dies
description: Martin Heidegger, the Ger., man philosopher who was one of the seminal thinkers of his time, died yesterday at the age of E46 in the town of his birth, Messkirch, West Germany. The cause of death was an infection of an unspecified nature.

title: Stage: Shrewd So Nice by Harris
Head Style Is Adopted By Frazier
description: PHILADELPHIA. May 26Joe Frazier unveiled today a new technique he said he would use against George Foreman. It was to move his head continuously, which he did against saprring partners who pretended they were Foreman.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Martin Weinberg, the new chairman of the local Democratic committee in Philadelphia, was incorrectly identified in The Times yesterday as Martin Weinstein.

description: Incoming

title: Accused Cadets to Involve Hundreds of Classmates
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., May 26  Cadets accused of cheating at West Point or who are critical of the honor code are compiling lists of hundreds of names of classmates who they, say remain unprosecuted.

title: Recklessness in Eritrea
description: Ethiopia's military rulers are behaving with callous recklessness in sending an untrained army of peasants into Eritrea, ostensibly to crush a separatist guerrilla movement that regular Ethiopian troops have been unable even to contain. The Addis Ababa regime has been doubly irresponsible in recruiting thousands of the largely Christian peasants by arousing their ancient hatred of Islam and promising them a holy war.

title: Trade Deficit Narrowed In April to $202 Million
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (Reuters)The United States trade deficit narrowed to a seasonally adjusted 5202.1 million in April from $650.9 million in March, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Britain and Bicentennial Old Ties and New Tours
description: LONDON, May 26Britain may have lost a colony 200 years ago, but no countryunless it be the United States itselfis having more fun or getting more mileage out of the Bicentennial. The descendants of George III are treating this birthday as if they had planned it all along.

title: Fur Showings: Embarrassment of Riches
description: Having four top designers in one's stable should be a headache for any furrier. But the sort of headache the house of Alixandre has is the envy of the industry. There's a design label to please just about any customer.

description: International

title: REPORT ON OSWALD TO BE MADE PUBLIC
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (AP) The Senate Intelligence Committee tentatively decided, 8 to 2, today to make public a report dealing with Lee Harvey Oswald's motives in shooting President Kennedy.

title: Situation of Leadership Is a Worry to Democrats
description: Governor Carey indicated yesterday that he expected Patrick J. Cunningham to step aside as Democratic state chairman, with the Governor asserting it would be most difficult for Mr. Cunningham to stay on in the face of his indictment.

Directed by Aran Jose Jusld; written by Mr. Jusid, Oscar Viale, Alejandro Saderman and Ana Maria Gerchuncff, lased on a novel by Alberto Gerchunott; nhotonranhed by Juan Carlos Desanao; music by Gustavo Berlemann. title: Envoy Says U.S. Erred in Beirut Policy
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 L. Dean Brown, the Ford Administration's special envoy in the Lebanon crisis, says that he believes the United States Government probably made a mistake in discouraging Syria from sending troops into Bei?? last month as a peacemaking force in the civil war.

description: The resignation of Alfred A. Giardino as chairman of the Board of Higher Education is an honorable final gesture in a battle he fought with valor. Fervently committed to free tuition and academic quality, Mr. Giardino tried desperately to arrive at a formula that would allow the City University to maintain both.

title: Fiscal Collapse of U.D.C. Was Result Of 3 Wrong Moves, Panel Concludes
description: ALBANY, May 26The financial collapse 15 months ago ofthe Urban Development Corporationthe first wave in the fiscal crisis that later engulfed the statewas the combined tesult of overly optimistic assumptions, a lack of management controls and twin mandates for the giant development agency that were contradictory and impossible to meet, a special investigatory commission concluded today.

title: Xhosa to Lose South African Citizenship!
description: CAPE TOWN, May 26The Government published legislation today under which approxinnately 1.3 million members of the Xhosa tribal group who live outside their homeland of the Transkei will lose their South African citizenship when the homeland becomes independent later this year.

title: Ziobro Posts 68137 Leads Jersey Golf
description: DENVILLE, N.J., May 26Billy Ziobro of Tammy Brook, the 1975 winner, shot a fourunderpar 68 today for a tworound total of 137 and a twostroke lead in the $35,000 Dodge open at the Rockaway River Country Club.

title: Manhattan School In Concert Marked By National Flavor
description: There were at least two interesting aspects to the Group for Contemporary Music's final concert of the season at the Manhattan School on Tuesday night. First, the musicians were all young undergraduates from the school's student body, gaining valuable performing experience in some challenging 20th. century works.

title: RUMSFELD TRYING TO HELP LOCKHEED SAVE JAPAN SALE
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld has interceded on behalf of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation in an attempt to salvage the troubled company's $250 million sale of patrol aircraft to Japan, Pentagon officials disclosed today.

title: Business Briefs
description: KUWAIT, May 26 (Reuters)Iran is seeking a $1.2 billion loan from Saudi Arabia to help meet an expected $2 billion budget deficit this year, the newspaper AlSiyassah reported today from Teheran. It said the loan request was made in talks with Saudi Arabia's Planning Minister Hisham AlNazer, who is accompanying King Khalid on a state visit to Iran. The visit is largely ceremonial, but the Saudi king is expected to discuss oil, Persian Gulf military matters and other issues with Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi.

title: Trotter Makes His Owner Travel
description: WESTBURY, L.I., May 26Snegem Flight, the Canadianbred stallion scheduled to compete in Friday night's $25,000 Goldsmith Maid Open Handicap at Roosevelt Raceway, has made an international commuter of Bill Megens, the trotter's breeder, trainer and driver.

title: Union Gets U.S. Funds
description: BOSTON, May 26 (AP)The Labor Department said today that it was giving a 5276,000 grant to the Textile Workers Union of America to train 200 underemployed workers in six states, including Massachusetts. The Federal program will operate also in the New YorkNew Jersey metropolitan area, South Carolina, Alabama and Pennsylvania.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Senate Kills Funds for Plane Pentagon Doesn't Want and Upsets Backing of a Second Unwanted Craft
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The Senate, perhaps unwittingly, upset today carefully laid plans within the militaryindustrialCongressional complex to have Congress order the production of $245 million worth of airplanes not wanted by the Defense Department.

title: Dance: Danes Shift Casts in 3 Works
description: The Royal Danish Ballet has an oddly eclectic repertory, yet also an oddly attractive one. Sometimes you see a lot of what can only be termed goodbad ballets. Masterpieces they are not, and yet they offer the dancers an opportunity to shine. For one of the most important aspects of the Danish Ballet is quite simply the Danish dancers. The company is a magnificent machine, and all the more magnificent for being, in a quite unmachinelike fashion, friendly.

title: 24 NATIONS SET UP A CORPORATE CODE
description: PARIS, May 26After more than a year of difficult negotiations, the 24 member countries of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development have agreed on a strict code of conduct for multinational corporations.

title: U.S. Danger Seen in Latin Drug Overuse
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Improper promotion and overuse of drugs in foreign countries can have serious ill effects on Americans as well as on the local populations, a prominent medical educator and former government official told a Senate subcommittee today.

title: Two Million Gallons of Oil Spilled
description: JERSEY CITY, May 26A metal plate on an oil tank at the Wellen Oil Company ruptured today, allowing more than two million gallons of heavy industrial oil to seep into the Hackensack River, according to fire officials.

title: Seoul Officials Deny Links to Moon Sect
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 26. South Korean officials said today that the Government of President Park Chung Hee was in no way linked with the Rev. Sun Myung Moon.

title: Baeza Is Assessed $500; Rider Protects Privacy
description: The stewards at Belmont Park fined Braulio Baeza, the millionaire jockey, 5500 yesterday for his recent disappearing act.

title: Ali Free of Claims
description: MUNICH, West Germany, May 26 (UPI)Walter Settele, the West German promoter of the Muhammad AliRichard Dunn title fight, denied today he would try to block Ali's departure because of financial claims against him. He said he had no claims against Ali.

title: Miki Defies Party Foes In New Bid to Oust Him
description: TOKYO, May 26Prime Minister Takeo Miki of Japan accused his adversaries within the ruling Liberal Democratic Party today of fostering dictatorship by trying to forces him to resign in favor of a new prime minister n'amed by party bosses.

title: Dorothy Schiff Tells of Relationship With Roosevelt
description: Dorothy Schiff, editor in chief and publisher of The New York Post, says in a new biography that she had a personal relationship with President Franklin Delano Roosevelt that lasted from 1936 to 1943.

title: Carey Now Wants Nadjari To Stay and Finish Cases
description: Governor Carey, in a sudden turnabout, said yesterday that Maurice H. Nadjari, whom he had tried to dismiss as a special state prosecutor, should remain beyond a June 29 deadline to complete a backlog of trials.

title: Noisy Farewell
description: The departure of the two Concorde planes from Dulles International Airport on Tuesday was a more significant sound test than their arrival the day before, since a characteristic of these supersonic craft is that they are much noisier than other planes on takeoff rather than on landing. The noise of the British Airways plane was not recorded, but that of its Air France counterpart registered a totally unacceptable 129 decibels, or twice the noise level allowed at New York's Kennedy Airport.

title: Ford Rallies.
description: President Ford's victories in Kentucky, Tennessee and Oregon reestablish him as the favorite to win the Republican nomination at his party's convention in Kansas City in August.

title: Shelling Resumes in Lebanon Amid Peace Efforts
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 26 (AP) Shelling between Moslems and Christians intensified today despite reports of progress in political efforts to end the Lebanese civil war.

title: SAVINGSBANK BILL IS SIGNED BY CAREY
description: ALBANY, May 26Governor Carey today signed into law the controversial bill allowing sayings banks to offer checking accounts and overdraft privileges.

title: WOLPER CO. IS SUED ON TOPLESS SCENE
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga., May 26 (UPI)A woman has charged in a $25,000 suit against a production company that her daughter and about 19 other students were taken from school without permission and photographed topless for a television movie.

title: IRT BROOKLYN RUNS REDUCED IN MIDDAY
description: The Transit Authority has cut back midday service Ipatween Manhattan and Brooklyn on the Lexington Avenue IRT line without making a public announcement.

title: Mr. Protest
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Racing for an Ozark Airlines plane recently, I ran into former Senator Eugene McCarthy. What are you doing these days, Gene? Cheerfully, he responded, Running for President.

title: BOMBER'S IDENTITY FALSE, ISRAEL SAYS
description: TEL AVIV, May 26 (AP)Security officers said today that a traveler who was killed here yesterday when his suitlease exploded during inspection had a forged Netherlands passport. Israelis have not been able to learn his true identity.

title: U.S. Seems to Let A.F.L.C.I.O. Veto Union Visitors
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The State Department has apparently given the A.F.L.C.I.O. the right to veto all applications by Soviet and other Communist trade union leaders to enter this country.

title: Interest Rates Up on Heavy Corporate and TaxExempt Volume
Police Question 5 More in Union Killings
description: Detectives, investigating a labor street fight in Woodside. Queens earlier this month that resulted in the slayng of two men, have found and questioned five men who were at the scene and were seeking to join Local 810 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Pianists Fail to Win Leventritt Prize
description: Five pianists competed to a draw in the finals of the International Leventritt Competition in Carnegie Hall yesterday. The 13 judges decided unanimously that none of the five were ready for the top prize of $10,000, an RCA recording contract and engagements with leading orchestras.

title: Princetonians Find Ways to Offset Inflation
description: PRINCETON, May 26Thomas F. Gibson 3d sold his 1937 Rolls Royce Phantom III last Christmas, made a 50 percent profit on the black coupe de ville and promptly paid his bills: $5,475 in tuition, room and board at Princeton University.

title: Cuban Withdrawal Plans Are Implicitly Confirmed
description: HAVANA, May 26 (Reuters)President. Osvaldo Dorticos Torrado has implicitly confirmed here that Cuba would withdraw 200 soldiers a week from Angola with the agreement of President Agostinho Nato.

title: FRANCIS WILSON, LED ACCURACY IN MEDIA
description: WASHINGTON. May 26Dr. Francis Graham Wilson, political scientist educator and president of Accuracy in Media Inc., a Washingtonbased group that monitors the press and broadcast services, died here Monday. He was 74 years old.

title: Yugoslav Lawyer Wins Suspension Of His Sentence
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 26  A Belgrade lawyer who, was sentenced to one year's, imprisonment in March for having defended the views or a client in court today won a suspension of the sentence.

title: Maybe Scipio's remarks to Polybius at Carthage were accurate. Kissinger apparently agrees. But consider an alternative.
description: TORONTOI think of myself as a historian more than a statesman. As a historian, you have to be conscious of the fact that every civilization that has ever existed has ultimately collapsed, Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said in October 1974.

title: Jack's Other Wife Is Very Demanding
description: DUBLIN. Ohio, May 26Only three years ago, before Jack Nicklaus sent the bulldozers in, woods and cornfields dominated the farmland here near Columbus where the Muirfield Village Golf Club now sprawls across two counties as a monument to him.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world fold prices Wednesday. tonoon: Morning fining $124.40, down 0.10; afternoon fixing $125.75, up $1.25. Paris: Afternoon market quotation.

title: Panel Named to Study the Cancer Rate
description: TRENTON, May 26Governor Byrne issued an executive order today creating a committee of cabinetlevel officers to try to learn why the state has the highest cancer mortality rate in the nation.

description: WASHINGTON, May 26Twentysix states and three cities, including New York. joined a coalition of labor, civil rights, civic and religious, groups today in filing a suit to prevent the Department of Agriculture from implementing its administrative cutbacks of the food stamp program.

title: Publisher Named in Michigan
description: DOWAGIAC, Mich., May 26 (AP)  Irene E. Brosnan has been named publisher of The Dowagiac Daily News. Mrs. Brosnan, who joined the newspaper in 1951, is the current president of the Michigan League of Home Dailies.

description: LOS ANGELES, May 26A weary Cat ebullient Frank Church flew in here today for an outdoor rally at the University and of California, Los Angeles, and then flew out again three hours later on his way to Cincinnati, in a frenetic attempt to win the Democratic Presidential nomination.

Ronald Reagan of California was averted when a Republican State Senate caucus voted unanimously to abandon an effort to eliminate the primary election provision that allows the primary winner to take all the state's delegates.

title: 7 European Nations Yield on Trade Fund In Nairobi Meeting
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 26 Third world demands for a common fund to regulate commodity prices were accepted in principle today by seven of the nine European Common Market countries, but West Germany and Britain continued to balk.

description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo., May 26.Missouri Democrats last night gave former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia fewer convention delegates than his backers had hoped.

description: MOSCOW, May 26 (AP)The Soviet Union and Angola signed agreements today on basic principles of cooperation, trade, and scientific and cultural cooperation, Tass said.

title: GOVERNOR WANTS NADJARI TO STAY
description: In recent weeks, inquiries by, Mr. Nadjari's office have resulted in a series of indictments of judges and political figures. Mr. Carey said yesterday: By reason of the nature of these indictments I would want the person who secured these indictments to carry them to trial. So I seek no change.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Judge Bruno L. Leopizzi of Passaic County District Court disqualified himself from presiding in the retrial of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis in Paterson for triple murder. Judge Leopizzi, in a letter to the lawyers involved in the trial, said circumstances may develop the trial to show that he represented two witnesses who appeared briefly before a June 1966 grand jury that investigated the three murders at a bar in Paterson. Judge Leopizzi said he was informed several weeks ago that he was assigned in June 1966 to represent the two witnesses before they testified in the grand jury room. He said he did not recall representing the two witnesses. Judge William Marchese of Passaic County Court was assigned by Superior Court Judge Charles S. Joelson to preside at the new trial, which is scheduled to begin Sept. 27. Kearny Upheld on ParkingLot Laws

description: BELGRADE, May 26 (AP)Ingra Pozhega, a 30yearold Russian who worked with Soviet travel agency, was convicted of espionage and sentenced to five years in prison, informed sources reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor In his OpEd article of May 15, Norman Birnbaum speaks of an emerging New European Socialism, with the possible advent of socialist and/or Communist governments maintaining independence from the Moscow brand of Communism, which they have found wanting. He also raises a warning finger against any U.S. intervention and quotes reminders from French and German leaders that the European nations are sovereign powers.

title: Carter Pledges Aid for City, Wins Beame Backing
description: Mayor Beame, in a significant move in state as well as national politics, officially endorsed Jimmy Carter for President yesterday and described him as a friend of New Yorkers.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON AMEX AND OTC
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecoun ter market finished mixed yesterday in sluggish trading.

title: Candidates Shifting Focus To California and Ohio
description: Republicans looked to California yesterday and Democrats to Ohio for clarification of the still unresolved races for the Presidential nominations. Roth states vote June 8.

title: ACCOUNTING FIRMS DISCUSS MERGER
description: Touche Ross & Company and Laventhol & Horwath, two of the nation's largest public accounting concerns, confirmed yesterday that they were holding exploratory merger talks. Spokesmen for both companies emphasized that the discussions had just begun and that no agreement or understanding had yet been reached.

title: Ford Defends His Opposition to Busing
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 26President Ford strongly defended his opposition to courtordered school busing tonight, denying that it was politically motivated or that it encouraged defiance of the law.

title: Panel Reports U.D.C. Collapse Was Result of 3 Wrong Moves
description: ALBANY, May 26The financial collapse 15 months ago of the Urban Development Corporationthe first wave in the fiscal crisis that later engulfed the state was the combined result of overly optimistic assumptions, a lack of management controls and twin mandates for the giant development agency that were contradictory and impossible to meet, a sper cial investigatory commission concluded today.

title: Sets, Wade Beat Racquets, Evert
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., May 26 The New York Sets Virginia Wade, replacing the injured Billie Jean King in women's singles, defeated Chris Evert, 75, tonight as both Miss Evert and the Phoenix Racquets suffered their first losses of the World Team Tennis season.

title: Stocks Decline Slightly; Dow and U.S. Steel Drop
description: Stock prices moved a shade lower yesterday, but substantial declines showed in two of Wall Street's recent favoritesDow Chemical and United States Steel.

title: Mexican Kidnappers Threaten To Kill Ambassczdok's Daughter
description: MEXICO CITY, Thursday, May 27 (Reuters)Guerrillas who have kidnapped the daughter of the Belgian Ambassador to Mexico have threatened to till the 16yearold girl if $800,000 in ransom is not paid belore midnight tonight, according to a spokesman for they Ambassador's family.

title: Carter Pledges Aid for City, Wins Beame Backing
description: Mayor Beame, in a significant move in state as well as national politics, officially endorsed Jimmy Carter for President yesterday and described him as a friend of New Yorkers.

title: Carter Carries His Campaign Into Jersey
description: TRENTON, May 26Jimmy Carter began the last two weeks of primary campaigning today, saying he was col fident a losing streak that has plagued him recently would not deny him the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: jersey Panel Is Selected To Study the Cancer Rate
description: TRENTON, May 26Governor Byrne issued an executive order today creating a committee of cabinetl& el officers to try to learn why the state has the highest cancer mortality rate in the nation.

title: Otter Spotters Gather Data in Man vs. Animal War
description: MONTEREY, Calif., May 24Terry Fabry, who earns her living as a figureskating instructor, rises before dawn these days to spend eight hours peering through a telescope at sea otters foraging off the beautiful, rocky coast here.

title: Rules Panel Clears Offshore Oil Bill
description: WASHINGTON, May 26President Ford and the oil industry were dealt a severe defeat today when the House Rules Committee, by a vote of 10 to 5, cleared for floor action Sill that would make farreaching changes in the Federal regulation of oil leasing and production on the outer continental shelf.

title: Martin Heidegger, a Philosopher Who Affected Many Fields, Dies
description: Martin Heidegger, the German philosopher who was one of the seminal thinkers of his time, died yesterday at the age of 86 in the town of his birth, Messkirch, West Germany. The cause of death was an infection of an unspecified nature.

title: Fed Urged to Revise Its Monetary Statistics
description: WASHINGTON, May 26A committee of leading economists recommended today that the Federal Reserve Board make a number of changes to improve its statistics on the money supply and other monetary aggregates.

title: GUIDES ON ADOPTION FOR JERSEY SOUGHT
description: TRENTON, May 26 (UPI)The New Jersey Supreme Court has been asked to issue guidelines for adoptions so that children are not caught in the emotional web created by natural and adopted parents.

title: Orantes Easy Victor
description: DUESSELDORF, West Germany, May 26 (AP)Manuel Orantes of Spain easily downed West Germany's Werner Zirngibl, 60, 61, in the third round of the $50,000 Duesseldorf Grand Prix international tennis tournament today.

title: Jersey County Stages Raids
description: MOUNT HOLLY, N. J., May 26 (UPI)More than 100 lawenforcement officials staged raid in nine Burlington County communities today, arresting alleged drug dealers. The county's Narcotics Strike Force obtained warrants for 37 suspe As in Willingboro, Moorestown, Lumberton, Mount Laurel and Medford and the townships of Burlington, Southampton, Pemberton and Tabernacle.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Cleveland Indians, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 8 P.M. (RadioWMCA, 7:50 P.M.)

title: DALEY WINS CURB ON FILM AUDIENCE
description: CHICAGO, May 26At the behest of Mayor Richard J. Daley, the Chicago City Council overwhelmingly passed today an ordinance barring children under 18 years old from viewing excessively violent movies.

title: Carter Campaign Funds Raised By a Group of Georgia Lawyers
description: ATLANTAA small group of influential Georgia lawyers who recognized Jimmy Carter's political potential 10 years ago have formed the core of his financial support ever since then.

title: Rise in Food Prices Reported To Depress Buyer Confidence,
description: The rise in food prices has had a depressing effect on consumer confidence, the Conference Board said yesterday. The board's bimonthly index of consumer confidence, with 196970 as 100, fell to 82.2 in April, down 11 percentage points from the February figure. The index on buying plans, also reported every two months, slumped almost 30 points to 96.7.

title: 1Year Bills Auctioned By the U.S. Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The Treasury auctioned oneyear bills today at an average yieldof 6.309 percent.

title: To the Land of Nod But Softly
description: They look like overgrown pillows. Even these newstyled, lighter versions of oldfashioned featherbeds, now being imported from China, remind one of the plump, billowy bags of precious goose down that turnofthecentury immigrants lugged from their homelands to this country.

title: Tanner Is Up set by McNair
description: ROME, May 26 (UPI)Fred McNair provided the upset of the second round at the 6160.000 Italian open tennis championships today by defeating fifthseeded Roscoe Tanner, 75. 76. McNair ranks 36th in America and Tanner third.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Turkey Hunt
description: ROSCOE, N. Y.In midMay in Roscoe if you spot a weary man with smudges of blue chalk on his fingers gulping down black coffee in a diner you can be sure he is one of New York State's spring turkey hunters.

title: Otter Spotters Gather Data in Man vs. Animal War
description: MONTEREY, Calif., May 24Terry Fabry, who earns her living as a figureskating instructor, rises before dawn these days to spend eight hours peering through a telescope at sea otters foraging off the beautiful, rocky coast here.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES ADVANCE BY LIMIT
description: CHICAGO, May 26 (AP)Grain futures rose sharply on the Chicago Board of Trade today, with soybeans advancing the allowable limit of 20 cents a bushel for the second time this week.

title: OPEC Members Open Parley On Future Prices of Oil
description: KUTA BEACH, Bali, IndoneIsla, May 26The oil ministers of the 13 member nations of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries arrived here today to consider the future world price of petroleum and a broad range of technical elements that will compose It.

title: 6,000 MORE FACE SCHOOL JOB LOSS
description: The New York City Board of Education said yesterday that it would have to dismiss 5,000 to 6,000 more teachers and other school employees next fall and would be unable to restore the full class day for pupils under the new city budget for 197677.

title: SST's Elusive Takeoff Annoying to Coleman
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (UPDTransportation Secretary William T. Coleman Jr. said today that he called the British Ambassador to explain his announyance about a lastminute move that allowed British supersonic airplane to bypass Federal noisemeasuring equipment.

title: Britain and Bicentennial Old Ties and New Tours
description: LONDON, May 26Britain may have lost a colony 200 years ago, but no countryunless it be the United States itselfis having more fun or getting more mileage out of the Bicentennial. The descendants of George III are treating this birthday as if they had planned it all along.

title: Accused Cadets to Involve Hundreds of Classmates
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., May 26  Cadets accused of cheating at West Point or who are critical of the honor code are compiling lists of hundreds of names of classmates who they say remain unprosecuted.

title: A Northport Class's Impressions Of Exotic City 35 Miles to the West
description: NORTHPORT, L.I., May 26 Since September students at Northport High School have used New York City as a classroom for a course titled New York City: Myths and Realities, and today they shared with their school the impressions of the people and the places, they had learned about.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Litton Industries, has updated its esumated costs to complete work on two major United States Navy shipbuilding programs by $544 million. The estimate came in a form 8K statement it has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Historians Put It in the Past Perfect
English and Italian Soccer Squads Will Meet Tonight
description: Immediately after three national anthems have been played at Yankee Stadium tonight, England and Italy will clash before a world television audience of 130 million and a crowd expected to be the largest to watch a soccer game in New York.

title: Doing the Discotheque Hustle
description: It's 10 P.M., and Richard Pampinella is settling into his booth off the dark dance floor of Hippopotamus, the East Side nightspot. He puts on his headphones. adjusts dials in front of him, flicks switches on the 10 consoles ringing his cockpit, triggers a galactic burst of blinking lights in the adjoining air space and lifts the club off into another high  decibel evening.

title: CHEATING ISSUE HITS AIR FORCE ACADEMY
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, 27 (AP)  Six Air Force Academy cadets resigned two weeks after they ;spurned a request from a student honor committee that they leave the academy for cheating, an academy spokesman said today.

title: Drive Is On to Divest Hays Of House Chairmanships
description: WASHINGTON. May 27 Some members of the House of Representatives, stung by the public furor over the Elizabeth Ray disclosures, today opened a quiet but determined drive to divest Representative Wayne L. Hays of his three committee chairmanships.

title: Israelis Quit Cannes Festival
description: CANNES, France, May 27 (AP)The Israeli delegationto the Cannes Film Festival has closed its stand and walked out to protest the showing of a film that it called a serious insult to Israel and the Jewish people.

title: Caso to Run Again Although the G.O.P. May Not Back Him
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 27The Nassau County Executive, Ralph G. Caso, said today that he would run for reelection for a third term in 1977 despite a warning from the Republican county chairman that he might not be the party's designee.

title: SYRIANS CONSENT TO U.N. EXTENSION OF BUFFER FORCE
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, May 27Secretary General Kurt Waldhelm said today that Syria had agreed to extend the United Nations observer force on the Golan Heights for another six months.

title: Parking Fees Rising At 17 of State Parks
description: TRENTON, May 27 (AP)The state's Division of Parks and Forestry reminded motorists today that parking fees would be increased at 17 state parks starting Saturday.

title: Perspective
description: The Federal Reserve is a spoilsport. Just when the party gets going, the Fed closes the bar. But that's what it's supposed to domanipulate interest rates and the supply of money to keep the economy on sober. noninflationary course.

title: St. John's, Columbia Nines Bow
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., May 27John Seneca. a freshman who missed half of the season because of a pulled muscle, in his right arm, pitched Seton Hall to an 80 victory over St. John's today in the opening round of the National Collegiate Athletic Association Northeast Regional playoffs.

title: Newtown Wrestlers Win
description: Newtown High took the Public Schools wrestling title yesterday by defeating Wagner, 3327, at Beach Channel's gymnaisum. Newtown was led by its ?? Rafael Soto, who posted his 50th victory against one loss.

title: Rutgers Commencement Clouded by Tuition Plan
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 27A possible tuition rise at Rutgers that would make the 210yearold institution the most expensive state university in the nation as of July 1 cast a pall today on commencement ceremonies.

title: SENATE UNIT VOTES T0 KEEP KEY PARTS OF 1975 TAX CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The Senate Finance Committee voted today to make permanent all but one aspect of the individual income tax cuts that have been in effect since March 1975.

title: REAGAN STRESSES CALIFORNIA DRIVE
description: IMPERIAL, Calif., May 27Ronald Reagan today took his campaign for California's crucial 167 Republican delegates into the 90degree heat haze of the Imperial Valley with the cold assessment that a victory in his home state was essential to sustain his challenge to President Ford.

title: Women Criticize Parties on Share of Delegates
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Women members of both major political parties contended today that the Democrats and the Republicans had both failed abysmally to select adequate numbers of women and members of minorities as delegates to their Presidential nominating conventions.

title: Refound Art of the Brooklyn Bridge
description: Not long ago, it was revealed that a treasure trove of 19thcentury architectural and engineering drawings, the original drawings for the Brooklyn Bridge, had lain in neglect for years in a cityowned carpenter shop in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn. The discovery of the drawings, one of the most complete architectural archives extant, set off a lively debate over their custodianship, with several city agencies claiming ownership.

title: DEDICATION HAS NORMAN THOMAS
description: With glowing tributes to a Socialist leader whose name was carefully avoided in classrooms during most of his lifetime, the Norman Thomas High School was dedicated yesterday on Park Avenue.

title: Sets Make Loves 6th Victim in Row
Britain's Resignation Honors Meeting Criticism
description: LONDON, May 27  Sir Harold Wilson today drew the anger and scorn of his Labor Party colleagues for bestowing honors on several personal friends.

title: Visiting a Papp Workshop
description: One thing about the Public Theater, it is a very public place. Which is only to say that Joseph Papp's percolating play factory downtown at 425 Lafayette Street on weekends is almost unfailingly alive with theatrical activity. Some of the most exotic of these exercises take place in what Mr. Papp calls his workshops. Though largely unpublicized, they are heavily attended by both theater people and the theatergoing public. They are also free.

title: Thriving Jewish Community at West Point Linked to Tradition
description: WEST POINT, N.Y.David M. Finkelstein entered West Point four years ago fully expecting to forfeit not only the comforts of his Queens Village home, but also the symbols and observances of his religiously Jewish upbringing.

title: KISSINGER ACCUSED ON U.N. CHINA SHIFT
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI) A former deputy director of the Central Intelligence Agency told Congress today that President Richard M. Nixon and Henry A. Kissinger undermined State Department efforts in 1971 to save Nationalist China's seat at the United Nations.

title: Albany Approves a Delay In Building Impact Studies
description: ALBANY, May 27Both the Assembly and Senate today passed a bill that would postpone the scheduled June 1 effective date of requirements that all development in the state be accompanied by environmental impact statements.

title: Kuwait Seizes Whisky
description: KUWAIT, May 27 (Reuters) Nearly 50,000 bottles of whisky worth $1.6 million on the black market, was seized by the Kuwaiti Coast Guard as it was about to be unloaded, officials have reported. Liquor seized in this Moslem country is usually destroyed.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 27Without waiting for a legislative vote on a measure to legalize the advertising of prescription drugs, Pathmark. one of the state's largest drug and grocery retailers, has begun advertising its medicine prices.

title: Bureaucratic Snarl Endangers a Marriage
description: The marriage of Robert and Ruth Migliore overcame what seemed like insurmountable problems, only to be threatened by bureaucratic ineptness.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: VW Busily Weighs Merits Of 2 PlantSite Finalists
description: BRUSSELS, May 27Volkswagen has narrowed its choice for the site of its first American auto assembly plant to Brook Park, Ohio, and New Stanton, Pa., a company spokesman in Wolfsburg, West Germany. said today. A third major contender was Columbus, Ohio, but it has been dropped from the field. which originally comprised 13 sites.

title: Bolshoi Theater Gets Lenin Honor
description: MOSCOW, May 27 (AP)The Bolshoi Theater, 200 years old and sparkling with new trimmings, received the Order of Lenin yesterday a top Soviet honor.

title: U.S.Soviet Accord On Nuclear Blasts To Be Signed Today
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) President Ford and Leonid 1 Brezhnev, the Soviet leader will sign a SovietAmerican nu cleartest treaty tomorrow, the White House said today.

title: Art People
description: WILL it succeed as a way of pushing young artists work and  not incidentally  make money for everyone concerned? Jud

title: $14,200 for Probably Undrinkable Wine
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 27A man paid $14,200 for a bottle of wine at an auction here today.

title: Modern's World of Narrative Prints
description: THAT PICTURES should tell a story was once taken for granted. That pictures should come in sequences, accumulating momentum and excitement as they went, was also once nothing out of the ordinary. When Giotto had wrought so well in the Arena Chapel in Padua, why should others fear a nonexistent taboo? It was the function of painting to speak to all mankind, irrespective of race, color, language or creed, provided only that they had made the journey to Europe.

title: Jersey High Court Is Urged to Retract Threat on Schools
description: TRENTON, May 27The New Jersey School Boards Association asked the State Supreme Court today to retract its threat to close public schools on July 1 if the Legislature failed to provide an additional $378 million for education.

title: Market Place
description: The decision Wednesday by Moody's Investors Service to downgrade the Municipal Assistance Corporation's bonds on which it had issued ratings comes at a bad time for investors in these and other debt issues of New York City and the corporation, the city's rescue agency.

title: Records: Strauss and Bruckner
description: You might never suspect it from the boisterous receptions that New York audiences give the Chicago Symphony, but there are a few stubborn listeners who refuse to be swept away by concerts under the baton of Sir Georg SoIti. Still, whatever reservations persist about Sir Georg and his hyperenergetic conducting style, the virtuosity of his orchestra is generally agreed upon. By chance, both proSoltis and skeptics are currently offered a Chicago Symphony recording, each on a different label.

title: Rubber Workers Halt Strike Benefits
description: CHICAGO, May 27In a stunning surprise, the United Rubber Workers, whose strike against the Big Four tire companies is now in its sixth week, voted today not to assess the 100,000 members of the union who are still working to pay strike benefits to the 70,000 who are not.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: Is rearing a child at home really better than day care?

title: Mr. Cunningham's Duty
description: The indictment of Democratic Stale Chairman Patrick J. Cunningham on bribery and other charges should last persuade even his most loyal political friends that he must step aside until his case has been adjudicated. Even if the serious charges against this key party leader had not been brought at so awkward a time, less than seven weeks before the Democratic National Convention. the people of New York and the Democratic Party would have a right to expect Mr. Cunningham to lift the shadow of suspicion which his presence throws across party and state affairs.

title: Tourist Boats Due at Ellis I.
description: E LLISISLAND in New York Harbor, the gateway to the United States and the threshold of promise for 12 million immigrants from 1892 to 1954, will be open to the public, starting tomorrow, for the first time in 22 years.

title: Ellis Island Tours
description: Ellis Island. where some 12 million immigrants entered the United States, will he opened to the public tomorrow for the first time in 22 years, with daily tours conducted by the National Park Service. Page C1.

title: Miss Ray to Publish Her Story in the Form of Novel
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Rather than identifying real people Elizabeth Ray's book about her alleged affairs with members of Congress will be published as a novel, the books publisher said today.

title: How to Get There
description: On the New England Thruway, Route 95, traveling from New York, get off at Exit 12, Rye. From Connecticut, take Exit 13, Cottage Street. From the Cross Westchester Expressway. Route 287, take the Rye exit and the Boston Post Road south. Rye is also served by New Haven Railroad and Amtrak.

title: Arabs to Rival Israel's Chess Olympics
description: Israel will be giving visiting chess players a 50 percent discount on El Al economy fares, hoteltourbreakfast packages, free visas and trips to Jerusalem and Galilee with free lunches.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Port of Entry
description: Ellis Island is a monument because, like Mt. Everest, it is there. No piece of American land has been more symbolic of this country's history; 12 million immigrants arrived through those somber, turnofthecentury brick buildings and their predecessors. Possibly 100 million Americans today can trace their heritage to its soil.

title: Evans, Miss Snyder Win Derwent Awards
description: Nancy Snyder, who opened in Jules Feiffer's comedy, Knock Knock, and Peter Evans, who plays the role of the homosexual in David Rabe's Streamers, were chosen yesterday as winners of the 32d annual Clarence Derwent acting awards.

title: Ea. AGAIN HOLDS WATS LINE RATES OF ANT, ILLEGAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 27In a move that could have a significant impact upon the price of longdistance telephone calls, the Federal Communications Commission today ruled, 7 to 0, that the rates charged for the popular WATS lines of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company were illegal. A.T.&T. is the parent company of the Bell Telephone System.

title: Governor Offers Cunningham His Sympathy Over Indictment
description: Governor Carey telephoned the embattled Democratic state chairman, Patrick J. Cunningham. yesterday to chat sympathetically about Mr. Cunningbarn's indictment, but not to ask for his resignation.

title: Britain Seeksto Use Waves f or Energy
description: LONDONFor centuries the tempestuous seas around Britain's coastline have served as a barrier against invasion and as an inspiration to its poets. Now the waves that pound those bulwarks may be put to use.

title: JUDGE TO RESIGN OVER HIS SALARY
description: NEWARK. May 27Superior Court judge Irwin I. Kimmelman said today that he was retiring from the bench because his $40,000ayear salary was not commensurate with the service he was called on to perform.

title: About Real Estate
description: Out of an excavation on the northeast corner of 56th Street and Broadway a 36story apartment house is about to rise.

title: MAJOR SHIFT URGED ON SOCIAL SECURITY
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) Major changes in financing the Social Security program or a reduction in benefits will be required eventually to protect its longterm integrity, a Congressional study said today.

title: Experts Say New Election Fund Law Saved Carter From a Blitz by Rivals
description: ATLANTA  Jimmy Carter has probably been the principal beneficiary of the new Federal legislation that controls the use of money in Presidential cam Daigns.

title: Rhodesian Fighting Takes Heavy Toll of Innocent
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 22As the fighting mounts steadily here, so does the number of innocent victimsblack African men, women and children living in thatched huts on the tribal trust lands.

title: The Labor Scene
description: Conflicting signals are coming from the Soviet Union on how ready it is to help depoliticize the International Labor Organization and thus keep the United States from carrying out its threat to quit the world labor body at the end of next year.

title: Stocks on Amex And Counter Slip On Rate Concern
description: Rising shortterm interest rates and concern over an increase in the prime rate sentl prices lower yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market.

title: Opera: Sexton's Grimm
description: TRADITIONALLY, madness in opera is something the heroine resorts to when things have gone wrong for her and a big solo scene with lots of brilliant singing will add shape and excitement to the work involved. One may feel a trifle sad when Lucia goes to pieces in Donizetti's opera about life at Lammermoor, but it is impossible to get terribly exercised about a girl whose coloratura continues lithe no matter what and whose distress does not keep her from harmonizing perfectly witha flute.

title: Moscow to Count Tigers
description: MOSCOW, May 27 (Reuters) Wildlife experts are soon to begin counting every tiger living in the Soviet Union, according to Tass, the Soviet press agency. The sensus is to start in eastern Siberia, the habitat of the biggest Soviet species. Tigers are also found in the Amu Darya area of Central Asia.

title: Esposito Glad Hodge Is a Ranger; Frazier Thinks He'll Stay a Knick
description: The main topic of Conversation at a special luncheon at. Gallagher's restaurant yesterday was supposed to be the sixth annual sports celebrity tennis tournament for the Dewar's Cup, starting on June 7 in Las Vegas. But some of the athletes, such as Phil Esposito of the Rangers, Walt Frazier of the Knicks and Rick Barry, of the Golden State Warriors, found other subjects  which involved their specialty sports more fascinating.

title: Garrett Is Hero of 52 Game
description: PHILADELPHIA. May 27After suffering dreadfully for three nights at the hands and bats of the firstplace Philadelphia Phillies, the Mets got a measure of revenge tonight with a fourrun ninth inning and a 52 victory.

title: Scientists Plan AllOut Loch Ness Search
description: There is something irresistible about the Loch Ness monster, like a mountain unconquered, a river unnavigated, a flying object unidentified.

title: OPEC Ministers Meeting Opens in Note of Discord
description: KUTA BEACH, Bali, Indonesia, May 27The conference of the oil ministers of the member nations of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries opened today on a note of public discord that was seen by insiders as oil politics as usual but was likely to foreshadow private agreement.

title: TOP WEEKEND FILMS
description: TODAY

title: Singapore Reports Finding a Network Of Subversive Cells
description: SINGAPORE, May 27 (Reuters)  The Government announced today that the police had smashed underground Communist cells and found network of subversive plans linked to activities in Australia, [Malaysia and Thailand.

title: F.C.C. Member Complains
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) A Federal Communications commissioner complained today that the F.C.C. had lost its ability to control A.T.&T., saying the company continued to charge customers rates the commission found unlawful.

title: WENDELLP. DODGE, EXPLORER, WRITER
description: Dame Maggie Teyte

title: Weekend Gardening
description: THE FULL moon in May, which this year came on the 13th, traditionally marks the last chance of frost in our region. The danger from frost should he past, and almost every gardener with a patch of land to tend is outside, tending it. For the indoor gardener also, its the perfect time for a bit of spring houseplant cleaning.

title: Rums feld Denies Helping Lockheed in Japan Deal
description: HONOLULU, May 27 (UPI)Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld said today that fifthlevel functionary of the Defense Department had asked Japan about its rcquctance to purchase Lockheed planes but that he himself did not intercede in the matter as reported in an article in The New York Times.

title: Electric Eclectic Bleecker Weekends
description: Bleecker Street is Saturday night and Sunday morning, an eclectic mixed bag that very much reflects the Greenwich Village community. It is a street to wander in, crammed with unusual shops to visit and to buy in, with bakeries, bread stores and eating places and with places to hear music  all kinds of music.

title: Proposed Tuition Rise Clouds Rutgers Graduation
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 27A possible tuiton rise at Rutgers that would make the 210yearold institution the most expensive state university in the nation as of July 1 cast a pall today on commencement ceremonies.

title: NEW CURBS ON ART LIKELY IN RUMANIA
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, May 23In the belief that Rumania's culture must be still more disciplined and politically purposeful, Communist leaders here are about to stage the nation's first congress on politicall education and social culture.

title: Betty Ford Urges Big Vote in Jersey
description: TRENTON, May 27Betty Ford swept into New Jersey today to visit a $13 million mansion and to give pep talks to Republican leaders and campaign workers in the hope that they will help get out the primary vote for her husband on June 8.

title: UNIT LABOR COSTS GREW ONLY 0.6% IN FIRST QUARTER
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Unit labor costs in the corporate sector of the economy rose less than 1 percent from the first quarter of 1975 to the first quarter of 1976, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Red Sox Edge Brewers, 21, As Jenkins Hurls 4Hitter
description: After a horrible start for Ferguson Jenkins in particular and the Red Sox in general Boston is beginning to display the form that carried it to the American League pennant a year ago.

title: Books of The Times
description: WOMEN make much better soldiers than men. They always know where the real enemy is hidden. They're realists like children and they are undistracted by fireworks. TD knows her enemy lies hidden behind the hillock of my charm. . . . Beyond my charm lies my execrable character. You wouldn't have it different, would you? You're a true de Sade minor character. You've been willing to go to the castle with on of his monsters and your thrashings and complaints are not attempts to break out but simply part, as . . . James would say, of the Donnee. It makes you all the more delicious to the monster. This is Wolf speaking. He is a novelist, TD's allegedly affectionate husband, and he is dying. In him, the literature of dying, which plays an increasing part in today's fiction and nonfiction, reaches a new stage of sophistication: I was glad to see him go. I was tired of his not very witty pontifications, his unimaginative male chauvinism, his egomania, his sexual braggadocio, and his unkindness. I don't know what Jose Yglesias intended for us to feel about Wolf in The Kill Price, but this was his effect
