title: Reopened Ellis Island Proves Sellout Attraction for Tourists
description: Ellis Island, which closed in 1954 after a 62year run as the greatest immigration center in history, was reopened yesterday to the public to become an instant smash hit as a tourist attraction.

description: A few years ago I at in a motor launch tarrying tourists to Kabarega (then Murchison) Falls in Uganda. Cr???odiles lolled in the gunmetalFray ???aters of the Nile: elephants browsed the distant river bank:. We were surrounded by primeval nature, traveling through a prehistory when animals reigned supreme. An elderly woman on the lnunch interrupted my thoughts. This is almost like Disneyland, she said, not very enthusiastically.

Y.. was married to Timothy Gamier Baldwin, son of Mr. and Mrs. William J. Baldwin of Oakmont, Pa. The Rev. Paul Nix performed the ceremony.

description: At first, the idea of spending a week al a &de ranch sounded implausible. Pam not by nature a jock. I have always thought cowboy lore a bore. And the little riding I did 20 years ago at a sumtier camp left me with no fond memories of horses or selfconfidence in my equestrian abilities.

title: Women's Relay Mark Set
description: EAST BERLIN, May 29 (AP) East German women sprinted to a world track record in the 400meter relay today, clocking 42.50 seconds to better their previous mark by onehundredths of a second. ADN, the East German news agency, said the record was set at a competition in Karl Marx Stadt by the team of ?dailies Oelsner. Renate Stecher, Carla Boaendorf and Marina Bios.

title: .. . the Ford Response
description: The Ripon endorsement tactfully omits the fact that although Mr. Ford on some issues is more moderate and more responsible than Mr. Reaganas, for example, on the complex Panama Canal negotiationsthe President has hardly given progressive and centrist Republicans much to cheer about. Instead, he has allowed Governor Reagan to push him steadily to farright positions.

title: Legal, Normal Politics Is Continual BackScratching
description: The political scientist Harold Lasswell once defined politics as who gets what, when and how; the political practitioner George Washington Plunkitt said he would accept as his epitaph, He seen his opportunities and he took em.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, May 29 (UPI) Ferrari,took the first two spots on the grid for the Grand Prix of Monaco. today, Niki Lauda and Clay Regazzoni gunned their scarlet Italian machines on to the front row for tomorrow's 156mile race. Lauda, the reigning world champion from Austria who has already won four of the five races run this year, will start from the pole after clocking 1 minute 29.65 seconds in he final qualifying session, averaging 82.6 miles per hour. Regazzoni, the 35yearold Swiss who won the Long Beach Grand Prix, was fractionally slower in 1:29.91. The Ferraris were the only cars to lap the twisting twomile circuit in under 90 seconds.

title: Bridal Style: No Bare Feet
description: ABLUEJEANED, Tshirted young couple sauntered into a jewelry store in the Roosevelt Field shopping plaza the other evening. They walked to a display case of watches, stood for a moment then glanced aboutas if to see who might be watching and headed for the diamond rings.

title: Arnold Palmer, the God of Go and How He Got That Way

title: Chicago Schools Deficit To Force Early Closing
description: CHICAGO, May 29 Faced with a $60million operating deficit, Chicago's public schools are planning to close 16 days earlier than scheduled this year to save enough money to avoid bankruptcy.

title: A Pause for Thought
description: PICTURE a young man, a student, standing tall, but waking from a deep sleep. He stretches his arms, rubs his eyes and looks around. He is standing in the middle of a road. Directly behind him there is a wall that reaches as high as the morning clouds and in front of him a road that forks in countless directions. People begin to urge him forward. Dazed, he looks at the road ahead and then falls asleep again.

description: ADREW UNIVERSITY task force that has been studying the moral, ethical, legal and other considerations that would weigh in a decision to end medical treatment for a patient such as Karen Anne Quinlan has come up with some preliminary and, perhaps, surprising answers.

title: A Case of Negligent Heroism?
description: THE question to be determined on this motion is simply this: Have the People presented evidence sufficient to sustain a jury verdict of guilty of criminally negligent homicide beyond a reasonable doubt?

title: Paris Moving Toward a Decision on Aiding Food Fund for Poor Countries
description: PARIS, May 29 Reacting to; pressure from developing countries and from some of its partners among the nonCommut nist industrial countries, the French Government is moving: toward a decision to contribute to a $1billion fund that aims. to build up food supplies in poor countries.

description: Mrs. Martha du Pont Scott's purchase last October of Proud Delta for 5250,000 as an addition to her Montpelier string continued to pay lucrative dividends yesterday as the 4yearold daughter of Delta Judge rushed to her third straight stakes victory.

description: Barnard College and Columbia Universityaffiliated for 87 yearsappear to be on a collision course in a struggle over whether Barnard will survive as an Independent women's institution or be merged into Columbia College.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THE Long Island vacation region starts just south of Queens, at Atlantic Beach, and reaches all the way east to the tip of the two forks. The island has camping, horseback riding, fishing, hiking, poison ivy, traffic jams, hotels, motels, Howard Johnsons, long lines at restaurants. Everything that constitutes ideal resort country.

title: 150 MILLION IN U.S. ARE OF VOTING AGE
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (UPI) The number of citizens of voting age for the November election will be 10 million higher than the 1972 Presidential election, the Census Bureau said Thursday.

description: Cardinal From Hanoi

title: Endpaper
description: Jerome Snyder wanted this page to be his tribute to some Noble Investigators"a few intrepid. unsung anatomical explorers who, Jerome said, brought light and knowledge to the dark recesses of our body's terra incognita. These are actual territories of the human body. authentically describedand uniquely depictedby Jerome. We would like this page to be our tribute to that intrepid explorer Jerome Snyder. a remarkable man, who died earlier this month at the age of 60. He, too, was a noble investigator, who brought us light, and knowledge. We loved him and we miss him.

title: Red Hook Loft Easy on Budget
description: Not everything was and is as it might seem in Christina and Vincas Meilus's loft homea furniture factory they renovated for the unheard of cost of $2 a square foot.

title: Port Foreign Trade Survives Recession
description: The port's foreign commerce by sea and air last year weathered successfully the effects of the deepest national and worldwide recession since the end of World War II, tne prt Authority of New York and New Jersey has reported. Although the port's overall foreign trade was down by 2.3 percent in value from the 1974 record, William J. Ronan, the blstate agency's chairman, noted that foreign trade here began to move toward full recovery in the fourth quarter of 1975. Mr. Ronan called this an encouraging trend.

title: A Plea for a Good Public Athletic Field in the City
description: New York City does not have an accessible, firstclass public athletic field. We have no public, lighted, allweather track that can be used year round by joggers as well as Olympiccaliber athletes. We have no public football field covered by artificial turf, the only surface that can survive daily use by amateur teams.

title: Elimination of City Pension Benefits Urged to Save $135 Million
description: The Temporary Commission on City Finances recommended Yesterday that three New York City retirement benefits be eliminated to save $135 million annually and to assist the city in coping with mounting pension costs.

title: Jets Keeping Line Open for a Call From Riggins
description: The coming week will be intportant for the Jets and for Al Ward, the general manager. Ward will be expecting a phone call from either John Riggins or his friend and for. mer teammate, Bob Billings, who has been acting as Riggins's ad. viscr. The big fullback from Centralia,Ran., who played out his option with the Jets and became a free agent on May 1, will review the offers he has had and he has promised Ward his next move will be to call and give the Jets the right of first refusal in matching offers.

title: Ethiopia, an Unknown, Violent Country
description: ADDIS ABABA, EthiopiaIt is one of the poorest nations in the world, yet its current military regime has quietly agreed to buy more than $200 million in jet fighters and radar equipment from the United States by next year. It suffered a drought in 1973 that caused the starvation deaths of More than 100,000 people. yet the old regime of Emperor Haile Selassie engaged in a venal coverup of the disaster.

title: $1.7 Million Airport Expansion Is Planned by Saratoga County
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y. County officials have announced a fiveyear, $1.7 million expansion program for the Saratoga County Airport.

title: A Nadjari Shoe Drops
description: Special State Prosecutor Maurice H. Nadjari has delivered the indictments of political and judicial figures he has been promising, and the charges carry the potential for serious damage to the New York State Democratic Party and, to a lesser extent, even to the national Democratic image. How much of that potential is realized, however, depends on whether the indictments stand up in court.

title: Nigeria Widens Red Links
description: LAGOS, Nigeria. May 29 (Agence FrancePresse) Nigeria is to open diplomatic relations at ambassadorial level, with North Korea as well as North and South Vietnam with, immediate effect, it was announced here yesterday. Nigeria will also open resident missions in Cuba and Yugoslavia, it was announced.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: A shortage of teachers sent three education officials from Lanarkshire, Scotland, to Lexington, Mass., in April 1975 in search of elementaryschool and secondaryschool applicants. After advertising in newspapers in Boston and New York, the Scottish officials said they had received 600 inquiries.

title: The Peeling Of the Potato Speculators
description: Few vegetables that pass across the checkout counters of supermarkets are as mundane as the potato. Yet potatoes are big business in the commodity markets, and last week they found their way into the public spotlight in one of the biggest financial scandals to hit the markets in years.

title: PEOPLE
description: Will Herberg, one of the nation's bestknown theological scholars, will retire from his professorship of philosophy and culture at Drew University at the end of the academic year. The 74yearold Mr. Herberg, who has been at the Madison school for 21 years, is in failing health and plans to live in retirement in his tiny booklined apartment near the campus. Although in his youth he was a selfproclaimed Marxist radical, in recent years Mr. Herberg has been regarded as conservative. William F. Buckley Jr., for whose National Review Mr. Herberg has written many articles, has described him as a great and humane teacher and being among the truly erudite men in America.

title: SAUDIS DOMINATE Al OPEC PARLEY
description: KUTA BEACH, Indonesia, May 29Saudi Arabia has emerged from this week's meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries in the position of virtually dictating the major policy decisions of the group.

title: Righteousness vs. Politics
description: CAPE MAY THE old pros came back to power in Cape May on Election Day. It was almost as inexorable as the Atlantic Ocean breaking over the sea wall. A lot of citizens were distressed, but few were really surprised.

title: French Company to Build South African Atom Plant
description: CAPE TOWN, May 29 Faced with mounting political opposition in the United States and the Netherlands, South Africa's Electricity Supply Commission today reversed an earlier decision in favor of an American, Dutch and Swiss consortium and awarded a contract worth nearly $1 billion for the country's first nuclear power plant to a French group.

title: When sisterhood turns sour
description: With only faint tremors of reluctance, I can say that I'm a good example of what the women's movement produces. I embraced consciousnessraising and supportiveness, once I discovered they were there, with a passion I'd previously reserved for smoothly waxed floors and bouillabaisse. I took pride in my sex till I bored the hell out of everyone. Lately, however, I find myself feeling extremely competitive with other women, at least those in my profession.

title: How Dance Conquered The TV Screen
description: When Channel 13 presents an hourlong broadcast on the Pennsylvania Ballet at 9 P.M. this Wednesday, the program will be the fourth in public television's Dance in America series. It will also mark the completion of the first half of the twoyear project. and thus presents an opportunity to evaluate the series so far.

title: The Eternal NursingHome Inquiries

Udall asks his audiences these clays, that the last survivors of the gaggle of Democratic Presidential aspirants that clogged the airlines in January would be a peanut farmer and this old basketball player? Who, indeed? The impression is inescapable, somehow. that Mr. Udall himself wouldn't have taken odds on himself back in the snows of New Hampshire. But now, in Ohio, Mr. Udall believes.

description: BOSTON, May 29 A majority of American public schools still ignore the spirit of the First Amendment and the Supreme Court rulings upholding the principle of separation of church and state, according to a survey of the AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith.

title: STAMPS
description: It is Benjamin Franklin's year as much as Thomas Jefferson's, no doubt about it In a simultaneous first day of issue in the United Kingdom and the United States, Great Britain is issuing this Wednesday a commemorative for Franklin, following by a day the scheduled simultaneous issuance of Franklin stamps of like design by the U.S. and Canada. Ireland issued Franklin stamps a fortnight earlier.

The forecast for tomorrow was partly sunny with temperatures in the upper 60's to mid 70's..

description: Before mapping a plan to build the West's first downtown subway, Denver transit officials weighed the demands on their transportation system and calculated they needed either a rapid rail line or 18 new lanes of highway. With the Rockies already shrouded in auto fumes, they opted for the mass transit link and are awaiting Federal awroval.

description: Former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia holds a substantial lead over both President Ford and former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California in the latest trial Presidential election survey, according to the Gallup Poll.

title: Home Clinic
description: In an effort to catch up on the backlog of unanswered questions most of the Home Improvement column this week is again being devoted to Questions and Answers. Many of the letters published here ask questions similar to those posed by other readers whose actual letters may not appear here, but who will, nevertheless, find their anwers printed below. Readers sending in questions about home repair problems should address them to: Home Improvement Department, The New York Times, Times Square, New York, N.Y. 10036. Only those questions of general interest will be answered here.

title: Wisconsin Crew Is Seeking 4th Title
description: SYRACUSE, May 29 (AP)  Wisconsin will seek its fourth straight national intercollegiate rowing championship when 98 crews converge next week on Onondaga Lake for the 74th annual regatta.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONSixteen years ago this fall, John F. Kennedy destroyed one of the shibboleths of American politics, that a Roman Catholic could not be elected President. So completely did he erase the memory of Alfred E. Smith's disastrous 1924 defeat that in every Democratic primary campaign since then, at least one of the contenders has been Catholic.

title: Notes: Cruises Are At an AllTime Peak
description: The cruise business is booming. Bookings are at an alltime high and well over a million Americans and Canadians are expected to take seagoing vacations this year. They will have a wider choice of vt.sels than ever. Twentyfour new cruise liners have been built since 1970 and an equal number of older ships have been reconditioned.

title: Stamen Rejoins Pirates
description: PITTSBURGH. May 29 (UPI)  Willie Stargell of the Pittsburgh Pirates will rejoin the team tomorrow because. of his wife's improved condition following surgery for removal of a bled clot no the brain. Mrs. Stargell was operated on last, Monday night. Stargell played while the Pirates were at borne earlier this week but remained hehind when the team left for Chicago.

title: Gala for Yorkville Council
description: Proceeds from the June 22 performance by the American Ballet Theater at the Metropolitan Opera House will go to the Yorkville Youth Council. Tickets, at $30, $55 and $75, are available from Mrs. Gillette Boland, 40 East 68th Street, as are $10 tickets for a preperformance supper at the Opera Club to meet Yoko Morlshlta the dancer.

title: Cossacks of the Aquacultural Revolution
description: EASTERN LONG ISLAND is uniquely situated on the shores of an aquacullural revolution. The East End's traditions and resources are linked with what has long been one of the world's most diversified fisheries, stretching from inshore wetlands and bays to the offshore continental shelf. But. fishing isn't nearly as good as it used to be. There are obvious reasons, such as overfishing and pollution, and less obvious ones that have to do with changes in the oceanic atmosphere and natural cycles of abundance and scarcity.

description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 29  About 50 people were killed and wounded this morning when mortars from Christian positions poured down on the openair vege table market outside Sabra, the Palestinian refugee camp in the southern part of the city. Beirut and the rest of Lebanon were beginning a fa miliar kind of Saturday.

description: To the Editor:

title: River Races Offer A New Dimension
description: The 72 small sailboats sped down the Connecticut River, propelled by fair winds and a swift current. With their bright, multicolored sails the Sunfish resembled a stream of butterflies fluttering between the lush, bordering forests. This was longdistance river racing, a new dimension in sailing. For some it was a fascinating alternative to roundthebuoy racing. Fe others it was a great escape two days, 50 miles of a magnificent river.

title: Protein From Petroleum Not Ready for Use in Food
description: BONN, May 26 After almost 20 years of experimentation and development the production of petroleum  derived proteins has reached several hundred thousand tons a year. but formidable obstacles still block its becoming a major food surce, at least in the West.

title: Tenafly Tract Faces Challenge
description: ASERIOUS challenge has been posed to Tenafly's plans to purchase a 274acre wooded tract from a Texas developer by means of condemnation proceedings that have been going on for two years The challenge stems from a taxpayer's suit, filed sack, which seeks to set aside all actions of the borough to acquire the tract and to restrain any further payments on the project.

title: Gye Pritzier Married to Alan Brunner
description: Gye Elizabeth Pritzier, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sverre Pritzier of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Alan Gargan Brunner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Louis Brunner of Darien, Conn.

title: Design
description: With summer just around the corner, it's time for dining alfresco. This season's crop of items for deck, patio and picnics ranges from imported umbrellas and trays to countrylooking stoneware and bandanaprint napkins.

title: Indian Sees Benefits in His 8 Children
description: BABARPUR, India, May 24  Munshi Ram, an illitcrote laborer who lives in a crude mud hut in this village 360 miles north of New Delhi, has no land and very little. money. But he has eight children, and he regards them as his greatest wealth.

title: Wright Wins in Debut
description: TOKYO. March 29 (AP)  A former American League pitcher, Clyde Wright, made his debut in Japanese baseball today, hurling the Yomiuri Giants to a 63 victory over the Taiyo Whales. Wright pitched for California, Texas and Milwaukee in the American League.

description: General

title: East Hampton
description: EAST HAMPTON IT began as a kind of vague germ of an idea I had three years ago, explained Enez Whipple, director of Guild Hall. But it would have to be a major undertaking requiring somebody working on it full time, and we just didn't have the funds for that kind of concentration.

title: Ann H. Laundon Planning Bridal To a Geologist
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Aithur Samuel Laundon of Darien, Conn.. and Paget. Bermuda, of the engagement of their daughter, Ann Hoyt Laundon, to Dr. Franz Elmer, Anderson of Strafford, N. H. son of Mr. and Mrs. Elmer Carl Anderson of Palo Alto, Calif.

title: REPRESSION RISE SEEN IN RUMANIA
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, May 23 Official repression in Rumania has increased markedly during the last year, despite humanitarian agreements reached last year by European chiefs of state at Helsinki, according to Western and other observers.

title: AMPLE WATER SEEN IN UPPER MISSISSIPPI
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP)  The United States Geological Survey has reported that untapped ground water in the Upper Mississippi Region could, if managed carefully, support an anticipated tripling of waterl demand during the next 45 years.

title: Times Slack, But Builder On East Side Keeps Going
description: AS a developer and owner whose luxury apartment towers have transformed much of the East Side in the last 16 years, Martin B. Swarzman has not allowed his pessimism over the real estait market to interfere with success.

title: Peyser Starts a Drive By Petition for Senate
description: While attention has been focused on the scramble for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate, Representative Peter A. Peyser, RepublicanConservafive of Irvington, has started distributing designating petitions to supporters around the state to back up his threat to challenge Senator James L. Buckley for the Republican nomination for the Senate.

title: R.R.Allen Jr. Weds Christine C. Fisher
description: Christine Chase Fisher, who received a bachelor's degree in special education magna cum laude from Boston College last Monday, was married yesterday to Radford Reed Allen Jr., a sales representative with the Aetna Life and Casualty Company in Burlington, Mass.

title: New Engineer Corps Chief
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP)  President Ford has named Maj. Gen. John W. Morris as the new head of the Army Corps of Engineers, replacing Lieut. Gen. William Gribble Jr., who retired earlier this month.

description: We are so prepared for irony in our intellectual life these days that a title

title: If Congress Examined Itself, Sex Might Be Just a Start
description: WASHINGTONCongress devotes a good deal of its time and taxpayers money to investigating what other people do. But Congress seldom investigates itself, whether its members are breaking the law or abusing their office, and the reason is transparent.

title: Jackie Pung, a Butterfly, Attempts L.P.G.A. Comeback
description: I feel like a butterfly that's come out of a cocoon, soft and gentle and small again, said Jackie Pung, the Hawaiian golfer who, at 55, is returning to the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour this week after an 11year absence.

title: Music in Review
description: Leo Mitchell, a former barltone, made his debut as a tenor on Sunday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, but sounded uncomfortable and under strain in his chosen new range.

description: The Case Against a Planetary Ant Heap

title: Posthumous poems, translated poems, and two novels of experiment
description: Harder to detect than banalities about young love and springtime, the various sentimentalities of madness and suicide have peculiar appeal in our era. Anne Sexton's biography authenticates her poetry, her selfinflicted death attesting to the reality of her pain: how unfeeling, then, for a reader to complain about the facility with which she renders human suffering. Yet 45 Mercy Street, a poet record of the miseries of divorce, sexuality, daughterhood, shows the devices of selfrevelation hardened into mannerism. However genuine the anguish, its rendition here raises large questions about the esthetic possibiliies of raw confession in poetry. How, for instance, can one properly respond to lines as grotesquely uncontrolled as these?

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: Today through SaturdayDevon, Devon Show Grounds. Lancaster Pike, Devon. Pa. Regular and green conformation hunters. Regular, green, amateurowner and junior working hunters; open, intermediate and junior jumpers; ponies, threegaited. fivegaited, fine harness, Hackney, Welsh. fourinhands. 8 A.M. daily except today at 2 P.M.

title: U.S., Getting Tip, Urges Tight Security At Nuclear Plants for Next Few Days
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 The utility operators of the cowl. try's 58 nuclear power plants have been warned to keep their security forces on special alert over the next several days, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission said today.

title: ALBANY NOTEBOOK
description: ANOTHER aspect of Suffolk County's controversial Southwest Sewer District construction project became embroiled in Albany politics recently when the Assembly's Democratic majority blocked a bill that would have allowed Federal revenuesharing funds to help pay for the project.

title: Crime Doesn't Pay Its Victims Very Well, Either
description: Before the summer, Congress probably will pass legislation that provides for compensation for victims of crimes and President Ford is expected to sign the bill into law. The Federal Government will join 12 states, several Canadian provinces and Britain, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, New Zealand and parts of Australia in offering assistance to innocent individuals who have paid medical expenses or suffered loss of income as the result of a crime.

title: Finnish Smoke Ads Opposed
description: HELSINKI, Finland, May 29 (Reuters)  A Parliamentary commission has proposed a ban im the advertising of cigarettes, cigars and tobacco in Finland. Ii rejected a suggestion that kmokers pay higher fares on trains.

title: Wood, Field &
description: ROSCOE. N. Y.A nearly full moon hung low in the west and wished the wooded hillsides with its unearthly light when Paul Updike of Roscoe and I set forth on the third, day of our spring turkey hunt.

title: Revlon Puts on a New Face
description: When an outsider trained In business schools and in a giant conglomerate replaces a founding entrepreneur who was an instinctive marketing genius, there's always concern lest the newcomer tamper with the output of golden eggs.

title: The World
description: TEHERAN, IranTwoandahalf years have passed since oil prices began their abrupt, fourfold rise, and the subsequent shower of wealth has been transforming the seonomic landscapes of the oilproducing nations and seeping down, though many strata, into their social and political aie. The results have been as various as they have been profound, depending on quirks of history and demography in the individual nations and on the different oil revenues.

title: New Products for the Handyman
description: Doityourselfers who have wanted to be able to do brazing, yet have been reluctant to spend the money involved ;n buying the kind of welding outfit needed to supply enough heat for the purpose, will undoubtedly be interested in the new Super Torch recently introduced by the Rernzomatic Corporation, Rochester, N.Y. 14613. Uti}izing disposable cylinders of Nlapp gas, the new torch has Special Cyclone Jet burner that. more than coubles the amount of BTU's supplied. This heat permits the user to do all kinds of brazing jobs when repairing household items, metal furniture, tools, bicycles and toys, as well as for jewelry making and metal working projects. (Properly brazed joints are, in most cases. just as strong as welding.) Sold in harware and department stores, the Super Torch has a suggested selling price of just under $20 with one tank of gas; a kit wiih pencil hurmar, dark glasses. six brazing rods, and other accessories, is priced at about S30.

title: Molloy Wins Track Title In C.H.S.A.A.
description: Luis Ostolozaga and Maurice Weaver played a game of cat and mouse yesterday in the twomile run at the Catholic High Schools Athletic Association outdoor track and field championships at Downing Stadium.

title: Olympia Brewery Takes a Giant Step East
description: OLYMPIA, Wash.We took a hard look at the facts. We were classified as a regbnal breweras were most of the hundreds of companies who've failed in our industry. To survive, we had to reach out beyond our market area.

title: Alone in Her Car
description: I AM a practicing ecologist. I recycle my newspapers and my tin cans, I save my bottles and I even remember to sort them by color and remove the rings at the neck. I don't burn leaves, I use organic fertilizers and I gave up smoking. I try to live the good clean life of an American ecologist. But I'll never make the team in the big ecology games.

title: Rev. Henry Lawrence Scott Jr. Fiance of Margaret C. Howell
description: Mrs. Richardson Howell of Atlanta has made known the engagement of her daughter, Margaret Carr Howell, to the Rev. Henry Lawrence Scott Jr., associate rector at Sr. Paul's Episcopal Church in Darien. Conn.

title: Music: Atlantans Series
description: The Atlanta Symphony Orchestra's Beethoven Festival tole a genuinely festive turn at Carnegie Hall on Friday night when the concertofilled second event took place. A program made up of the Piano Concerto No. 5 ("Emperor"), the Violin Concerto and the Triple Concerto qualifies as unusual by almost any standard, and the unusual is what any festival should provide.

title: Atom Test Limits
description: The new SovietAmerican treaty restricting peaceful nuclear explosions (PEN'S) that was signed by President Ford and Soviet Communist Party leader Brezhnev Friday paradoxically does more to curb the military atom than the 1974 weapons limitation pact that spawned it. And the PNE treaty itself is overshadowed by its annex, .a,.protocol four times longer that is by far the single most important document in this twoyear complex of agreements. This is the protocol that provides for the first time a precedent for onsite inspection of arms ccmtrol measures inside the Soviet Union, and provides it in an extraordinarily detailed way.

title: Ideas &
description: WASHINGTONThere are not too many areas left the United States where from heaven breaketh open seemingly infinite clean air. Chief among those that remain are the national parks, wilderness areas and stretches national forest. For years conservationists and representatives of industry have battledin Congressional and departmental hearings and in the courtsover the future of these clean regions.

title: 7 Offer to Care for Miss Quinlan Without Extraordinary Methods
description: The parents of Karen Anne Quinland have found seven physicians willing to treat the 22yearold comatose woman as a chroniccare patient and to refrain from using extraordinary medical procedures to keep her alive, but have not found a medical facility that will accept the young woman as a patient.

title: Fantasy Boom: The Profits Are Real
description: In February 5,500 people attended a convention at the Commodore Hole in New York City. Their median age was 15, but the youngest was 6 and the oldest over SO. Most were white, middle class, of above average intelligence and possessed of a higher education or in pursuit of one. A golden age group ,of 150all over 65had conic up from Florida. One participant had flown in specially from Japan and another from Australia. Their mission: to look into Klingons, Romulans, Vu!cans and Salt Vampires and consider such. questions as. How many tribles fell on Captain Kirk from the storage compartment of the U.S.S. Enterprise? (Answer: 1,771.561). The conventioneers were, of course. Star Trekkies.

title: A Plan to Ease Youth Joblessness Is Drafted by Business and Union Leaders
description: The American Assembly on Manpower Goals proposed broad program last week for reducing overall unemployment and for assisting poorly prepared young people in obtaining work.

title: Leila Hadley, Travel Author, Has Nuptials
description: Leila Eliot Burton Hadley Smitter, who as Leila Hadley is author of Fielding's Guide to Traveling With Children in Europe, was married in Erwinna, Pa., yesterday afternoon to William Charles John Musham. He is chairman of the board and president of the ITE Imperial Corporation, manufacturer of electrical, pneumatic and hydraulic power systems, and vice chairman of the parent comGould Inc. of Chicaro.

title: Carey Asks $3.7 Million to Computerize Data on Relief Recipients
description: ALBANY, May 29 Governor Carey asked the Legislature today to appropriate 33.7 million for the development of central computer registries of all welfare and Medicaid recipients in the state.

title: TV VIEW
description: The inevitable clash between action and reaction seems to have intensified for journalism these days. The postWatergate honors due the profession are being followed by increasingly tough questionings of methods and practices. While Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein as played by Robert Redford and Dustin Hoffman in All the President's Men are currently being embraced at movie box offices, the latest book by the two Washington Post reporters, The Final Hours, is being severely criticized in certain responsible quarters for some of its journalistic techniques. As a television critic, I am naturally most concerned with the relatively new phenomenon of electronic journalism. And as a fairly reasonable mortal, I prefer to focus on the best. 60 Minutes, the highly successful magazine produced by CBS News, usually serves my purpose quite nicely.

title: Margaret Helen Smithers Is Bride
description: Margaret Helen Smithers, daughter of Mrs. S. Phelps Platt Jr. of New York and Chatham, Mass., was married yesterday afternoon in New Haven to John Crawford Koeniger 2d, son of Mr. Koeniger and Mrs. Charles A. Kirkland, both of Short Hills, N. J.

title: The Boom Came And Stayed
description: The peculiar is becoming permanent. It's just three years ago that I looked up and down Broadway and saw no onereally no oneheading far a theater box office. The absence of vitality was so marked, and so slokening that I found myself suggestingin an admitted fantasiathat we tear the theater district up by the roots and plant it elsewhere. I'd no sooner spoken, it seemed, than the peculiar began poking its head around the corner. The summer before last or about two and onehalf years agoan audience, a very sizable audience, began marching into lobbies, pockets ?? with money, for no discernible reason whatsoever. There hadn't been any new hits or new stars or new critical raves to lure them on. They'd just come. They're still there. More than that. They now seem to have brought their sisters and their cousins and their aunts with them.

title: Point of View
description: What a wondrous machine is our judicial system!

description: TRENTON NEW JERSEY, searching for a new tax to find the $378 million or so needed to balance the 197677 public school budget, is severely restricted in possible choices. Most taxes commonly imposed by states are already in effect here, except for a levy on income, which has just been rejected again by the Legislature.

The World

title: Doctor Rat
description: While technically sportive and sometimes successfully lyrical, William Kotzwinkle's novel about man's inhumanity to rats, dogs, snakes, lions, elephants, bears, whales, turtles, etc. is so recklessly sentimental in its argument as to be food fit for Lynette (Squeaky) Fromme and other such fauna children. Doctor Rat did not quite make me want to go out and shoot dachshunds; but it did not persuade me, as it seems to have meant to, that laboratory research, using animals, into the causes of cancer is the equivalent of Dr. Mengele's experiments at Auschwitz.

title: 3DWORLD EDITORS PLAN A NEWS POOL
description: NEW DELHI, May 29 Should an Indian newspaper reader have to depend upon the account of an American or British reporter to learn what is happening in Burma? or Nigeria? or Vietnam? For years, the question has been nagging thirdworld editors who are concerned about the domination of the international flow of news by four Western news agencies.

title: L.I.R.R. Bars Engineer Cleared by Court
description: The Long Island Rail Road is refusing to rehire an engineer it dismissed after a fatal wreck, even though a State Supreme Court justice has thrown out the criminal charge against him, praised him as a hero and urged his reinstatement.

description: With nearly 2 million people on its mailorder customer list for regular annual proof coin sets, uncirculated sets and special Bicentennial coin sets, the U.S. Mint is far and away the largest coin dealer in the world. Many of these customers, of course, are not fullscale coin collectors; they buy a set or two each year and that's it, seldom ???ing near a coin shop.

description: BRUSSELSThe incipient migration of major European auto makers to the United States has already begun to pull suppliers after it into the highly competitive American market.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: As cameras get more automated and hence more complex, one problem that crops up with increasing frequency is that of the camera malfunctioning and having to be sent in for repairs. When this happens the camera owner inevitably wonders what went wrong and what, if anything, he or she could have done to prevent it. Next come such questions as: Where should I take if for repairs? How much will they charge me? How long will it it back?

title: Sunday Observer
description: The most soughtafter man in politics this year is Moe Mentum. The political reporters pay attention to scarcely anyone else. It is a rare Tuesday night that doesn't find Walter Cronkite or John Chancellor analyzing the day's returns to find out which candidates have Moe Mentum on their side, and which candidates Moe has rejected.

The American economy is not only leading the comeback but outperforming its rivals in growth and strength.

They are Sheila Young, speed skater; Jim Ryun, the miler; Bob Seagren, pole vaulter, and Dwight Stones, high juniper. Francie Larrieu, a prospective Olympic runner, also entered. The tournament will be played June 7 through 10 at Las Vegas.

description: AHEAD should be round and solid enough to roll down a hill, William Merritt. Chase once counseled one of his students. The painter was not giving advice on the art of decapitation or on a new form of quoits but in the technique of portraiture.

description: The Board of Higher Education and the New York State Legislature are to meet separately this week to take up the question of ending the 129yearold policy of free tuition at New York City's public colleges.

title: THAYER LINDSEY, GEOLOGIST, IS DEAD
description: Thayer Lindsley, Canadianl mining executive and geologist who founded Ventures Ltd., a holding company with mining interests on four continents, died yesterday at his home, 700 Park Avenue. He was 93 years old.

description: SYDNEY, Australia. May 29 (UPI)if injury and politics do not interfere, one of the great footraces in history will be run on July 31 in the 1,500  meter final at the Olympic Games in Montreal.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Detectives canvassed Bronx neighborhood for clues in the slaying of 5yearold Lawrence Hawkins Jr., who was found stabbed to death Friday night in the basement of the building where he lived. Police officers questioned scores of residents in the building at 835 Walton Avenue at 158th Street and other residents of the area without reported success.

title: CHILDREN PLACED BY FRESH AIR FUND
description: Kay Barbel worried that the youngsters would be bored and Barbara Kirwin thought her neighbors might not like it.

title: Diana Dick Is Affianced To Canon Jeffrey Cave
description: Mr. and Mrs. C. Mathews Dick Jr. of Washington and Newport, R. L, have announced the engagement of Mr. Dick's daughter, Diana Pick, to Canon Jeffrey Paull Cave, precentor of the Washington Cathedral (Episcopal Cathedral of SS. Peter and Paul). He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Howard Layman Cave of Bonita, Calif.

title: TV VIEW
description: We've now had more than a month of Mondaynight baseball games on ABC. The ratings are low. This would be good news if it could be blamed, authoritatively, on ABC and its Mondaynight blabbercasting, with Bob Prince playing the part of Frank Gifford, Bob Uecker playing the part of Don Meredith and Warner Wolf playing the part of Howard Cosell. A Uecker, like a Meredith or a Joe Garagiola, seems to be necessary on every team of mod announcers. It's required that he have been an indifferent performer in his playing days, in order for his inferiority complex to be commercialized; the others are allowed to make jokes about him whenever the game fails to engage their attention, which is often, whether or not the viewers at home are engaged, which is difficult because the blabbercasters keep distracting us from the play. One thing is perfectly clear: When ABC claims that it is not responsible for those banners that spring up, as if by spontaneous conniption, every Monday night in ballparks across the nation, the network is being, au, disingenuous. ABC's baseball season started off in Baltimore, and there was a banner: What Is A Uecker? The Network of the Olympics. Nobody in Baltimore had ever heard of Uecker. This is known as managing the muse.

title: Dr. John F. Devlin Dead at 58; Authority on Forensic Medicine
description: Dr. John F. Devlin, Deputy Chief Medical Examiner of New York City and one of the country's outstanding forensic pathologists, died yesterday morning at his weekend cottage on Block Island, R.I., apparently of a heart atack. He was 58 years old and lived at 7 Lexington Avenue.

title: Lawyer Weds Miss Corvey
description: Patricia Ward Corvey, a legal assistant with Squire. Sanders & Dempsey, Cleveland lawyers, was married yesterday afternoon to David Mark Kelso, a lawyer with the firm.

title: She Teaches Talkshow Guests How to Bubble
description: You know those two places under your eyes? says the perky lady behind the blinding lights and the TV camera. Could I see you make little apples up there?

title: Criminals At Large
description: Isaac Asimov is best known for his science fiction, but he is protean and has written on everything from the Bible to Shakespeare to detective stories. The man is a writing machine. and MURDER AT THE ABA (Doubleday, $7.95) is his 168th book. As can be deduced from the title, it is a mystery novel. As cannot be deduced, the author  himself plays a prominent part in it. Nobody has ever accused Isaac Asimov of being a shrinking violet.

title: In Summary
description: President Ford has taken a firm executive position on an issue with potentially broad voter appeal: busing. Mr. Ford has directed Attorney General Edward H. Levi, who said yesterday lie had decided against intervening in the Boston case, to continue to search for a suit in which the scope of busing orders could be reexamined by the United States Supreme Court, and the President promised to introduce legislation soon to minimize the use of busing.

title: The Pool Business Is Back in the Swim
description: The dry spell in swimming pools seems over.

title: ENCOUNTER:
description: Wheeling over Italy's mountain spine on a fivespeed bicycle with 50 pounds of baggage means throbbing, straining thighs, sweat stinging your eyes and glazing your body. My curses bounced riff the rock walls of the Trebbia River valley as I rounded a turn to face another three kilometers of uphill.

title: Socialist Angola's Main Economic Prop: Gulf Oil
description: LUANDA. AngolaThe Gulf Oil Company is back and working normally in the oilfields off the shore Cabinda province in northern Angola. It is a situation not without irony.

title: Now I Can Die Official, Says PulitzerWinner Ned Rorem
description: I like glory and I like fame, said composer Ned Rorem, this year's Pulitzer prize winner in music. To have won the Pulitzer has been totally satisfying. It's a onceinadecade refashioner, carrying the decree that bitterness is henceforth unbecoming. And if you die in shame and squalor, at least you die Official.

title: U.S. to Challenge Ruling on Kissinger Attribution
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP)  The State Department has decided to appeal a Federal Court ruling in an effort to keep four comments at a news briefing on the Vladivostok arms accord from being attributed directly to Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, a spokesman says.

title: The Reagan Challenge...
description: Former Gov. Ronald Reagan has mounted an extraordinary challenge to President Ford in the five months since he began campaigning in the snows New Hampshire. Although he trails in the number committed delegates, he remains within striking distance. If he wins in California on June 8, the outcome of the nomination struggle will probably remain in doubt until the national convention decides in August.

title: Letters
description: Butt out

title: If insanity exists it is saner than sanity
description: These are the writings of two most heretical psychoanalysts. Despite different titles and outward forms, both are essentially collections of aphorisms. loosely joined by the idiosyncrasies of their authors; the books are long on feelings, which dominate the facts. Both authors found it unnecessaryor have been unableto systematize their thoughts. Read in conjunction the books are studies in similarities, and in contrasts.

title: Books of Interest
description: The New Downtown, Rebuilding Business Districts, by Louis G. Redstone, 330 pages, McGrawHill Book Company, $22.95. A heavilyillustrated analysis of the problems and methods of revitalizing center city cores, with detailed case studies of renewal projects in 56 cities in this country, Canada and abroad.

title: JEANNETTE F. HALL
description: Jeannette F. Hall, professionally known as Janet Hall as director of the Janet Hall Artist Bureau for the last 20 years, died Friday at her home, 200 West 58th Street. She was 77 years old.

title: Shaver Gets New Post
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 29 (AP) Al Shaver, the broadcaster for the Minnesota North Stars, was named director of communications for the National Hockey League team today.

title: Dtente is in the eye of the beholder
description: In 1972 it was statesmanship, and Richard Nixon won a landslide victory running on it. In 1976, many see it as a threat, and Ronald Reagan and Jimmy Carter are running against it. Secretary of State Henry Kissinger believes it is his greatest accomplishment. Close to a majority in Congress now think it could be his worst blunder. And though recent polls show that more than 60 percent of Americans approve of it, President Ford will not let the word pass his lips. By any other name (or no name at all) it is still detente, the elegant, suitably ambiguous French term that has come to label the complex new relationship between. the United States and the Soviet Union in the 1970's.

title: Book Ends
description: Collaborationists. The symbiosis between the specialist, who knows something but can't write it for a general audience, and the popularizer, who can write to engage a wide readership, is an uneasy one. The specialist accuses the popularizer of glibness; the popularizer disdains the hermetic world of experts. Not to mention egoconflicts and crass money matters revolving around how much the popularizer should profit from the specialist's research; or the specialist from the popularizer's writing flair.

title: Addis Ababa a City of Shadows, Fear and Rumors
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, May. 28Even at midday. Addis Ababa is a city of shadows and whispers.

title: Correction
description: Apologies to Washington Cathedral. which was not credited in this space three weeks ago with having commissioned Gian Carlo Menotti's opera The Egg, to be presented in its world premiere on June 17. Menotti's Martin's Lie, in its U.S. premiere. completes the double bill.

title: FISHING
description: FLUKE fishing was expected to remain strong this week in the Long Island bays, while offshore the party boats continued to fish the bottom for sea bass, ling and himWish while waiting for the bluefish schools to move northward.

title: Harboring Some Stately Visitors
description: FOR three days (and nights) in July, hundreds of the world's most exotic sailing ships will be making their way from Newport, R.I., to New York City for the Fourth of July Bicentennial parade up the Hudson River. Call It Operation Sail 76 or just a sailor's paradise, but the flotilla that will invade the Sound will comprise the largest sail gathering since the Battle of Navarino in 1327. Since most of the sloops, schooners, brigs, ketches and brigantines will need a snug harbor where they can spend the night and break the 150mile journey,into two days, five North Shore localities have been designated as official ports of call: Port Jefferson, Huntington, Oyster Bay, Hempstead Harbor and Manhasset Bay.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: ART

title: Decision On TV Awaited
description: THE state's quest for a commercial television channel to call its own seems to have taken on the attributes of a neverending soap opera.

title: A SingleMinded Band Runs the Carter Drive
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 Dr. Peter Bourne, the Britishborn psychiatrist who runs Jimmy Carter's campaign outpost here, still thinks of himself as a latecomer in the inner circle of Carter confidants because he has been in the group for only five years.

title: LETTER
description: To the Editor:

title: DrugProgram Cuts: Save Now, Pay Later
description: HARRIET ROVNER is a drug worker in my town. It's a pleasant community not far from the water, and the people who live in it spend a great deal or money on things like sailboats, color TVs, playroom panelling and fertilizer. The other day, Harriet talked to two juniorhighschool students who had gotten sick on cut marijuana and were worried about that. She also advised a 43yearold housewife, who was afraid she had become addicted to valium. And she took a girl to a hospital for alcoholic detoxification. The girl was only 13 years old, and she had been drinking a quart of whiskey a day.

title: Fred Segal, 51, Who Wrote The BrokenField Runner
description: Fred Segal, author and playwright, died Friday at the Santa Monk (Calif.) Hospital. He was 51 years old and lived in Woodland Hills, Calif.

title: New Amusement Parks Riding The American Boom in Leisure
description: ATLANTA, May 28 When a new amusement park opened here this week, ?layor Maynard Jackson hailed the event as the greatest opening since the opening of Gone With the Wind,' and the park's operators celebrated by throwing a blacktie cocktail party amid the whirling carousels fantasy puppets and sequined musicians.

title: A Unique Dilemma
description: LOS ANGELES, May 29One consequence of the possible nomination of Ronald Reagan as the Renublican Presidential candidate will be unique in this century. In that event, Mr. Reagan will have defeated a sitting President of his own party, who will. remain in office throughout the campaign, and in fact for five months after the Republican convention.

title: Food
description: One of the traditional dishes of the Greek kitchen is a marvelously aromatic creation known variously as arni sto harti, arni sto ladoharto and arni tou haritou, among other things. It is basically lambshanks or legseasoned with a variety of herbs and baked in parchment or other paper. In presentday homes, of course, aluminum foil is the general and convenient substitute for paper. We offer here our version of that dish, plus a first course on which we absolutely dote, garides mi feta, or shrimp baked in tomato sauce with feta cheese and a dash of ouzo, the aniseflavored liqueur of Greece. There is also a recipe for a salad of Greek inspiration.

title: Bell's 187 Sets World Vault Mark
description: WICHITA, Kan., May 29 Twentyyearold Earl Bell of Arkansas State University set a world polevault record today with a jump of 18feet714 inches at the United States Track and Field Federation championships.

title: What's Doing in the CONNECTICUT RIVER VALLEY
Reds Sink Dodgers in 9th On Mor4an's 2Out Hit, 65
description: CINCINNATI, May 29 (AP)  Ken Griffey tripled home the tying run with two out in the ninth inning and Joe Morgan's single against Mike Marshall today enabled the Cincinnati Reds to register a 65 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: A Gesell for adults
description: Books of popular psychology, doityourself therapies, are generally awful. Most of them contain the thinnest scrapings of classic theory, puffed up like the newest snack food with facile optimism, and packaged in a folksy style that would embarrass Colonel Sanders. Their appeal doubtless lies in the illusion of mastery they offer. Less guides to the examined life than operator's manuals, they promise that all of personal life can be comprehended in a few easytomemorize formulas. Get these under your belt, finetune yourself to the right combination of technical expertise and selflove, and you will be not only a winner, but a wiseman, seeing cannily into all things including your neighbor's character.

title: Where There's a Loser...
description: A call was made yesterday to the Reno Turf Book to inquire about action on the Presidential primaries. We're not allowed to take those bets, the manager said. Under state law we can't handle action on elections or on high school garnes in any sport in Nevada. Politicians and prep school kidsit seems a curious coupling, I guess they're: afraid somebody might bet on the kids, the man said. And maybe pollticians in Carson City aren't all that sure about politicians from California and Georgia and Michigan. All of which brings us to a letter from the indispensable Phil Bieber.

title: GARDENING
description: ALL your gardening efforts begin to come to fruition about now. Many of the flowering trees and shrubs are at their peak, perennials are starting to display varieties of form and color, late spring bulbs are in fullest splendor and annuals are beginning to contribute to the garden panorama. But your chores are not over.

title: Business Is Still Risky in Bulgaria
description: Bulgaria no longer is the last place in the world to make a dollar. Close maybe, hut not last. Trade in the past three years has tripled and reached $50 million last year.

title: Amelia R. Rea, R. F. Maguire 3d To Wed July 31
description: Vice Adm. William Freeland Rea 3d of the Coast Guard and Mrs. Rea have announced the engagement of their daughter, Amelia Ruth Rea, to Rayrner Francis Maguire 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Maguire Jr. of Orlando, Fla.

title: CHESS
description: Once a bishop has become dead, blocked by one or more of its own pawns, it is all too easy to dismiss it as a piece of permanently inert chessboard furniture, yet it is amazing how often the dead bishop can be resuscitated to wreak havoc.

title: Venezuela Assures Big Landowners on Takeovers
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, May 29The private farmers of Venezuela, who porduce 90 percent of this country's food. received assurances today against expropriation of land and promises of better prices.

title: Katharine O'Brien To Marry June 19
description: Mr. and Mrs. Thomas F. O'Brien of Montclair, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Katherine O'Brien, to Robert Winston ReesJones, son of Mr. and Mrs. Trevor W. ReesJones of Dallas. The wedding is planned for June 19 in the Central Presbyterian Church in Montclair, N.J.

title: SunnySide Up
description: Roll back the roof and let the sun shine in car buyers are telling Detroit.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONThe world is learning to live with floating currency exchange rates, hut the news accounts no doubt remain a mystery to many people. Why has the onceproud British pound sunk so low, for example?

title: Future Social Events
description: Show of Metal Wins Gold

title: Motor Sport Calendar
description: Tomorrow  International Motor Sports Association races at Lime Rock Park. Lakeville, Comi. Practice: 9 A.M.: Qualifying for Camel GT race. 40mile heats at 10 A.M. and 11; 10lap vintage car race at 12:30 P.M.: 100mile Goodrich Radial Challenge race at I P.M.; 40.mile Formula Vee race at 3 P.M. and 100mile Camel GT Challenge series race at 4 P.M. Information: phone Lime Rock Park: (203)4352572.

title: Joan H. Cannon Plans Marriage To R. T. Cassin
description: Mr. and Mrs. Dormer Cannon of New York and Lakeville, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Joan Hamilton Cannon, to Richard Thomas Cassin, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Francis Cassin of Larchmont, N. Y. The wedding will take place Sept. 11.

title: A Diverting Flute and Guitar Program
description: The available music written for flute and guitar may be limited, both in quantity and quality, but there is enough to make up at least one diverting concert program. Andrew Bolotowsky. flutist, and Joseph Karpienia. guitarist, proved the point in Carnegie Recital Hall on Friday night, and their recital was a model of taste and civilized refinementsimply the sound of their two instruments playing in tandem was a pleasure for the ear.

title: A.S.P.C.A. Sued by Some Members On Neglect, Mismanagement Charge
description: One day a few weeks ago. a woman named Marlene Kennedy found a mixed German shepherd who had been hit by a car on the Upper East Side.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Tom Seaver of the Mets, on Tommy Hutton of the PhiIs, who has a career batting average of 424 against him: He sees me very well. Even pitches that other hitters swing at, he takes because he knows it's a ball. Against me he's got an eye like Babe Ruth.

title: Six Little Ducks
description: Ordinarily I dislike the genre of book with illustrations set to the words of an old familiar song. I like to sing my songs, not read them aloud as a story, trying to repress the tune. So it was with skepticism that I approached Chris Conover's Six Little Ducks ("But the one little duck with the feather in his back/He led the others with a Quack, Quack, Quack."). But Miss Conover has not merely illustrated a song. Her blackandwhite drawings and colorful, doublepage panoramas enhance and expand, adding new dimension to the words. What comes across is a sense of joy, loving care for detail and a sprinkling of mischief. Her grocer is a bobcat named Bob Katz. A rat types busily in a subterranean, book  lined niche, and his sign labels him underground publisher. Chris Conover has her animals doing things human beings do, but remaining animals not anthropomorphized Disneyesque mu

title: June
description: June is the year settling down to the business at hand, which is growth after spectacular preparations, opening buds, blossoms, spreading leaves. The meadows are ready for the haymakers. Pastures that were glorified by spring beauties and bluets now are spangled with buttercups. Apple blossoms have faded, the petals fallen, and September's fruit is established where the bees only yesterday, it seems, were wallowing in pollen.

title: 154 Refugees Reach Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand. May 29 (AP) A Vietnamese fishing .trawler carrying 54 refugees, including 22 children, reached Thailand after 12 days on rough seas, the Thai immigration department said today.

title: P. E. Molitor Jr., Museum Head, And Marie Kalat, Curator, Wed
description: St. Peter's Episcopal Chapel in Wianno, Mass., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Marie Barkley Kalat, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul F. Kalat of Providence, R. I., and Wianno, to Paul E. Molitor Jr. of Milton, Mass., son of Mr. and Mrs. Molitor of Newbaryport, Mass.

title: The 400 Eels of Sigmund Freud
description: Did you read, and if you did, have you been able to forget Mundome, A. G. Mojtabai's first novel? In it, a New York librarian bifurcates before our eyes into himself and his female principle, his sister. It had a cast of characters almost limited to these two, unitedand separatedin schizophrenia. Mundome made a small critical splash and then sanic into the customary oceanic depths reserved for promising but. unspectacular first novels.

title: U.S.C.on Brink of Old N.C.A.A. Glory
description: There was a time when Southern California's domination of collegiate track was taken for granted. From 1926 through 1968, the Trojans won 25 of the 33 National Collegiate ouzdoor championship meets and was second in six others. The golden era ler Southern California included separate streaks of nine and seven consecutive N.C.A.A. plus 15 straight conference championships and a 17year period during which the Trojans did not losa a dua; meet.

title: ART VIEW
description: WASHINGTON

title: DINING OUT
description: SOME weeks ago, after a restaurant in the Red Bank area got something of a drubbing in this space, a reader suggested another place, one not too far off, that also is devoted to things from the sea: The Fisherman's Wharf in Rumson.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: In a reinterpretation of the Constitution's freespeech guarantee, the Supreme Court has ruled for the first time that commercial advertising is protected by the First Amendment. The ruling opens the way for competitive advertising by pharmacists, which may result in lower drug prices and therefore savings for consumers.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: BORDEAUX, FranceMonday. May 17, was historic. The supersonic Concordea joint project of Britain and Francelanded at Andrews Air Force Base outside of Washington with the President of France aboard.

title: SHOP TALK
description: WITH artifacts, weavings, and rugs from all over the world on display, the Wall Gallery_ in Summit resembles a rnuseinn. However, the African textile designs, appliqued Dahomey hangings and Iranian prayer rugs here are for saleand at a savings of 25 percent,

title: HouseHoppers Move In, Fix Up, Move On
description: RUMSON, N.J.The question is how do Samuel and Mary Weir come to be living in the White House, a handsome if disheveled 32room mansion that some industrial potentate built in 1915.

title: Treasures in the Trash Heap
description: IT was late Sunday afternoon on the kind of rainy spring day that treats the people who care to venture out to a new definition of the color green. But the traffic was light as Barbara Hall swung her hatchback car off of Route 25A and headed south into Greenlawn on a road lined with lush growth.

title: In Israeli Eyes, Rabin Cannot Seem to Do Anything Right
description: JERUSALEMSign of the times No. 1: Hardly a day has passed in recent weeks in Israel in which the name a potential candidate to replace Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin has not been put forward. The names have not been the usual ones, Defense Minister Shimon Peres or the former Foreign Minister, Abba Eban. Instead, they have been figures, most of them apolitical who have not served government before. Example: Yigal Yadin, the famous archeologist who retired as army chief of staff in 1952 and has devoted himself to academia since. then. The former general's political views are largely unknown, and yet when he appeared on a television interview program here last week, it was page one news in all the papers. Mr. Yadin underscored the anomaly himself by saying: People come to me and suggest that I head a new political movement without even asking me what my ideas are.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: During the Carnegie Hall gala on May 16, one started thinking about equivalent events of the past, and could not find any counterpart. The gala, in case you missed the news, celebrated Carnegie Hall's 85th birthday and also kicked off Carnegie's S6.5million endowment drive. The concert alone was good for $1.2 million in cash and pledges. Why not? It brought together Vladimir Horowitz, Yehudi Menuhin, Isaac Stern, Mstislav Rostropovich, Leonard Bernstein and the New York Philharmonic, Dietrich FischerDieskau, and the Oratorio Society conducted by Lyndon Woodside.

title: The Southwest Spawns A Playwright
description: DALLAS

title: Homemade Rhododendron Hybrids
description: Breeding and selecting rhododendrons is a hobby for anyone with a few hundred square feet of garden, a touch of ego, an eye for beauty and some patience. Each spring after the first few years the amateur hybridizer can gaze down lines of rhododendrons blooming for the first time.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Interest rate uncertainties  a recurring source distress in recent weeks  occupied the stock market much of last week, cutting back prices and keeping the trading pace slow.

description: Harriette Sterns Merrill of New York, advertising director of Working Woman magazine, was married yesterday noon to David Luxner of Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, V. I.

title: ContehLopez Bout Reset Again
description: LONDON, May 29 (AP) The lightheavyweight title fight between John Conteh of Britain and Alvaro Lopez Stockton, Calif., has been postponed again, from June midOctober.

title: Out of the Ordinary Tomatoes
description: For a change from the usual garden tomatoes, why not try some of the close tomato relatives such as the husk tomato and tree tomato.

title: Brazilians Can Clinch Soccer Cup Tomorrow
description: SEATTLE, May 29 (UPI) Even without Pei& Brazil can field a formidable worldcaliber soccer team.

title: 17 ON L.I. ARE HELD AS ILLEGAL ALIENS
description: Using a helicopter and walkietalkies. Federal agems moved on Gurney's Inn in Montauk, L.I., one of the largest hotelrestaurant complexes on Long Island, early yesterday, and arrested 17 employees as illegal aliens.

title: Courtesy Rule Decried
description: THOSE New Jerseyans who think that the state may not have the best possible appointed public officials, including judges, now have some support from the New Jersey Bar Association.

title: Bicentennial Fete Set At Art Gallery Tuesday
description: WASHINGTON. May 29 (AP)  A recreation of a typical French fireworks display of the 18th century is planned by the National Gallery of Art next Tuesday. The gallery director, J. Carter Brown, said this week that it had generated tremendous interest.

title: A Look at the ManMade Mess
description: VANCOUVER B. C.When the world took its first collective look at its environmental problems, at a United Nations conference in Stockholm in 1972, it was the natural environment that preempted attention. The manmade environment, as reflected in the large web of community problems, urban and rural. was left for separate treatment.

title: On the Farm With Zoink
description: LISBON, Ohio, May 29 In the Pine Tree Inn down the country road from the Csonka Brothers Farm where he lives in content seclusion, Larry Csonka had finished a porterhouse steak slightly smaller than some of his 30 head of black Angus cattle. He was sipping a bourbon and water with his brother, Joe. and two others in the dimly lit bar. The other patrons had nodded pleasantly and respected the privacy of the New York Giants new fullback, who was wearing a striped sport shirt, jeans and brown boots. But now a local dude in a gray leisure suit interrupted Larry Csonka's conversation.

title: PriceFixing Study In Apparel Quickens
description: More so than at any time in recent years, the investigation of price fixing in; a basic commodity of lifeclothinghas reached proportions that point to mounting: concern over the high price of; apparel for the family and the possibility that millions of Americans are paying peak, prices because of collusion between producers and retailers.

title: ROCKEFELLER SEES A REAGAN DEFEAT
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 Vice President Rockefeller said today there was not a chance in the world that President Ford would select Ronald Reagan as his running mate to unite the Republican Party for the November election campaign.

title: ARTISTS ARRESTED IN LENINGRAD SHOW
description: MOSCOW, May 30 (Reuters)  The police in Leningrad detained a group of artists who tried to stage an openair art show today in defiance of City Council ban.

title: 2 Soviet Violinists Top Competition in Brussels
description: BRUSSELS. May 30 (AP)Soviet artists won the first two places today in the International Queen Elisabeth Music Grand Prix for Violin.

title: TALKS IN LEBANON COLLAPSE AGAIN; COMBAT STEPS UP
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Monday, May 31Efforts to nudge the 14monthold Lebanese civil war toward a political solution appeared yesterday to have Collapsed once more.

title: A Civil War Pensioner, 85, Remembers Her Good Man
description: HIGHLAND, N. Y.  Lottie Gildersleeve Smith, one of 166 Civil War pensioners in the country, has no regrets that she was pushed into marriage at IS to a 63yearold widower who told her he had been posted as guard at the Ford Theater the night Lincoln was shot.

title: Black Commissioner of Police Overcomes Bad Start in Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, May 30In most urban areas of the United States, the police department, confronted with high crime rates in black areas on one hand and charges of police brutality by black leaders on the other, is at the center of racialt turmoil.

title: North Sea Getting Its Test as Oil Drilling Site
description: EKOFISK OIL COMPLEX, North Sea, May 28Here, close to the center of the North Sea, a chain of artificial islands is taking shape in one of the most ambitious engineering ventures of all time.

title: 1,500 Drop In on Byrnes at Morven
description: PRINCETON, May 30As a cannon boomed on the front lawn, Governor and Mrs. Byrno opened the doors of Morven, their offical residence here, and greeted throngs of New Jerseyans who drooped by for a Sunday stroll through the yellowbrick Colonial mansion today.

title: Ballet: Eglevsky Displays New Unity
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L.I., May 30Two legacies of the Eglevsky Ballet's recent tour with Galina Rogozina and Valery Panov were seen over the weekend in its final season performances at the high school auditorium here. The most obvious was the restaging of the Grand Pas from Petipa's Don Quixote, and the second was less obvious, but more significanta new sense of ensemble dancing.

title: Alison Finney Wed to Henry B. Stebbins
description: Alison Warren Finney, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Finney of Washington, was married yesterday afternoon to Henry Blanchard Stebbins. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Bellows Stebbins of Bedford, N.H.

title: Board Is Named to Examine Labor Dispute at Hospital.
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP) Louis Levine, a former New York State Industrial Commissioner, was named today as chairman of a threeman board examining a laborcontract dispute involving 40,000 private hospital employees in the New York City area

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CREAM OF THE CROP  This week should provide a bargain for fans of short movies, a production activity that usually bypasses cpmmercial theaters (unlike the old days) and circulates in programs at schools, community and art centers, museums, college campuses and for industry and science audiences.

title: New Hampshire Keeps Leadoff Primary Role
description: CONCORD, N.H., May 30 (AP)The 1976 Presidential primaries are still going on around the country, but New Hampshire already has moved to protect its leadoff primary four years from now.

title: Dietz Wins Trials For Olympic Sculls
Mrs. Gandhi Is Adamant on Birth Control
description: NEW DELHI, May 30Prime Minister Indira Gandhi declared here today that she would brook no opposition to the birthcontrol program that was being vigorously pushed by her Government.

title: EDWARD E. STEWART
description: Edward E. Stewart, president and chairman of the National Dairy Products Corporation (now the Kraftco Corporation) until his retirement in 1961, died Saturday at his son's home in Tampa, Fla. He was 80 years old.

title: Carey Seeks to Pressure Board on City U. Tuition
description: Governor Carey sought to put pressure on the Board of Higher Education yesterday by terming tuition at City University unavoidable.

title: Personal Finance
description: The stock market has been so tricky to fathom over the last four years that many investors might have made more money keying their trading to such auguries as sunspots or pigeon flights in Central Park than to the kind of advice they have been getting from most money managers.

title: Violence Hits Boston After U .S . Declines to Enter Busing Case
description: BOSTON, May 30 (AP)A civvil rights leader hailed the Justice Department's decision to stay out of the Boston busing case as a victory for the U.S. Constitution, but antibusing militants predicted it would touch off new violence.

title: Some Republicans Fearful Party Is on Its Last Legs
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Is the Republican Party over? Divided by a contest for its Presidential nomination and debilitated by the events since the last national election, the party may face a new disaster in November and perhaps beyond.

title: Jupiter
description: Astronomers know now that Jupiter is, after the sun, the largest object in the solar system, with a mass more than twice that of all the other planets combined.

title: ICELANDIC DISPUTE EASED BY BRITAIN
description: LONDON, May 30In a move that could have precedentsetting consequences for nations access to the riches of the sea, the British Government today announced measures that mean its bitter sevenmonth conflict with Iceland over fishing rights has probably ended.

title: Simon Calls Swing To Deficit Balance Of Trade Desirable'
description: WASHINGTON. May 30 The big swing in the nation's trade balance from surplus to deficit has been desirable. in the view of Treasury Secretary William E. Simon.

title: Jackson Is Taking On Role Of a Potential Kingmaker
description: CLEVELAND, May 30Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington, who had hoped by this stage of the campaign to hotd a commanding lead in the race for the Democratic Presidential, nomination, finds himself in stead in the lesser but potent role of ootential kingmaker.

title: Channel 13GoGetters
description: As the big, drenching drops of a sudden spring shower began to fall, David Conroy, a Channel 13 volunteer, darted into pp old SoHo warehouse, the other day, and climbed the worn steps to reach the Dc ntown Potters Hall, a pottery' collective where a group of women turn out ceramics that are sold nationwide.

title: Suns Beat Celtics,10598,Trail by 21
description: PHOENIX, May 30 (AP)Alvan Adams scored 33. points, 12 in the last five mnutes, leading the Phoenix Suns to a 10598 victory today over the Boston Celtics in the National Basketball Association championship series.

title: APRIL ORDERS DOWN FOR MACHINE TOOLS,
description: Machine tool orders in April totaled $148.9 million, down 8.6 percent from the March level, the National Machine Tool Builders Association reported over the weekend. However, this was a gain of 55 percent over the level of April 1975.

description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Scientific Deadend Faces U.S. In Its Agricultural Technology
description: URBANA, Ill., May 30American agricultural technology, which made the nation the breadbasket of the world, seems headed for a scientific deadend.

title: Children Used to Spelling Bees Try the Quilting Kind
description: All over the country, hundreds of communities have been busily stitching Bicentennial quilts, from the estatedotted exurbs of Connecticut to the desert towns of New Mexico. Now New York City has a stitchery celebration of its own: quilts done by schoolchildren.

title: Max Carey, 86, in Hall of Fame For StolenBase Record, Dies
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 30 (AP) Max Carey, a Hall of Fame baseball player who was best known for his basestealing feats, died here today. He was S6 years old.

title: Sarah Chasis, Lawyer, Bride
description: Sarah Chasis, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Herbert Chasis of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Henry Clabaugh Hiles, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Constant Hiles of Pensacola, Fla. Rabbi Edward Klein performed the ceremony at the Lotos Club.

title: Bridge:
description: Whatever the result of the Reisinger knockout team championship played Friday, one player in the final was certain to be a successful defender: Matt Granovetter and Ron Rubin of New York had played together on the winning team in 1975 and were now on opposite sides.

description: Kathy Anne King, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward King of Great Neck, was married there at noon yesterday to Jordan Samuel Wouk, son of Mr. and Mrs. Victor Wouk of New York and Millwood. N.Y.

description: CRANSTON, R.I., May 30Senator Frank Church, the late bloomer of this season's trop of Democratic Presidential aspirants, has the best record of any of them: He has won every primary he's enteredall three of them.

description: JERSEY CITY, May 30 (AP)The Britishflag container ship Dart Atlantic, carrying an oversized reproduction of the Liberty Bell, docked this morning at the Global Terminal here.
