title: Angola Worker Groups Await Voting
description: LUANDA, Angola, May 30On Luanda Island, a long stretch of palmshaded beaches, pleasant restaurants and quaint fishermen's huts, Angolans are talking earnestly of people's power.

title: Brown Seeks New Victory To Slow Carter Campaign
description: CRANSTON, R.I., May 30Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California, searching somewhat desperately for a way to rekindle the spark created by his ,upset victory in the Maryland !Democratic Presidential primary election two weeks ago, brought his belated campaign to Rhode Island for the long Memorial Day weekend.

title: Study Finds Surplus of Courses In Teaching, Law and Medicine
description: Surplus capacity exists nationally in teacher training and production of Ph.D.'s, and there is at least a potential surplus of medical and law schools, according to a report by the Carnegie Council on Policy Studies in Higher Education.

title: Foreigners Swarm To Britain to Shop On 3Day Holiday
description: LONDON, May 30 (AP)The decline in the value of the pound has brought swarms of foreign tourists to Britain to take advantage of the difference in prices.

title: Memorial
description: The threeday weekend established mainly for benefit of the travel, hotel and entertainment industries has largely robbed of any but commercial significance most of America's great and historic holidays. Almostbut not quite.

title: ARGENTINE LEFTISTS SEIZE JUNTA OFFICER
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 30 (AP) An army colonel named by the military government to oversee Argentina's large labor union federation was kidnaped today by leftwing guerrillas, police sources reported.

title: Study Finds Arms Sales Abroad Save U. S. $560 Million in Year
description: WASHINGTON, May 30By selling $8 billion in arms to other countries last year, the United States was able to cut its other military costs by $560 million, according to a new congressional study.

title: Max Carey, 86, Dies
description: Max Carey, who holds the record for most years (10) leading the major leagues in stolen bases, died yesterday at the age of 86. Details on page la.

title: Maude Richardson, 82, Dead; Community Worker in Brooklyn
description: Maude B. Richardson, for six decades a worker for community betterment in Brooklyn, died Wednesday at Kings County Hospital. She was 82 years old and lived at 1729 President Street, Brooklyn.

description: Laura Gabrielle Rosenthal and Terence Michael McGarry were married yesterday in Suffern, N.Y., in the garden of the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. M. L. Rosenthal. The ceremony was performed by State Supreme Court Justice Theodore A. Kelly.

title: Memorial Day
description: Parking  Sunday parking rules in effect.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 30Has the rising cost of airplane fares and the subsequent drop in passenger usage of airlines doomed Newark International Airport?

title: Bowa Helps Lonborg Win 8th, 71
description: Jim Lonborg, holding a 10 lead over the Montreal Expos yesterday. needed some breathing room. And Larry Bowa was just angry enough to give it to his Philadelphia Phillie teammate.

title: Women at West Point Silly to Westmoreland
description: MIDDLETOWN, Ohio, May 30 (AP) Gen. William C. Westmoreland said yesterday it was silly to permit worn. en to enroll at the, West Point Military Academy.

description: RICHMONDBy most white American standards for measuring success, Frank Spencer Royal, a black man, has made it.

title: Financial Holiday
description: All banks in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut will be closed today in observance of Memorial Day. Securities and commodities markets throughout the country will also be closed.

title: FUCHIDA, BOMBER AT PEARL HARBOR
description: KASHIHARA, Japan, May 30 (Reuters)Mitsuo Fuchida, the pilot who led the Japanese air attack on Pearl Harbor, died here today, according to a hospital spokesman. He was 73 years old.

title: A Few Mountain Families Resist Communism in Southwest China
description: CHING HUNG, ChinaMore than a quarter century after the Red Army marched into Yunnan Province in the southwest corner of China, there are some 20 families living deep in the mountains who still are no sure that communism is such a good idea.

title: 7 Guerrillas Reported Slain In Rhodesia in 24 Hours
description: SALISBURY, May 30 (Reuters) Seven more guerrillas have been killed in Rhodesia in the last 24 hours, according to a security fsrce communique today.

title: HUMPHREY AND FORD ALMOST TIED IN POLL
description: Senator Hubert H. Humphreyi of Minnesota and President Ford are in a virtual tie for voter support, according to the Gallup Poll's latest test Presidential election survey. But in a race between Mr. Humphrey and former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California, the Senator would lead 52 to 42 percent, with 6 percent undecided.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: In that America is doubtlessly the most dedicated saladeating nation in the world (and has contrived the greatest number and some of the most imaginative salads on earth), it is small wonder that salads seem much on the mind of native gastronomes, particularly as warm weather approaches.

title: MOON SECT INVITES PARENTS TO RALLY
description: Members of the Rev. Sun Myung Moon's Unification Church have been calling and writing to their parenrs from Various centers throughout the: country in recent weeks, urglag. them to attend the sect's scheduled program at ankee Stadium tomorrow.

title: Poll Shows French Reds Gain:. Support in Campaign of Change
description: PARIS, May 30The French Communist Party has been campaigning for broad support by seeking to demonstrate that it has changed, and opinion polls show that if an election were held now the Communists! would probably emerge as Government partners with the Socialists.

title: La Mama Series Ends With Shows By Sunny Murray
description: Sunny Murray first attracted notice in jazz publications when he began playing the drums with Cecil Taylor during the early 1960's. Mr. Murray has been leading his own groups since 1964, but he has recorded infrequently: His performances, such as the Friday and Saturday concerts by his group,, which ended the Jazz for Car; toglaphers series at La Mama, usually go unheralded outside the jazz community.

title: Books of The Times
description: Follow closely now. Barry Commoner's latest book, The Poverty of Power: Energy and the Economic Crisis, begins with marvelously lucid and dramatic explanation of the Second Law of Thermodynamicsthat elusive principle of nature that holds, in Mr. Commoner's words, that the spontaneous processes that are the actual events of the real world always lead to states that are less ordered, more probable, and represent less information than the states in which they began. (Or, to put the secona Law more apnoristicany, The entropy of the universe is constantly increasing.) In a startling transition, Mr. Commoner ends his book with a plea for the United States transition to a socialist form of government, or, as he puts it, a production system that is consciously intended to serve social needs and that judges the value of its products by their use, and an economic system that is committed to these purposes.

title: Panatta Topples V ilas In Italian Tennis Final
Quotation of the Day
description: He was one of the best. He always helped out. He was always there first."Fireman Matthew Kiernan, in tribute to Fireman Patrick J. Cleary, who gave his life in a predawn rescue of a mother and child. [18:1.]

title: Press betrayed. Purge due. Please tell George Bush. And publisher.
description: WASHINGTONWhat bothers me the cairn after the storm. The press has been had by the Central Intelligence Agency, That shocking fact rolled like thunder through the report of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities. Yet where is the loud collective outrage from what I like to consider the honorable trade of journalism, the only one I have ever plied?

title: Woman Nuclear Engineer: Some Adverse Reaction
description: REACH BOTTOM, Pa.Roberta Kankus clipped on identification badges and radiation indicators, unlocked doors and walked into a huge room where generators and turbines roared. She was careful to walk around one generator.

title: The Annual Bulge of Summer Becomes Noticeable in Old Lyme
description: OLD LYME, Conn., May 30 The population of Old Lyme last Friday was a few residents short of 5,000. One month from now it will have tripled. The transformation from slowmoving old New England town to summer resort began this weekend with the Memorial Day holiday.

title: MALPRACTICE BILL REVISED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 29The Republicancontrolled Senate introduced a medical malpractice insurance bill today that modified some of the majority party's earlier insistence on sweeping changes in the current law. The bill was viewed as an attempt to move toward some compromise with Democrats.

title: GEORGE CARR WRIGHT
description: George Carr Wright, director of the education department of the Funk & Wagnalls Publishing Company until his retirement in 1969, died Saturday at his home in India'antic, Fla. He was 75 years old.

title: Hanoi's Leaders,'
description: HONG KONG, May 30North Vietnam's leaders had no in tention of accepting a last. minute political settlement of the war last year, according to Hanoi's Chief of Staff, despite the Communists repeated public hints that they were interested in such negotiations if President Nguyen Van Thieu would resign.

title: Freebooter Sail Victor In Sound
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., May 30  Tony Widmann from Rowayloo, Conn., cannot remember exactly how many failed races he has sailed in Long Island Sound, distance races like this weekend's annual trek out to Block Island and back under the auspices of the Storm Trysail Club. In 15 years there had been many for the 48yearold advertising executive in command of five different cruising boats named Freebooter. It is an avocation that is almost an allergy.

title: How Patriots Behave: A Critic's View
description: It was sheer coincidence that I happened to be carrying a copy of Lillian Hellman's Scoundrel Time with me as I climbed the rickety stairwell to the American Theater Company's secondfloor shoebox on East 14th Street for a performance of The Patriots. But The Patriots wasn't more tnan 20 minutes under wayjust past the brisk establishment of no fewer than three love storieswhen the book began to burn in my hand.

title: SEOUL AND TOKYO CLASH OVER SILK
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A, growing trade dispute between, Japan and South Korea has flared up again, this time over silk.

title: A Relapse Suffered By Martha Mitchell; ConditionIs Critical
description: Martha Mitchell, the estranged wife of former Attorney General John N. Mitchell, was hospitalized in critical condition yesterday morning after suffering a cardiac arrest and other serious complications from a bone marrow disease, her doctor reported.

title: BRICE A. FREY JR.
description: Brice A. Frey Jr., who retired in 1972 as senior vice president of the General Reinsurance Corporation of Greenwich, Conn., died Friday at St. Paul's Hospital in Dallas. He was 61 years old and lived in Corsicana, Tex. For many years he had been a resident of Tuxedo Park, N.Y.

title: HAWAII DEMOCRATS PICK 17 DELEGATES
description: HONOLULU, May 30Hawaii Democrats officially elected 17 delegates to their party's national convention today, voting to send 15 of them uncommitted to any Presidential candidate.

title: A Civil War Pensioner Recalls Her Good Man
description: HIGHLAND, N.Y.Lottie Gildersleeve Smith, one of 166 Civil War pensioners in the country, has no regrets that she was pushed into marriage at 18 to a 63yearold widower who told her he had been posted as a guard at the Ford Theater the night Lincoln was shot.

title: Kosygin Conferring With Iraqis; He Is Due in Syria Tomorrow
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 30Prime Minister Aleksei Kosygin of the Soviet Union began talks with Iraqi leaders today in Baghdad.

title: Dances at aGathering by City Ballet
description: Saturday was pretty much of an average day for New City Ballet at the New York State Theater, but luckily that average is almost ,phenomenally high. It is amazing how consistently interesting the company is, season after seasan, and some of the new young dancers, who entered the company a few years ago but are now making their presence felt, are giving the troupe a new youthful bounce.

title: City U. From 1847 Ideal to a 1976 Reality
description: When the dimensions of New York. City's fiscal crisis finally brought an end to businessasusual last year, the sprawling City University was ordered to trim its operations in keeping with the city's threeyear austeri'y plan, starting with a 155 Million cut during this spring semester.

title: In Search of Jimmy Carter
description: CINCINNATI  Deep inside, what moves Jimmy Carter? The questicin obviously troubles some thoughtful people. They worry about this outsider who has become the likely Democratic nominee. They wonder about his principlesnot his views on this issue or that but his basic beliefs.

title: Investing in the Future
description: Although the city counts new construction projects like pearls, there are two on the boards now that have an importance beyond the immediate help for jobs and the economy that are the traditional function of building. Both the Commodore Hotel plan in .Manhattan and the new shopping mall for Jamaica are examples of a kind of publicprivate effort that goes beyond real estate investment to an investment in the city's stability and future.

title: CAPOTE IS ARRESTED IN L. I. CAR MISHAP
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L.I., May 30 (UPI)The author Truman Capote was arrested tonight on charges of driving under the influence of alcohol, unlicensed operation of a motor vehicle and faiJure to keep to the right following a minor traffic accident near his home here, the state police said.

description: CEYMOREHFrancls. Our unbounding thanks, for a lifetime, to the greatest fche.

title: Atlantans Perform the Missa Solemnis
description: Beethoven's Missa Solemnis belongs to a select company of highminded musical conceptionsaach's Mass in B minor. Wagner's Parsifal, Mozart's Don Giovanni among a handful of other worksthat demand special treatment in order to communicate their full impact. Music of such a lofty nature requires nothing less than complete dedication on the part of both the performers and the audience.

title: Connecticut Veto Deadline For This Year Is June 21
description: HARTFORD, May 30 (UPI)The special veto session of the Connecticut Legislature this year will be held no later than June 21, Gov. Ella T. Grasso's office said last week.

title: Brazil Faces Italy in Yale Bowl
description: Undefeated Brazil meets Italy at 3 P.M. today in the Yale Bowl, New Haven. and could clinch the American Bicentennial Soccer Cup series with a victory. But Brazil, which has won two games, will be without Francisco Marinho. its star defender, who injured his foot in the victory over Team America Friday and left last night for Brazil. Marco Antonio will replace him.

title: Operating a School Teaches Its Founder Plenty About Business
description: Had Irina Pigott known what she was getting into when she set up the East Manhattan School eight years ago, she might have been too discouraged to on ahead with the idea. She assumed she would turn a profit quickly on the nurserythrough  thirdgrade school, as she had in 1951 when she opened the Parsons Nursery School in the large colonial house she and her husband occupied in Queens at a rent of $125 a month. With her husband's words in mindIf you lose money, you closeshe had taken to the sidewalks in 1951. I walked the streets and copied the names of pediatricians from the door plates, mailed them brochures and word quickly spread, Mrs. Pigott recalled. I started with eight or 10 children, and enrollment quickly grew to 80 in two sessions attended by four teachers.

title: Memories of a Boy From Massachusetts
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass.I could die waltzin', my father said. In fact, he was a poor dancer, with a tendency to hop. Mother, who loved dancing, married him for other qualities.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: There is little danger that offshore oil drilling will have an adverse environmental impact on shore communities, according to the United States Department of Interior. The department said in its final Environmental Impact Statement released in Trenton yesterday that the greatest danger to the environment would lie in pipeline construction, not in oil spills.

title: Sportswear Gets Its Act Together
description: The new phrase they're tossing around at Kimberly, the knitwear house whose legion of followers is as loyal as Dior's, is packaged sportswear.

description: WEST POINT, May 30Pointer View, West Point's weekly newspaper. covered the cheating scandal at the United States Military Academy for the first time this week, nearly, two months after the scandal bebecame a national news story.

title: North Sea Getting Its Test as Oil Drilling Site
description: EKOFISK, OIL COMPLEX, North Sea, May 28Here, close to the center of the North Sea, a chain of artificial islands is taking shape in one of the most ambitious engineering ventures, of all time.

title: ICELANDIC DISPUTE EASED BY BRITAIN
description: LONDON, May 30In move that could have precedentsetting consequences for nations access to the riches of the sea, the British Government today announced measures that mean its bitter sevenmonth conflict with Iceland over fishing rights has probably ended.

description: The city's revenue estimates for the fiscal year that begins on July 1 appear to be overstated by $49 million, and there may be other shortfalls, State Deputy Comptroller Sidney Schwartz said yesterday. Mr. Schwartz, who is monitoring the city's effort to deal with its fiscal crisis, said in a report to two state agencies the Emergency Financial Control Board and the Municipal Assistance Corporation  that propertytax receipts in the 197677 period might be $24 million less than Mayor Beanie had estimated in his budget and that the reserve for uncollectible aid from Albany and Washington should be increased by $25

title: The Court and Freedom
description: The ringing words and stunning phrases of the Bill Rights are no more than marks on paper if the courts of the nation have neither the inclination nor the will to give them force in national life. The ultimate test their vitality rests in the hands of the Supreme Court on which depends protection of those liberties enumerated in the Bill of Rights as forming the very core American freedom.

title: Max Carey,86 ,in Hall of Fame For StolenBase Record, Dies
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 30 (AP) Max Carey, a Hall of Fame baseball player who was best known for his basestealing feats, died here today. He was 86 years old.

title: In Akron's Retread Ritual, Pickets Need No Signs
description: AKRON, Ohio  In oneindustry towns, the pace of life is often tied less to the 12month calendar than to the vagaries of the dominant business. Washington rises and falls with the quadrennial frenzy of a Presidential election. In Akron, life revolves around a threeyear cycle coinciding The Talk with the expiration of the United Rubber Workers conof tract. In 1967 some of the 19thcentury brick factories that ring this city of 270,000 were shut for 92 days by a strike. In 1970 pickets closed individual plants for 49 days. In 1973 the strike lasted 24 days. Today 11,000 rubber workers have already been on strike 41 days. If this city had a motto, it would be Once again, with feeling.

title: Shore Resorts Expecting Good uycentennial'
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 30Front Keansburg on Barnegat Bay to Cape May Point on the Delaware, state shore resorts are expecting a big summer season.

The Rev. George M. Hooten Jr. performed the ceremony.

description: The $46,850 Edgemere Handicap, won by Sea High Stable's Erwin Boy, may have been of chief interest to the damp crowd of 32,356 at Belmont Park yesterday. For horsemen, however, the conversation pieces were today's $100,000 added Metropolitan and next Saturday's $150,000 added Belmont Stakes.

description: Susan Gail Boas, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert S. Boas of Great Neck, L. I., was married yesterday evening at the Plaza to Mark Lee Claster, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Claster of Coral Gables, Fla. Rabbi Jerome Davidson performed the ceremony.

description: HARTFORD. May 30Arthur Johnson finished a slow, almost baleful rendition of the Poor Girl Waltz before a huge, appreciative crowd in a park in the middle of Hartford.

description: PARISFrench movie critics can't explain it. The people here who pay as much as $13 a seat can't explain it. And, after 73 minutes of absurd rambunctions on the stage of the Olympia Theater here, Jerry Lewis himself couldn't explain it.

title: Supporters of Israel Throng 12Hour Rally in Paris
description: PARIS, May 30 (Reuters)Thousands of supporters of Israel streamed into a fairground here today for a noisy rally that reportedly drew more than 100,000 people. Its organizers said the rally was the biggest of its kind ever held in Europe.

description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., May 30The provincialism that is frequently associated with Easterners did not appear among some of the leading high school basketball players in the New YorkNew Jersey area when they picked the colleges of their choice.home. Most of the local players are getting away.

description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, May 30 (UPI)Niki Lauda, driving in the style that has given him five victories in six world championship races, led from start to finiah today and won the Monaco Grand Prix in a Ferrari for the second consecutive year.

description: JERSEY CITY, May 30A Rutherford mother of six children who attained the highest average in the evening division of St. Peter's College here was among 727 graduates to receive degrees today at the school's 85th commencement exercises.

title: At Night, Block Belongs To the Male Prostitutes

description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 30Johnny Rutherford, a genial and witty Texan who feels he was cheated by rain from winning the Indianapolis 500 last year, won the race today with the help of rain.

title: Progress for Angola
description: The withdrawal of 200 Cuban soldiers a week from Angola, as promised by Fidel Castro, will contribute badly needed stability in southern Africa and relieve fears of greatpower conflict there; but the contribution will be far greater if Mr. Castro is serious in his additional promise to keep Cuban troops out of liberation movements elsewhere in Africa and Latin America. Even African governments that welcomed Havana's massive intervention on the side of the Popular Movement in Angola's civil war were uneasy about the continued presence of some 14,000 Cuban soldiers that country. And even Africans who refused to view the Angolan conflict in a coldwar context feared that the Cubans might become permanent instruments of Soviet African policy.

title: Board Is Named to Examine Labor Dispute at Hospitals
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP) Louis Levine, a former New York State Industrial Commissioner, was named today as Ichairman of a threeman board examining a laborcontract dispute involving 40,000 private hospital employees in the New York City area.

A girl on the horse's back, in a blue bikini, waved to the applauding crowd, then crouched flat. The animal looked down at the swirling water, appeared ready to plunge, but balked.

title: Dave Anderson
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 30Behind him, some spectators held up a homemade banner with a telephone drawn on it. Victory Lane, it read, is calling A.J.No. 4. When they yelled to him, A.J. Foyt turned and smiled and waved. He was sitting on the low cement wall of his pit at the Indianapolis Speedway today, talking to some friends and signing autographs and watching his pit crew in redplaid shirts tinker with the red Gilmore Special that would be driving. A.J. Foyt has won the Indianapolis 500 three times, as did Mauri Rose and Wilbur Shaw, but he's 41 years old now and if is going to win, it for a record fourth time, he can't wait much longer. But he's going to have to wait at least until next year because he finished second to Johnny Rutherford by 12.8 seconds today in the rain that shortened the race to 255 miles and in the controversy that shortened his fuse. To the competitor named Anthony Joseph Foyt Jr., this Indianapolis 255 will beremembered as the mystery of the missing 19 seconds.
